item.title: Business Intelligence Developer at Esri (Redlands, CA)
item.description:
Excel at Esri by developing enterprise-level business intelligence and data management solutions. Your talent and experience as a business intelligence developer are what we are looking for to continue building upon our success.



Responsibilities:




  • Develop, maintain, and optimize enterprise data warehouse, data marts, and operational data stores

  • Develop business intelligence client and server-based visualizations using Microsoft technologies (e.g., PowerPivot, SSRS, Power View, PerformancePoint)

  • Integrate visualizations with SharePoint

  • Develop and monitor daily and intra-day ETL jobs and resolve production issues

  • Participate in requirements gathering, documentation, testing, and production implementation of new and existing ETL processes

  • Develop and conduct training on the different data sources available for reporting and analysis

item.title: Senior Application Engineer at Esri, Inc. Headquarters (Redlands, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Use your extensive IT experience providing technical expertise to business colleagues to help grow relationships and manage client expectations while supporting customer-facing applications. In this role, you will drive innovation by working closely with various teams to plan, direct, and coordinate technology projects, delivering solutions that meet and often exceed expectations. This is a great opportunity to learn on the job and explore new technologies with little supervision.



Responsibilities:





  • Plan, design, and implement advanced IT solutions that enable Esri to leverage new technologies enhancing productivity, reliability, and performance

  • Provide support by resolving complex issues on our core applications/system; this may include system architecture design, capacity planning, and project management

  • Support applications hosted on various web server technologies (.NET, Java) in multiple OS and platforms, in both virtual and cloud environments

  • Perform web server log analysis and offer reports for various applications supported

  • Leverage scripting to support the day-to-day operations for job processing, log analysis, and application automation on an ad hoc basis

  • Support application deployments, building new systems, and upgrading and patching existing systems

  • Support day-to-day operations on mission critical systems

  • Create and maintain documentation for all servers, applications, tools, scripts, and procedures

  • Be available on-call as needed with participation in 24x7 support

item.title: Sr. Dev Ops Engineer @ GoPro at GoPro (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The Role:
Our team is looking for experienced DevOps engineers to join us. Our group is diverse and tight knit. We use primarily open source tools to build distributed private and public cloud (AWS) environments and deploy web services into those environments. 

We use tools like Ubuntu Linux, Ansible (with Tower), Jenkins, Nagios, Graphite (with Grafana), MySQL, PostgreSQL, Asgard, Nginx, Docker, Hadoop (2.0 mixed work load, not just mapreduce). We write code in Python and Ruby. 

DevOps here at GoPro means between 30% to 70% Dev / Ops mixed role. On the Developer side, the focus is on backend software engineering, data processing, application architecture for SOA, APIs, internal tools, SQL / DBA, etc. On the Ops side, the focus is on unix systems engineering, cloud automation, infrastructure as code, virtualization and containers, network engineering, security, database architecture, continuous integration, network filesystems, and web scale production infrastructure. 

We use a Kanban model to support many sprint teams that build web services and front end components. We have a dedicated project manager who ensures only actionable tickets reach our queue. We actively iterate our processes with input from the team. We also run our own projects related to infrastructure, automation, monitoring, continuous integration and internal tools. We're a services organization with a service oriented mindset that builds products for our internal customers to get stoked on. 

Dream it, build it, deploy it, be a GoPro HERO! 

You Will:
* Build cloud environments to a service specification you help develop, to be used by thousands of development and operations engineers. 
* Support the deployment of applications into those environments.
* Engineer the services that automate application provisioning and put self-service capabilities in the hands of our application development and operations teams.
* Build tools and monitoring.
* Advance the art and do cool stuff!

So what's so great about our gig? Yeah, we figured you'd ask eventually. 
* Competitive base salary 
* Stock Options 
* Full benefits (medical, dental, vision) 
* Life insurance 
* 401K 
* Paid Vacation Time 
* On-site snacks/beverages 
* Discounted Gym membership 
* We all learn, teach, and train together. Learn something new? Tell us about it. We'll return the favor. 
* GoPro's San Francisco office is located near the UN Plaza / Civic Center BART Station in Sunny (Foggy) San Francisco. It is a small, dog friendly, open floor plan office. 

How To Apply:
* The Sourcery will be the first point of contact.
* All applications receive a response.
* All applications are kept strictly confidential.
* To apply, click here.


GoPro is an equal opportunity employer.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - C++, Java, MySQL at Brax (San Diego, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Brax is a native advertising platform that empowers advertisers to get a better ROI on the $2.2 Billion annual spend on content marketing. We believe culture is the most important part of growing our company so both your skills and synergy with the team must be a good fit.


Currently we use Laravel, MySQL, Google Apps, JIRA Agile, Confluence, Bitbucket and run on Apache servers. We work in Agile Scrum sprints of 3-4 weeks long and party hard to celebrate.


We are looking for an experienced software engineer that wants to make a big impact leading our product development team. You will be working on customer-facing code that impacts our business daily while getting to learn new skills and directly interact with the company founders.


This position is ideal for an experienced engineer looking to grow into the CTO role as the team grows. If you have experience working with big data performing clickstream log analysis; creating systems for real-time and historical reporting; or working on transactional bidding systems (eBay, Google Adwords, Facebook Ads or similar) then you are a superhero at Brax.


Are you tired of fixing someone else's code that was written years ago? Want to build new systems from the ground up leveraging cutting edge technology? Come check out Brax.

item.title: Lead Systems/DevOps Engineer at Factual (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
Factual is looking for a Lead Systems/DevOps Engineer to head up a small Sysops/DevOps team. Our search is for a special kind of Sysops/Devops engineer -- one who codes to automate, is comfortable with cloud and physical infrastructure, and treats metal like a resource (e.g. hasn’t named a server after a greek god in at least 5 years).


We respond to over 100Kqps, manage a multi-petabyte compute cluster, heavily use and contribute to open source systems. and aggressively build, adopt, and deploy new technologies and capabilities.


This is a great opportunity to manage serious infrastructure that is servicing large amounts of data and traffic, work with a large and outstanding engineering team, and employ state-of-the-art tools and techniques.

item.title: Javascript Engineer at Elasticsearch (Los Altos, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Note only developers residing in US only. Sorry no exceptions. This is a full time role and working remote is OK or at our offices in Mt View CA or Phoenix AZ


Responsibilities:



  • Innovate, lead and contribute to front end and visualization experience of the Elasticsearch product using Javascript .

  • Collaborate with other development teams, quality engineering team, and documentation team to execute on product deliverables.

item.title: Intermediate Database Developer/Business Intelligence Analyst at Well Lifecycle Resources (Houston, TX) (allows remote)
item.description:
Well Lifecycle Resources LLC seeks an Intermediate Database Developer with Business Intelligence experiences to work on transactional database development in Microsoft SQL Server 2008+ and Oracle 11g environments.


Candidate will be a member of WLR's software development team and will work closely with Development leads, Business consultants, and Customers to provide full software life-cycle support.


The ideal candidate will be an highly motivated and self-starting individual possessing strong problem-solving skills who can work under minimal supervision. Strong database design, stored procedure development, performance tuning, and complex report design/data visualization skills are required. General knowledge of software development processes and best practices are also expected.


This role is remote (work from home), but may have up to 50% travel per year. Houston or Dallas based candidate preferred. Oil & Gas industry, TIBCO Spotfire, and Peloton MasterView experiences a strong plus. 


Both contract and permanent job types entertained. 


We offer competitive and flexible salary packages, 401k, profit sharing, paid vacations, and medical benefits.

item.title: Android Engineer @ Scribd at Scribd (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The Role:
Scribd is now a top 10 app in the eBooks category, and we've grown our installs by a factor of 10 over the last 6 months. We also recently brought our app to the Kindle Fire, and we're so far from done, it's not even funny. 

But we've done all this with an Android team of just 3 people. To take the app to the next level, we're looking for an Android Developer to join our team and help us build the Netflix for eBooks!

Our goal is to invent the world's best reading experience for mobile devices. To do that, we need to make an amazing reader for all kinds of written content, get offline & syncing exactly right, and build a content discovery experience that always finds you something you actually want to read. We're also working on analyzing data so we can enhance our recommendations to our readers. 

As an Android Engineer at Scribd, you'll have the opportunity to learn from our small but excellent (if we do say so ourselves!) team and solve real challenges for an app that is more than just the hottest game - we truly believe that we're building a meaningful product, and that we can get people to read more by making reading easier and more beautiful on mobile devices. 

What We Offer:
* Competitive base salary
* Full benefits (medical, dental, vision)
* Create your own workstation with any type of equipment
* Free catered meals from local restaurants, three times a day
* Frequent company activities ranging from weekly happy hours to group indoor skydiving
* Generous equity to give you true skin in the game
* Flat organizational structure that ensures your influence on products we build
* Imagine mixing go-karts and quadricopters with free food and company ski trips!

Please Note:
* International candidates willing to relocate are welcome to apply! 

How To Apply:
* The Sourcery will be the first point of contact.
* All applications receive a response.
* All applications are kept strictly confidential.
* To apply, click here.

item.title: Software Engineer at ScoreBig (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
We are seeking engineers who have a genuine interest in learning, implementing and pushing the boundaries of technology.  Our ideal candidate is someone with 3 - 5 years of experience working on a full-stack e-commerce site.  If you started programming before college because you wanted to try out an idea, you are our ideal candidate. Not only are you an excellent programmer, you are also someone who sincerely enjoys the art of finding sophisticated and efficient ways of solving problems. You are someone who is constantly leveling-up your coding game by staying current through side-projects, asking/answering Stack Overflow questions or contributing to open source projects. If you take pride in your nerd cred, come join our team of talented techies.


WHAT WE LOOK FOR


It's über important to us that we hire top-notch engineers.  Not just someone who can code, but someone who's curious and is always game to try new things.  So when we review a resume, we place a lot of emphasis on extracurricular activities like hobby projects, Stack Overflow / GitHub contributions, and other things that show us you are all about technology.  Now that you know what we are looking for, apply at your own risk :)



WHAT YOU'LL BE DOING


Anything and everything.  One of the pluses of working at ScoreBig is that you'll never get pigeonholed in a particular area of our platform. You'll work on different parts of our platform based on priority so you might be working on a new payment page one week then onto our dynamic pricing engine the next.

item.title: Data Access Engineer @ Pantheon at Pantheon (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The Role:
Pantheon is looking for an engineer who can lay the groundwork for a data team, owning the systems and responsibilities we'll need to provide widespread access to data and analytics for our company, and eventually our users. 

As a founding member of the data team, you'll focus on architecting, building, and maintaining our data event ingestion platform, helping provide access to data-driven insights to initiatives across the organization. You'll work with other engineers to facilitate tracking relevant events, build and maintain our ETL processes, and oversee our data warehouse. Once we have an MVP data warehouse in place, you'll consult with business analysts and other employees to train them on how to explore and visualize the data. You'll make sure they have the tools they need to pull out that data to make decisions on our product and our business. As we grow, you'll help build our data team.

Sample projects you'll tackle in this role:
* Integrating our data warehouse with Business Intelligence exploration tools
* Helping analysts and product managers answer hard questions, either by digging through existing data, or identifying the missing data so that it can be properly collected and analyzed
* Understanding and communicating tradeoffs relevant to data analysis (i.e. error rates vs. cost to reduce error rates, granularity vs. storage/processing cost, etc.)
* Generally helping Pantheon navigate the data landscape, from Open Source technologies (Hadoop, Pentaho, etc.) to PAAS offering (RedShift, Dynamo, etc.) to SAAS offerings (Amplitude, Mixpanel, Looker, Tableau...)

What we can offer you:
We have all the usual perks and benefits but what we can really offer you is a fantastic work environment powered by an amazing team.

Pantheon's team includes many long-term contributors to Drupal. We have maintainers of contributed modules and members of core initiatives on staff. We contribute to Fedora, Node.js, Sensu, and many other open source projects. We are a team that shares an enthusiasm for open source technology along with our internal mission.

Oh yeah...here are a few other things we offer as well:
* Industry competitive salary.
* Stock options.
* Vacation days and time off.
* Full medical coverage (medical, dental, vision).
* Top-of-line equipment.
* Fun at Drupal community events.
* Discounts on custom bicycles - the founders of Pantheon also founded Mission Bicycle.
* Dog friendly office.
* Training stipend to attend industry conferences.
* Fully stocked kitchen with lunches provided.

How To Apply:
* The Sourcery will be the first point of contact.
* All applications receive a response.
* All applications are kept strictly confidential.
* To apply, click here.

item.title: Software Engineer at GenomeDx Biosciences (Hom, Slovenia)
item.description: The Software Engineer works within the Engineering team to design, implement and test software applications that all departments in the company will depend on for day to day business activities. This role will rely heavily on development performance, effective communication, thorough testing and timely delivery.

item.title: Software Developer at Backstop Solutions Group (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
Software Developers


Join a growing team of passionate, self-motivated, talented, and creative people with big ideas about the future of software for the investment industry.  Backstop is a Chicago based company that makes web-based software applications for hedge funds and the people who invest in them.  Over the last few years, we have grown considerably, won several awards, and built a lot of great software.  Backstoppers take our customers and our service very seriously, but pride ourselves on not taking ourselves too seriously in the process.


We're looking for excellent, experienced software developers. Our technology stacks are heavy on the server side, Java and Rails-oriented, but that doesn't stop us from using the right language or tool to solve a particular problem. We love using Ruby to drive the browser and API tests of our Java applications, building Fitnesse suites to organize our Scala-based integration tests, scripting data loaders in Python, and even hacking at, and in, Perl5 when we're feeling retro.


Core Responsibilities:



  • Implementing a multi-terabyte ElasticSearch cluster, feeding it delicious hedge fund emails and documents via Clojure

  • Refactoring a portfolio liquidity DSL and its related service calls

  • As part of a smooth on-call program, writing Puppet manifests which automatically size heap relative to RAM and machine profile

  • Migrating the storage layer of a large Rails application to support a Repository pattern

  • Using feature flips to gradually make our platform support all kinds of alternative investment vehicles

  • Increasing JS unit test coverage provided by our Jasmine suite

  • Pairing on production code with another Backstopper, whether they be intern or senior developer

  • Writing automated RSpec tests to prove that your feature works the way you expected

  • Taking part in our regular retrospectives

  • Committing new features that will land on a hedge fund manager's browser tonight

  • Getting crushed in our Ping Pong tournaments (we have Foosball tournaments too, but those are less tournament and more massacre)

item.title: Data Architect at Backstop Solutions Group (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
Data Architect


Join a growing team of passionate, self-motivated, talented, and creative people with big ideas about the future of software for the investment industry.  Backstop is a Chicago based company that makes web-based software applications for hedge funds and the people who invest in them.  Over the last few years, we have grown considerably, won several awards, and built a lot of great software.  Backstoppers take our customers and our service very seriously, but pride ourselves on not taking ourselves too seriously in the process.


We’re looking for a Data Architect who can understand the way that our various applications store and access their data.  Right now that’s mostly in java using Hibernate against an Oracle database backend.  This job is sometimes called “Application DBA.”  We’d love to have some insight in how to make that combination work better, as well as other technologies we can use to supplement that strategy.  Be creative!


Core Responsibilities:



  • We're looking for someone with a strong background in database administration, specifically Oracle 11g RAC.  Knowledge of Amazon RDS is a big plus.  You should be comfortable taking occasional shifts as a low-volume first-tier Oracle administration on-call.

  • You’ll need to have strong skills with PL/SQL, ANSI SQL, unix/linux shell scripting and the ways that Hibernate ORM or ActiveRecord mediates the app’s interaction with the database.

  • You’ll be working closely with java and ruby developers, so you’ll want to be pretty proficient in either/both of those, as well as being able to communicate effectively on technical topics with those developers.

  • There’s a lot of really cool stuff happening in the world of data storage technology right now.  You should be tied into current developments in graph databases, NoSQL stores, caching systems, and other such approaches. 

  • Farther down the stack, we’ve got a combination of local storage and big shared filers (NetApp).  You should have some thoughts about the best way to structure, tune, analyze, and ensure reliability for where our bits actually end up.

  • Other technologies that might help achieve our goals but aren’t strictly necessary:


    • Network setups - Maybe our connection between the apps and the database need to be changed in some way?

    • Virtualization - We’re primarily running linux on top of KVM.  If you have strong feelings about kernel parameters or certain qemu flags, we’d love to hear them!

    • DevOps patterns - Our developers and DBAs have a lot of power to make the changes they feel are best.

item.title: iOS Developer at Splitwise (Boston, MA)
item.description:
Splitwise for iOS has been our flagship platform for almost two years. The main Splitwise app has over 2,500 reviews with an average rating of 4.5 stars, and our companion app Plates has been featured by Apple around the world. The Splitwise founders know iOS well, but we are under-staffed and splitting our time between Android, iPhone, and the web.


We are looking for an iPhone expert with an eye for detail, who will challenge our assumptions and help make Splitwise for iPhone into a world-class app. Someone who knows how to build an iPhone app at a scale for millions of users, who is up-to-the-minute on developments by Apple, and who has a dedication to polish and user experience that will make Splitwise truly delightful, not just functional. We're looking for someone who can see the whole picture: user experience, in-app performance, smart engineering, and more.


You won’t be alone. Our engineers, Marshall and Ryan, have built our iPhone app from day one and are experienced at making improvements on both the front-end and the back-end. Our business people, Jon and Zoe, are here to help you with analytics, product management, and any other dirty work.


We are a small team that is hyper-focused on growing and scaling a popular app. There's tons of exciting work to do! Working with us is a great opportunity for an experienced iPhone engineer to take on big decisions and demonstrate their product and engineering leadership.

item.title: Senior Front End Developer at Fuisz Media (Santa Monica, CA)
item.description: The Senior Front-end Web Engineer will be focused on creating our video experience creation studio. This web app provides a way to upload and enhance videos with our interactive layer, as well as deploy to different distribution formats.

item.title: E - Technology Developer at University of Wisconsin Hospital and Clinics (Madison, WI)
item.description:
The E-Technology Developer responsibilities will include working under the supervision and direction of the Technical and Project Manager, Office of e-Health Innovation and Policy. The Front-End Developer is responsible for designing and supporting programming applications for exisiting and new systems on the web.  This position requires strong technical skills in gathering information from users, defining work problems and developing a system of computer programs and proceedures to resolve problems.


Successfull performance requires technical skill in system design, analysis and implementation of programs and web-based applications. In addition, the individual must have technical knowledge and experience with a variety of web languages - specifically requiring HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript - as well as development tools, operating systems and database technologies.

item.title: Software Engineer at Lendio (South Jordan, UT)
item.description:
If the words AngularJS, Node.js, REST make your heart flutter then the following may apply to you.  At Lendio we expect all developers to first enjoy solving business problems, and second to amaze with the speed and usability of the end product.  As a developer here, all the stack belong to you, so you can’t get scared when any project is assigned to you no matter where in the workflow it is.  We work with many different new and old tools and we don’t expect you will know them right away.  What we do expect is smart, motivated engineers.


We have great benefits, untracked PTO and a culture that allows the stack to change as the team finds better ways to solve problems.

item.title: Lead developer - futur CTO at RogerVoice (Paris, France)
item.description:
Startup développant une application qui permet aux sourds de téléphoner


Site web: www.rogervoice.com


Vidéo: http://youtu.be/kSArMUZF2m8


Kickstarter: http://kck.st/1C526AE



Technologies :


VoIP - SIP


Reconnaissance vocale


Plateforme js



Votre profil :



Vous voulez travailler pour une jeune pépite du web ayant un projet socialement innovant ?



RogerVoice cherche un lead developer pour porter son aventure à sa maturation commerciale. Une personne motivée, un as qui nous impressionnera par sa créativité, son autonomie et sa prise d’initiative.



Développeur expérimenté, ou jeune talentueux(se), vous êtes passioné(e)s par les nouvelles technologies. Les langages et technologies tels NodeJS, Ruby on Rails, Asterisk, WebRTC, C éveillent en vous un intérêt et vous voulez vous mettre au defi.  



Entrepreneur d’ans l’âme, vous aimez apprendre et vous n’hésitez pas à vous faire entourer des personnes meilleurs que vous pour solliciter leur conseils et compléter vos compétences.



Vous évoluerez sur votre position au fur et a mesure que la boite grandit et embauche. Vous pourriez gerer des activités transverses ou plus pointues, et approfondir votre expertise en gestion et management.



Ce poste est un CDI. Vous ne toucherez pas qu'un salaire. Nous proposons également des parts dans la société. Et notre joie de vivre. La culture chez RogerVoice, c'est avant tout la libre expression de soi, l'épanouissement personnel autant que professionnel. On donne libre cours à nos envies, tout en restant motivés par le projet. Nous avons organisé des voyages kitesurf au Brésil, nous faisons du télétravail entre San Francisco et Paris, et nous participons régulièrement à des meetups et soirées. Tout en décrochant coup à coup les défis impossibles de notre projet. Défis technologiques comme sociales. Au fond c'est cet équilibre qui nous stimule.

item.title: Full Stack Ruby on Rails Developer - Musicians Welcome at Reverb.com (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
About Us


Reverb is the premier marketplace for buying and selling vintage and handmade music gear. In just two years we've grown from a startup to a high growth company on pace to be one of the top ten online music equipment retailers in 2015. We work out of a music store surrounded by beautiful and inspiring instruments, and we want you to join us.


Our Culture


We build on Ruby/Rails. We believe in talking to our customers, fast development cycles, clean architecture, test driven code, fast specs, hypermedia APIs, service oriented architecture, contributing to open source, and continuous deployment.


You'll work alongside a world-class technology team, where software developers and designers work together to deliver the best user experience possible. Everyone at Reverb talks directly to customers, takes creative initiative, helps set their own priorities, and comes up with new ways to grow the business. Our software engineers take pride in crafting great software but take even more pride in product ownership, taking ideas from concept to release and beyond. Not sure what it's like to work here? Check this out: http://product.reverb.com/work-at-reverb


Here are the qualities we look for in our potential hires:



  • Product ownership – we are not just software engineers and designers. At Reverb, you’ll be expected to track the performance of features you release, talk to customers, and help figure out next steps to grow the business.

  • Self-motivation - taking initiative to just get things done. Have an idea? Find someone else to help you make it a reality rather than waiting for work to be assigned.

  • Spirit of a tinkerer - engaging in activities outside of work to further your knowledge, playing with new ideas, and being involved with the community, be it twitter, blogging, stackoverflow, open source contributions, meetups, mentoring, etc. You'll be encouraged to spend 20% of your time investing in long term value for the company including refactoring, blogging, and experimenting with new technologies and techniques.


Just a few of the things you might be involved in if you worked here:



  • Working on a dynamic user generated feed and personalization system built on ElasticSearch

  • Building out internal intelligence tools to detect high risk behavior

  • Creating and scaling up our curation system so that buyers can discover really great gear, and helping sellers sell more of their inventory

  • Developing public facing and internal REST JSON APIs for external systems using Grape with HATEOAS/Hypermedia standards (Roy Fielding would be proud!)

  • Rotating through a week of customer service interaction where you'll have the freedom and responsibility to build tools to improve scalability of the organization

  • Pairing on and writing well tested and well crafted code (Ruby 2.1 / Rails 4) that will be easy to maintain, using TDD/BDD approaches


Bonus Qualifications



  • Musical skills and passion (hobbyist/amateur/have shipped a record/anything goes)

  • Participating in open source projects or local user groups.

  • Deep experience with ElasticSearch and Redis.

  • Strong linux and command line skills.


What you'll get



  • Competitive salary and stock options in a high growth company

  • No-bureaucracy environment where ownership and initiative is valued, and where everyone talks to customers.

  • Health insurance and more importantly, a healthy work environment - no 80 hour weeks

  • Flexible vacation and sick days

  • A MacBookPro, monitor, keyboard, mouse of your choice. Even a stand up desk if you want!

  • Discounts on music gear

  • An incredible office location in an exposed brick loft with lots of light, close to the Paulina brown line


This is a local position in Chicago, please no remote workers or recruiters.

item.title: Scientific Informatics Analyst/Developer at Marine Biological Laboratory (Falmouth, MA)
item.description:
The Bay Paul Center at the Marine Biological Laboratory (MBL) seeks applications for a highly motivated full time informatics developer interested in data mining and analysis. The successful candidate will join researchers internationally recognized as pioneering in the fields of biodiversity and genetic computation.


The successful candidate will play a role in designing heuristic and natural language processing algorithms for creating services which will bring recognition, discovery, disambiguation of scientific names on a global scale, which will help to significantly simplify information flow for the biodiversity scientific community, medicine, governmental, nature preservation communities. The candidate will also be in charge of processing massive amounts of data coming from high throughput DNA sequencing facilities. Close integration with global biodiversity community, experimental and informatics scientists of the Bay Paul Center and MBL as a whole will be an important part of the job.

item.title: Scientific Informatics Analyst/Systems Administrator at Marine Biological Laboratory (Falmouth, MA)
item.description:
The Encyclopedia of Life and Bay Paul Center research community are seeking an experienced systems administrator who is comfortable in a DevOps environment. Our ideal candidate would be familiar with writing code as well as systems administration. The position emphasizes communication, collaboration, and integration with our software developers. We will use your expertise to help migrate several large (>1TB) data stores and a 100,000-hits-a-day website to a new systems architecture while enhancing our Chef-based systems architecture, sensu monitoring systems, and capistrano deployment processes. We aim to improve our deployment frequency and deploy time, maintain minimal failure rates, and shorten lead time to fixes. We are looking for a systems administrator who can improve our processes to become increasingly programmable and dynamic, using a DevOps approach, in order to maximize the predictability, efficiency, security, and maintainability of our operational processes.


Experience with large-scale product delivery, quality assurance, feature development, and systems maintenance is a must; you should be able to demonstrate your ability to improve reliability and security and to provide faster development and deployment cycles, as well as your experience with process control and granular tracking and reporting of events and efficiencies.

item.title: Software Engineer - C# at Intronis (Chelmsford, MA)
item.description: We are seeking an experienced, talented, self-motivated software engineer who has a successful track record utilizing .NET, C#, Object Oriented design and implementation and Web Services.  Working closely with a team of analysts, developers, QA and other business resources you will be continuously improving and enhancing the primary interface for our growing customer base.  We work in a fast-paced, collaborative environment where you will have the opportunity to rotate through research and development, mainline development and sustaining environments while working with our offshore partners.

item.title: Senior Backend Engineer @ GoPro at GoPro (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The Role:
We're looking for an awesome, fun, smart, hardworking, creative, friendly, responsible person to effectively help GoPro execute on company vision, create great products, and make a great working environment.

As a Senior Backend Engineer, you'll constantly be improving our web services while working closely with the Front End Development team. You'll work with video and photo data (of course!), you'll help us scale our software products and you'll design and build code to seamlessly integrate our software with our hardware devices. If you enjoy tackling large-scale storage and bandwidth problems, then we want to talk with you!

Challenges we'd like your help solving include:
* Designing databases to manage our massive amounts of data 
* Building API's with clean interfaces
* Creating systems that are highly concurrent
* Building a new photo/video feature set for our millions of users
* Collaborating with our architects to build components of the larger GoPro Ecosystem 


Our Stack and Technology Philosophy:
We believe in using the best tools and languages for the job. Engineers who have low ego and informed opinions that help us select the technology and tools we use are appreciated. There is always the ability to admit we're wrong and make changes later. 

Right now our stack includes:
Ruby on Rails, PostgreSQL, Angular.js, Ubuntu, Vagrant/Dockr and SmartStack

So what's so great about our gig? Yeah, we figured you'd ask eventually. 
* Competitive base salary 
* Stock Options 
* Full benefits (medical, dental, vision) 
* Life insurance 
* 401K 
* Paid Vacation Time 
* On-site snacks/beverages 
* Discounted Gym membership 
* We all learn, teach, and train together. Learn something new? Tell us about it. We'll return the favor. 
* Sunny, dog friendly office that's centrally located. 

How To Apply:
* The Sourcery will be the first point of contact.
* All applications receive a response.
* All applications are kept strictly confidential.
* To apply, click here.


GoPro is an equal opportunity employer.

item.title: Senior Developer Seeking a Collaborative Environment at Network Merchants LLC (Roselle, IL)
item.description: The software development team at NMI is a small, agile group that works closely together but requires independent thinking and motivation. Developers have direct influence over the design and implementation of their code and are heavily involved in application testing. Expertise should include fluency in coding, strong troubleshooting and analytical skills, good communication skills and a genuine passion for solving problems related to scalability, performance, security, and redundancy.

item.title: Director, Software Development, Radius at NBCUniversal (Stamford, CT)
item.description:
Role Purpose:


The Director, Software Development provides strategic technical direction, leads, and manages the onsite and offshore Software Development of cross-platform applications, including web, mobile, and connected TV applications. This position is a key role in developing a new suite of digital products. The Director, Software Development works as part of a group of passionate technologists with a clear charter to deliver the best possible web and mobile applications available. Each member of the team works with a wide degree of creativity and latitude


Responsibilities



  • Build, manage, and maintain the onshore and offshore Software Engineering teams with appropriate knowledge and skillsets 

  • Provide hands-on technical and systems architecture design and development, including the management of Drupal as a back-end service for modern front-end and mobile applications. 

  • Oversee and assure the optimal application of technology and engineering resources to meet product development and/or internal customer requirements. 

  • Lead the design, develop, and maintain supported technology platforms. 

  • Create and foster collaborative relationships with Product Management, QA, and Operations teams and support them to ensure that products are correctly defined, documented, tested, and released timely. 

  • Ensure standardization of approaches, frameworks and toolsets

item.title: Business Intelligence / Workflow Developer at Fenwick & West LLP (Mountain View, CA)
item.description:
We have an opening in our IT group for a Business Intelligence/Workflow Developer. This is a junior-level programming position that will focus on the creation of business intelligence (BI) and workflow (aka business process) applications for use at the Firm by its attorneys, clients and staff.

Responsibilities Include:



  • Design and develop document automation and workflow applications using Microsoft .NET and related technologies

  • Work closely with Portal Team developers to integrate the applications developed into its intranet, extranet, and public website computing environments

  • Work closely with Portal Team operations engineer to ensure business intelligence and workflow applications and environments are highly available

  • Create and maintain comprehensive unit tests for all BI and workflow applications

  • Adhere to Portal Team standards for development, naming conventions, source control, etc.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Priceline.com (Norwalk, CT)
item.description:
Come join the Priceline Hotel Engineering team. You will have the opportunity to work on mission critical projects and have direct impact on the evolution of Priceline Hotel platform.

Are you passionate about working on complex, highly scalable software projects? Do you enjoy being part of unconventional solutions to the most challenging business requirements? Do you like to learn and work on a variety of front-end and back-end engineering technologies? Is Java your 'tool of choice' when solving the most complex issues?


If so, the come join the Priceline Hotel Engineering team where you will have the opportunity to work on mission critical projects and have direct impact on the evolution of Priceline Hotel platform.

Responsibilities:



  • You will be responsible for coding, unit-testing and maintaining projects for the Engineering team in Java, based on system specifications and Change Requests provided by the business team.

  • Automation of business and technical processes, troubleshooting production issues and fixing as needed, maintaining and improving deployed code as needed.

  • Work closely with the Product line Technical Leads and other Java engineers to ensure that company coding standards, policies and IT procedures are observed as well as participate in the evaluation and selection of new strategies and technologies.

item.title: Director, Software Engineering at Priceline.com (New York, NY)
item.description:
*This role can be in New York City or Norwalk, CT


Are you an exceptional technical leader looking for your next big opportunity?

Are you ready to lead a world-class development team responsible for a popular consumer website?

Priceline.com is a seeking an Engineering Manager to lead several crews of software engineers building our mission critical hotel user experience.  There is no more important technical role at our company.  You will manage a team of talented front-end developers who tackle complex technical challenges at the heart of our efforts to innovate and grow.  

As important as being a great engineer, we are looking for great technical leaders.  Priceline is a fun, agile, fast paced and highly collaborative environment.  People love working here and we want to keep it that way!  We are looking for problem solvers, the kind of people who instinctively search for win-win solutions that grow our business.

Join us in the heart of Manhattan!  

Responsibilities



  • Oversee the development of a world class website and engineering team

  • Recruit and develop team leads and software engineers

  • Provide technical leadership in a fast-paced and innovative environment

  • Lead the planning, execution and success of complex technical projects

  • Collaborate with other teams to share and adopt coding best practices

  • Work closely with product management to ensure we're building the best products

item.title: Front End Engineer (Java) at Priceline.com (New York, NY)
item.description:
Priceline.com, the leading online destination for smart travelers, is seeking an intelligent, motivated full-time developer to join our growing team.  Our creative, flexible company culture merges the agility of a start-up with the stability of an established, international public company.


The ideal candidate is passionate about creating well-architected solutions; well-versed in JSP development; familiar with pulling data from an Oracle database and architecting REST-based APIs for consumption by the front end; and comfortable with version control. 


Our agile development process centers around A/B testing incremental changes and empowering our technologists to suggest best practices. We understand the dynamic nature of technology, and we support our developers’ efforts to stay on the leading edge by attending meet-ups, going to conferences, and educating one another through code reviews and presentations. 


What You’ll Do:


You’ll be working in a small, tight-knit team, supporting our high-traffic Hotel business. You’ll be coding, unit testing, and supporting the creation of applications that deliver real value to our customers — applications that utilize complex business logic, maintained by world-class engineers.


You’ll be collaborating closely with Product and Design team members. In addition to developing on Priceline’s existing stack, you’ll be responsible for identifying and evaluating new technologies as needed.


*This role can be in NYC or Norwalk, CT

item.title: SharePoint Developer at Fenwick & West LLP (Mountain View, CA)
item.description:
We have an opening for a SharePoint Developer who will be responsible for collaborating with fellow IT department team members in the design, development and support of custom .NET/SharePoint applications used by employees and clients of the Firm.

Responsibilities Include:



  • Acts independently and under general direction to perform project-based and time-sensitive tasks.

  • Confer with management or development teams to prioritize needs, resolve conflicts, develop content criteria, or choose solutions.

  • Design, build and maintain web sites using authoring or scripting languages, content creation tools, management tools and digital media.

  • Write, design and edit web page content.

  • Analyze user needs to determine technical requirements.

  • Create web models and application prototypes that include physical, interface, logical, or data models.

  • Incorporate technical considerations into web site design plans.

  • Evaluate code to ensure that it is valid, properly structured, meets industry standards and is compatible with browsers, devices, or operating systems.

  • Recommend and implement performance improvements.

item.title: Full Stack Engineer with the eBay Home Page Team at eBay Inc. (New York, NY)
item.description:
We’re looking for an outstanding full stack engineer to work with the Homepage team in NYC as we redefine the face of eBay. You’ll be working with a world class team of engineers, designers, product managers, and analysts to create great products that make a difference on one of the world’s most trafficked and loved websites. We currently work on the Feed and Today products. The eBay Feed delivers an endless stream of interesting content based on what a customer chooses to follow on eBay. The Today page highlights unique items and collections available on the site chosen by our curatorial staff. Our technology stack includes Java for back-end with MongoDB/MySQL, and HTML/LESS/jQuery and vanilla JavaScript in the front-end (with a little bit of Node.js). 

On a day-to-day basis, you would: 



  • Create robust, scalable APIs that support web, mobile web, and mobile applications 

  • Use best practices to write clean, maintainable code for the project, and create a fast, elegant experience for customers 

  • Handle service calls efficiently and manage data representation for template rendering 

  • Identify and address performance bottlenecks 

  • Use best practices to write code and setup processes that are easy to manage and maintain 

  • Be responsible for major projects and features from design phase to coding and testing 


We’re a small team that likes to move fast and iterate faster as we deliver future of social commerce. We’ve built a reputation at eBay for being a highly capable, high performing team with incredible talent across the board. We only want to work with the best, and we’d love for you to join us.

item.title: Director of Apple Awesomeness (iOS Lead Developer) at ChartSpan Medical Technologies (Greenville, SC)
item.description:
Do you believe “Anchorman” was one of the greatest movies of our generation?  Do you secretly not turn the channel when re-runs of Fresh Prince come on?  Can you humiliate any pubescent teenager who challenges you to solve a Rubik’s Cube?  Read on mighty stallion, we have a luxurious stable for you.


ChartSpan Medical Technologies (www.chartspan.com) is looking for an idealist, loaded with aptitude and experienced in developing iOS apps. 


ChartSpan is a consumer healthcare data company.  We are contrarians who are doing exactly the opposite of what the healthcare industry is telling us to do.  We are empowering patients with the ability to manage their OWN healthcare information and data.  We are putting innovative and disruptive technology in the hands of patients, with zero dependencies on doctors.  Think of us as the “red-headed-step-child” of healthcare.  We are also one of the most downloaded medical apps in America, beating big names like WebMD and Walgreens. 


We are a start-up in the emerging technology hotbed of Greenville, South Carolina.  (It ain’t Austin, but it’s awesome.)  Our snazzy, new office is being built in downtown Greenville (May 15th completion) and will include a gym, café, bike barn, coffee shop, lounge…and is just steps from more than 100 great restaurants located in the downtown district. 


We’ve closed a $1,000,000+ round of funding and are about to close an even larger round.  This important position includes a market competitive salary, equity, health insurance and benefits.


This opportunity is for the person who needs to spend his or her day changing the world and making a significant contribution to the improvement of peoples lives.

item.title: Lead Developper at CloudGarden (Castelnau-le-Lez, France) (allows remote)
item.description: Nous cherchons un lead développeur confirmé à la recherche de nouveaux challenges. Bras droit du CTO, vous aurez la responsabilité technique du projet. Nous faisons du « lean startup » et de l'agile (Scrum, Kanban) pour la conception et le développement de notre produit. Le MVP a été développé sur Liferay portal par les partenaires historiques du projet. Vous serez en charge des développements de la version beta et de la suite. Vous mettrez en œuvre notre API et nos outils de synchronisation de données. Vous intégrerez les API de multiples éditeurs (Google Apps, Office 365, Salesforce.com, etc)

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at MOJO Marketplace (Salt Lake City, UT)
item.description:
Software Developer


Draper, UT; 


Job Details


We are looking to bring on board a software developer as a key member of our organization to help our development team ship the cleanest code on the block. Successful candidates will become part of our group working with all aspects of the organization.


Skills and Qualifications: 



  • 4+ years experience in the industry or some college or Bachelors degree is plus.

  • Strong technical understanding.



  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.


Duties



  • Participate in an Agile SDLC

  • Coordinate with Project Management and Stakeholders on requirements

  • Develop code to satisfy requirements

  • Maintain high coding standards and unit tests

  • Coordinate with QA & SysOps for deployment & support


Requirements



  • Technology

    • REST & SAO

    • Object Oriented PHP (Cake, Laravel, or other MVC framework)

    • MySQL

    • JavaScript, AJAX, JQuery

    • Git

    • Unit Testing & Continuous Integration

    • Agile SDLC familiarity (Scrum preferred)

    • Clear communication skills

    • Excellent problem solving

    • Working both independently and within the team




What's in it for you:




  • Awesome Comprehensive Benefits for you and your family!

  • Competitive Base salary 

  • Work on an internationally used product with the top internet brands

  • Join an excited and results oriented team!!



For your hard work, you will be rewarded with a strong compensation package including health care, 401k, benefits, working with the latest technologies and other cool perks. 


This is an urgent position, interviews are occurring immediately. If you feel that you have the technical qualifications, please apply now!

item.title: Web Developer at Crowdcomfort (Somerville, MA)
item.description:
CrowdComfort offers a mobile solution for facilities managers that empowers building occupants to report comfort levels and maintenance issues in seconds from anywhere. This information is processed through CrowdComfort’s proprietary software and shared with managers in real-time through a secure portal that provides comfort and maintenance reports. This data can be leveraged to engage employees, improve workflow, drive operational savings, and optimize organizational performance.


We are looking for a candidate


Who is:



  • A team player

  • Eager to ask questions and get clarifications

  • Strives for perfection

  • Flexibly independent

  • Passionate about their work

  • A star communicator

  • Well organized (Trello, Github, Agile, Scrum, Kanban, Google Hangout/GoToMeeting/Skype)

  • Eager to break new ground in development

  • Able to work in a fast-paced and quickly shifting environment


Who has:



  • Experience working with a startup

  • Experience with RESTful APIs (implementing and using)

  • A basic sense of visual design/UX common practices

  • Dedication to quality work

  • Insurmountable respect for the 80-20 rule

  • Some sample of work completed completely independently


Who can:



  • Make a website run on Chrome 33 or I.E. 7

  • Fill in design/UX gaps by extrapolating best practices from around the web

  • Follow a release schedule

item.title: Mid-Level PHP Web Developer at Purebred Breeders (Cooper City, FL)
item.description:
About Us


Based in sunny South Florida, Purebred Breeders helps families throughout the country adopt loving puppies from our nationwide network of qualified dog breeders. 


Our internally developed web applications and sites are used every day by our 100+ employees, all our breeders, and millions of visitors.  Our company has been growing strong for nine years, and we continue to enjoy a casual work environment with strong work ethics.


Responsibilities



  • Develop new features and updates for internal web applications, public websites, and emails

  • Review code for security, usability, and maintainability

  • Follow industry best practices

  • Work independently and proactively on assigned issues

  • Contribute innovative ideas in a team environment

  • Discuss requirements with managers of other departments

  • Provide positive professional influence to coworker


What You Can Expect



  • A supportive, casual, and rewarding environment

  • Casual dress code

  • Consistent but flexible schedule (8 hours a day, Monday to Friday)

  • Respect for work-life balance

  • No late nights or crunch time

  • Weekly meetings and task sprints

  • Source control with Git and an issue tracker

  • Quiet workspace (there are no animals on the premises)

  • Fast Windows PC and dual monitors

  • Cohesive team of 4 developers

item.title: Vice President of Engineering at Rally Health (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Rally Health is looking for an experienced leader to take on a high visibility, broad scope and high impact role within the engineering organization. The VP, Engineering will lead Rally’s engineering team and own the core engineering services for Rally’s three product lines. For the right candidate, the role may be expanded to include ownership of the engineering team for the Analytics and Data backbone services. This role reports directly to the Executive VP of Engineering.



Rally Health develops three distinct yet interwoven products: a wellness platform, a benefit administration platform, and a healthcare exchange platform. These three verticals are supported by a set of common services that unify the user experience for our enterprise customers and our consumers. Examples of such services include but are not limited to: Identity (Login and Registration) Services, Eligibility and Affiliation Services, Personal Health Record Services, A/B Testing Services.



The core engineering team is currently made up of 15 engineers and is expected to nearly double each year for the next two to three years, as we continue to grow and deepen our product offerings. This position is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity for a highly experienced individual to shape the future of an innovative, quickly-growing digital healthcare startup by leveraging and applying their preexisting knowledge.



Key Responsibilities:




  • Partner with the business leads of each vertical to make key engineering and business decisions

  • Grow and structure the engineering team to align with the business scaling challenges

  • Mentor and develop existing human capital on a journey to world-class performance, whilst retaining team loyalty

  • Effortlessly manage platform development to cope with large traffic requirements

  • Balance the speed of adding new features with the need for stability and performance

  • Provide technical leadership on critical back-end and infrastructure projects, as well as architectural challenges

  • Own the overall architecture and outcomes

  • Implement additional and/or modify existing agile principles, and drive a deeply agile culture

  • Establish the critical KPIs to support engineering delivery and to measure technological performance

item.title: Senior Software Engineer Web UI/UX at American Express (New York, NY)
item.description:
American Express is embarking on an exciting transformation driven by an energetic new team of high-performers. This group is nimble and creative with the power to shape our technology and product roadmap. If you have the talent and desire to deliver innovative payment products and services at a rapid pace, serving our customers seamlessly across physical, digital, mobile, and social media, join our transformation team!

You will be part of a fast-paced, entrepreneurial team responsible for delivering a world class Cardmember across multiple channels, including native iOS, Android, web, social integration, java services, and APIs. You will be challenged with identifying innovative ideas and proof of concept to deliver against the existing and future needs of our customers.

Responsibilities

Serving as a core member of an agile team that drives user story analysis and elaboration, designs and develops software applications, and builds automation tools for testing.
Owning all technical aspects of software development for assigned applications; Performing hands-on architecture, design, and development of systems
Performing hands-on software and strategy development, typically spending about 50% of time actually writing code, , conducting code reviews and testing in ongoing sprints, doing proof of concepts
Driving consistent development practices - tools and common components; Developing deep understanding of tie-ins with other systems and platforms within the supported domains
Working with technical product managers contributing to blueprints, and assisting with annual planning of feature sets
Identifying exciting opportunities for adopting new technology to solve existing needs and predicting future challenges
Mentoring other Software Engineers, may have management responsibilities over 2-3 Software Engineers
Manage your own time, and work well both independently and as part of a team.
Work closely with product managers, back-end and other front-end engineers to implement versatile solutions to tricky web development problems
Quickly generate and updating HTML prototypes from UI concepts for testing and team feedback
Finalizing HTML prototypes into Web Applications by integrating with back-end services and functionality
Embrace emerging standards while promoting best practices in order to push the limits of what a browser can do.

Qualifications

This high energy Senior Software Engineer:
6+ years of software development experience and preferably a BS or MS degree in computer science, computer engineering, or other technical discipline
Demonstrated experience in Agile development, application design, software development, and testing
Thorough understanding of XML, JSON, Web Service technologies, and data structure fundamentals
Experience with Java applications design and development in an Enterprise setting using J2EE, Spring, SQL DBMSs desired
Expertise in Objected Oriented Analysis and Design across a variety of platforms
A proven hunger to learn new technologies and translate them into working software
Ability to effectively communicate to internal and external business partners on solution design
Experience with HTML/XHTML, CSS, JavaScript, and Software Version Control Systems (such as svn, git) required
Experience with JavaScript Libraries (such as jQuery, GWT, Dojo, AngularJS), Social Media (Twitter, Facebook, Google+) APIs, Search Engine Optimization, Web Page Optimization strategies desired
Experience with adaptive and responsive techniques
Internationalization (I18N) and Localization (L10N) experience is a plus
Experience with a broad range of software languages and payments technologies is a plus


American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other status protected by law. American Express is embarking on an exciting transformation driven by an energetic new team of high-performers. This group is nimble and creative with the power to shape our technology and product roadmap. If you have the talent and desire to deliver innovative payment products and services at a rapid pace, serving our customers seamlessly across physical, digital, mobile, and social media, join our transformation team!

item.title: Python Developer at Curse, Inc. (Huntsville, AL)
item.description:
SUMMARY:


Interested in working on some of the most popular sports gaming web sites in the world? Futhead.com, Muthead and Huthead are just a few of the sites you’ll be working on as Python Web Developer at Curse. In this role you’ll be developing cutting edge web properties primarily using Python, Django, Redis, Varnish and MySQL. We’re looking for coders passionate about gaming, sports of all kinds and coding.


DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Plan, design, develop, debug, implement and support Django-based web applications.

  • Modify existing platform to: correct errors, improve performance and enhance functionality.

  • Adhere to and recommend improvements to project coding standards.

  • Work in a team environment with shared code; disciplined use of source code control and process documentation.

  • Improve software quality by conducting systems analysis, and recommending changes in policies and procedures.

item.title: Chief Technology Officer at Baton (Washington, DC)
item.description:
We are a VC funded start up (associated with a major hospital network) that is looking for a technological co-founder to join our team. As CTO, you will select a development stack and build a team that is capable of supporting our mission of eliminating preventable medical errors through better communication. A strong candidate will be:


1. A developer who can also fill a CTO role and build a team. A successful candidate will have held a senior level position and be well versed in building and running a development team.


2. Technically savvy with judgment that we can trust. We provide a healthcare solution, so the first priority will be creating a robust, well tested application (HIPAA compliance will be necessary). The second priority will be the ability to iterate quickly in an agile development environment.


3. Motivated and fully engaged in our mission of saving lives by eliminating preventable medical errors. We expect the CTO will encourage and promote this culture among all members of the team.

item.title: Image Processing Programmer at Bonanza.com (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
We're looking for a developer to help us continue to build the Background Burner.


Spoiler alert: You don't need a background in image processing to be effective in this role. What you lack in image processing experience, you can potentially compensate for with intelligence and a determination to learn.


This software has already been used to process more than 10 million images, but we're only getting started. Some of what we're cooking up for it:



  • Build a mobile app for users to make Background Burns from iPhone and Android

  • Improve the speed & accuracy of the front-end editing tool

  • Increase accuracy of background identification for pictures of humans

  • Work with CEO to build an image matching system to accompany the Background Burner

  • Help flesh out our background replacement tool

  • Speed up image processing times

item.title: Android Developer - Digital Arm of VICE at Carrot Creative (New York, NY)
item.description: Carrot is looking for an Android Developer to join our team. We're looking for someone who is first and foremost a self-starter. Beyond this, you have experience with Java, and are comfortable working within a team. You can build well-designed applications as well as work off exiting code-bases. Our work is often tapping into a variety of third party APIs, so you can work closely with our User Experience and Design teams to help drive product decisions.

item.title: Software Engineer at Dude Solutions (Cary, NC)
item.description: Dude Solutions continues to grow and needs amazing engineers.  This is an excellent fit for talented engineers who thrive in a fast-paced environment.  New hires will work alongside our top-notch engineers and product team to design, implement, and deliver our highly ambitious products.  We don’t hire using a checklist (5 years of that, 3 years of this, etc.).  It’s all about your passion and dedication to the craft of software.  We only mention specific technologies, languages, etc. as a sneak peek into our current tools of the trade.

item.title: PHP Expression Engine - Code Igniter Web Developer at Incorporated Research Institutions for Seismology (IRIS) (Washington, DC)
item.description:
Are you an experienced web programmer/developer with a conscience? Are you interested in developing applications that improve earth science learning around the globe? Would you like to help define and manage projects rather than being just another coder fixing bugs? We are a small scientific consortium with a global reach. You will be required to develop applications from the ground up, including architecture, project management, coordination of outsourced development, and work with scientists at the cutting edge of earthquake research.


Location: Washington, D.C 20005


Essential Duties and Responsibilities:



  • Design, implement and maintain various complex web applications. Includes interacting with project owners/leads from various groups within the company to analyze requirements, designing, coding, debugging and testing

  • Create, customize and maintain interactive web applications (see iris.edu, usarray.org, and iris.edu/hq/internship for examples)

  • Use the Mantis ticketing system to capture projects, requirements, updates/schedules/deliverables.

  • Develop and maintain web applications for a diverse audience, such as student internship and workshop registrations and submissions

  • Develop and maintain web-related databases, data flows, and web-based APIs using RSS and structured data such as XML, images, PDFs, and Youtube streams

  • Provide miscellaneous IT support including basic troubleshooting and interfacing with the outside systems administrator

  • Work closely with other developers on the team to find solutions for difficult problems

  • Document all technical inquiries, develop and review content for Google Docs and wiki-based knowledge-base

How to apply and what to expect
