item.title: Software Engineer - Utility Player at Quantcast (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
We seek the ultimate utility player to join our highly versatile and talented engineering team. 

The person we want to hire combines strong OO-design and software development skills with Unix commandline-fu and dexterous troubleshooting abilities. To be the right fit for this team, you’re likely learning the latest Python library in your spare time and have probably forked a handful of github projects to tinker with. You’re intensely geeky, but you don’t shy away from working with other departments to resolve practical customer and business problems that arise. In the face of pressure, you’re a staunch navigator – cool, calm, and collected – steering the ship gracefully through the storm and distilling peril into long-term system advancements.

Possessing a myriad of tools at their disposal, engineers on this team are the technical experts for all of Quantcast’s mission-critical applications and services—the tech stack that ultimately makes up our core revenue-generating products. In this role, you’ll become well-versed with our custom mapreduce technology and have the unique opportunity to learn the true meaning of ‘big data,’ getting hands-on experience with an infrastructure that handles dozens of daily _petabyte-scale_ data processing jobs that run across a 10000+ core commodity compute cluster.

In addition to keeping our existing business running smoothly (as if that was not enough!), this team provides the core function of bringing new applications to production quickly and reliably by providing guidelines, tools, scripts, and libraries that ensure they are fault-tolerant and scalable. What’s more, this team authors general purpose frameworks, dashboards, and utility programs to solve company-wide pain-points and will automate any and all operational work. 

Finally, this group of multi-disciplinarians is the catalyst, facilitating internal adoption and production-ization of early prototypes produced by our product development teams. The result is auspicious--an accelerated innovation and product cycle which gives Quantcast tremendous speed, flexibility, and a real advantage in a dynamic and rapidly evolving marketplace!

Responsibilities



  • Maintain, scale, and optimize existing mission-critical data pipelines and applications that makeup Quantcast’s core products

  • Provide guidance on QC’s petabyte-scale data processing infrastructure and create tools, scripts, and libraries to fit pre-production applications to production

  • Render fault-tolerance, monitoring, and alerting tools for various software development projects

  • Build company-wide tools and automation in Java, Python, Ruby, C or bash

  • Act as a Catalyst for Quantcast’s product development cycle

  • Troubleshoot production issues and be part of 24/7 on-call rotation



Requirements



  • Strong utility player, versatile and capable of picking up new technologies quickly

  • Strong Java development background; interested in impacting design and programming best practice across the company using code reviews and pair programming

  • BS in Computer Science, related degree, or equivalent experience

  • Proficient in one or more programming and scripting languages (especially bash, ruby, and python)

  • Linux power-user or experienced administrator

  • Detail-oriented and strong communication skills

  • Team player; passionate about technology; wants to make an impact!

item.title: Engineering Manager/Director at Quantcast (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Quantcast is seeking senior engineering leaders to steer our market-leading products to even greater greatness.


Although the specifics of the role will depend on your skills, background and interests, as senior engineering manager you’ll own a technically innovative product and be responsible for its success in the market.  You’ll lead a team of engineers and engineering managers extending and enhancing the full stack supporting the product, which will involve a variety of web, MapReduce and real-time big data processing technologies.  You’ll work closely with product management and play an active part in shaping product strategy based on your own vision for what’s technically possible.


You should bring a passion for meeting business needs with technically innovative solutions, and you should be good at shifting between the two—understanding how big-picture goals inform technical details, and vice-versa.  Previous teams you’ve led should respect you as a technical leader as well as manager.  You should like data: you’re probably the type who looks at a graph and immediately has questions about how the metrics were calculated and what they mean.  And you should be skilled in the fine art of follow-through, of making sure your product is genuinely living up to its potential. 

Responsibilities



  • Translate your passion, vision, and technical experience into innovative, industry-leading products

  • Effectively manage teams and work with product management


Requirements



  • 5+ years experience in engineering management

  • Demonstrated technical leader

  • Experienced with all phases of software development (design, development, test, operations, and end-of-life)

  • Track record owning products: defining vision for them, building them, and refining them over time

  • Experience working on data-oriented products

  • Java

  • MapReduce or other big data technologies

  • Effective communicator with executive management and internal customers

  • Big pluses for a background in online advertising or publishing

item.title: Mobile Application Developer (Android/iOS) at BrickSimple (Doylestown, PA)
item.description:
Mobile Application Developer – iOS and/or Android - Full-time Position


BrickSimple LLC (http://bricksimple.com) is a leading developer of next generation web, mobile, and wearable computing applications. Our talented creative team develops custom solutions and products that leverage current mobile/tablet computing and powerful emerging technologies.


We're looking to add at least three more team members over the next 30 days. If you're an Android, iOS, and/or HTML5 developer that wants to build some awesome stuff, BrickSimple is a great place to do it.

item.title: Data Engineer at Quantcast (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
At the heart of Quantcast’s revolutionary services is a team of elite developers working on a massive data pipeline. This is the core team that sorts through hundreds of terabytes of data each day and builds advanced distributed computing systems to crunch through Everest sized data sets.

Quantcast is hiring Software Engineers with experience producing top quality code in a production environment where the data was the product. The ideal candidates are fascinated by complex, large-scale problems and preoccupied with scalability (as in hundreds of terabytes).

There are only a few companies working with this scale of data and infrastructure. Unlike the rest of them, we’re doing this with a small team, offering new hires direct access to our data and the opportunity to have an immediate impact on our core business.


Responsibilities:



  • Develop software to perform large-scale cluster data processing

  • Build infrastructure to automate extremely high volumes of data delivery

  • Creatively solve scaling issues

  • Contribute to the design and architecture of innovative solutions to difficult problems 


Requirements:



  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience

  • Willingness to jump into any problem to provide creative scaling solutions and deliver on tight deadlines

  • Possessing a strong mathematical inclination is a major plus, as is experience working with extremely large, complex datasets

  • Experience building or working on distributed computing infrastructures also a plus


Technologies: 



  • Excellent Java (or other OO-language) programming skills coupled with an understanding of good software engineering practices

  • Solid background working with scripting languages, Ruby or Python is preferred

  • Solid database experience (ideally Postgres or MySQL)

  • Interest in Grid computing or MapReduce technologies

  • HPC or ETL experience a plus

item.title: Software Engineer, Big Data Platform at Quantcast (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Quantcast's Big Data Platform Engineers will have proven interest in, and experience with, big data, petabyte scale data warehouses, distributed systems, availability and reliability of large systems, fault-tolerance, efficiency and performance.
We seek engineers to help build the next generation of our multi-petabyte data transformation and analysis technology.
We are leaders, not followers, in the Big Data space:



  • QFS, our petabyte-scale file system 2x more space efficient and faster than HDFS. https://github.com/quantcast/qfs/wiki/Performance-Comparison-to-HDFS

  • Quantsort, a revolutionary map-reduce sort architecture that speeds up map-reduce significantly and simplifies greatly the management of shared map-reduce clusters.  https://www.quantcast.com/inside-quantcast/2013/12/petabyte-sort/

  • Proprietary implementation of SQL based analytics at petabyte scale.


A candidate for this position will have proven interest in, and experience with, big data, petabyte scale data warehouses, distributed systems, availability and reliability of large systems, fault-tolerance, efficiency and performance.
We offer you the opportunity to make an impact and grow in a fast paced environment at the bleeding edge of commodity cluster computing.  We need your passion, drive, energy and experience with distributed or supercomputing systems.

Opportunities



  • Rare R&D environment.  Quantcast’s business model relies heavily on big data.  This makes for a healthy R&D environment where ideas are driven by and can be validated quickly at scale on realistic workloads.  Moreover, we develop the whole cluster software stack, including a high-performance distributed file system, which means you won’t be constrained by arbitrary limitations of third party software.

  • Make your mark.  Build/grow your personal brand as a Big Data engineer.

  • Great timing.  We are a fast growing pre-IPO technocracy.  It’s a rush, don’t miss it.


Responsibilities



  • Design and implement Big Data systems such as petabyte scale warehouses, batch and stream processing and analytics runtimes, or large-scale storage.

  • Diagnose and produce systems solutions to Big Data problems, such as scalability to thousands of processing units, load balancing or fast analytics on petabytes of data.

  • Innovate in the Big Data space.  Lead, don’t follow.


Requirements



  • Passionate, self-driven

  • Experience working on very large-scale data warehouses, transformation/analytics or storage systems

  • Excellent development skills in Java or C++

  • Strong software development skills (version control, code review, testing, release, monitoring, debugging)

  • Experience implementing MapReduce, distributed systems and programming languages are good to have but not strict requirements

item.title: Full Stack Software Engineer at Quantcast (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Quantcast seeks software engineering generalists that will work up and down the entire technology stack to build new features and products to drive the continued success of our Measure and Advertise businesses.

At Quantcast, these full-stack polyglots work in all aspects of agile application development, from DB schema design through Java business logic to advanced Javascript on the frontend. They also work with QC-specific, and other industry-leading, big data technologies (e.g. Hadoop, QFS) – our products are driven by data after all and we process an average of 30PB every single day!

The right applicant will thrive in an environment where independent decision-making based on product requirements is the norm. Individuals in this role will want to work on our many open-ended problems and will have an opinion when it comes to selecting the right tool/technology for the job (and the ability to explain why!).

As a Full Stack Software Engineer at Quantcast, you will have a major impact on how the world perceives and interacts with our products. We hope that you’ll bring your passion for application development to help us build truly world-class technology and products!

Example full-stack projects:

Advertising Reporting Infrastructure
Creating our client facing reporting infrastructure to provide campaign performance and analysis to internal and external clients

Online Measurement
Building new features for Quantcast Measure that will be viewed and used across the entire Web ecosystem

Mobile
Brand new mobile projects that range from prototyping to designing data schemas for both Android and iOS applications

Scaling Tools
Developing toolsets that support a number of core business operations at Quantcast

Quantcast Audience
Building automation architecture to drive Quantcast advertising systems and building new service-based platforms for client-side applications

Requirements



  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, related field or equivalent experience

  • Polyglot developer with excellent command of Java, C++ Python, or Ruby

  • Object-oriented application development experience

  • Strong understanding of various web technologies and frameworks

  • Good relational database experience (MySQL, Postgres)

  • Understanding of client-side performance and Javascript

  • Experience with consumer facing high traffic web applications a major plus

  • Passion for new technologies and driven to build the best products

item.title: Senior Rails Engineer: awesome team, Backbone, MongoDB at Kapost (Boulder, CO)
item.description:
Want to move to Boulder? Come work at Kapost!


The Kapost Engineering team is a small team of extremely talented individuals.  We believe in the craftsmanship of elegant code, as well as the thrill of moving quickly and delivering value to our customers every day.  We offer an atmosphere of creative autonomy and expect great things of our team.

item.title: Systems Engineer (Linux) at NWEA (Portland, OR)
item.description:
NWEA has a new opening for Systems Engineer (Linux) in our downtown Portland location. This is a full-time opportunity with excellent compensation; outstanding benefits; and career growth opportunities.
Founded by educators nearly 40 years ago, Northwest Evaluation Association™ (NWEA™) is a global not-for-profit educational services organization known for our flagship interim assessment, Measures of Academic Progress® (MAP®). More than 7,400 partners in U.S. schools, districts, education agencies, and international schools trust us to offer pre-kindergarten through grade 12 assessments that accurately measure student growth and learning needs, professional development that fosters educators’ ability to accelerate student learning, and research that supports assessment validity and data interpretation. To better inform instruction and maximize every learner’s academic growth, educators currently use NWEA assessments and items with nearly 10 million students. Our research-based core lets us do what’s driven us from the beginning: give educators tools proven to help them make a difference. We are searching for talented individuals who desire to make a difference in education by demonstrating a commitment to our mission: Partnering to help all kids learn®.

Position summary
Systems Engineers are members of the Product Engineering group (PE) at NWEA, a high-functioning team of creative, collaborative, motivated and professional individuals driven by the singular mission of partnering to help all kids learn. We are in search of like-minded individuals who want to build and operate cutting-edge technologies to deliver a SaaS assessment platform that supports upwards of 100,000 concurrent users. If you embrace a dynamic environment, the spirit of innovation and the importance of education, then we would love to see what you can do. We are building a world class product organization that rivals the largest software as a service companies in the world.
As a member of the Technical Operations team within PE, you will design, build and manage a world class infrastructure to support NWEA's products and mission. Our team consists of forward-thinking individuals who want to disrupt the traditional mold through progressive design and implementation practices.
Anybody can hire folks to look after a 24x7 organization and you can find that job anywhere. At NWEA, you will also make a difference in education and gain both depth and breadth of knowledge and experience by being part of one of the best companies in Portland. We are growing as a DevOps organization that believes in Scaling, Transforming, Growing, Leading, and Innovating while having fun and making a difference.
Below is the fine print of the job. But what you really need to have is the following:
;Passion for education
Willingness to fail, learn and grow
;Innovative spirit
;Interest in automation
;Desire to understand how your responsibilities fit into the big picture
Responsibilities
Install, configure, maintain and automate multiple Redhat/CentOS Linux environments via Puppet and Foreman
• Participate in continuous integration efforts and Agile software development processes to support regular software releases for our SaaS platform
• Lead the evaluation, selection and deployment of new technologies and tools
• Work with project managers, department heads and team members to determine project approaches, parameters and priorities
Work with colleagues to optimize overall system performance. This includes working with applications, network, storage, database and server technology
Provide support to internal and external clients, including participation in the 24x7 on-call rotation
Perform system audits, document findings, and publish recommendations
Keep abreast of technical developments to ensure the NWEA is able to take advantage of industry advances

item.title: Professional Services Engineer (NY) at Puppet Labs (New York, NY)
item.description:
Department: Client Services
Reports to: Director of Professional Services
Location: NY, New York

Summary of Role

Do you have a passion for Open Source software? Excited about what Puppet is doing and want to be a part of it? Love utilizing your technical knowledge in a client-facing role?

Puppet Labs is hiring additional Professional Services Engineers to join our growing PS team! In this role, you'll help our Puppet Labs' customers succeed through training, consulting, and custom development engagements, as well as further Puppet Labs product growth with direct customer feedback.

As part of our Professional Services team, you will work with our customers to implement solutions and deliver professional services, as well as deliver training and keep Puppet & MCollective training accurate and up-to-date. In addition, you will be responsible for providing pre-sales support to Sales & Marketing, developing and publishing Puppet modules and products, and developing and promoting integration and tooling around Puppet Labs products. As Professional Services Engineer, youll also develop blog posts and other communication for Puppet Labs, and work with R&D and Product Management to develop and test Puppet Labs products.

Qualifications

  • Unix &/or Linux SysAdmin or DevOps background, including automation
  • Strong customer relations & presentation skills - must be able to speak well in front of an audience and with customers
  • Excitement about working with the Puppet community
  • Passion for problem solving
  • Excellent time and project management skills
  • Self-motivated and self-directed
  • Requires the ability to travel up to 60% (domestic & internationally) via ground and/or air transportation, including but not limited to, operating a vehicle and/or riding as a passenger in a vehicle, airplane, train or other form of transportation
  • Requires logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions or approaches to problems
  • Requires contact with others (face-to-face, by telephone, virtual meetings, VOIP or otherwise) and the ability to work and interact in a group or team
  • Technical degree (CS/IT/Eng/ITSec) or equivalent experience
  • Valid driver's license
  • A criminal background check is part of the employment hiring process.
  • Puppet Certified, a plus!

Preferred but not required

  • Programming skills (Ruby, Python, Perl, etc.)
  • Large scale infrastructure experience
  • Experience with Puppet or other configuration management tools
  • Knowledge of data center management, systems management, and monitoring, networking & security
  • Professional services experience in an open source/enterprise software company

Application Instructions

In order to be considered for this position, please submit your application online (via the Apply Now button). Please include a cover letter with your resume addressing the following:

  • Why are you interested in working for Puppet Labs?
  • Please summarize how your background fits the listed qualifications.
  • Please confirm you are available for up to 60% travel domestically & internationally.
  • Please include a list of references in your cover letter.

Working for Puppet Labs

Our mission at Puppet Labs is to drive the cost of technology change to zero. We make IT automation software for systems administrators, freeing them from repetitive work and fire-fighting so they can do more interesting and higher-value work for their organizations. Our most important measure of success is their love for our products.

We're growing fast, but we're determined for everyone here to have a real impact on the company and our customers every day. We're driven and restless. We encourage creativity and collaboration. By challenging each other, we foster continuous improvement. We hire carefully for passion, self-motivation, intelligence, curiosity, and adaptability.

We offer excellent health benefits for employees and family, a flexible time-off policy (that we do insist you use), and a variety of methods to grow your skills and further your career. We have employees all around the US, the UK, Sweden, Canada, the Czech Republic and Australia. Our headquarters in downtown Portland, Oregon, is one block off Tom McCall Waterfront Park with views of Mt. Hood, Mt. St. Helens and the Willamette River.

Puppet powers thousands of companies, including Twitter, Yelp, Disney, Google, Citrix, eBay, NYSE, Cisco WebEx, Salesforce, Bank of America and PayPal. Our investors include Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers, VMware, Google Ventures, Cisco, True Ventures, Radar Partners, and Emerson Street Partners.

item.title: Systems / DevOps Engineer at NuData Security (Vancouver, BC, Canada)
item.description:
NuData Security is looking for a full time Systems / DevOps Engineer.


NuData Security is a leader in web and mobile risk-based behavioral analytics. Headquartered in Vancouver, British Columbia, our client base includes Fortune 50 companies and gives us a global footprint. We’re looking to add a new member to our Infrastructure team.


You will be a key member of our Operations team – responsible for all aspects of our infrastructure. You will help manage, architect and develop all of our staging and production systems, and will spend your days doing everything from building, deploying, and migrating large scale server clusters to writing code that optimizes our testing process. You are energetic, ambitious, motivated and precise, and you pride yourself on designing robust, self-healing systems that can withstand a datacenter failure or spike in traffic. You think of servers as objects (in an object oriented kind of way) and you can make 30 servers do what you need at once.


Primary functions



  • Understand business/technical requirements

  • Design, develop and maintain new solutions individually and as part of a team

  • Modify and maintain existing solutions

  • Contribute and help us execute to our long term IT vision


Qualifications and Experience



  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computing Science or related field, or equivalent work experience

  • 3+ years of experience in managing servers, networks, and infrastructure

  • Broad knowledge of many of the following: OSX, Linux, network, servers, virtualization (including on premise and cloud), security, availability, redundancy and  monitoring.

  • 3+ years of experience in at least one modern programming language, as well as application design and architecture

  • Strong object oriented design and data structure skills

  • Strong problem solving, algorithm design, and complexity analysis

  • Exceptional communication, both written and spoken


Assets



  • Experience in scaled out environments and distributed systems, as well as architecting large scale systems

  • Experience with Cassandra, MongoDB, or any other NoSQL database

  • Deep knowledge of AWS

  • Demonstrated ability to understand the business process 


What we offer in return includes a beautiful view of the North Shore mountains, coffee that doesn’t suck, and colleagues that are as brilliant as they are likeable. We do cool things as a company. You know, like sword fighting, pinball playing, craft beer tastings. Plus all that normal stuff like a competitive salary, health benefits and flexible work hours.


If this sounds like you, apply and tell us why you’re the best candidate for the job. 


(Our focus currently is on candidates that are in or are willing to relocate to the Vancouver area and who are eligible to work in Canada.)

item.title: Software Developer at NuData Security (Vancouver, BC, Canada)

Software Developer


NuData Security is looking for a full-time Software Developer that will interface with our Data Analysts and create new tools to efficiently store, index, retrieve and handle big data.


NuData Security is a leader in web and mobile risk-based behavioral analytics. Headquartered in Vancouver, British Columbia, our client base includes Fortune 50 companies and gives us a global footprint.

If this sounds like you, apply and tell us why you’re the best candidate for the job.

item.title: Interaction Designer -work in Brooklyn, lead design for one of our products at Signal (formerly BrightTag) (Kings County, NY)
item.description:
The Signal Development Team is growing. We're looking for an Interaction Designer to fill a key role on our team based in Brooklyn working primarily on our Signal Engage product.  


Signal is a real-time marketing technology provider. We offer an open, neutral data platform. Our platform is made up of our patented suite of products that were built from the ground up to create a new standard for the way marketing data is collected and shared.  Our cross channel platform works with any marketing/analytics tool. It makes it possible for brands to stream data in real time (less than 50 milliseconds from data collection to syndication), helping marketers to turn the live data into knowledge they can use immediately.  Signal was founded as BrightTag in 2010 and is headquartered in Chicago.  Our Brooklyn office is in DUMBO and is new and growing.


What we value:  We don’t care about ninjas or rock stars.  We look for people who are really smart, really nice and who want to solve big problems and have the freedom to solve them without slogging through layers of bureaucracy. We believe in code quality, testing, peer reviews, collaboration. We like polyglot programming. We believe in using the best tool for the job.  We love open source, open communication and have created an environment where we treat people like adults, give them big problems to solve and the power to solve them.  We value building the right team and love that people rarely leave us.


What you’ll be doing:



  • Design and execute the look and feel of our UI.

  • Maintain the quality of our platform for today’s customers.  And, because you aspire to more, you will always looking for ways to provide a greater experience current and future users.

  • Partner closely with our account team to understand our Users’ experience and enhance constantly it through progressive Agile iteration.

  • Work closely with the rest of the team to organize, design and implement new features for our product.

  • Help to make the architectural components of the platform better.  

  • Work with product and engineering to determine requirements, articulate and advocate user needs and then turn those needs into concepts and elegant interface designs.

  • Develop and maintain design wireframes, mockups, and specifications. 

  • You will participate in bi-weekly sprints, weekly releases.

  • Learn and have fun.  You’ll experience the awesome fun that is Hack Week, Shark Week, demo days.  Want to know more? Read our Code to code by.

item.title: Experienced iOS Developer at 52inc (Columbia, SC)
item.description: We're looking for motivated iOS developers that are interested in fast-moving and rapidly changing projects. As we grow, we're looking for additional iOS team members to lead the development of projects for clients. With a new project every few weeks, you'll never be bored working on the same project for long. You'll work with talented UI/UX designers to create amazing experience for our clients in the mobile space. Along with designers, you'll be working toe-to-toe with Android developers, server application developers, and other iOS developers. The key to this position is being able to lead and ship a high-quality app in a short amount of time. We specialize in great apps, on a short deadline. If this sounds like something you'd be interested in, drop us a line!

item.title: LAMP / Wordpress Developer at Digiday (New York, NY)

We are looking for a highly motivated individual who can thrive in a fast pace environment and successfully contribute to the team. Our goal is to find someone who is experienced with implementing cutting edge web development techniques. The ideal candidate will have a can-do attitude, passion for technology, extensive development experience, and will be able to get up to speed quickly.


RESPONSIBILITIES

item.title: Chicago Software Developer at Spiceworks (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
Who you are: Do you live, eat and breathe programming? Someone who sees code in their sleep and won’t be happy until you find that perfect UI? Would you consider yourself a developer’s developer? Spiceworks just might have your dream job! We’re looking for a razor sharp developer (Chicago) to help transform how IT pros get their work done. If you’re a software fanatic who tirelessly fine tunes their craft and seeks to improve your ideas based on what end-users really want and need – it’s time to apply!


 Your day-to-day (as a Software Developer, you’ll): 



  • Help take our platform to the next level with an endless source of new ideas

  • Turn those awesome visions into realities and have a direct, practical impact in the IT trenches

  • Think about usability every step of the way (not just code on auto-pilot)

  • Tap into our user base, interact with them directly, and get real-world feedback and insights to make ideas and features as relevant and useful as possible.

  • Contribute to the design and development of product features as well as major components

  • Offer innovative ideas to help evolve the Spiceworks suite of products

  • Work directly with our growing community of over 6 million IT pros as well as experienced developers who are experts in the industry

  • Work across the board, from frontend to backend and everywhere in between

  • Have a blast every step of the way!

item.title: User Interface Developer at Spiceworks (Austin, TX)
item.description:
Who you are: Are you an ambitious UI developer with a passion for solving hard problems? Can you see a digital deliverable through from mockup to implementation? Do you relish the challenge of scaling a large social site or love finding ways to blur the line between traditional desktop apps and the web? Then Spiceworks just might have a position for you! We’re looking for a top-notch UI Application Developer to help contribute to the next phase in the Spiceworks’ suite of products. 


Your day-to-day (as a top notch UI Developer, you’ll): 



  • Focus on design and development of large, new product features

  • Working with UX Designers to design end user workflows

  • Contribute to the innovation and evolution of Spiceworks as a developer platform

  • Promote design consistency and other UI standards across our products (working closely with other members of the UI team).

  • Work directly with our growing community of over 5 million IT pros

  • Join an exciting new team with tons of room for growth

item.title: Big Data Engineer (f/m) at mbr targeting (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
mbr targeting uses patent pending algorithms for highly efficient real-time advertising. It is 100% science- and technology-focused and the processes and analyzes massive amounts of data at minimum computing time. Also it is working at the cutting edge of Big Data and real-time technologies. We operate large-scale deployments of real-time web services and it is based in Berlin, Berlin, Berlin, Berlin, Berlin, Berlin, Berlin!


We are looking for


Big Data Engineer (f/m)


YOU will …



  • work on extending our Hadoop-based Big Data infrastructure into the Petabyte region.

  • help make the enourmous amounts of data accessible to our machine learning team for ad-hoc queries.

  • establish more real-time stream-processing capabilities as new data comes in.

  • implement batch jobs from scratch and optimize existing ones.

  • always adapt the latest technologies from the Hadoop ecosystem.


YOU have …



  • an academic degree in Computer Science or equivalent.

  • deep expertise in the Hadoop eco-system.

  • strong experience with SQL and NoSQL databases, ideally: PostgreSQL, Couchbase, Cassandra, …

  • ultimate Big Data Buzzword Compliance: Hadoop, Hive, MapReduce, Impala, Parquet, HBase, Storm, Oozie, ElasticSearch, …

  • the desire to quickly learn new technologies and work on existing code written in any programming language (mostly Java, C++, Python).

  • ideally already worked on 100TB+ Hadoop clusters.

  • as a big plus: A background in online advertising technology (adserving, RTB).


We offer …



  • a small, young and highly passionate team of extraordinary co-workers.

  • an open and embracing culture for the latest hot technologies.

  • an agile, focused, yet relaxed atmosphere with flexible working hours.

  • a high level of freedom and responsibility.

  • a competitive salary.

  • a nice and spacious Berlin-style office in the heart of Neukölln.

  • a large-scale reservoir of Club Mate that can be accessed in real-time!


Send an informal application including a CV directly to our CTO: jobs@mbr-targeting.com

item.title: UI Designer at Spiceworks (Austin, TX)
item.description:
Who you are: Do you cringe at poorly designed software and websites? Do you pride yourself on composing beautiful interfaces that can transform a complex problem into a simplistic user experience? Well, you just might have a home at Spiceworks! We’re on the hunt for a UI/UX Designer who can serve up pixel perfect mockups and work with product managers to concept new, awesome ideas.

Who we are: Spiceworks’ innovative model combines a network management app with an online social network of over 5 million IT pros. They rely on Spiceworks to carry out their day-to-day responsibilities and connect with each other to exchange tips and IT advice… and have a great time! Best way to sum up Spiceworks: We’re sort of like LinkedIn meets Facebook for IT pros. Curious what our designers are up to? Check out their work on Dribbble.

What you’ll do: As a killer UI/UX Designer you are responsible for crafting a user experience that’s visually compelling and sublimely simplistic. We’re looking for someone with true design skills who can appreciate the details in light of a broader artistic vision. You’ll be working in a creative environment with other designers and developers. You’ll also wear the shoes of the end user, designing an interaction that captures their attention and delivers a seamless flow. Oh, and you’ll have a blast every pixel of the way!

item.title: Junior Developer at EnergyWatch Inc. (New York, NY)
item.description:
EnergyWatch is an established energy consulting firm with a startup mentality.  Founded in 2000, EnergyWatch helps our clients minimize energy cost, consumption, and emissions and maximize energy income through utility invoice analytics, energy procurement, utility budgeting and reporting, and real-time consumption analytics. 


Through our proprietary integrated energy management program, EnergyWatch identifies and analyzes the interactive effects of operational and capital improvements on utility supply and delivery costs; measures, verifies, and reports on key performance indicators; and summarizes the results for key decision makers.


EnergyWatch has existed for the past 14 years as a local (NYC) consulting firm with a great reputation for superior customer service and second to none business ethics.  We're launching our new platform, new website designed by a leading web design firm, and new office space designed by the firm responsible for BuzzFeed and Paperless Post's offices, all in an effort to expand our reach nationally, and then internationally.  We're looking to bring on talented programmers who will be instrumental in helping EnergyWatch achieve this vision!


What you’ll do:



  • Work as a key early member (Junior Developer #2) of a high performance product development team

  • Work directly with the firm’s Partners and lead developer on creating, refining, and maintaining an industry leading integrated energy management platform

item.title: Software Engineer at B-Line Medical (Washington, DC)
item.description:
B-Line Medical is seeking a software engineer with a passion for research & development in pursuit of making great products. Our ideal candidate will have a solid background in computer science fundamentals and at least 3 years of development experience with an emphasis on enterprise-grade platforms and systems.


What you will be doing as a key member of our team:



  • Research and development using several back-end technologies in support of our complex multi-server application.  Examples include C++, .NET, SQLite, Node.js, Nginx, MySQL or PostgreSQL, and others -- strong general development skills are a plus

  • Research and development specific to multiple live and recorded video streams, live data streams, live data sharing, and other real-time data input and analysis; this includes using sockets and event-based communication

  • Working to solve complex problems while producing quality code

  • Continually improving and delivering reliable software through focused code reviews, pair programming, and other methods of collaboration

item.title: Senior Developer at D+H (Mississauga, ON, Canada)
item.description:
As a member of the Enterprise Common Product Platform (ECPP) team, the Senior Software Developer is responsible for the development of ECPP platform framework and ECPP Software Development Kit (SDK) using agile methodologies. This includes technical design, systems analysis, coding, automated unit testing and integration testing. You will liaise with other developers, team leads, technical leads, QA, project managers, business analysts and end users regarding the development and implementation of ECPP platform components using .Net and Microsoft technology. This role reports to the ECPP
Development Manager.

item.title: PHP Developer at Vaco LLC (Nashville, TN)
item.description:
The software developer’s role is to design, code, test, and analyze PHP software programs, MySQL databases and applications. This includes researching, designing, documenting, and modifying software specifications throughout the production lifecycle. The software developer will also analyze and amend PHP software and MySQL database errors in a timely and accurate fashion and provide status reports to the Applications Development Manager.



Strategy & Planning


• Work with the Applications Development Manager or Senior Software Developer conceptualizing and developing new software programs, databases and applications.


• Meet deliverable schedule in the development life cycle (SDLC) for a variety of projects.


• Assist in the preparation and documentation of software requirements and specifications.



Operational Management


• Consistently write, translate, and code software programs, stored procedures and applications according to specifications with the guidance of the Applications Development Manager.


• Run and monitor software performance tests on new and existing programs for the purposes of correcting errors, isolating areas for improvement, and general debugging.


• Administer critical analysis of test results and deliver solutions to problem areas.


• Liaise with network administrators, systems analysts, database administrators and software engineers to assist in resolving problems with software products or company software systems or databases.

item.title: Junior Software Developer at Loopon (Barcelona, Spain)
item.description:
We are  looking for a talented and passionate junior developer to help us meet the challenges of a growing IT startup. You will be working on and learning about all parts of our system; frontend, backend, database, system architecture.


In your role as a junior developer you will get the chance to learn from experienced developers with many years of experience from different industries. Since Loopon is a young and small company you also have a great opportunity to grow in the organisation and get a bigger responsibility in the future.


Last but not least, you get the opportunity to live and work in Barcelona with a nordic salary level.

item.title: Web Application Developer at EditShare (Boston, MA)
item.description: EditShare is seeking a highly-talented developer eager to work on our suite of media and storage web applications in our Boston office.  Our web applications provide video asset management, video sequencing, and video trimming tools that stretch HTML5 and JavaScript to its limit.  If you love working on the latest web application APIs and standards while building tools for the film and television industry, then this may be the job for you.

item.title: Senior C# ASP.NET Software Engineer at Saturn Systems (Duluth, MN)
item.description: We are now accepting applications for a Senior C# ASP.NET Software Engineer with at least seven years of development experience. In this position, you will establish system requirements, design system architectures and perform complex software analysis and development. You will use your communication skills to work effectively with clients and teammates, all in an agile environment. This is an excellent opportunity for you to take the next step in your career. These positions are in our corporate offices in Duluth, MN, on the shores of Lake Superior, one of the best places to live in this country.

item.title: Python Developer - Build the smartest way to buy a car at Unhaggle Inc. (Toronto, ON, Canada) (allows remote)
item.description:
Unhaggle serves car buyers with a relentless passion for phenomenal customer satisfaction.  We’ve made buying a new car easier, faster and more transparent for car buyers and dealers alike with our innovations.


We are currently the #1 web portal in Canada for new car buying. The data we provide powers our own tools and products, including our flagship consumer car buying service at Unhaggle.com and leading automotive portals including Yahoo Autos, MSN Autos, Autofocus, AutoGuide, Globe Drive, and others.


We are looking for a Python developer with experience with web application development. This is a full-time contract position. We are looking for developers who will be working from home and ideally to work with us on a long-term basis. You will be working remotely and we accept applications from candidates anywhere in the world.


Our management team is based in Toronto, Canada. Selected candidates will be asked to work as much as possible in Toronto Time / EST Time (GMT -4).


We use GitHub to manage tasks and code reviews as well as tools like New Relic, Sentry, Browserstack. Stripe and  Redis. We are constantly seeking to use the best tools available for our development team.


You will be primarily involved in three different projects:



  • Our web portal unhaggle.com


  • REST APIs, for integration with different partners




  • An internal and innovative web application we built for industry clients




Additional information:




  • All projects are written in Python and Django. The scope will usually include front-end (CSS/Javascript and AJAX/XHTML) and back-end (Django, Python, PostgreSQL and general server software).




  • We take quality seriously and you should expect to be involved in well written code bases following standards such as PEP-8 and good software engineering practices.

item.title: Front-End Engineer at DBOX (New York, NY)
item.description:
DBOX is looking for a front-end developer to join its growing development team. You should be skilled in the latest web technologies including HTML5, CSS3 and modern, modular, testable, and idiomatic JavaScript. You’re pragmatic in your approach to problem solving. You’re also highly proficient at writing clean, semantic markup.


The right candidate will help build the front-end for a variety of clients in luxury markets as well as a variety of other industries. You should cherish experimentation and exploration with new technologies, while at the same time keeping your mind on the task currently at hand. This role will enable you to have a significant influence over the structure and direction of new projects. You will be working with cutting edge technologies, and will have significant runway to grow your skills technically and professionally.

item.title: Python Web Application Developer at Scopus IT (Consulting @ Google) (New York, NY)

The work involves design, implementation, and maintenance of web-based applications for internal business use. This development is for critical web-based system to be used internally for the organization, but throughout the world. The ideal candidates will be comfortable working as key contributors in implementing new tool providing technical solutions for support needs as required. 


This is a fantastic opportunity to gain experience while working on-site in an incredible dynamic environment.


Responsibilities include: 



  • Designing and quickly implementing clear, effective web pages.

  • Developing day-to-day maintenance of web content.

  • Responding to a variety of web-related requests across departments.

  • Technical documentation writing in HTML, good presentation and code documentation.

  • Fulfilling several project requests simultaneously while meeting tight deadlines. 


(Note: We have additional consulting roles doing imaging development for a medical device using similar technology platform.)

item.title: Software Developer - contract positions at Arcurve Inc. (Houston, TX)
item.description:
Want to work in a software development environment where the focus is on creating, developing and delivering high quality software solutions?  Are you interested in working in a fast paced environment with highly skilled peers?  Read on…


Current Project Portfolio


Accept a challenging position working with a variety of technologies, working with clients to design, build, implement and deliver custom software solutions in a range of business domains:



  • Create Enterprise business applications in C#, .NET from Winforms to WPF

  • Web Development projects in ASP.NET, MVC

  • Specialized projects in mobile including iOS and Android development

  • Utilize your knowledge of Oracle, SQL Server, My SQL to help clients design and deliver data driven, technical solutions

  • An opportunity to work with our multidiscipline team on VB and .NET applications


Does one, or all the above appeal to you?


How We Work



  • Fast moving environment.  We have a variety of projects to work on, technologies to work with, in an iterative, team based culture.

  • Contribute your domain expertise or learn the business processes in a new field of interest

  • High Standards – our clients demand them, we out-deliver both in the quality of software we produce.

  • Flexible Hours with a focus on delivering objectives, not determining “office hours”.

  • Involvement in all aspects of the Software Development Lifecycle, potentially taking on different roles for different projects at different times.

  • Focus on client interactions which provide feedback on what you have designed, built and delivered.

  • Mentoring; give and receive – learn from other smart individuals with professional software experience, while contributing your skills and expertise to the mix.

  • Hands on; come in, get up to speed, produce, deliver and see the results of your work.

item.title: Senior iOS or Android Developer at Small Planet Digital (New York, NY)
item.description:
Small Planet Digital (http://www.smallplanet.com) is interviewing candidates that can join our staff and work full time in our Dumbo, Brooklyn office in the role of Senior iOS Developer or Senior Android Developer. We’re a fun, hardworking, and talented company that develops world-class mobile applications for some of the best clients around.

As a Senior Developer you will work directly with company leadership and producers on various app development projects, creating iOS and Android games and apps for our own distribution and for client engagements. Our applications have topped the charts and won awards, and we’re growing strongly.


We offer full-time salary, benefits, a great work environment, and exciting growth opportunities. This is an excellent opportunity to join a talented team and grow your career as the company grows.

item.title: The Dream Job: Web App Developer at Recovery Brands, LLC (San Diego, CA)
item.description:
Are you a web developer looking to work in a relaxed, collaborative environment with other talented people on projects that really matter? Do you want a role that has great leadership, a game-changing product vision and an office culture rooted in creativity, authenticity, passion and fun? If so, we've been looking for you! 


We're looking for a Web Application Developer who specializes in architecting and developing incredible web applications that meet business requirements. The right candidate is a PHP pro who can pick apart third party APIs and build their own for in-house systems. Initially, this person will create and develop a system to manage a high volume of client campaigns with thousands of tracking phone numbers, while interfacing with various APIs (Twilio, Marchex/Voicestar, etc.). The goal is to better enable us to schedule, monitor and adjust campaigns, produce comprehensive internal and external reports, and ultimately generate revenue while improving ROI for customers by connecting people seeking help for addictions to the treatment centers that best meet their needs.


We'd like you to:



  • Architect and develop systems based off business requirements

  • Creative strategy to enable the lead management platform to yield ever-improving results for clients and our revenue

  • Work with third party web APIs and develop APIs for in-house systems

  • Take ownership of your projects, you’ll be building a vital component of our business!

  • Develop easy to use visual dashboards (in-house design resources are available)

  • Devops; provisioning and maintaining web stacks utilizing Nginx, PHP-FPM, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Varnish

  • Write test cases

  • Build WordPress plugins

  • Improve workflows for the team (reduce repetitive tasks, increase ability to extract key insights, enable on-demand reporting, etc.)

item.title: Enterprise Applications Systems Programmer at Adams State University (Alamosa, CO)
item.description:
Adams State University’s Computing Services Department is currently seeking applicants for an Enterprise Applications Systems Programmer. This is a full-time, 12-month, at-will/exempt position that reports to the Manager of Enterprise Applications Systems.


Summary of Position:


The Enterprise Applications Systems Team in the Computing Services Department supports the numerous systems which comprise our Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) infrastructure at Adams State University. This infrastructure is based primarily on Ellucian’s Banner ERP solution running on Oracle Databases.


This position will serve as a hands-on technical position as an applications programmer providing application programming support for one or more Banner ERP Modules. This position will design and develop campus solutions that require knowledge and proficiency with Oracle database development and a variety of programming languages, to include: PERL/CGI-Perl, PL/SQL, C, Java, Visual Basic, Groovy, Grails, SOAP, web-services and Python.


Applications Programming Responsibilities:




  • Function as a fully operational applications programmer for the Banner ERP system




  • Perform the full range of Banner programming skills, including program design, coding, testing, debugging, maintenance and documentation through the use of analytical skill, experience and judgment




  • Based upon user requirements, this position will be responsible for designing, modifying and maintaining specialized Banner programs, processes, scripts and reports




  • Provide primary support for at least one module of the Banner ERP system. This includes being a technical liaison between the Computing Services Department and the functional ASU Department and monitoring and completing related work tickets for areas of responsibility




  • Do research as necessary, to stay current with the changing needs and requirements of functional areas of responsibility (Financial Aid, for example) as they relate to the Banner ERP system




  • Act in a support and back-up role, when needed, for other Banner team members when they are unreachable




  • Work as an active team member on various team projects and initiatives, as necessary in support of short-term and long-term team goals and initiatives




Qualifications:




  • Requires a Bachelor’s degree in CS, MIS, CIS, CSCI or related field.




  • Requires a minimum of 3 years professional work experience in a software development field, 5+ preferred. Preferred area of experience is in Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) applications programming.




  • Demonstrated technical abilities and effective teamwork skills in an Enterprise Applications Systems team-centric environment




  • Strong computer programming skills with experience with PL/SQL, SQL, PERL/CGI-Perl, Groovy, Grails, Java, SOAP, web-services and Python preferred




  • Experience with programming web-based middleware for Ellucian’s Banner system or a similar Higher Education ERP system is preferred




  • Experience with Red Hat Linux and Oracle Databases is preferred




  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills and interpersonal skills, with a demonstrated ability to work with diverse campus constituencies




  • Extensive experience with implementing cross-functional and intra-departmental projects and systems



  • Knowledge of current trends, ideas and resources in the Enterprise Applications Systems area of Higher Education


Benefits: Adams State has a competitive benefits package including medical and dental benefits, vacation and sick leave


Salary: $50,000 annually


Further information:


Adams State University is a state-supported institution that offers both undergraduate and graduate programs. Located in Alamosa in the San Luis Valley of south-central Colorado, approximately 4 hours from Denver and 2.5 hours from Santa Fe, Adams State is designated as a Hispanic Service Institution and as a regional educational provider. Additional information about the University can be found at http://www.adams.edu. Information about Alamosa can be found at http://www.alamosa.org


Applications:


Applicants should submit a letter of application, resume, educational transcripts, and three references. Electronic applications are acceptable. Official transcripts will be required prior to campus interviews. Review of completed applications will begin immediately and will continue until the position is filled.


Send all materials to:


Meagan Smith
Assistant to the Vice President for Finance and Governmental Relations
Adams State University
Alamosa, Colorado 81101
719-587-7727, meagansmith@adams.edu


Adams State University is particularly interested in applications from women and minorities.


In compliance with the Immigration Control Act of 1986, candidates for positions must provide proof of eligibility to work before an offer of employment can be made final.


Employee Background Check Policy at Adams State University:


Adams State University is dedicated to providing a safe and secure environment for our faculty, staff, students, and visitors. To assist in achieving this goal, we conduct background checks on persons offered positions at the university prior to employment as described in the background check policy.


Full descriptions of all positions are available from the contact person listed and at http://www.adams.edu/administration/hr/employment.php. Adams State University is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. Applications are sought from all qualified persons regardless of race, color, sex, disability, and, as covered by law, veteran status. In addition, University policies prohibit discrimination on the basis of religion, national origin, ancestry, age, sexual orientation including transgender status and gender expression, marital status, and parental status.

item.title: Senior Java Developer at TD Ameritrade (Ann Arbor, MI)
item.description:
Role:


The Sr. Software Development consultant will perform complex software design tasks and will provide thought leadership on the design, installation and maintenance of complex systems/projects.  This role will serve as an SME on a particular system or application and will be required to gain complete understanding of business requirements and communicate them to development teams.   This role will mentor and lead Jr. Level developers while ensuring development practices are in line with company best practices and policies.


This role will be part of the team responsible for the re-architecture, design, development  and launch of  the next generation code base aligned to the future state platform architecture.


Responsibilities:



  • Performs product design & troubleshooting exercises of extremely high complexity which require extensive research and analysis.     

  • Leads system design and specification development, program logic and flow-charting, testing, debugging, and documentation. Will be responsible for making complex design choices to be used by the development teams.  

  • Leads moderate to highly complex programming tasks, providing review of various development tasks and documentation. Provides analysis of problems and recommends solutions.

  • Is a key contributor in client/technology interactions in the development of technology solutions? Will interface with Enterprise Architecture & Infrastructure teams on strategic designs and initiatives.

  • Leads the troubleshooting of complex problems in development and production environments, ensuring timely resolution of issues.

  • Mentors more junior developers, serves as an SME on their system of expertise and directs the work and assigns development tasks of JR. Developers.

item.title: Senior Full Stack Python Engineer at Zenefits (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
As an engineer at Zenefits, you’ll create and ship software everyday that is fundamentally changing the way the HR industry operates. You should be able to slide up and down the software stack, building the infrastructure to support the products you release. We want people who care deeply about what they build and about the quality of execution.


At Zenefits, the engineers own the product that they build completely and wear multiple hats during the development process. And thus, you should be able to empathize both with users and the rest of your team. This means considering both how our users will use your software and how your peers will use your code.


You should have built and, more importantly, maintained widely used products. You're willing to pick up the slack and do the unglamorous tasks.


The primary languages we speak at Zenefits are Python (Django) and JavaScript (Ember.js).

item.title: Mobile Developer, Team Lead at Top Hat (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
What You'll Do


We're looking for a hardcore mobile engineer to lead our mobile team on the mission to build our cutting edge native mobile clients. This is the piece of software that students all over the world use in class to interact with the Top Hat platform. We are looking for someone who is extremely technical, but also understands the nuances of a beautiful mobile experience.




    Come work here because we're making a dent in the universe




    Come work here because we have a brilliant team




    Come work here because we care about software craftsmanship




    Come work here because we don't take ourselves too seriously




    Come work here because we care about and iterate on our development process




Your work will touch hundreds of thousands of paying customers (500,000 and growing every day). We only officially launched a little over two years ago, but we’re already profitable and are growing like crazy! Lucky for you, we’re small but mighty. That means you get to touch everything mobile and sometimes even help out on front-end, back-end, database code—whatever your little hacker heart desires! And what’s more? Everything you touch will be yours. Well, kind of. We follow the “Facebook approach,” meaning we give developers complete ownership of features.

item.title: Full Stack Developer at Top Hat (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
About the Gig 

We're looking for  hardcore engineers to help build our cutting edge education platform that students all over the world use in class. Does doin’ your thing in Django take you to your happy place? Does coding in JavaScript feel better than Christmas morning? Read on, you Maniac Hack. Read on.


Our client side app is built on a fairly sophisticated JavaScript framework and makes use of JQuery, backbone.js and all the usual suspects. The server side is written in Python on Django, with a MySQL database. In addition we use Node.js and SockJS for our real time components. Our systems all run on Amazon Web Services.


You will be will be working a variety of projects relating to our flagship web application. These will include frontend MVC application design and development, DOM optimization, and scalable and modular HTML/CSS . In terms of backend development, you will be working on our Django application and creating lightning fast REST APIs.


We like to hire developers who have solid full stack experience but definitely value, and accommodate, developers who choose to be more focused on either front-end and back-end development.

item.title: Software Developer at British Sky Broadcasting (Greenford, UK)
item.description:
Software Developer (Agile / Java)- West London

Background

Sky is currently seeking passionate and effective individuals to help grow their online business. These individuals will be self-organising and will build on a culture of success. candidate will be joining a mature Agile team of developers, testers and analysts using Scrum and XP methods with a strong continuous improvement culture.

Description

As a Java Developer you will be a proactive, disciplined professional who displays a technical aptitude and possess a level of business acumen. You will work in a dedicated product team using Agile practices to deliver high-quality tested software to the business on a regular basis. This role reports directly to the Scrum Master.

Key Responsibilities:
  • Develop excellent quality software using agile techniques such as Test Driven Development and Pair Programming
  • Take an active role in Story definition, assisting QA's and business stakeholders with Acceptance criteria and BDD
  • Drive best technology and software development practices into the team with passion and enthusiasm
  • Participate in daily stand-up meetings, planning games, showcases, and retrospectives.
  • Strive for continuous improvement within the team
  • Resolution of defects during the full product lifecycle.
  • Deliver production-ready, fully tested software in every iteration


Requirements/ Skills:
  • Experience and strong ability in Java
  • Knowledge and experience of a wide range of best of breed open source and commercial technologies
  • Experience of software development for high capacity, high traffic, high availability websites/systems
  • Delivery experience within an agile project
  • Excellent communication skills


Behaviours sought:
  • A track record of getting the job done
  • An enthusiasm and aptitude for learning new skills and practices
  • Take pride and ownership in your work
  • Proactive attitude
  • Good team player


Our expectations are high, but so are the rewards: a real opportunity to expand upon your technology career with us, an excellent salary and comprehensive Sky benefits including health cover, contributory pension, Sky Broadband, Sky HD and competitive bonus scheme. Our world-class technology professionals enable us to consistently deliver outstanding innovation and keep us at the top of our market - join in!

We want Sky to be a great place to work. Somewhere people can reach their potential, fostering a culture of opportunity that motivates people to aim high and giving them all the support and tools they need to succeed.

Sky delivers some of the most diverse content and services on the planet, and we value the same diversity within our business. We provide a culture of entrepreneurialism and opportunity for one and all.

It's our people that make Sky the UK and Ireland's leading entertainment company. That's why we work hard to be an inclusive employer, so everyone at Sky can be their best.

  • Be seen as a lead character within the team that can offer advice around design, architectural decisions and code quality

Our expectations are high, but so are the rewards: a real opportunity to expand upon your technology career with us, an excellent salary and comprehensive Sky benefits including health cover, contributory pension, Sky Broadband, Sky HD and competitive bonus scheme. Sky delivers some of the most diverse content and services on the planet, and we value the same diversity within our business. We provide a culture of entrepreneurialism and opportunity for one and all.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Education Portal (Mountain View, CA)
item.description:
About Education Portal


We are a technology company on a mission to make education accessible. Education Portal helps millions of students improve their grades and earn college credit. We offer self-paced, online video courses that cover every subject taught in high school and junior college. Our team has built these courses from the ground up, leveraging data and technology to make the entire learning process simple and engaging for students.


We are a profitable, fast growing company looking to expand our team.


We began our journey in 2002 as a self-funded start-up and have grown every year since our inception. As a small, independent company, our employees have a direct impact on company direction and results.


We are located in the heart of downtown Mountain View, just a few steps from the Caltrain station. We only hire top talent, so those who pass our rigorous interview process will find themselves as part of one of the brightest and most innovative teams in Silicon Valley.


We have a culture of social responsibility. As we continue to generate profits, we give back by funding scholarship programs and helping charitable organizations provide open access to information and education throughout the poorest regions of the world.


Come join us on our mission and make a difference.


About the Senior Java Software Engineer Position


Education Portal serves over 10 million users each month, which requires a solid architectural foundation and cutting-edge user experience. We're seeking a passionate, data-driven innovator to help take our product to the next level and solve the complex problems that arise from developing predictive and recommendation algorithms based on massive amounts of user data.  Your work will directly impact how we evolve and grow.  This is a fun, multifaceted job in an entrepreneurial environment.


The successful candidate knows and loves working with the latest software stacks, can model multidimensional data sets, and can draw from experience to impact our platform. You are analytical and creative, and you don’t quit. Education Portal has a culture of getting things done, and demands exceptional collaboration across its engineering and product teams.


Responsibilities:



  • Design, develop and deploy high-volume scalable web applications in Java

  • Participate in system design, architecture decisions and lead regular code reviews

  • Work in a highly interactive, team-oriented environment

  • Help refine our ROI and intent-matching algorithms to directly increase profitability

  • Actively improve our software platform using new tools, frameworks, and technologies

  • Become a key member and decision-maker in our top-notch engineering team


Why work for Education Portal?

  • Help make education accessible to people who need it

  • Enjoy a fun, casual and collaborative working environment

  • Join a profitable and financially stable company

  • Help guide company decisions and direction

  • See results of your work in days, not years

  • Have your work impact 10+ million web visitors each month

  • Grow professionally with our training and skill development programs

  • Work with other talented and passionate team members


Benefits:



  • Competitive compensation (including salary and bonus plan)

  • 401(k) retirement plan with employer matching

  • 20 days of flexible paid time off annually (increases to 30 days over 5 years)

  • Additional 10 paid holidays annually

  • Flexible work schedules

  • Comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans (we pay 100% of premiums)

  • Tuition reimbursement and gift matching programs

  • Stocked kitchen and beverages provided

  • Company sponsored gym memberships

  • Company sponsored Friday happy hour to celebrate weekly accomplishments

item.title: Software Developer-Front End Fun, Fully Funded San Diego Startup! at Furlocity, Inc. (San Diego, CA)
item.description:
Phenomenal opportunity to make a significant impact on one’s future career and goals while directly influencing the success of a cutting-edge organization! Furlocity, Inc. is currently looking to identify a talented Front-End Engineer (full-stack) with a passion for both personal and professional excellence coupled with a love for animals! 


Furlocity is making history and you can be a part of it as a core member of our technology “dream team!” The exponentially growing $60 Billion Pet Industry is significantly behind on the times and ripe for technological disruption. Since 2012, Furlocity has been on a mission to do just that. Now that Furlocity is well-established with proven success, we are moving to the next phase in our company history and positioning our company comprised of Furlocity’s  team of extremely talented individuals.


Modern technology and great client experiences are the heart of Furlocity. As a key member of our team, the talented Front-End Software Developer will be a core part of engineering the front-end architecture and get the freedom to execute his/her vision from concept to implementation, with a great team to help him/her along the way!  Our newest Developer will have a rare opportunity to work with modern technologies and add new and exciting features across multiple verticals in an untapped lucrative industry. Just think...Furlocity is the Expedia of pet accommodations and travel!


By joining Furlocity, you will have an once-in-a-lifetime ground floor opportunity to make a significant impact on your future career and goals while directly influencing the success of a cutting-edge organization!


Not just your regular ‘ole company perks!  Furlocity is committed to providing exciting career opportunities in a FUN and stimulating work environment that values trust, respect, new ideas, teamwork, creative talent, enthusiasm and innovation!  In addition to competitive compensation, we offer other excellent perks/benefits like:



  • Opportunity to Make History as early employee with a 1st-to-do-it company!

  • Lucrative stock options

  • Full time in-house key position with exceptional career advancement and a plethora of opportunities for professional development

  • Work on cool projects and solve complex/difficult problems everyday with the freedom to do what you do best!

  • One “Furlocity R&R Day” (Rest & Relaxation Day) per month in addition to your standard paid-vacation days/time-off because we know you work hard

  • 2+ weeks paid vacation/time-off

  • Fast laptop, big monitor, quiet office, comfy chair and lots of snacks

  • Think Zappos! Fun, innovative and laid-back work environment which fosters positive team culture and creativity...we love team lunches!

  • YOUR NAME on a never-been-done-before technology in a multi-billion dollar industry!

  • Unlimited coffee and flexible schedule--to help you keep the momentum going

  • Have pets? Bring them to work!

  • Need assistance insuring your furry family members? We got you covered!


Furlocity’s current stack includes:  


Ruby on Rails/RoR primarily as an API (rails  4.1.6 /ruby 2.1.3), Linux, Haml, TDD with Rspec, Coffeescript, JQuery, Postgres, Git, HTML5, CSS (SCSS), Backbone on the client, Handlebars for templating, Javascript test framework, Teaspoon, jasmine, Phantom JS, BDD with cucumber

item.title: Full Stack Software Developer - work on cool and innovative projects! at Upcoming (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
What we're looking for


Upcoming is expanding its development team. We're looking for an experienced software developer interested in working across the stack developing innovative tools in a fast-paced startup environment, while living in an awesome european city.


We use python in the backend (Flask, Celery+RabbitMQ), and manage the frontend with Jinja2, jQuery, LESS and Grunt; persistence is done with MySQL and Redis. The deployments are automated, in a Continuous Integration environment.


Our backend is developed in-house, with state-of-the-art publishing related features such as:



  • Monitoring of 1000's of rss feeds from news websites, in order to detect trending articles all around the globe.

  • Advanced analysis of our own articles' metrics, for automatically promoting them among our publication channels (this is aimed at maximizing virality).

  • (Bayesian) Headline and thumbnail A/B testing

  • Highly scalable click-through-rate optimizer, presented in a workshop of the ACM Recommender Systems conference in Hong Kong last year.


Since we're part of a big media group, some of these tools are now being used by other teams, reaching tens of millions of users every day.


What we offer



  • A perfect balance between working on innovation projects and “regular” web development, both with short and iterative development cycles.

  • The flexibility and dynamism of working in a startup, with the strong stability of being part of a big company.

  • An international environment, with people from all over the world (UK, Italy, Romania, Argentina, Brazil, Iran, and more)

  • Thorough relocation assistance, regardless of where you’re coming from

  • A competitive salary

  • 25 vacation days (and a great work-life balance)

  • Amsterdam! You’ll be living in one of the most beautiful and cosmopolitan cities in the world.

item.title: Software Developer at GSA Capital (London, UK)
item.description: Software Engineers operate at the very center of GSA Capital’s primary activities. They undertake the development of proprietary tools used by our quantitative researchers to create and test automated trading algorithms. Additionally they develop and operate the systems used to deploy, automatically manage and monitor these algorithms. In this undertaking they work together to research and solve problems in a variety of areas including but not limited to high speed simulation and calculation, real-time event processing, high throughput systems, fault tolerance, large scale data processing, storage and analysis, grid computing and performance tuning of complex systems.

item.title: Java Web Developer at Nomura (New York, NY)
item.description: Systems Management Engineering is globally responsible for the design, development and level 3 support of software within the Enterprise Infrastructure Services group.
