This role provides the candidate opportunity to drive the architecture, design and build of the visualisation technologies for a new data analytics platform that will help transform the firm’s approach to managing the global estate.

item.title: Computer Vision Specialist for iOS app [Part-time] at Orka Pod, Inc. (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Orka Pod Inc. is looking looking for an experienced computer vision specialist to help us on a part-time basis to develop a face detection engine for an iOS app. 


We are building an iOS app and that requires face detection on live video from the iPhone camera. CIDetector and the standard iOS packages are currently being used, but are not reliable or accurate enough for our purposes.


You will be working with a small team of seasoned engineers on this project. We have previously developed many iOS apps, but are missing computer vision specialists on the team.

item.title: Node.js API Developer at Coolblue (Rotterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
As a Node.js API developer at Coolblue you develop the RESTful microservices that form our API.


What you tell your friends you do
"I write code. - No, not like morse code. Computer code. Just... Never mind."


What you will really be doing



  • Developing microservices as part of the Coolblue API.

  • Designing our API through RESTful resource structures.

  • Creating and optimizing data models for various distributed (NoSQL) data stores.

  • Refactoring and optimizing core components of our Node.js codebase to improve its overall performance and quality.


How will you be doing this



  • You're part of an agile, multidisciplinary team. You bring your own unique skill set to the table and collaborate with others to accomplish your goals.

  • You prioritise your work with the team and its product owner, weighing both the business and technical value of each task.

  • You experiment, test, try, fail and learn all the time - with one thing at a time.

  • You don't do things just because they were always done that way. You don't ignore the lessons learned, however - even those learned by others.


Our stack
A distributed system based on microservices, built in Node.js, C# and PHP. All exposed through a uniform RESTful interface using HAL+JSON as our hypermedia format. All services exchange state change notifications through RabbitMQ. We store data in Elasticsearch, Redis, MySQL, Memcached - or whatever works best. We use GitHub, TeamCity, StatsD with Graphite and ELK.


What have we worked on last quarter



  • Further improving on our continuous deployment pipeline.

  • Implemented bluebird as our promises framework of choice.

  • A lot of groundwork for a powerful faceted search service.


Team
You'll become part of an agile, multidisciplinary team, ranging in size between four and six members. You get your own team room, a scrum master to help guide the process and a product owner to represent the business' needs.


We offer



  • Money.

  • To help you keep your money, we also chip in on your pension, pay for your travels and offer a discount on all the stuff we sell.

  • An indefinite contract (that's for ever, and ever, and ever).

  • Room for you to do things your way.

  • An extensive relocation package. Just pack your toothbrush, we'll take of the rest.

  • Lots of things you can learn through our in-house Coolcademy.

  • All work and no play is not our thing, so you get 25 days of paid leave.

  • You're not a real Dutchie if you don't own a bike, so our reimbursement plan has you covered.

  • An office in the heart of Rotterdam so there's plenty to do after work.

  • And yes, we also have the industry standard perks such as free beer, ping pong tables and awesome parties.

item.title: Director of Frontend Engineering (Relocation offered) at Agoda (Bangkok, Thailand)
item.description:
Overview:


We’re looking for an experienced Frontend Engineering Director to help us expand, scale and innovate our frontend development department.


Are you passionate about using technology to solve problems?  Can your passion drive a team to develop lean, efficient code that serves as the frontend of our cutting edge product? Then we would like to hear from you!


As the Director of Frontend Development at Agoda you will lead and guide a team of 60-80 software engineers that work on our storefront, the Agoda website. With 5-8 direct reports, you will work closely together with your peers to improve the website on the areas of functionality, quality and performance. You provide strategic input and thought leadership whilst constantly evaluating, mentoring and coaching your department managers as well as overseeing recruitment incentives. Your mission is to help us make Agoda the best online travel website bar none.


For you to be successful, within six months you will have coached the department to have a thorough understanding of engineering best-practices in software development, evaluate decisions and technologies, think critically and closely adhere to Scrum methodologies. Your team will be putting technologies to the best of use for the interest of Agoda and to improve quality of the Agoda website.


In this role you will have the opportunity to be part of the largest online travel company, to be a meaningful contributor to our growth and strategic direction and to drive research and innovation and to make a step change in your career.


Responsibilities: 



  • Lead, guide and mentor multiple frontend engineering teams using Scrum

  • Ensure our systems are scalable and can handle millions of daily visitors

  • Ensure our systems are fault-tolerant and self-healing

  • Drive engineering best-practices (unit testing, continuous delivery, etc.)

  • Encourage and drive meaningful innovation


Some of the technologies that you will use on a daily basis:



  • Frontend web technologies (HTML, CSS, SAS)

  • JavaScript web technologies (jQuery, Angular.js, socket.IO)

  • Frontend server side technologies (E.g.: C#, Python, Play framework)

  • NoSQL database technologies (E.g.: Cassandra, Hadoop, Couchbase)

  • Object Oriented Languages (E.g.: C#, Java, Scala)

  • Continuous Integration (Jenkins) 

  • Performance and load testing

item.title: Senior Java Developer (WCC) Utrecht at WCC Smart Search & Match (Utrecht, Nederland)
item.description:
As a Senior Java Developer with WCC you will be creating beautiful, cutting edge and high-quality applications that bring the power of ELISE to the end user. In a close-knit team of experts who thrive on customer satisfaction and innovation, your work will consist of creating business logic layer solutions in Java based on WCC’s flagship product ELISE (build by the Core Team in C++).


You’re able to transfer any problem or challenge into a solution and naturally lead a team into this direction. Besides developing in Java (and some JS) you’ll be working in the following technology stack; Tomcat, Spring, Apache CXF, Maven, Eclipse, Jenkins, Jira, Sonar, JavaScript, AngularJS, Bootstrap; Bower and Grunt.

item.title: Full Stack / Backend Developer at Gracious Eloise (New York, NY)
item.description:
Gracious Eloise wants to make communication more personal. With our patented handwriting digitization technology, people can add a “handwritten” touch to their important messages be it virtual or typed then printed.


Full stack developers at Gracious Eloise work on all parts of the system, from our widgets and websites to our API to handwriting processing and rendering. Our technical challenges are many and you’ll have the opportunity to extend yourself by optimizing code and systems across the stack, developing your machine learning skills, honing your UI creation abilities, and more.


Our culture: Making computers understand handwriting is a very difficult problem and we have cracked the handwriting code, persevering through problems to build working solutions. We do this by being curious and having a strong drive to get stuff done. We collaborate to reach the best solution quickly and efficiently. We are constantly learning and extending ourselves. We are self-aware and honest with ourselves and other team members. We use Scrum as the framework for iterating and learning from our successes and failures.


Our team is small. In joining us, you’ll become a core team member making significant contributions. Your experience and expertise will influence technical direction, product decisions, and the culture of the company as we grow and learn together along the journey.


Things you will do:



  • Develop our REST API, embeddable web widgets and related websites

  • Build handwriting processing and rendering enhancements and tools

  • Automate tests and processes over providing manual solutions

  • Optimize and scale all layers of the applications and systems

  • Collaborate with team members on code review and getting work to done


Things you will use and learn:



  • The stack: Ruby, Python, CoffeeScript, PostgreSQL, and the numerous libraries and tools built on top of and around them

  • Libraries and tools such as Backbone, Gulp, Mocha, Rails, Doorkeeper, RSpec, and Guard

  • Deploy on Linux in AWS and Heroku

  • Machine learning, including: NumPy, SciPy, scikit-learn, and OpenCV


All employees are offered a competitive salary, stock options and healthcare benefits. Engineering comprises 80% of the company.

item.title: Creative Director at Tradeweb (Jersey City, NJ)
item.description:
Description of the Position:


As the Creative Director at Tradeweb, you will focus on the visual development of Tradeweb’s award winning OTC Trading Platform. You will work closely with the Technology, Product Management and Marketing Departments. Working with the company’s existing brand and style you will refine the appearance, ergonomics and UX of our trading platform.


We look to hire people who are comfortable working in an entrepreneurial environment that fosters creativity and innovation but also maintains a focus on timely quality delivery.


Responsibilities/Accountabilities:



  • Deliver the concept, strategy, visual solution and overall user experience for our trading platform.

  • Design mockups and interfaces for Tradeweb’ s Institutional electronic trading platform(with a focus on UI/UX)

  • Contribute to the concept, strategy, visual solution and overall user experience while following a user-centered design process.

  • Document stylistic rules appropriate for the brand and the audience of the medium with oversight including color palette, typography and logo/wordmark

  • Communicating clear, compelling designs both visually and verbally: talking through ideas and motivations, sketching out mockups and documenting specifications

  • Oversee creative deliverables to fulfill all needs and requests in a timely manner

  • Deliver visual assets needed by development teams in the appropriate file formats

  • Ability to concept, brainstorm and come up with unique ideas independently as well as within group settings

item.title: Software Engineer, Smart Answers at Ask.com (Oakland, CA)
item.description:
Us

Join the #1 brand and top Web property focused on answering people's questions. At Ask.com, we're building a next-generation Q&A service - spanning both the Web and mobile devices - that combines the power of search with insight from real users by developing products and tools that drive user satisfaction, revenue, and traffic. We are serious about creating and maintaining a great culture and are looking for great people to come join our team.

The Role

Become part of a software engineering team that builds technology that directly answers our users questions. Ask.com was the first search engine to develop and deploy this technology which uses a combination of linguistic analysis, API usage, editorial content, and structured data processing. A wide array of tools and support applications create these Smart Answers and we are continually improving these tools while also creating new technologies to help our hundreds of millions of users around the world get to their answer as quickly as possible.

You

You are an seasoned software engineer with a passion for coding excellence and a substantial interest in relational databases, big data systems, information retrieval, and application services. You will bring your innovation, motivation, and superior ability to problem solve to contribute to our continued success.

Your task
  • Maintain, troubleshoot, and improve a suite of software applications and tools that are critical to our content business.
  • Monitor and improve performance and health of the applications, tools processes, and infrastructure.
  • Be a constructive, participating member in migrating C#/.Net/ASP/MSSQL applications to a Java/Node.js/MySQL environment.
  • Convert unstructured data to structured, relational databases and leverage those systems in data driven knowledge applications and services.


Your skills
  • Heavy knowledge in designing and optimizing complex SQL queries. Strong experience using Stored Procedures.
  • Expert C/C++/C# developer in Unix/Linux/.NET environments.
  • Experience with IIS, Tomcat, Jetty, JSP/Servlet, and Apache httpd.
  • Fast prototyping skills and familiarity with scripting languages such as Python and Unix shell scripting.
  • Strong unit testing, devops, and debugging skills.
  • Computational linguistics and NLP experience desired.
  • Node.js experience a plus.
  • Hadoop and big data experience a plus.
  • Strong analytical problem solving skills.
  • Able to work effectively and cooperatively in a team environment.
  • Experience with the Agile development methodology.
  • BS/MS in computer science, computer engineering or related technical field, and 5+ years experience in job offered or computer-related occupation. PhD a plus.

item.title: Sr. Big Data / BI Analyst at CDK Global (Hoffman Estates, IL)
item.description:
At CDK Global we provide integrated technology solutions to over 26,500 auto, truck, motorcycle, marine, recreational vehicles and heavy equipment dealers in over 100 countries worldwide.


CDK Global is a Fortune 1000 company serving dealers in over 100 countries. This position will play an important role in supporting the newly independent organization's continued growth.


Never heard of us? 


Have you ever bought or leased a car? 


If so, then we've been there with you, behind the scenes. 


We are transforming the way vehicles are marketed, sold and serviced by delivering innovative, easy-to-use, and intelligent solutions and are looking for a Senior Data Engineer to join our team.  In this role you will:




  • Model historical data to extract insight to help our customers optimize and simplify the automotive retailing experience

  • Collaborate with data scientists, software engineers, product managers, and others to identify new analytics and intelligence opportunities

  • Design and implement technical solutions to challenges in ETL, data mining, analytics and reporting

  • Import data from many internal and external transactional systems into a large warehouse

  • Expose complex data insights to other teams through API's and other integration mechanisms

item.title: Data Protection Officer at Remedy Partners Inc. (New York, NY)

Remedy Partners is looking for a Data Protection Officer to oversee and coordinate privacy programs and processes including, but not limited to, internal and external Data Protection issues and queries.



Tasks

  • Work with all departments to develop operations for security and privacy compliance

  • Work with product management, engineering, and IT personnel during product development to ensure products and services are in compliance with applicable global privacy and data protection requirements

  • Create and maintain projects plans that encompass tasks, deadlines, status and resource allocation.




Knowledge

Skills



  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

item.title: Software Developer- Data Intelligence at FreshBooks (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
About Us


FreshBooks has a big vision. We launched in 2003 but we’re just getting started and there’s a lot left to do. We're a high performing team working towards a common goal: building an outstanding online accounting application to help small businesses better manage their finances. Known for extraordinary customer service and based in Toronto, Canada, FreshBooks serves paying customers in over 120 countries.


Job Duties:



Join our development team in designing and developing our popular online application and the tools we use to run our business behind the scenes.  You'll learn hands-on about our industry and our customers, and you'll be figuring out how to make them happy, and then going ahead and doing it.  You will be responsible for planning, designing and coordinating the development and operation of our online accounting application using web application frameworks such as Python, PHP, Ruby and MySQL.  Specifically you will be our Data Intelligence expert in Development implementing our business intelligence infrastructure and working closely with stakeholders to analyze data for insights into the business.


Job Requirements:



  • 3+ year of experience with object-oriented development

  • 2+ years of experience with PHP, Python, Shell Scripting and MySQL

  • Operations/IT knowledge related to UNIX servers, UNIX command line and shell scripts

  • Experience using deployment technologies such as Jenkins, Puppet, Ansible, and Docker

  • Experience with data warehousing: conventions, basic ETL techniques, technologies such as Hive, BigQuery and Hadoop

  • Understanding of databases: basic query syntax, architecture, optimization etc.

  • Aptitude in software systems design/architecture to optimize for speed, scale and volume

  • Appreciation and understanding of Big Data problems around volume, variety and velocity of data from a technical standpoint

  • Ability to analyze data meaningfully to make informed business intelligence recommendations for the company

  • Experience developing software in an Agile environment and ability to become deeply involved in our Agile processes at FreshBooks

  • Ability to work in an open environment and collaborate with teams across entire company

  • Solid communication skills to speak with customers, stakeholders and executive team

  • An undergraduate degree in Computer Engineering or Mathematics

  • Preference given to candidates with a Masters in Software, Mathematics or Engineering


How to Apply

We're looking for people who are interested in getting in on the ground floor of an incredible opportunity to build amazing software and transform the lives of small business owners all over the world.  


Location: Toronto, ON  Canada


Term: Full-time permanent


Salary: $75,000 to $100,000 CDN + health benefits + stock options + 3 weeks vacation

item.title: Software Engineering Manager/Architect at Bluebeam Software, Inc. (Pasadena, CA)
item.description:
Bluebeam Software plays a critical behind-the-scenes role in some of the biggest construction projects in the world.  Our cloud-based servers make it possible for construction professionals to collaborate in a paperless ecosystem using Bluebeam’s desktop and iPad client applications—all the way from initial plans through the last day on the job site.



We have HUGE plans for the future of our paperless ecosystem, and we're growing quickly.  We're looking for an engineering manager/architect to help evolve the product, mature our engineering practices, and lead the teams that build our web-based services and infrastructure.



Bluebeamers are smart, funny, opinionated, friendly (and weird).  We love our customers, and we build products that help them work quickly and accurately.



So, if you'd like to help build a kick-ass system, solve some real-world problems, and work with a great team, read on...



The role



  • Provide technical and team leadership to the Enterprise cloud services teams.

    • Develop best practices within the engineering team.

    • Develop technical vision to complement long range product goals



  • Manage the team

    • Coach team members to help them develop their career here at Bluebeam.

    • Conduct semi-annual performance reviews.

    • Develop and implement hiring plan according to technical needs of the teams.



  • Establish the architecture of the cloud-based ecosystem in partnership with the desktop and mobile application architects.

  • Collaborate with product, QA, operations, and project management to define the product roadmap and deliver amazing products.

  • Contribute to engineering department-wide discourse and decision-making.



Your experience



  • 10+ years in software development roles.

  • 5+ years in a management position with direct engineering team reports

  • Experience recruiting and hiring

  • Coaching/steering bright and opinionated developers

  • Comfortable interacting directly with executive team - explaining technical concepts to non-tech people.

  • Experienced practitioner of Scrum or other Agile variant. (not just theoretical knowledge)

  • End-to-end understanding/appreciation of a software product's lifecycle

  • BS or higher in computer science or related field, MS preferred. 



Your technical qualifications



  • Architecture: Skilled designer of applications as well as systems architecture.  You know how to build a fault tolerant multi-tier system that can scale in a distributed environment.

  • Object-oriented programming chops:  C#/.NET preferred, but if you're strong with C++, Java, or another mainstream static programming language, we should still talk.)  Bonus points if you have a scripting language like Perl, Ruby, or Python in your back pocket.

  • Strong knowledge of IIS and SQL server.

  • Direct experience building applications using AWS or other cloud-based infrastructure.

  • Working knowledge of testing strategies and approaches, especially automation approaches.

  • Working knowledge of DevOps concepts related to repository management, build process, continuous deployment.



Click here to see what it's like to be a part of Bluebeam and Bluebeam Engineering. And if you think you're a good match for the team, send us your resume and *personalized* cover letter!

item.title: Software and System Integration Engineering Manager, Bloomfield Hills, MI #18315 at Bose Corporation (Bloomfield Hills, MI)
item.description:
Are you interested in diving in and learning about the newest automotive infotainment technology? Do you thrive in a face-paced, small team environment?


Bose Corporation is looking for a highly motivated technical individual for the position of Software and System Integration Engineering Manager located in our Bloomfield Hills, MI office. In this role, you will be part of the team that launches new automotive audio systems working closely with the most prestigious automobile manufacturers.


Responsibilities include, but not limited to:



  • Lead, coach and supervise a small team of system integration engineers located in our Bloomfield Hills office and across several global locations to include Germany, China, and Korea.

  • Manage team with full responsibility for performance reviews, employment, and salary decisions.

  • Provide day-to-day direction to team members

  • Manage product and system functional verification testing of customer programs.

  • Drive resolution of electrical and software interface issues between infotainment components.

  • Manage, oversee, and build an embedded application software development team in Bloomfield Hills which is responsible for OEM specific implementations.

  • Oversee Software deliverables (internal and external deliveries)

  • Manage local SW training, quality and continuous process improvements in coordination with ASD core SW development.

  • Build strong advocacy with OEM customer teams in North America and other global locations.

item.title: JavaScript UI Developer (Contract or Fulltime) at LogRhythm (Boulder, CO)
item.description:
LogRhythm is a software company focused on security intelligence analytics. We are looking to add a JavaScript UI Developer to our team to support ongoing development of our dashboard which allows our customers deep visibility across their entire IT environment. If you dig networks being violated you should stop reading right now. Or find your moral compass and keep reading. 



  • The application consists of an AngularJS web user interface (UI) and is powered by JavaScript (Node.js) and Java in the middle tier. The stack includes: Node.js, AngularJS, D3.js, CoffeeScript.

  • Our UI has an impressive amount of polish. Building a portal to client data to help them track down ever-changing threats is critical work. We take UX serious so a complicated task like protecting your network is made easy and engaging.

  • Our browser support matrix includes “evergreen browsers” (IE10+, Chrome, Firefox, mobile). We have given our web team the latitude to utilize the modern technologies needed in order to scale.


Within this domain we are the fastest growing private company in the world and we are headquartered in Boulder. This is one of the true success stories within the Boulder/Denver tech community. You’ll get a chance to join a local company that’s gone from startup to an established company who's out innovating the largest security companies in the world.

This innovative team will work in ASP.NET MVC on Azure Cloud, within an Agile environment.

item.title: Hadoop Systems Engineer at Criteo (Paris, France)
item.description:
Your mission:


Build the appropriate infrastructure to store more than tens of TB of additional data every day, and offer both batch and nearline processing capabilities, at a rate of 300,000 messages per second per datacenter, across six datacenters.


Fully automate the administration of thousands of servers with a fully open source approach using Chef.


Datacenter as a computer: efficient usage of all hardware with a common storage and computation platform using Yarn / Mesos.


High stakes, high rewards: 1% increase in performance may yield millions for the company.


Develop open source projects. Because we are working at the forefront of technology, we are dealing with problems that few have faced. We’re big users of open source, and we’d like to give back to the community

item.title: Senior Ruby on Rails Developer (m/f) Core at XING AG (Hamburg, Germany)
item.description:
XING is the social network for business professionals with millions of members all over the world.
Help us shape the future - for a better working life!

The XING Core Cluster builds the very heart of our social network, providing technological and directly user-facing products and underpinnings to everything XING does. Building highly visible and top-traffic applications that touch millions of users every day, we provide all other parts of the platform with internal services to create value for our users. The core cluster consists of around 30 people working in Development, Project Management, Product, UX and QA. We focus on helping our users get the most out of our network and market places, while developing new and improving existing products.  And we are looking for you to help us!

A challenging task:



  • A highly responsible position, implementing sophisticated yet pragmatic additions to the XING platform to nurture our growing member base

  • An awesome and professional cross-functional team in a mature and highly dynamic and agile development environment

  • You'll act as a technical expert and play a leading role in our team as a back-end-focused RoR engineer who is not afraid to touch the front end and other, non-ruby technologies, whatever gets the job done

  • Don’t fall in love with your solution – always challenge the status quo and be prepared to forge new paths, even if this means throwing away yesterday's best idea to make room for tomorrow's

item.title: Sr Software Engineers - Service Platform, join us in Dubai at Dubizzle Middle East FZ LLC (Dubai, United Arab Emirates)
item.description:
Are you a talented engineer with a passion for concurrency and distributed systems? You know that concurrency is hard, but getting it right is fun. Have you worked on a distributed system, failed and learned how not to do it? You know that cloud platforms fail constantly and it's your job to ensure that no user will notice this. You went through the pain of having not enough information to troubleshoot a distributed system and know how it should be done? 


We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer with a broad experience on building systems at scale to join our team. You will be part of a platform that handles millions of requests per day. Continuous integration, auto-scaled rolling releases and cross-service communication are all part of the daily gig.If you think that is for you, write us.


Your responsibilities? 



  • Gather up-to-date and in-depth understanding of the dubizzle code bases and technology stack and actively contributing to SP product development within a month of joining;

  • Gain a detailed understanding of the complete architecture of our products and services and the position of your product stream in it;

  • Lead planning sessions around new product features and deliver detailed roll-out/roll-back strategies for releases;

  • Develop elegant solutions for complex problems, especially in the area of distributed systems;

  • Research and apply industry trends as part of your daily work;

  • Write and maintain exemplary code following dubizzle’s programming practices;

  • Actively advocate best practices on a companywide level and ensure the cleanup of suboptimal code;

  • Create unit and feature tests of your own work and expand existing test for our existing codebase;

  • Contribute to the reliability and efficiency of our current code base. Propose optimization and alternative solutions for Service Platform current platforms;

  • Define the architecture of your product steam;

  • Meet regularly with the Service Platform Team to shape the technical vision for the service platform of dubizzle;

  • Actively contribute in post-release maintenance issues;

  • Function as a mentor on the fundamentals of distributed systems, concurrency,  resilient and scalable systems and other elements of the specialty;

  • Code-review all major pull-requests, defining programming standards and providing constructive feedback.

item.title: Graduate Software Developer at ThoughtWorks (London, UK)

item.title: CTO/Partner for innovative fashion tech startup at Haute-Trader (New York, NY) (allows remote)
item.description:
Hi,


I am looking for a fullstack - or partial stack developer for Haute-Trader, the premier destination for designer fashion trading. You will serve as our CTO or equity freelance programmer. The feature specs and wireframes of the site are very detailed both front and admin, we have an organized design guide, and the company vision is clear. I am fine with someone that can come to our office and code on weekends or work from home in New York. If you have a full time job that is definitely fine, if not preferred.

item.title: Operations Engineer @ Course Hero at Course Hero (Redwood City, CA)
item.description:
The Role:
Course Hero is looking for an Operations Engineer to help us scale our infrastructure to handle growing site traffic as we help even more students. This is our first Ops Engineer hire, and you'll join our CTO and a small team of engineers to solve these challenges hands-on. As we grow, you'll have the opportunity to architect our new production environments and build out an Operations team. 

Each engineer has a role in building Course Hero's architecture and will have the opportunity to touch all parts of the stack. Our projects are big - terabytes of data and customers around the world - but our team is small, so you'll see projects from start to finish, and work closely with other engineers, leadership, and other teams in our organization to ensure successful results. 

You will: 
* Scale our site from 10x to 100x including adding new servers and infrastructure, while maintaining and improving network integrity and security. 
* Lead and improve deployment, including automation and continuous integration. We currently use TeamCity and Capistrano, but we're open to other tools as we scale. 
* Improve systems monitoring, backup and recovery of MySQL, on Rackspace Cloud and Amazon EC2 servers. 
* Optimize and improve our MySQL database performance and work with our Analytics team to implement data warehousing tools.
* Improve site security and stability. 
* Optimize our current production environment and eventually architect the next version as we grow. 



What we can offer you: 
* Industry competitive salary and stock options. 
* Full medical coverage (medical, dental, vision). 
* Retirement plan to help you save for the future. 
* Regularly planned team events and outings. 
* Free Friday lunches and an endless snack and drink supply. 
* Commuter transportation benefits.
* On-site amenities including a day spa, gourmet cafe, 3 miles of nature trails along the bay, and free membership to a 7500 sq. ft. fitness center.

How To Apply:
* The Sourcery will be the first point of contact.
* All applications receive a response.
* All applications are kept strictly confidential.

item.title: Principal Engineer at PagerDuty (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
As a Principal Engineer, you’re the keeper of the vision:  You design new services and systems, making sure they fit your long-term technical vision.  You do the technical design of new customer functionality, features, and APIs, making sure they fit PagerDuty’s short and long-term product vision.  You even have a vision for the kind of software engineers you’re trying to “grow” as you mentor, teach, and lead them.  You’re always thinking about the big picture, even when working on the details.


You’ve thought about working at one of the many big software engineering companies out there (and probably have in the past), but know that you can make a much bigger impact at a startup.  You want to work at a fast-growing startup, but the thought of building yet another social-this or messaging-that doesn’t really appeal to you.


At PagerDuty, we’re building an alerting and incident tracking system to help IT operations groups detect and respond to issues. Startups, Fortune 500 companies, and everything in between rely on us to alert them quickly when they have operational troubles. We’ve got a product undergoing big changes and we’re facing some very hard technical problems to boot.  We need a principal engineer to help us design and build out new systems, features, and engineering teams.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - DevTools at PagerDuty (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
We are fanatics about uptime at PagerDuty – we have to be. Startups, Fortune 100 companies, and everything in between rely on us to alert them quickly when they are down. We are looking for a stellar Software Engineer that understands the importance of proper tooling around deployment automation, how it can improve uptime, and how to increase engineering speed.


You have played with different tools. Docker, AWS, Vagrant, Chef, Capistrano, Fabric, Salt, ChatOps... these are all words that you understand and are very opinionated about. You understand that proper automation is not just about reducing work, it is about making the right thing the easy thing to do as well. You get excited about having other engineers as customers and helping them.

item.title: Senior Realtime Software Engineer at PagerDuty (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
As an entrepreneurial backend / systems engineer, you’re caught between two worlds. You probably work at (or have thought about working at) one of the many big software engineering companies out there. You know they have more than enough interesting problems to keep you engaged, but you have a nagging feeling that you’ll be just another cog in a multi-thousand engineer machine. You want to work at a startup, but the thought of building yet another social-this or game-mechanics-that doesn’t really appeal to you.


At PagerDuty, we’re building an alerting and incident tracking system to help IT operations groups detect and respond to issues. Startups, Fortune 500 companies, and everything in between rely on us to alert them quickly when they have operational troubles. We’ve got interesting technical problems in spades, but we’re still very much a startup. We’re looking for a senior engineer to help build out our real-time backend alerting systems, both adding features and helping us maintain our high uptime record as we continue to acquire new customers and scale out our systems.

item.title: Automation QA at ThoughtWorks (Dallas, TX)
item.description:
As a Quality Assurance Analyst here’s what you can do at ThoughtWorks:



  • Come up with testing strategies that meet the ever-changing requirements of our  user-centric solutions and business goals

  • Design, build, and test critical and complex custom-designed, multi-tier, business applications that use a wide range of current technologies

  • Mentor and evangelize Agile, Lean, and Continuous Development testing best practices 

  • Utilize your hands-on skills while providing leadership and strategic guidance to the teams and client

  • Learn something new everyday. 

  • Travel the world. 

  • Speak at conferences. 

  • Write blogs and books.

  • Start new offices in places you’ve never been before. 

  • Think through hard problems, and work with a team to make them reality.

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, transparent, non-hierarchal, and ego-free culture where your talent is valued over a role title

  • Develop your career outside of the confinements of a traditional career path by focusing on what you’re passionate about rather than a predetermined one-size-fits-all plan

item.title: Lead Developer at ThoughtWorks (Addison, TX)
item.description:
As a Lead Developer at ThoughtWorks, here's what you can do:



  • Work with really smart people that "get-it" and will challenge you to be better

  • Every organization is becoming a software company, you'll be at the helm leading that transformation within global organizations in the Retail, Finance, Airline, Education, Government and Energy industries

  • Think through hard problems, and work with a team to make them reality in disruptive and impactful ways.

  • Work on large-scale, custom-designed, multi-tier, enterprise-level software development projects using Java, Ruby and/or .NET

  • Inspire teams of software engineers

  • Be responsible for the quality of software and resolving any issues regarding client satisfaction

  • Be a mentor and role model to less experienced developers

  • Employ "Agility"  including task estimation, test automation, deployment automation and Continuous Integration to improve overall execution speed and product quality

  • Travel the world.

  • Learn something new everyday

  • Speak at conferences. 

  • Write blogs and books.

  • Think through hard problems, and work with a team to make them reality.

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, transparent, non-hierarchal, and ego-free culture where your talent is valued over a role title

  • Develop your career outside of the confinements of a traditional career path by focusing on what you’re passionate about rather than a predetermined one-size-fits-all plan

Our North America offices are in Chicago, Dallas, New York, Atlanta, San Francisco, and Toronto.  Relocation isn't necessary if you live in one of these cities. If you live elsewhere, please let us know to which one you are willing to relocate to.

item.title: Software Developer - Equity Sales & Trading Startup at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

Bloomberg is looking for an entrepreneurial software developer to join a team currently in the prototype stage of a brand new product. The product is intended to offer senior executives at financial institutions around the globe valuable analytics to help them make key business decisions.

Responsibilities:

The current code base for a working prototype is all brand new, and as such this will require a visionary mind to help shape the future of the product. Development so far has been with C++ on Linux with a JavaScript user interface, but any individual will require flexibility to work the full technology stack, both the back and front ends to evolve the system and so experience with a range of tools in the fields of UI, database design and messaging middleware is ideal.

We are looking for developers interested in tackling problems involving large, high-frequency data sets, applying machine learning techniques to non-trivial problems, and combining a wide-range of technologies to form unique, antifragile solutions.

item.title: Senior Server Side Software Developer (C++/Unix) - Charts Data Services at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

The Bloomberg Charts and Technical Analysis product is used by hundreds of thousands of financial professionals worldwide to make investment decisions. Our next-generation Charts unlock market data and deliver analytics that give our clients unprecedented advantages. The Charts product spans a wide gamut of functionality including real-time pricing data, historical trend analysis, statistical models, technical analysis tools and much more.

The Charts Data Services team is looking for a C/C++ Server-Side Developer who is passionate about building highly scalable, low latency backend systems for delivering analytics and data. The candidate should enjoy working cross-functionally and with different R&D teams in the company to design and implement solutions that improve the applications offered to our clients. The candidate should also understand business needs and translate these into effective designs, project plans and technical implementations. Some of the projects include aggregating data across various sources, preparing data for different types of analysis and presentation, providing an execution platform for Bloomberg and user generated models and developing a framework to alert customers when events or conditions of their interest occur.

item.title: News Infrastructure Developer For High Performance, Scalable News Systems at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

The R&D News department at Bloomberg is recruiting senior developers to play a leading role in the design and implementation of some of the most critical applications on the Bloomberg Terminal. Our team works on problems such as real time search and query filtering, low latency indexing, text classification, collaborative filtering, machine translation and others. These applications are integral parts of a real time processing pipeline that processes over 1 million news stories a day from over 80,000 sources. In addition to challenges presented by a low latency and high throughput environment, we have to solve the business problem of presenting an overwhelming amount of content to a large user base, in a way that allows them to efficiently make decisions in the financial markets.

item.title: Senior Application Developer (C++/JavaScript) - Charts Applications at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

The Bloomberg Charts product is used by over 150,000 financial professionals worldwide to make trading and analysis decisions. Our next-generation Charts unlock market data and give our clients unprecedented competitive advantages. Today's Charts product spans a wide gamut of functionality, from pricing to annotations, 3D volatility surfaces to map, real-time data to historical trend analysis and much more. The Core Charts platform provides cutting edge analytics of both simple price data and Bloomberg and third party technical analysis. It incorporates UI representation for events, annotations, as well as News, Economic analysis, Portfolio data, etc.

We are looking for a C/C++ Server-side Developer to join the Charts team. The candidate will work on the state-of-the-art charting and statistical analysis systems for visualizing multiple market instruments. Some of the development projects include building next generation Bloomberg Charting product by utilizing the latest client and server side technologies, integrating Bloomberg Terminal Charting product with MS Office tools, building new multi-security analysis and statistical applications. Daily activities include working closely with business representatives to understand business needs, translate these into effective designs and project plans, and coding solutions that suit our customers' needs. Candidates should exhibit an aggressive drive, an aptitude for engineering quality software, strategic thinking.

item.title: Senior Software Developer - Buy Side Data Management at Bloomberg LP (Lexington, KY)
item.description:
The Role:

The Buy Side Data Management Team is looking for a self-starter and motivated developer to join our less-than-a-year-old and fast-paced team as it builds a new common data platform for management of client data on behalf of institutional brokerage firms.

Because this is a new product being built from scratch, we research which technology, algorithms and techniques to use, giving us a great range of freedom with our decisions. As the current team size is small, the new team member will have many opportunities to have a big impact on the product.

Our team currently collaborates closely with two other application teams at Bloomberg as they leverage our new Buy Side Data Management system.

The ideal candidate is someone with good communication skills who is willing to take charge in leading some of our initiatives by working with other development teams and the business. He/She has good C/C++ skills and debugging abilities with a positive can-do attitude towards the challenges faced during the execution of a project. The candidate must have a proven ability to design robust backed software components, especially database and application services, that can scale as our product grows. He/She will analyze and improve efficiency, scalability and stability of various parts of the system on a continuous basis. The candidate should be able to lead technical and design meetings and enjoys understanding client needs and translating them into product enhancement proposals.

THE BDM PRODUCT:

Sell side traders need to efficiently manage their relationships with the buy side clients in order to target the right clients. The Buy Side Data Management Team is building the next generation data architecture for a tightly coupled set of products to give traders an edge over their competitors.. BDM will serve as the go to place for all applications and products that deal with buy side client data management.

item.title: Systems Reliability Engineer at Bloomberg (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

As a Systems Reliability Engineer working on Bloomberg's critical services, your mission will be to ensure Bloomberg is fast, highly available, scalable, and able to withstand unprecedented increases in load. In this role you will be at the heart of solving production problems. Your scope is from the kernel to the application. The position requires the flexibility to take a holistic approach to troubleshooting and the ability to delve deeply into technical details. The team is co-located with the various application development teams and will report directly to the Systems Reliability Engineering organization for oversight, strategic direction, training and career development. The Systems Reliability Engineer will build automation tools for system health, production acceptance tests to validate production changes and will ensure the system is well instrumented and highly fault tolerant.

Responsibilities:

- Manage availability, latency, scalability and efficiency of Bloomberg applications development by instilling engineering reliability into our development life cycle with a focus on fault tolerant approaches
- Respond to and resolve unexpected and potential service problems and write software to prevent problem recurrence
- Drive capacity planning, performance analysis, instrumentation and other non-functional systems requirements
- Review and influence ongoing design, architecture, standards and methods for improving operating services
- Manage system releases, write production software acceptance tests and coordinate all aspects of the release including coverage and communication plans

item.title: Python Programmer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

Bloomberg's R&D Network Design & Information Security (NDIS) group is responsible for the design, architecture, development and security for Bloomberg's internal and client-facing global network, security, and virtualization infrastructure.

The NDIS group is looking for an entry- to mid-level System Security engineer with a strong programming background. The position offers a challenging prospect to work on a wide range of technologies, with the primary focus being on system security and development. The candidate should have strong technical and programming skills, excellent problem solving skills and an appreciation for the scope and impact of their highly visible work. The candidate must possess a strong ability to multitask effectively, prioritize tasks in a high-pressure environment, and work in a team environment.

item.title: Software Developer C/C++ - Equity Products at Bloomberg (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:


The Bloomberg Equity product is used by over 100,000 financial professionals worldwide to make decisions and increase alpha. Our next-generation Equity analytics unlock market data and give our clients unprecedented advantages. Today's Equity product spans a wide gamut of functionality, from fundamentals to estimates, company analysis to peer valuation, idea generation to portfolio construction, and exchange-level tools to macro regional/industrial analysis.


Equity R&D in our New York office is seeking driven and dedicated developers to join our fast-paced team. We develop rich user interfaces as well as powerful backend servers in C++. Developers contribute to all phases of software engineering ranging from requirements through release. Candidates should exhibit strategic thinking, an aggressive drive, and an
aptitude for engineering quality software.

item.title: C/C++ Developer - Systems Technology (Autocomplete) at Bloomberg (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:


Bloomberg's Systems Technology group is looking for a Senior Software Engineer to join the team and work on our "Autocomplete" product. Autocomplete is an integral part of discoverability on the Bloomberg terminal, providing terminal users with suggestions for relevant securities/functions/people/etc that are just keystrokes away. Search results must be relevant, fast, and always available while searching datasets that contain millions of records and are kept up to date in real-time.

item.title: Sr Natural Language Processing Software Engineer at Bloomberg L.P. (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

The R&D ADSK Team at Bloomberg is looking for a seasoned senior software engineer to work on projects involving machine learning, natural language processing, and computation linguistics.

Our group develops sophisticated real-time systems that help create the best customer service experience possible. This includes the accurate routing of chat based questions to representatives based on their specialty and experience. We analyze chat conversations between representatives and clients in real-time to help assist the rep and create semi-automated systems to improve efficiency. You will have the opportunity to interface with the business to better understand the requirements and to drive the direction of the product.

We are seeking senior software engineers who can formulate a vision and work towards making it a reality. The ideal candidate would have background in mathematics and statistics as well as machine learning and natural language processing enabling them to contribute immediately to projects.

item.title: ASP.NET Developer at Velir (Somerville, MA)
item.description:
We are looking for an ASP.NET Web Developer to join Velir’s Production Support team.  Velir is a full service digital agency located in Somerville, MA.  We are a collection of talented, creative and technical professionals building leading digital experiences for an impressive array of clients.  We believe strongly in long-lasting relationships and work with our customers to build applications that stand the test of time.  Our Production Support team is focused on cultivating these long term relationships by regularly and reliably delivering product updates and enhancements.


Our ASP.NET Web Developers are polymaths, their expertise spans the breadth of web development.  They have an excellent ability to troubleshoot and debug complex issues, are skilled at full stack web development, have a strong grasp of web infrastructure, and can navigate parallel development efforts that require complex branching and merging SCM strategies.  While these technical skills are paramount, the right candidate must possess an empathy that allows them to take on our client’s issues as if they are their own. 


If you are a skilled ASP.NET Web Developer, have a desire to work closely with clients, and are excited about consistently adding or improving features and releasing code to production then please get in touch.

item.title: Senior Software Developer - Fixed Income Trading at Bloomberg (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

FIT Trading Components R&D is seeking driven and dedicated developers to join our fast-paced R&D environment in our New York Office. We are a one-stop shop for clients to execute trades/strategies for different Fixed Income Instruments. We develop rich (real-time) user interfaces which are powered by backend servers in C++.

The ideal candidate will have extensive experience designing/developing high-performance object-oriented solutions using C++ and RDBMS. This developer would primarily be working on multi-threaded server-side applications which have high transaction rates.

item.title: Senior Software Developer for Derivatives Team at Bloomberg (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:


Bloomberg LP revolutionized the financial industry years ago by introducing it to the power of technology. Now there is a USD 700 trillion derivative industry asking for smarter tools and better automation to make sense of all the complexity, risks, pitfalls and regulations surrounding these financial instruments. The Bloomberg derivative team intends to take those challenges by offering a one-stop solution to bring transparency, efficiency and excellence for market professionals.


We are looking for people who enjoy working at the confluence of technology, finance and mathematics, who are talented and have superlative technical skills (C++ on *nix is our weapon of choice, but we also dabble in OCaml, Python, Javascript, and etc. when needed), and who are excited to apply unique technical solutions in analytical and algorithmic problems. The candidate will gain significant experience in developing systems involving market data capturing and interpretation, OTC deal structuring and valuation, risk and scenario analysis, and lifecycle management for a wide variety of derivatives and structured products. Finally the candidate will get great exposure to market expertise by collaborating with all stakeholders such as business managers, financial engineers and quantitative researchers.

Responsibilities:



  • Design, code, implement, and test new features and modules in Bloomberg's derivative system

  • Work with product managers to translate and understand product specifications accurately

  • Project management, including estimation, scheduling, milestone tracking, risk management, and project status reporting

  • Responsible for bug fixing issues with the software applications

item.title: Senior Web Developer - Bloomberg Vault at Bloomberg (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:


Bloomberg is looking for a Senior Software Developer for Bloomberg Vault. Bloomberg Vault is a startup in Bloomberg Enterprise group developing a cloud-based compliance archiving service, eDiscovery tools and real-time compliance monitoring infrastructure. Our software, which is hosted in Bloomberg's private cloud, has gained rapid market adoption with over 700 enterprises and processes more than 200 million daily messages and archives over 60 billion messages.


We are changing the way compliance is integrated into enterprise workflows. Our fast moving R&D team is looking for developers that are up for the challenge of building secure, scalable and high quality services using a combination of proprietary and open source components.


- Content ingestion of e-mail, IM, mobile, voice, social media, files using SMTP,SFTP,SICAP, HTTPS and proprietary protocols
- Long-term archiving in geo-distributed and compliant storage, e.g. WORM, replicated/redundant , cold storage, encryption
- Massively scalable time-based and faceted search and real-time analytics using Lucene, Solr, Hadoop and big data / machine learning technologies
- Real-time and in-stream compliance monitoring, surveillance and analytics with flexible policy-based orchestration
- Applications for compliance review workflows and eDiscovery processes developed using Ruby on Rails, JavaScript and open source web stack


The ideal candidate will join a quickly growing agile team in the development of new web products in the area of cloud-based services. We are looking for experienced developers with hands-on Ruby on Rails development experience leveraging Rails best practices. Candidates must be able to work independently to find a path to success by researching and recommending alternatives when faced with challenging situations. Candidates should have a passion for technology and a flexible, creative approach to problem solving. They should be able to take ownership of business requirements and devise and develop solutions that meet customer needs. Time to market is critical. Day to day tasks will involve the development and integration of new applications and enhancements.

item.title: Senior Big Data / Cloud Architect - Bloomberg Vault at Bloomberg (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:


Bloomberg is looking for a Senior Software Developer for our cloud-based real-time content filtering and monitoring platform for e-mail, instant messaging, voice and social media data. The service is part of Bloomberg Vault.


Bloomberg Vault is a startup in Bloomberg Enterprise group developing a cloud-based compliance archiving service, eDiscovery tools and real-time compliance monitoring infrastructure. Our software, which is hosted in Bloomberg's private cloud, has gained rapid market adoption with over 700 enterprises and archives over 60 billion messages.


With the explosive growth of social media and web collaboration data real-time content filtering and monitoring is a crucial requirement for business of any size to stay compliant with regulations. Our infrastructure process over 200 million messages a day checking content and interaction patterns and providing analytics and event-driven reporting.


We are looking for experienced software developers that are or want to become expert in areas such as geo-distribution, real-time processing, service hosting, message orchestration, high-available, fault-tolerant and low latency computation.


Candidates must be able to work independently to find a path to success by researching and recommending alternatives when faced with challenging situations. Candidates should have a passion for technology and a flexible, creative approach to problem solving. They should be able to take ownership of business requirements and devise and develop solutions that meet customer needs. Time to market is critical.

item.title: VP of Engineering - Funded Start-up in Ad-Tech at BAM (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Job


BAM is an early stage ad-tech company based in the New York City. We are looking to hire a VP of Engineering to build and lead our technology team with the potential to grow into a CTO. This is an opportunity to have a fundamental impact on the success of a startup and benefit from equity growth. This is a hand-on role - so expect to branch, code, test, push, pull, merge, debug, config, and troubleshoot on a day-to-day basis.


For example, you will routinely:



  • Drive system and software architecture

  • Grow a team from the ground up, building and leading a small, fast, agile team

  • Deliver code and infrastructure for real-time bidding at consumer Web scale

  • Commit production code in AngularJS, Python/Flask, Redis, RabbitMQ, Elasticsearch, and Hadoop

  • Automate deployment and scalability in AWS (Jenkins, Route 53, Cloudfront, S3, EC2, RDS, OpsWorks)

  • Identify and clear roadblocks of any kind

  • Ensure for the care, feeding, intellectual stimulation, and entertainment of your team

  • Continuously improve all of the above

item.title: Senior Real-time Communications Architect at Bloomberg (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:


Bloomberg Community is looking for an experienced distributed systems architect to help design and build the next generation of communication and collaboration products for the Bloomberg Professional Service. This role encompasses the instant messaging (Chat), email (Mail) and collaboration products used by our network of 350,000 financial professionals.


Our subscribers depend on Bloomberg Chat for its lightning-fast delivery, high reliability and ordering guarantees; we deliver nearly 300 million posts each day to these financial professionals. Our Live and Talk products round out the real-time platform by providing video and audio channels to that subscriber base, all while maintaining the same level of service and strict guarantees for delivery and archiving.


Bloomberg Mail is a cloud-based platform used for Internet email, bond announcements and pricing, financial research distribution and many other types of communication on the Bloomberg Terminal. Our users rely on Bloomberg Mail because of its real-time performance, massive scale, ironclad security, tight integration with financial data and applications on the Bloomberg Terminal, unique features like message retraction and "your message was read!" notification, machine learning-based message classification and, most importantly, singular access to the Bloomberg network.


Our systems are built on top of Open Source, commercial and proprietary technologies. These highly available, large-scale distributed systems include comprehensive storage and search infrastructures, real-time email and instant messaging transport and delivery pipelines, a real-time classification engine for user-based and machine learning-based tagging, APIs for integration with other applications and systems, as well as feature-rich and powerful user-interfaces optimized for our specialized customers.


We are seeking a candidate with broad experience building large-scale real-time globally distributed systems. The Architect joining this team will re-imagine, develop and deploy a myriad of systems that test the limits of powerful hardware and Bloomberg infrastructure.

item.title: Automation Developer - DevOps at Bloomberg (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:


The UI Infrastructure team provides the building blocks used by the firm's 3000+ R&D employees to deliver high-quality, high-performance functionality to our customers in a timely manner. The successful candidate will have the opportunity to work across a number of development scrum teams to support an agile continuous development and deployment environment. The candidate will have experience with automation and monitoring using tools and technologies such as Jenkins, JIRA, Chef, Python, Web and cloud services across a range of platforms including Windows, Linux, Solaris, and AIX.

item.title: Sr. JavaScript Framework Developer - JS/UI at Bloomberg (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

This is a key position in our UI Infrastructure Core Tech team responsible for driving next-gen Bloomberg development platforms enterprise-wide.

In this role you will be a key member of the team developing the JavaScript platform that provides the building blocks, framework, and infrastructure used by the firm's 3000+ R&D employees to build high-quality, high-performance applications used both internally and externally. The successful candidate will have experience implementing performant JavaScript applications with an emphasis on optimization, API design, and architecture. This is an opportunity to directly affect the daily lives of internal developers using a modern stack of JavaScript technologies to enable highly interactive desktop applications. Emphasis will be placed on developing well-tested and structured code, and the ability to work in a highly collaborative and fast moving environment.

item.title: Senior Linux Systems Engineer at Bloomberg (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

Bloomberg's Network Services Design and Information Security team is looking for a Linux engineer. This is a great opportunity to work on a wide range of technologies with the main focus being on Linux systems design and engineering. You will be working in a highly creative and innovative team environment alongside systems & network designers, architects, network security and integration specialists.

We are looking to hire a Linux systems engineer with good scripting/programming experience to architect solutions to meet business needs and requirements. The candidate will be responsible for architecting, building and managing Linux based appliances. You would be involved in the full life cycle right from specifying the hardware requirements to building systems, automation and management tools. The successful candidate will have a strong technical background in the administration of Linux servers, preferably rpm based distributions.

This individual will work closely with internal Application Development teams to understand how an application functions and the system and operational requirements in supporting it.
The person will also be responsible for developing procedures and documentation as well the training of operations and implementation personnel worldwide.

item.title: Tradebook Low-Latency And Algorithmic Trading - Senior C++ Developers at Bloomberg (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

Bloomberg Tradebook is a leading agency broker, a US ECN, and a technology provider of cross-asset electronic trading platform, supporting Equities/Futures/Options/FX trading.

Tradebook is building the next generation, ultra-low latency trading platform, which supports multi asset trading, exchange routing and order matching. With high capacity and sub-microsecond latency, the new system will be the foundation for Tradebook's future and propel it into more markets and grab new opportunities.

Our focus is on developing low latency & real-time black box trading systems, algorithmic trading systems, providing connectivity/FIX solutions and providing direct market connectivity solutions.

R&D Tradebook is looking for a motivated and talented C++ developer to join this effort. You will be working a small group of technologists passionate about pushing the boundaries of technology and delivering innovative product solutions. The role involves implementing a high performance technology stack from ground up, designing efficient data structures and services for business functionality, and building a highly available system with throughput of millions of messages per second. Candidates should exhibit an aggressive drive, bias towards action, and a proven aptitude for engineering quality software solutions.

This candidate will also work closely with Sales, Products and Trading Desk from idea generation to implementing and delivering cutting-edge technologies and trading solutions to the market.

Tradebook is seeking developers with project experience in creating systems for:
- Algorithmic Trading
- Black Box Trading
- Market Making
- Risk Management
- Quantitative Analysis
- Event Based Trading
- Solutions for Hedge Funds
- Solutions for Proprietary Trading firms (Prop shops)
- High frequency trading applications
- Low latency trading applications

item.title: C++/Python WebCrawler Engineer at Bloomberg (Princeton, NJ)
item.description:
The Role:

Data Acquisition R&D in our Princeton, NJ office is seeking a motivated Senior Software Engineer to assist in further development of our web crawling system. Bloomberg's web crawling technologies are some of the most advanced web scraping capabilities in the world. Candidate must have extensive experience with C/C++ and Python.

item.title: R&D Real-Time Market Data Senior Software Developer at Bloomberg (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

R&D Real-Time Market Data is seeking a strong C++ developer with a passion for building robust, high performance software. Our team develops feed handlers for the most important financial data sources from all over the world, such as stock exchanges, news vendors, and pricing contributors. As the foundation of Bloomberg's data infrastructure, we help drive the decision making of the most influential participants in the financial markets.
As a part of our team, you will help create complex software systems from the ground up. We are involved in all aspects of the development life cycle, from requirements planning through to QA and troubleshooting. We also work closely with various businesses and other R&D groups to design and develop our systems. The work environment is fast-paced, spirited, and friendly. Expect to make immediate contributions to our production code and Bloomberg's industry-leading success.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Bloomberg Vault Content Ingestion at Bloomberg (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

Bloomberg is looking for a Senior Software Developer for Bloomberg Vault. Bloomberg Vault is a startup in the Bloomberg Enterprise group developing a cloud-based compliance archiving service, eDiscovery tools and real-time compliance monitoring infrastructure. Our software, which is hosted in Bloomberg's private cloud, has gained rapid market adoption with over 700 enterprises and processes more than 200 million daily messages and archives over 60 billion messages.

We are changing the way compliance is integrated into enterprise workflows. Our fast moving R&D team is looking for developers that are up for the challenge of building secure, scalable and high quality services using a combination of proprietary and open source components.

- Content ingestion of e-mail, IM, mobile, voice, social media, files using SMTP,SFTP,SICAP, HTTPS and proprietary protocols
- Long-term archiving in geo-distributed and compliant storage, e.g. WORM, replicated/redundant , cold storage, encryption
- Massively scalable time-based and faceted search and real-time analytics using Lucene, Solr, Hadoop and big data / machine learning technologies
- Real-time and in-stream compliance monitoring, surveillance and analytics with flexible policy-based orchestration
- Applications for compliance review workflows and eDiscovery processes developed using Ruby on Rails, JavaScript and open source web stack

The ideal candidate will join a quickly growing agile team to drive the development of analytics and data enrichment. Must be able to work independently to find a path to success by researching and recommending alternatives when faced with challenging situations. Candidates should have a passion for technology and a flexible, creative approach to problem solving. They should be able to take ownership of business requirements and devise and develop solutions that meet customer needs. Time to market is critical. Day to day tasks will involve the development and integration of new applications and enhancements.

item.title: Senior Java Software Engineer - BLAW Search at Bloomberg (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

Bloomberg is looking for an experienced Software Engineer to join us in building BLAW's Search and Data Navigation platform, leveraging open source search technologies and machine learning models for natural language search and relevance. The candidate should demonstrate a history of on-time delivery, excellent communication, and a positive get-it-done attitude. Legal domain expertise and experience working on legal research platforms is a strong plus.
Through BloombergLaw.com and the Bloomberg Professional Service, we offer the integration of legal research, news, collaboration tools and market information that is unmatched in the industry.

item.title: Java Software Developer II at Envision Pharma, Inc. (Glastonbury, CT)
item.description:
A career in technology at the Envision Pharma Group may be just what you’re looking for.


About the Envision Pharma Group and Envision Technology Solutions


Envision Technology Solutions designs, develops, implements, and supports innovative and strategic management software for our life sciences clients including DatavisionTM, the industry-leading publications planning software.


Using prevailing web-based technologies, we build our scalable tools using modern open systems design. Our solutions are based on our unrivaled experience in the life sciences industry, and a deep understanding of the needs of our clients. Only then do we undertake a rigorous process to build the right solution using the right technologies.


Software Developer II at Envision Technology Solutions


Roles and Responsibilities of the Software Developer II include:



  • Support the design, development and maintenance of several commercial software products, implemented across a range of production environments

  • Diagnose problems and develop solutions in a fast-paced, dynamic environment using Agile and traditional development methodologies

  • Leverage knowledge of the software development lifecycle and architecture to complete day-to-day tasks

  • Train incoming Software Development team members in internal procedures and product specifications
