item.title: Customer Care Specialist - Technical Support at Envision Pharma, Inc. (Glastonbury, CT)
item.description:
Envision Technology Solutions designs, develops, implements, and supports innovative and strategic management software for our life sciences clients. 


Using prevailing web-based technologies, we build our scalable tools using modern open systems design. Our solutions are based on our unrivaled experience in the life sciences industry, and a deep understanding of the needs of our clients. Only then do we undertake a rigorous process to build the right solution using the right technologies. We have the expertise to provide a reliable, effective, and financially viable solution for your product throughout its life cycle.


The skilled members of Envision Technology Solutions division, some of whom are invited speakers at leading industry conferences, have had the distinction of collaborating as a cohesive unit for more than a decade.


CUSTOMER CARE SPECIALIST - TECHNICAL SUPPORT 


Profile/Responsibilities



  • Provide hot line support and training for external clients on the use of our proprietary software packages

  • Maintain optimum customer service levels for external clients across all of our proprietary software products

  • Maintain communications with customers during the incident resolution process

  • Assist clients with change management needs, such as software upgrades and configurations

  • Coordinate with team members to ensure all client requests are handled appropriately and in a timely manner

  • Learn and understand client business needs based on industry knowledge

  • Perform testing of new software platforms and releases to assist QA team members

  • Document and edit supporting materials including training content and software support documentation

  • Provide Level 1 Data Analytical Support for Account Management team

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Autonomous Vehicle Mapping Startup at Vehicle Data Science (Oakland, CA)
item.description:
At VDS, we teach autonomous cars how to drive. Our technology mines and processes billions of GPS tracks and vehicle sensors to create a high-precision map of driving behavior. We use this data to improve how robotic cars and driver assistance systems interact with their environment. You can read more about us at http://vds-corp.com.



We’re looking for a Senior Software Engineer to help lead the design and implementation of our data infrastructure.
Our platform is built in Python with a PostGIS database in the back end. A key aspect of the position is to help evolve the current system from a single-machine paradigm to a parallel architecture -- both for data processing and data storage. Some web programming may also be needed to further develop our browser-based GUI. Initially, the position will be split roughly 70% hands-on coding and some combination of architecture and design, supervision of junior engineers, and code reviews. This mix will evolve over time as the company grows.



We're a team of 7, hoping to be eight soon. We were founded in 2013 on a grant from the National Science Foundation. Since then, we’ve grown thanks to a second federal grant and revenue from automotive customers.

item.title: Senior Java Engineer at Brightpearl (Bristol, UK)
item.description:
Brightpearl is one of the fastest growing software companies in Europe that is changing the way small to medium size retailers and wholesalers run their business all over the world.  Our cloud-hosted SaaS product (hosted by AWS) integrates orders, inventory and customer data enabling our customers to focus on growing their business. Brightpearl has all product development and technical operations work in Bristol, and is headquartered in San Francisco.


Senior Software Engineer Role Description/ Key Tasks

We’re looking for a talented, experienced Software Engineers to join our polyglot language team on our PHP frontend and Java micro-service architecture.  We work using standard IDEA IDE’s (Intellij, PHPStorm) on Linux (Ubuntu, Mint) with Chef, Ruby and Vagrant.  We hold regular Lunch & Learn sessions, meetups and give developers half a day a week to pursue personal projects.

We’re looking for a primary specialism in the Java language, but with exposure to other languages (PHP, Javascript, Ruby, Go, Python). 

As a Senior Software Engineer, you will act as a design advisor and implementation specialist.  You will contribute to the functional improvements and system quality improvements with the technical leads and core platform team. 

As a Senior Software Engineer you will also:



  • Work in all stages of the development life cycle from requirements analysis, design specification and implementation.

  • Work with the techops team to clarify and communicate infrastructure impact.

  • Work with the core platform team on core frameworks, libraries, performance, security and other system qualities.

  • Utilise your problem solving skills to debug staging and production issues at all levels of the stack.

  • Work as a key engineer in a small highly skilled Agile development team.

item.title: Technical Team Lead, Data at Intent Media (New York, NY)
item.description:
Have you built big-data systems before, and do you want to build an industry-changing platform? Intent Media is looking for a Technical Team Lead, Data to help us continue to build out our cutting-edge data platform and to help us move even faster in our data-driven business. While our ideal candidate has built and deployed a sophisticated, large-scale data processing pipeline, we’re open to talking with experienced leaders from various different backgrounds. If you're interested in solving hard problems, working with huge amounts of data, and using a wide range of interesting technologies to get things done, then we want to talk to you.



What you will do


Every day the Intent Media Data Team processes terabytes of data to build sophisticated models that we use to help some of the world's largest e-commerce retailers deliver more value to their customers and partners. We're tackling interesting, large-scale engineering problems while building out a system to handle even bigger things. We continually look to contribute some of our efforts to the public domain, through open source, publications, speaking, etc., and would be especially interested if you’ve been active in this way.


Why work at Intent Media


Our vibrant team accomplishes a lot every day, and our management insists upon work/life balance so that we never become stale. We infuse fun and learning time into our days and our vacation policy includes a minimum, but no maximum. Our employees enjoy coming to work, and we let them know they're valued.


We don’t take ourselves too seriously, but we take our work very seriously.


We believe that in order for our employees to produce at their top level, they need to have intimate access to strategic decisions. Our flat structure and open communication allow for innovation from all levels – ideas flow freely.


We offer competitive compensation and great benefits; stock options; $2K learning budget; free Citi Bike membership, and company-wide social events.


Interested?


Apply with your resume in just a few clicks! You can learn more about us at:


www.intentmedia.com/products


www.intentmedia.com/about


http://intentmedia.tumblr.com


www.facebook.com/intentmedianyc


www.twitter.com/intentmedia

item.title: Software Engineer at Intent Media (New York, NY)
item.description:
Are you looking for the culture of a start up with the work/life balance and security of a more established company? We’re looking for talented Software Engineers that love turning ideas into tested features in production. At Intent Media, our engineers are more than coders - everyone has the opportunity to come up with new ideas, to shape the future of our company.


Are you an innovative software engineer with at least a few years of Java, Clojure or Ruby experience? Do you want to be a key member of a small team that owns a young software product end-to-end? We have a few new products in production looking for people to help build product functionality and scalability, and have some fun along the way. Join us!


What you will do


We believe in short iterations, daily releases, and working in small teams to solve hard problems. We work directly with product managers and product owners on collaborative teams. We work on big data problems, high performance ad serving, and challenging front-end Javascripts – sometimes all on the same day.


Why work at Intent Media


Our vibrant team accomplishes a lot every day, and our management insists upon work/life balance so that we never become stale. We infuse fun and learning time into our days and our vacation policy includes a minimum, but no maximum. Our employees enjoy coming to work, and we let them know they're valued.


We don’t take ourselves too seriously, but we take our work very seriously.


We believe that in order for our employees to produce at their top level, they need to have intimate access to strategic decisions. Our flat structure and open communication allow for innovation from all levels – ideas flow freely.


We offer competitive compensation and great benefits; stock options; $2K learning budget; free Citi Bike membership, and company-wide social events.


Interested?


Apply with your resume in just a few clicks! You can learn more about us at:


www.intentmedia.com/products


www.intentmedia.com/about


http://intentmedia.tumblr.com


www.facebook.com/intentmedianyc


www.twitter.com/intentmedia

item.title: Integration Engineer at LeadCloud (Baltimore, MD) (allows remote)
item.description:
LeadCloud is in need of a mid-level engineer to help us integrate third party web services. This position will use a combination of technologies and languages to process web (data) requests both in to and out from our lead processing platform.  The platform is a 100% cloud-hosted custom workflow engine that uses the latest technologies available.


While this position offers remote work, the applicant will need to be available via Skype (or other chat platform) from 10am-5pm in a US timezone Monday-Friday.


LeadCloud is on its way to becoming the default Lead Integration Platform to the online marketing industry, and is currently used by over 150 industry leading partners.  Position includes competitive salary, health benefits, ability to work from home, and most importantly a fun and challenging work environment where the envelope is pushed every day.

item.title: Software Developer II at Paycor (Frisco, TX)
item.description:
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Develop new applications, modify and maintain existing software, working closely with end-users, IT peers and management

  • Make changes to prevent recurrence, modifying existing code and faulty files, writing and running special programs

  • Document the new applications, or the changes made to existing applications

  • Participate in unit, integration, and business acceptance testing of the applications.

  • Troubleshoot application and system issues

item.title: Senior .NET (C#) / Web developer @ CaptiveAire Systems at CaptiveAire Systems (Raleigh, NC)
item.description:
CaptiveAire values its software developers highly and offers them immense opportunities for freedom and creativity while not having overbearing or micro management.  We value very highly our developer environment and provide the absolute best in terms of equipment and work environment.  We have an in-house espresso machine. What more could you need!  Our corporate office has been recently remodeled with more on the way.


This position will be a mixed role of new development, assisting with legacy application ports, helping with ongoing development of a number of existing applications (maintenance), and assisting with E-Commerce web site upgrades. The position will expose you to all areas of IT at CaptiveAire.


When interviewing, you should be comfortable and able to sit and have a casual conversation with other senior-level developers about topics such as Dependency Injection (Autofac preferred), class hierarchies including inheritance, polymorphic stacks, interfaces vs. abstract classes, basic and advanced questions concerning day-to-day use of Visual Studio, web-based technologies such as KendoUI, TypeScript, Less, AMD, SignalR, and a host of others. A high degree of understanding of WCF services is also a plus.  You will be expected to participate in whiteboard discussions and give code examples on-the-fly for simple coding exercises such as database connections and other basic topics.


For overall project management, we use an internally-hosted instance of YouTrack as well as Confluence for documentation efforts.  For our CI, we are using TeamCity and internally-hosted NuGet packages to help better manage our software builds, dependencies, and deployments.  We are also using Octopus Deploy for most all software deployments.


As a developer, you will also have an opportunity to contribute to CaptiveAire's growing list of open source projects hosted on Github.


https://github.com/CaptiveAire


** This position is not available for telecommuting.

item.title: Test Engineer at Wynyard Group (Wellington, New Zealand)
item.description:
Wynyard Group is a global market leader in the development of advanced crime fighting software used in investigations and intelligence operations by government agencies and financial institutions. Wynyard solutions help solve and prevent crime, defend against advanced persistent cyber threats and counter terrorism.


THE ROLE:


We are looking for an experienced Test Engineer to design, build and execute effective test automation solutions enabling efficient assessment of product quality. The role will work closely with the development and product teams to drive continuous quality improvement along with promoting visibility to key stakeholders.


THE KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Ensuring and verifying quality across various products and applications

  • Collaborate with the development team and product owner to identify and quantify the risks for a particular iteration.

  • Collaborate with the development team and product owner to design and build test artefacts for a particular iteration.

  • Communicate the cost / benefit for different levels and approaches of testing, when balanced against business priorities and risks.

  • Liaising with key stakeholders to ensure that planned testing meets their requirements.

  • Develop and lead test automation strategy / effort

  • Collaborate with the development team to execute test cases for a particular iteration.

item.title: Senior iOS Developer (m/f) at Westwing Home & Living (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
Westwing is one of the world’s fastest growing eCommerce companies: Backed by well-known investors with over EUR 150 mn. in funding, we are the leading Home & Living eCommerce company in the 15 countries we serve. Every day, we inspire more than 17 mn. members with stylish furniture and accessories from well-known brands they love. In 2013, we surpassed EUR 110 mn. in annual sales and continue to grow rapidly.


Our international team is the secret to our success. Westwing balances style expertise and creativity with a deeply data-driven business and tech mindset. We are proud to be working with inspiring colleagues who are smart, fun, ambitious and looking for the challenge to transform an industry.


Do you think this could be you? To pursue our ambitious growth strategy, we are looking for a Senior iOS Developer (m/f). In this position, you will be responsible for the design and the architecture of our new iPad app and for further optimization of the existing iPhone app.


Your responsibilities will be:



  • Developing and designing a new iPad App for Westwing

  • Optimizing and maintaining our existing iPhone App running in 11 countries

  • Analyzing and optimizing UI and back-end application code for efficiency and performance

  • Implementing and testing new features in close collaboration with our QA team

  • Thoroughly understanding product development and helping to shape product direction and features

  • Bringing in your advanced coding skills and creative ideas every day

item.title: Product Owner Data Science at Booking.com (Amsterdam, The Netherlands)
item.description:
Booking.com is looking for a E-Commerce Product Owner with substantial experience in a data science related discipline, preferably recommender engines or other personalization methods. We are looking for someone to extend our already highly impactful teams with industry experience and a different perspective.

As Data Science Product Owner (E-commerce) you will be responsible for creating products and features improving our customers' experience using our data, with a strong focus on driving conversion and customer loyalty. You will work with the data scientists, designers and developers in the Front-end Team to constantly find and test improvements with high commercial impact. We are looking for an experienced technical product leader with significant responsibility, offering a fantastic opportunity to improve the customer experience of the world's leading online hotel reservations website. Candidates must have a strong commercial focus, a solid background in statistics, data science and managerial experience with machine learning for a major website.

Key responsibilities: 



  • Ownership, prioritization and briefing for projects of varying length and complexity

  • Research impactful uses of big data to create new features, and enhance the existing ones

  • Identify improvements opportunities in the main website, that could be tackled with solutions based on data.

  • Helping to define the (Mid/long term) navigational chart of Web-intelligence at Booking.com, to take it to the next level.

  • Create new business opportunities using Booking.com's data

  • Advocate and facilitate the use of data and data science methods across Booking.com

item.title: Lead iOS Developer at After School (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Lead iPhone Developer


“After School” is an anonymous and entertaining message board for your school.  We launched the app last month. In under 4 weeks, over 200,000 people have installed the app and over 50% of all US high schools are on it. 


We are backed by some of the most famous investors and advisors in Silicon Valley!


After School is seeking a self-directed engineer with a desire to build robust, scalable, and exciting mobile applications. We are specifically looking for an engineer to leadour iPhone development.


Responsibilities include: craft and lead world-class iOS experiences, implement stunning user interfaces, and take an instrumental role in growing After School working directly with the co-founders.


Qualifications:



  • Must have at least one of these: multi-talented prodigy, worked at a large, well-known company, dropped out or graduated from a top-ranked school, and/or built something hundreds of thousands of people are using



  • Must have experience with advanced iOS topics and building beautiful, custom interfaces on the iPhone

  • Person should have developed libraries, a large code base, or tools to minimize their lines of code

  • Want to become one of the best mobile developers in the world

  • Top engineering school dropouts are good too :)

  • Must want the freedom to work from wherever and whenever

  • Experience with other mobile platforms is a plus (Android)

  • PHP, MYSQL (LAMP) and other web languages are a big plus

  • Culture - friendly extraverted, super passionate about life, many interests, child prodigies


If you are interested, please send me an email (with apps you’ve built, your LinkedIn profile, web presences, resume, or simply a note): cory@corylevy.com

item.title: Front End Developer - Funded Start-up in Ad-Tech at BAM (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Job


BAM is an early stage ad-tech company based in the New York City. We are looking to hire a Front End Developer. This is an opportunity to have a fundamental impact on the success of a startup and benefit from equity growth.


For example, you will routinely:



  • Build visually stunning and highly usable interfaces using AngularJS, Sass, Bootstrap, D3 (the Angular way), Yeoman, and Grunt

  • Collaborate with product owners, designers, and API developers

  • Work in topic branches in Git/Github, peer review code, and merge pull requests

  • Debug cross-browser compatibility issues and make it all work seamlessly on any device

item.title: Senior DevOps Engineer at Support.com (Redwood City, CA)
item.description:
Take this incredible opportunity to get in on the ground floor of a new SaaS product offering. Support.com is changing the way technology support is built into products, managed and delivered. Our SaaS product offering is targeted directly to contact centers and product organizations wanting a turnkey service and support platform integrated into their product.


Join us as a Senior DevOps Engineer to help build the next generation cloud infrastructure to support cross platform SDK on iOS and Mac that can help apps remotely connect to backends; perform operations on the device remotely; do real time voice and data sharing over 3G and Wifi networks and analytics via rich data capture.


Responsibilities:



  • Architect solutions around Support.com’s cloud hosted environment including rapid deployment, automation, monitoring and troubleshooting.

  • Work closely with the Engineering team to understand the architecture and provide appropriate high availability cloud deployment solutions.

  • Manage Support.com's cloud hosted software solutions to provide a high level of service to our customer base. Installation and configuration of cloud environments and upgrades of current environments.

  • Monitor and troubleshoot and fix issues with services including web applications and database servers

item.title: Backend Infrastructure Engineer at Moat (New York, NY)
item.description:
We're looking for a Backend Infrastructure Engineer who can help architect robust backend systems that support our product offerings, including a real-time analytics system as well as an industry search engine that play a mission-critical role for some of the world's largest publishers, media companies, and technology companies.


Because we work on the cutting edge of many technologies, we need someone who is a creative problem solver, highly resourceful in getting things done, and productive working both independently and collaboratively.  Other responsibilities will include: 



  • Work side-by-side with our engineers to implement scalable and reliable strategies to enhance Moat's ability to take on our next 10X increase in traffic.

  • Take part in pushing billions of transactions per day through probabilistic data structures.


  • Working with columnar databases and advanced PostgreSQL features to improve performance of analytical workloads.


  • Safeguarding the security of hundreds of thousands of web sites.


  • Collaborating with Amazon developers and helping to shape the product roadmap of several AWS services. 

  • Scaling a global web crawler to help transform unstructured web data to structured data. 

  • Managing hundreds of EC2 instances

  • Help design and engineer the architecture for scalability, high availability, performance, flexibility, operational efficiency, security and maintainability.

item.title: Front End Web Developer (Bristol) at Potato (Bristol, UK)
item.description:
We're looking for front end developers to join us in our office in central Bristol, developing web tools and apps for huge audiences. Our clients include Google, YouTube, Skype, PayPal and other agencies such as BBH and Mother.


This role will see you leading the technical aspects of a project with our friendly, expert team. The workload will sometimes be hectic, but the atmosphere is cheerful and proactive. We want to put you and your team in a position to write and deploy the best code that you can.


There are plenty of technical acronyms in here, but fundamentally we're looking for intelligent people who have an eagerness to learn new things, and the communication skills to be able to explain them to humans such as project managers and our clients.


As well as the technical knowledge, we need people that get it - people who can figure things out by themselves but know when to yell for help. Cutting down and simplifying complex problems with interfaces which make them appear straightforward.



You should probably know about...



  • Architecting and developing complex JavaScript-powered applications

  • Working closely with backend developers and UX designers

  • Javascript frameworks & libraries such as AngularJS or Backbone.js

  • Semantically marked up HTML

  • CSS, including LESS & SASS

  • git

  • Template engines such as Django, Jinja, or Smarty


We also like talking to people who enjoy...



  • Working in an agency environment

  • JavaScript unit testing tools

  • Development & consumption of HTTP APIs

  • Internationalisation

  • Google Apps & APIs

  • Use of PaaS, such as Google App Engine, Heroku, Elastic Beanstalk, or Windows Azure

  • noSQL & SQL databases


In return you'll get...



  • Free lunch, drinks and snacks

  • A fun and supportive, developer-focussed working environment


Applying


Feel free to apply with a cover letter and CV, but what we would really like to see is some code you've written. A GitHub or Bitbucket URL is ideal. Please let us know whether a freelance or fulltime position is preferable, too.


If we like what we see we'll get back to you quickly to arrange to have a cup of tea and a chat.


jobs+fe-brs@p.ota.to


Agencies:


Please don't call. If (one day) we need you, we'll be in touch.


We will not engage with cold-calling or emailing agencies in any way.

item.title: Front-End Web Developer at Online Rewards (Cincinnati, OH)
item.description:
You're a front-end web developer who keeps up with modern practices. You're curious enough to learn about new technologies and experienced enough not to put a fad in production. We want you to work with us!






Perks



  • Developer-centric company and a cubicle-free, distraction-free workplace

  • Sustainable work pace based on real 40-hour weeks

  • Modern downtown office space in historic Carew Tower overlooking Fountain Square

  • Contribute to the evolution of our usability and design standards

item.title: eCommerce Web Developer - Magento at Dr. Dennis Gross Skincare (New York, NY)
item.description:
Our fast-paced, growing skincare company is looking to hire a motivated, detail-oriented, and innovative Web Developer to join our team. This individual will have the opportunity to completely restructure our e-commerce site, www.dgskincare.com.


Overview


This position will work closely with the Director of Digital Marketing & E-Commerce to define and execute the technical needs for dgskincare.com & dennisgrossmd.com, and to ensure these sites are continually optimized.  The Web Developer is responsible for overseeing the agency developing the new dgskincare.com site as well as on-going maintenance and support for this site and dennisgrossmd.com. This role will require direct site development/upgrades as well as CMS management, agency oversight and day-to-day coordination with cross-functional teams.


Key Responsibilities


Dgskincare.com



  • Oversee agency developing new dgskincare.com site, from technical perspective

  • Manage continuous site optimization including UX updates, UAT and analytics tagging for site, emails and special projects (desktop, tablet and mobile)

  • Execute regular dgskincare.com updates: homepage rotations, offers, product & content updates, new features via Magento software

  • Deploy e-mails regularly; oversee list health and implement analytics

  • Manage search engine optimization

  • Coordinate with cross-functional teams including art dept., client care, etc. to ensure site needs are met

  • Regularly report on analytics for site traffic and conversion based on email effectiveness, SEM, SEO & Site (Google Analytics)

  • Stay abreast of latest tech trends and needs for optimizing site including necessary security patches are updated


Dennisgrossmd.com



  • Oversee agency managing dennisgrossmd.com on-going and ensure latest security patches are updated

  • Conducting on-line technology research

  • Maintain search engine optimization

  • Manage e-mail deployment, oversee list health and implement analytics

  • Stay abreast of latest tech trends and needs for optimizing site

  • Coordinate with cross-functional teams including art dept., client care, etc. to ensure site needs are met

item.title: System Engineer at Zonar Systems (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
The primary responsibility of the person holding this position is to engineer reliable and robust systems to support Zonar's applications and data.


Essential Tasks and Duties:



  • Ensure system reliability maintained at 99.9% or higher

  • On-call duties for emergency operations of servers / networking equipment as it relates to Zonar’s application and database servers

  • Assist in developing standards and procedures for System Engineers and Administrations


Knowledge and Skills:



  • Strong understanding of configuration management tools such as puppet, cfengine, or chef

  • Proficiency in scripting with Python, Perl, or sh

  • Strong knowledge of common Linux distributions (CentOS, Debian, etc.)

  • Understanding of Storage Area Network (SAN) and Big Data solutions

  • Familiarity with common open source infrastructure tools

  • Experience with common networking equipment (Cisco, Juniper, F5, etc.)

  • Strong understanding of networking protocols

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills

  • Ability to set goals, and achieve scheduled deadlines


Education:



  • BS Computer Science degree, related degree or equivalent industry experience


Experience:



  • 2+ years Linux System Administration

  • 3+ years Linux System Engineer

  • 3+ years running production IT/web operations


Working Conditions:  Standard work week is 40 hours, Mon-Fri 8AM – 5PM.  Work generally conducted in a climate controlled office environment.  On site work at data center required as necessary.  Evening and weekend work is occasionally required for server maintenance and upgrades.  On-call duties shared with other system administrators.


Disclaimer The above information on this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification.  It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.


Zonar maintains a drug-free workplace and is an equal opportunity employer functioning under an Affirmative Action Plan.

Function: We’re looking for a Mobile Development Engineer to help us design, create and grow our mobile applications and platforms. This person will work closely with our product team to assess the implementation strategy to fulfill customer and business needs. This analysis will support the implementation and deployment of new business functionality through our agile software development lifecycle. This position requires a highly motivated individual who is comfortable with rapid changes in direction and environment. The successful candidate will be customer oriented, results driven and passionate about delivering innovative quality services to delight our customers.

item.title: Software Development Engineer II at Zonar Systems (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
We’re looking for a senior Software Development Engineer with experience across the application stack to help us design, create and grow our applications and platforms. The amount of data we collect and process is staggering. We have big data challenges and are looking for folks that have a passion and experience delivering solutions within this problem set. No business problem will be too big or too small to meet customer expectations, achieve critical time to market, and deliver business value.


You will work closely with our product team to assess the implementation strategy to fulfill customer and business needs.  This analysis will support the implementation and deployment of new business functionality through our agile software development lifecycle.  This position requires a highly motivated individual who is comfortable with rapid changes in direction and environment.  The successful candidate will be customer oriented, results driven and passionate about delivering innovative quality services to delight our customers.


Essential Tasks and Duties:



  • Develop applications and services across the stack to deliver new features and support for Zonar’s products.

  • Deliver features with quality and on-time meeting release plans and delivery commitments.

  • Guide the architecture and technology decisions to drive quality, performance, usability, and sustainability to empower a world-class user experience and business value to our customers.

  • Instrument your code to achieve insight on business metrics, usage, and performance.

  • Follow engineering best practices and provide technical mentorship to other members of the team.


Additional Responsibilities and Duties:



  • Follow all company policies and procedures.

  • Perform all other duties as required.

  • Overtime as required.

  • Travel as required to support Zonar’s needs.


Knowledge and Skills:



  • Strong knowledge of object-oriented design, data structures, algorithm design and problem solving.

  • Proven experience implementing mission critical internet based applications implementing best practices for software code development, re-use, and componentization.

  • Highly proficient in Python, PHP and/or SQL.  Experience developing UX a plus.

  • Highly skilled with databases, Postgres a big plus.  Design and implementation of features to process and query large sets of data.  Be able to tune application and query performance.

  • Experience in designing and building large scale systems.  Demonstrated knowledge with distributed and multi-threaded implementations a plus.

  • Passionate orientation and attention to customers.

  • Ability work well with others, motivate others and thrive in a dynamic and challenging work environment.  Able to set goals and achieve scheduled deadlines.

  • Excellent leadership, verbal and written communication skills.


Education:



  • BS or equivalent degree in computer science or related field.


Experience:



  • 5+ years relevant work experience in software development.


Working Conditions: The standard work week is 40 hours, Mon-Fri 8AM – 5PM.  Work generally conducted in a climate controlled office environment.



Disclaimer: The above information on this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities, and qualifications required of employees assigned.


Zonar maintains a drug-free workplace and is an equal opportunity employer functioning under an Affirmative Action Plan.

item.title: Software Engineer - Platform Web Services at MotoSport (Tualatin, OR)
item.description:
At MotoSport.com, connect our powersports (dirt bikes, ATVs, UTVs, motorcycles, sport bikes and cruisers) customers to their passions through the best selection, awesome customer service and cool technology solutions. We’re looking for a Software Engineer to help us develop the platform stack on which to build our next generation of cool tech solutions.


 The PDX Engineering Team’s primary purpose is to build the data, application and service layer for the MotoSport.com website and build the tools and processes to enable MotoSport to grow through existing channels and new markets. The Software Engineer - Platform Web Services primary purpose is to support the growth of MotoSport.com by building new software solutions focusing on RESTful web service technology.


 If you are the right candidate for the job, you have done full stack software development before, have experience working in an online ecommerce environment, and have no fear of RESTful web services. You know how to architect solutions that require little or no maintenance. You’ve made mistakes over your career and have learned a lot from them.


In this role, you will:



  • Use Java and Python to build new RESTful web services.

  • Use Java to consume and build/extend Platform web services.

  • Write unit tests and own your own code in production.

  • Create basic interfaces, dashboards and internal-use tools with JavaScript, jQuery, HTML5 in the form of Mashups of data from RESTful web services.

  • Interface with Graph, NoSQL and, of course, Relational databases

item.title: Software Consultant at Rough Stone Software (Pittsburgh, PA)
item.description: You will work as part of a small team to build software for a specific client.  Our developers get experience with different tools and domains as they move from project to project (usually 3-6 months).  You will be responsible for delivering features as well as helping the team improve how we deliver software.  Our teams are small, so you will be involved in all parts of delivering software, from requirements discovery though install & post install support.

item.title: ExactTarget Technical Architect at DEG (Overland Park, KS) (allows remote)
item.description:
Do you want to change the world? Most do, but few actually accomplish this feat. DEG, named one of Inc. Magazine's "25 Companies That Are Changing The World" is changing the world and is looking for a talented, innovative, team-oriented associate that makes DEG more than the sum of its parts. 


DEG, a two-time ExactTarget Partner of the Year and the most recognized ExactTarget Marketing Cloud consultancy in the world, is seeking a Technical Architect (ExactTarget) to work on software and technology projects. The Technical Architect (ET) works within the Engineering department, while collaborating with the Direct Marketing department, implementing custom solutions integrated with ExactTarget's one-to-one messaging platform. The Technical Architect (ET) is a consultant with deep application and feature knowledge of ExactTarget, as well as specific technology domain expertise. DEG's digital marketing expertise has empowered clients such as Lee Jeans, Hyatt, and Hallmark to achieve their goals and objectives through smarter digital strategies.


The Technical Architect position is considered one of the best jobs in the company by those who enjoy working on complex solutions in a variety of industries and with emerging technologies.

item.title: Web Application Architect To Grow With Our Atlanta Office at AppRiver (Atlanta, GA)
item.description:
AppRiver is looking for a motivated, experienced web application architect. We are a leading provider of cloud services creating security software using agile processes and modern technologies. If you are looking for a highly creative, continuously evolving and team-based work environment – one where you get to solve challenging problems, collaborate with talented colleagues, and make a difference – we would love to hear from you.


We care about commitment, character and a culture of constant improvement. We want people who want to work here and love what they do. The kind of people who not only adapt to change, but who prefer to make positive change happen for the good of the organization. We have a very low attrition rate because we spend a lot of time making sure we get the right people. As a result, we have a unique blend of talented team members who work well together and whose skills complement each other.


What you will be doing


You will become part of a new high performance team of creative, empowered and hard-working Software Developers. Your duties will include (but are not limited to):



  • Writing high-quality code and unit tests for internal, customer-facing, and proprietary commercial software applications

  • Participating in software design and architecture

  • Take part in refactoring to adapt to new business needs and improve legacy code

  • Provide technical leadership including architectural guidance & best practices

  • Learning and sharing new concepts, patterns, principles

  • Working with an agile team by participating in planning, costing and retrospectives

  • Supporting production code issues and repairing defects

item.title: Software Architect (777-173) at Meridium, Inc (Roanoke, VA)
item.description:
Summary:


Develops design specifications for components and major subsystems within large applications. Works with others in a project team and participates heavily in construction (i.e. programming) activities. Works with others in the project team and participates in testing, documentation, and deployment activities.  Works independently and leads all technical aspects of a project.


Responsibilities:



  • Develop design specifications, using OOD techniques, for components or subsystems within modest to large Web or Client-Server Enterprise Applications.

  • Demonstrated ability to multiplex between architecture and senior programming assignments.

  • Review / mentor multiple project teams Architecture, design and Code.

  • Demonstrated ability to write clean, well documented code.

  • Demonstrated ability to engage in effective unit and system testing.

  • Demonstrated ability to understand complex software modules such as .Net, ASP and core frameworks.

  • Demonstrated ability to work with Database programming including SQL Queries, read, writes and updates.


Meridium:


Meridium is the global leader in asset performance management software for the oil & gas, chemical manufacturing, power, mining and discrete manufacturing industries.  We have an incredible team building leading edge software that helps our customers increase production and improve safety by predicting and preventing equipment failures. 


We believe that culture and a thriving, innovative work environment is important.  If you would like to:


Be part of a team working on exciting, demanding, and rewarding projects that impact some of the world’s largest companies


Work in an environment that encourages innovative thinking and open communication


Be part of an organization that values honesty, truth, openness, and respect for each other and our customers


Maintain a great work-life balance with flexible hours and a casual environment


Apply leading edge technologies and platforms to solve big business challenges


Then Meridium may be the place for you!

item.title: Sr. Software Developer (773-173) at Meridium, Inc (Roanoke, VA)
item.description:
About Meridium:


Meridium Inc. is the global leader in asset performance management solutions for process, power, mining and discrete manufacturing industries. With Meridium software and services, companies will accelerate profitability through effective asset strategies, thus increasing asset reliability and improving the performance of their production assets. Developing or improving these asset strategies also has a direct, positive impact on operational excellence by reducing financial, health and safety, and production risk; optimizing maintenance costs; ensuring regulatory compliance and decreasing the potential for undesirable incidents. Simply put Meridium predicts and prevents asset failures.


Job Summary:


This Sr. Software Engineer will develop design specifications for components and major subsystems within large applications. Works with others in a project team and participates heavily in construction (i.e. programming) activities. Works with others in the project team and participates in testing, documentation, and deployment activities.  Works independently and leads all technical aspects of a project.


If you’re passionate about:


Creating a safer and more predictable environment for our clients Working in an environment encouraging innovation and open communication Flexible hours and a casual environment Working with the latest technology frameworks and industry standards


Then Meridium may be the place for you!


Responsibilities:



  • Develop design specifications, using OOD techniques, for components or subsystems within modest to large Web or Client-Server Enterprise Applications.

  • Write clean, well documented code.

  • Engage in effective unit and system testing.

  • Work with Database programming including SQL Queries, read, writes and updates

item.title: Trading Systems - C/C++ Experienced Software Developer at Bloomberg (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Role:

Trading Systems at Bloomberg is looking for skilled senior developers. Bloomberg's senior developers design and build mission critical Trading Applications for the largest broker dealers and investment advisers in the world, providing global solutions for managing orders, executions, quotes, and positions. Institutions use our advanced tools for market compliance, connectivity, algorithmic strategy trading, programmed trading, risk management, ticketing, pricing, and back office/clearing. As you will work closely with development and the business side, strong communication skills are a must.

item.title: Developer - Site Reliability Team at Stack Exchange (New York, NY) (allows remote)
item.description:
Stack Exchange is growing fast, and our infrastructure needs just keep getting bigger.  We’re looking for a developer to join our Site Reliability Engineering team of outstanding sysadmins and developers working on sites that see 3000-4000 hits per second during peak times.


At Stack Exchange we’re passionate about our technology.  We own and operate our own infrastructure, and take the time to do it right (even the office wifi).  We like to stay on the cutting edge of technology, so you will always being working with or working towards using the latest and greatest there is.  We get all the hardware we need for redundancy and performance, and we create our own tools when needed (like our open source monitoring system).


Some projects that you will be working on:



  • Bosun and scollector - our open source monitoring system and data collection agent written in Go

  • Opserver - our open source dashboard and additional monitoring tool

  • Building systems to automate some of the SRE pain points around a mixed Windows and Linux environment including deployment, patching, inventory, and config management

  • Extend some of the open source projects we use including logstash and puppet


Technologies you’ll work with:



  • Windows 2012 and 2012 R2

  • Modern Linux distributions - we’re running CentOS 6 and 7

  • IIS, DFS, Multi-site AD, SQL Server 2012 and 2014

  • Go and C# as primary languages, plus some work  in Ruby, Powershell, BASH, Python, etc.

item.title: Data Warehouse Specialist at Standard Media Index (New York, NY)
item.description:
SMI is looking for a highly capable individual with SQL Server, exceptional communication and data management skills to support our rapidly growing and exciting global data business.


Reporting to the Director of US Technology, you will be responsible for supporting a significant number of SQL Server databases and applications running internally and across our Advertising Agency partners and Media/Finance subscribers.


Our technical platform is primarily based around a growing number of Amazon Web Services instances which support our internal processing of large data volumes from a variety of sources, and our delivery of data back to our Agency Partners and Clients.

item.title: Senior Ruby on Rails developer, committed to sustainability at Green River (Brattleboro, VT) (allows remote)
item.description:
We think of the internet as a societal nervous system - a growing global network of awareness and intelligence that we must put to good use. Helping to transform the market requires software skills, analytical experience, business sophistication, and a genuine commitment to ethics and social responsibility.  Incorporated in 2000, Green River's team of 15 software engineers collaborates with clients including Starbucks, US Green Building Council, NBCUniversal, B Lab, and many others. We are located in scenic southern Vermont, with a satellite office in Cambridge, Massachusetts, as well as remote staff around the country.  


Our projects offer challenges in developing complex scalable algorithms as well as highly designed responsive user interfaces.  We’re constantly evolving our approach to software development as new best practices emerge. Together, we’ve created a collaborative atmosphere in our company--shaping together the kind of work and lifestyle we want and fostering career paths through mentorship.  This has resulted in exceptionally long-term relationships with both our clients and our staff.


We are looking for an individual who has experience with Rails, SQL, Javascript and CSS, and who can lead a programming team.  We offer a competitive salary with great benefits, including 100% of health insurance, five weeks paid time off, retirement benefits, and so on.


As the population rises, the climate changes, and critical resource thresholds are reached and exceeded, it’s becoming increasingly important for information systems to help us obtain and interpret data about people and organizations, in terms of both economic benefits and human and ecological health. This vision of the future is what drives us at Green River.


We look forward to hearing from you.


Green River

item.title: Site Reliability Engineer, Networking at Stack Exchange (New York, NY) (allows remote)
item.description:
Stack Exchange is growing fast, and our infrastructure needs just keep getting bigger.  We’re looking for a senior sysadmin to join our team of outstanding sysadmins and developers working on sites that see 3000-4000 hits per second during peak times.


At Stack Exchange we’re passionate about our technology.  We own and operate our own infrastructure, and take the time to do it right* (even the office wifi).  We like to stay on the cutting edge of technology, so you will always being working with or working towards using the latest and greatest there is.  We get all the hardware we need for redundancy and performance, and we create our own tools when needed (like our open source monitoring system). 


* Doing it right has the added benefit of reducing Sleep Interrupting Events (SIEs) when you are on call. We _love_ our sleep and don’t want it interrupted!


We want to hire the right person wherever you are in the world. If you’re in New York or interested in relocating to our office, you’ll enjoy some amazing amenities like private offices and in-house chefs. If not, we’ll help you create your dream office at home, wherever that might be.


Examples of projects that you’ll work on:



  • Bring configuration management to our network infrastructure so we can scale to N datacenters

  • Tune both our network equipment and servers to have the lowest latency possible

  • Make our site-to-site VPN connections highly available


Technologies you’ll work with:



  • Cisco Routers, ASAs and Switches, HSRP / Keepalived / BGP, Multi-site VPN

  • Haproxy, Redis, CentOS, and Puppet

  • Windows 2012 and 2012 R2, IIS, DFS, Multi-site AD, SQL Server 2008 and 2012

  • Go, Bash, Perl, Python, Powershell, Ruby


You’ll be working out of our swanky New York office. It includes its own chefs, showers in case you like to work out in the middle of the day or bike to work, ping pong, and barista-quality espresso prepared by the CEO. And you will get your own office!


What you’ll do:



  • Coordinate daily with a terrific team of sysadmins and developers

  • Rack servers and maintain our finely-crafted cable management

  • Tackle big projects from inception to deployment

  • Help us handle traffic of 3000 hits/sec and plan for growth to 10000

  • Handle alerts on all parts of our infrastructure as part of a 24x7 on-call rotation

  • Document all these fun things by blogging about them

item.title: Full Stack Web Developer - Internal Tools at Stack Exchange (New York, NY) (allows remote)
item.description:
Come help us create the future of Stack Exchange. We're looking for creative developers who are excited about building tools to support the growth of our company and especially our growing sales team. Some projects we've been working on:



  • Live-updating status dashboards displayed in every office and used by the sales team to monitor sales and view progress towards sales goals

  • An interactive scrum board for the sales team that automatically syncs with sales opportunities in Salesforce

  • A new billing and accounting system rolling out across the organization


As a developer on our internal dev team, you'll work primarily in our main stack of C#, ASP.NET, and MSSQL Server, with supporting technologies like AngularJS, coffeescript and Redis. You’ll also have the opportunity to interact with a lot of third-party tools like Salesforce, our Asterisk and Cedar phone systems, etc. We don't expect you to know everything coming in, so we'll pair you with mentors who will help you learn and develop.


We want to hire the right person wherever you are in the world. If you’re in New York. Denver, or London (or you’re interested in relocating to one of our offices), you’ll enjoy some amazing amenities like private offices and free, catered lunch. If not, we’ll help you create your dream office at home, wherever that might be, complete with 30-inch monitors, motorized standing desks, and the best equipment available.

item.title: Software Engineer Web UI/UX at American Express (New York, NY)
item.description:
American Express is embarking on an exciting transformation driven by an energetic new team of high-performers. This group is nimble and creative with the power to shape our technology and product roadmap. If you have the talent and desire to deliver innovative payment products and services at a rapid pace, serving our customers seamlessly across physical, digital, mobile, and social media, join our transformation team!

Software Engineers that join our Technologies team can be assigned to one of several exciting teams that are developing new virtual internet-based payment solutions, customer service portals, online merchant services support and integration, credit management tools, and suites of web-based applications for cardmember targeted offers that will span over 20 international markets.

You will be part of a fast-paced, entrepreneurial team responsible for delivering world class Cardmember experiences across multiple channels, including native iOS, Android, web, social integration, Java services, and APIs. You will be challenged with identifying innovative ideas and proof of concepts to deliver against the existing and future needs of our customers.

Responsibilities include:
Serving as a core member of an engineering team that designs and develops software applications
Writing code and unit tests, automation, and conducting code reviews and testing
Identifying exciting opportunities for adopting new technologies to solve existing needs and predicting future challenges
Performing ongoing refactoring of code, utilizing visualization and other techniques to fast track concepts, and delivering continuous improvement
Working with product managers to prioritize features for ongoing sprints and managing a list of technical requirements based on industry trends, new technologies, known defects, and issues
Manage your own time, and work well both independently and as part of a team
Work closely with product managers, back-end and other front-end engineers to implement versatile solutions to tricky web development problems
Quickly generate and updating HTML prototypes from UI concepts for testing and team feedback
Finalizing HTML prototypes into Web Applications by integrating with back-end services and functionality
Embrace emerging standards while promoting best practices in order to push the limits of what a browser can do

Qualifications

BS or MS degree in computer science, computer engineering, or other technical discipline, or equivalent work experience
Demonstrated experience in Agile development, application design, software development, and testing
A proven hunger to learn new technologies and translate them into working software
Ability to effectively communicate with internal and external business partners
Expertise in objected oriented analysis and design across a variety of platforms
Thorough understanding of XML, JSON, Web Services technologies, and data structure fundamentals
Experience with Java application design and development in an Enterprise setting
Experience with a broad range of software languages and payments technologies is a plus
Experience with HTML, CSS, JavaScript and front end technologies required
Experience with adaptive and responsive techniques
Internationalization (I18N) and Localization (L10N) experience is a plus


American Express is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, or any other status protected by law. item.description:
American Express is embarking on an exciting transformation driven by an energetic new team of high performers. This group is nimble and creative with the power to shape our technology and product roadmap. If you have the talent and desire to deliver innovative payment products and services at a rapid pace, serving our customers seamlessly across physical, digital, mobile, and social media, join our transformation team!

Technical Project Managers that join our Technologies team can be assigned to one of several exciting teams that are developing new virtual, Internet-based payment solutions, customer service portals, online merchant services support and integration, credit management tools, and suites of web-based applications for cardmember targeted offers that will span over 20 international markets.

You will be part of a fast-paced, entrepreneurial team responsible for delivering world class cardmember experiences across multiple channels, including native iOS, Android, web, social integration, Java services, and APIs. You will be challenged with identifying innovative ideas and proof of concept to deliver against the existing and future needs of our customers.

  • Ability to get industry leading solutions to market efficiently and effectively

  • Experience in clarifying objectives, dealing with ambiguity/under-defined problems, advocating for simplification, and influencing teams

  • Ability to enable business capabilities through innovation

  • Demonstrated willingness to learn new technologies and takes pride in how fast they develop working software

  • Bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, computer engineering, or other technical discipline, or equivalent work experience, is preferred

  • PMI certification is a plus

  • Scrum Master certification is a plus

  • Experience using Rally agile delivery management platform is a plus

  • Experience with object-oriented design and coding skills across a variety of platforms (JAVA, HTML5, BLAZE, DB2, XML, and Mainframe) is a plus

  • Experience with web services and open API development, as well as SOA concepts, is a plus

  • Experience with payments technology and industry is a plus

MG2A

item.title: Software Quality Assurance Engineer at American Express (Fort Lauderdale, FL)
item.description:
American Express is embarking on an exciting transformation driven by an energetic new team of high performers. This group is nimble and creative with the power to shape our technology and product roadmap. If you have the talent and desire to deliver innovative payment products and services at a rapid pace, serving our customers seamlessly across physical, digital, mobile, and social media, join our transformation team!

Quality Assurance Engineers that join our Technologies team can be assigned to one of several exciting teams that are developing new virtual Internet-based payment solutions, customer service portals, online merchant services support and integration, credit management tools, and suites of web-based applications for cardmember targeted offers that will span over 20 international markets.

  • Works with engineers to drive improvements in code quality via manual and automated testing

  • Responsible for managing the definition, implementation, and integration of quality principles into the design and development of software and IT processes

  • Involved in the review of requirements specifications for weaknesses in function, performance, reliability, scalability, testability, usability, and security and compliance testing, and provides recommendations

  • Plans and defines testing approach, providing advice on prioritization of testing activity in support of identified risks in project schedules or test scenarios

  • Develops test plans, testing resource requirements, and overall scheduling of testing activity

  • Responsible for developing manual and automated test cases and configurations needed to meet testing of business requirements

  • Executes test cases/scripts to ensure delivery of quality software applications

  • Monitors and tracks resolution of defects, coordinating with engineers in order to prevent, report, and resolve

  • Designs, monitors, and analyzes quality assurance metrics such as defect, defect counts, test results, and test status

  • Identifies opportunities to adopt innovative technologies

  • This rebel with a cause looks beyond the obvious for continuous improvement opportunities

Qualifications

This high energy Quality Assurance Engineer must have:

  • 3+ years of experience in IT, with an emphasis on QA, and proven ability in writing test cases, running functional, automated, or performance tests, and managing defects

  • Experience with Agile, other rapid application development methods, and Waterfall SDLC

  • Solid experience in test-driven development, unit testing, functional testing, system integration testing, regression testing, GUI testing, web service testing, and browser compatibility testing

  • Experience in working with testing automation tools like JMeter, HP Load Runner, HP Quality Test Professional, HP Quality Center, open source tools Selenium (Selenium IDE, Selenium RC, Selenium Web Driver), JUnit, Eclipse, and preparation of automation test framework

  • Strong written and verbal communication skills

  • Ability to effectively interpret technical and business objectives and challenges

  • Ability to think abstractly and deal with ambiguous/under-defined problems

  • Demonstrated willingness to learn new technologies and takes pride in how fast they develop working software

  • Bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, computer engineering, or other technical discipline, or equivalent work experience, is preferred

  • Ability to enable business capabilities through innovation is a plus

  • Experience with coding skills across a variety of platforms (JAVA, HTML5, DB2, XML, and Mainframe Cobol) is a plus

  • Knowledge of web security and encryption technology is a plus

  • Any of the following test certifications - QAI, ASQ, IIST, ISEB, ISTQB - are a plus


  • Experience with payments technology and industry is a plus

MG2A

item.title: Software Engineer at Nextiva (Scottsdale, AZ)
item.description:
Nextiva - Why Work For Us?


Because at Nextiva, our people do amazing things to help businesses solve their toughest challenges.  We simplify the way businesses communicate. We acquired our first customer in 2008, and today over 100,000 businesses across the United States use Nextiva. Our team consists of over 300 talented people that embrace Amazing Service. Technological innovation and our team are our competitive edge. We don't study industry trends and build our products and services reactively; we define the industry's direction. We have revolutionized the way businesses communicate, and we will continue to do so.


We work with passion and take our business seriously.  We also aim to cultivate an environment of having fun while accomplishing our goals. Our culture is both professional and playful, and this approach plays a key role in our daily successes. Our culture of Amazing Service extends to how we treat both our customers and each other. We are passionate about Nextiva’s unique culture, and of course are looking for likeminded individuals that share our values and vision.


Here's a bit more about the Software Engineer - Full Stack Web Application Development position:



  • Being a big part of a small team working on web-based tools to aid small and medium businesses (including ourselves, we eat our own dog food).

  • Building correct and fast software systems to support software service product websites and maintain an acceptable performance and uptime of said systems.

  • Understanding and contributing code across the entire software stack

  • Working with the product team on the feasibility and estimation of new features.

  • Ongoing research and evaluation of new technologies and methodologies to improve the quality and feature set of our software.

  • Mentoring others and leading by example


Technologies We Use



  • Python, Pyramid, SQLAlchemy, py.test

  • Postgres, Redis, RabbitMQ

  • Javascript, React.js, jQuery

  • nginx, uwsgi

  • git

  • Linux, Debian

item.title: Public Sector Lead Developer (Senior Consultant) at Microsoft (Reston, VA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Are you passionate about writing code that solves some of the largest problems facing the US Federal Government?


Do you value deploying applications into production with real world impact?


Want to work on projects using the latest (including pre-release) Microsoft technologies?


Are you a technical leader who loves helping junior developers hone their craft?


Microsoft Services’ US Public Sector Solutions Center (PSSC) utilizes proven Microsoft tools, practices and solutions development experts to develop mission-critical solutions for public sector customers. Operating from Microsoft’s premises with all necessary infrastructure supplied, the PSSC’s highly qualified personnel work hand-in-hand with customers, partners and other Microsoft teams to deliver professional solutions within reduced time and financial boundaries, and with increased predictability of success.

The PSSC Lead Developer will oversee the design and development for multiple projects, providing guidance and assistance across multiple projects. By mentoring and providing assistance, the Lead Developer will serve to augment the technical expertise and capabilities of each individual project team, ultimately delivering solutions of higher technical quality and capability.


The PSSC Lead Developer’s primary responsibilities include:

Secondary responsibilities include:

item.title: Senior QA Automation Engineer at SpotHero (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
SpotHero is seeking a Senior QA Automation Engineer who will work directly with our Co-Founder and CTO, Larry Kiss. You will be responsible for building out the testing infrastructure and unit, integration, and functional test suites for our entire stack, and native mobile apps.


What might you find yourself doing here?


We are looking for pragmatic generalist programmers who can not only help us execute in building this out, but also have a real say in our technological direction. We're on a Python/Django stack, with both iOS and Android native apps. However, we're open to experienced engineers with other backgrounds, like Ruby. 



  • Architect and build out test infrastructure, to support lifecycle testing of our web and native app products

  • Lead QA efforts, to guide engineering team to achieve QA goals

  • Choose and implement the tools that will be used for automated UI testing (ie Capybara, Selenium, PhantomJS, etc.)

  • Lead QA efforts on native app testing. Previous experience is not required, but a scrappy attitude to research and get it done, is a huge benefit

  • Experience with continuous integration tools such as Jenkins

  • Python or Ruby experience preferred

  • Be open to contributing to Open Source, where possible

item.title: Senior Front End Developer at SpotHero (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
SpotHero is seeking a Senior Front End Developer, who will work directly with our Co-Founder and CTO, Larry Kiss.  You will be responsible for building the features that our users see and interact with on a daily basis, and for creating the tools that make that possible.  


What might you find yourself doing here?


We value engineers who can work at all levels of our stack, but have a particular passion for HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.  Our product team follows a rapidly iterative and data-driven product roadmap. Our ideal candidate will thrive in such a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment, and will have the ability to both collaborate and execute efficiently.



  • Creating user-facing search and eccommerce interfaces that leverage single-page application frameworks like Backbone to maximize client-side speed and scalability.

  • Developing lightweight, responsive tools to support our operators and partners such as analytics dashboards and integration interfaces.

  • Leveraging Sass to expand our UI component library which allows us to streamline development and ensure consistency across all of our interfaces.

  • Using tools like Grunt to work towards further automation of our common development practices such as code minification, code linting, css vendor prefixes, unit testing etc...

  • Discovering new ways to improve page load times. Some examples could be build optimizations, image spriting, lazy loading rich content, leveraging CDN assets or minimizing code in general to name a few.

item.title: Web Developer at ReverbNation (Durham, NC)
item.description:
Come work for a music company that has been voted one of the ‘Best Places to Work’ in the Triangle for 3 years running.



Successful candidates are individuals who thrive on collaborative teams where everyone works on everything, and everyone is encouraged to contribute ideas across all levels of the organization.  You should desire to work in a fast moving and adaptive start-up environment but with the stability, compensation and benefits of a successful company.



As a Web Developer, you will use your web development skills to develop applications and systems that will help local businesses be more successful and accelerate the growth of ReverbNation.



You should want to…



  • Design and implement high quality, elegant SaaS software for desktop, mobile web and mobile apps

  • Collaborate directly with product management, marketing, design and engineering teams on new product features

  • Help define the processes and frameworks to support a high-performing engineering organization



People we’ve hired have…



  • 2+ years of experience designing and developing web applications

  • Mastery of at least one OO programming language, ideally Ruby

  • Experience working with common Internet technologies (e.g. MySQL, CSS, HTML, JavaScript, jQuery, AJAX)

  • Strong belief in the importance of applying modern programming patterns, especially MVC

  • High attention to detail and pride in producing high-quality software

  • Passion for learning about and developing with new technologies

  • Flexibility to adapt quickly with our growing and ever-changing business

  • Thrive in a fast-paced, Agile-like environment

  • Experience with Angular and responsive frameworks like Foundation is a plus

  • Experience with an open-source toolset – ours includes Ruby, Apache, Node.js, Memcache, Redis, ElasticSearch, and Kafka



Stuff you’ll get…



  • Competitive salary and potential for equity

  • Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision plan options (100% of premiums paid by company)

  • A collaborative work environment where you’ll learn about and influence every aspect of the business

  • The opportunity to work with some of the most talented leaders, designers, marketers and developers at one of the fastest growing startups in the Triangle

  • The opportunity to define the foundational technology that will power the growth of our business

  • An environment that fosters transparency and the company vision through regular company updates and happy hours

  • A company that partners with you to learn, grow and excel in your career



ReverbNation is a SaaS company revolutionizing music by making it simple for Artists and their Musicians to do what they do best.  More than 3,000,000 musicians use the technology at ReverbNation on the web and mobile.  The mission of ReverbNation is to help Artists get the most from their music and fans.  If you want to see how your hard work leads to the success of your company, ReverbNation is the place for you.



See for yourself… https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MHPz0zUNPPc



We are hiring Web Developers of all experience levels – from Junior (2+ years of experience) to Senior (8+ years of experience). All candidates, no matter your experience level, who meet the qualifications listed above are welcome and encouraged to apply!



Out-of-town candidates interested in relocating to the Raleigh-Durham, NC area are welcome to apply –relocation assistance will be provided for exceptional candidates!

item.title: Senior Backend Developer at SpotHero (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
SpotHero is seeking a Backend Developer who will work directly with our Co-Founder and CTO, Larry Kiss and our amazing Engineering Team.  You will be responsible for building all things related to the backend horsepower that powers our website, our API, and our native apps.


What might you find yourself doing here?


We are looking for pragmatic generalist programmers who can not only help us execute in building this out, but also have a real say in our technological direction. We're on a Python/Django stack, with both iOS and Android native apps. However, we're open to experienced engineers with other backgrounds, like Ruby.



  • Architecting and building out a public API, with throttling controls, rock solid security, and analytics to measure usage.

  • We're constantly optimizing for speed, as a way to deliver the best experience to both website users and native app users. Sometime this means rearchitecting the front-end and API interaction. Sometimes this means using edge of network caching. Maybe we even need to optimize our algorithm. Bottom line is best experience for the customer, no matter what it takes.  Sometimes this conflicts with A/B testing strategies. So building out a robust system, that is both fast, and allows our growth team to effectively test new features, is critical.

  • Our Parking Garages are crucial to our business. So we're building them a suite of analytics tools, to help them monitor and optimize rates and availability, to provide the best value to the customers.

  • Architecting a RedShift data warehouse, to combine 10+ databases, to allow for incredibly quick big data analysis.

  • We're streamlining the onboarding of new cities, by building out suites of tools for business team use. 

  • Companies are excited to integrate with our products. Just imagine, after you purchase event tickets, you need amazing parking for the event.  So we're making that seamless experience happen.

  • We believe in the best customer experience ever.  This includes their experience at the Parking Garage itself.  When the garage has a barcode scanner, all our customer has to do is scan their barcode on entry, and exit, and the gate automatically opens.  It's truly amazing!!


Let’s talk details. Our ideal candidate will love to dig deep on backend, and not shy away from architecting solutions that involve newer technologies that we’ve never used, including front end related solutions. Right now, our backend is powered by Django, python, postgresql, redis, mongodb, and nginx + uwsgi. Our front end is a combination of responsive design, and a backbone app to make searching blazingly fast.  We're currently in 10 cities now, and you'll be instrumental in getting into all the major cities in the US.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at GrubHub, Inc. (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
We are looking for engineers to help us dramatically expand and improve our set of products while simultaneously supporting a massive increase in the capacity of our systems. We have been extremely picky about assembling a team of smart, humble people who are passionate about creating amazing products. We work in an agile manner and believe strongly that small cross-functional teams empowered to make decisions and move fast are the best way to do so. This is an unbeatable opportunity for developers who hope to work on and deliver world class software in a friendly, fun, and innovative environment.


Responsibilities:



  • Design, implement, and deliver awesome technical platforms and products for all constituencies (diners, corporate accounts, restaurants, internal tools)

  • Understand our products from both a technical and business perspective in the context of our larger business.

  • Communicate with leadership, product owners, other technologists, and users to create working software based on an understanding of business and technical priorities.

  • Break down complex problems into elegant technical solutions to intelligently solve problems for GrubHub.com diners, restaurant, corporate accounts and internal stakeholders

  • Actively contribute to the adoption of strong software architecture, development best practices, and new technologies. We are always improving the process of building software; we need you to help contribute.

  • You will be a key part in accurately estimating the timing of software delivery

item.title: Site Reliability Engineer at GrubHub, Inc. (New York, NY)
item.description:
We want to bridge the gap between web developers and traditional tech ops by building processes that support our infrastructure (both bare metal private and public clouds) including management, monitoring, deployment.  This role will focus on allowing for scale to keep up with customer demand while providing the best customer experience possible. 


This role will work side by side with dev teams. We are looking for someone that can work in the scrum, bridge the gap between dev and ops, and help define tools, systems and processes.  This role will help provide a tech ops perspective on story pick-ups and help facilitate tasks needed to keep the runway clear for new code.  Daily tasks could include dev stand ups, NOC information hand-offs for code coming down the pipe, building puppet manifests, verifying continual integrations and deployments are functioning as needed, and winning the ping pong championship!
