item.title: Software Development Engineer (SDE) at INRIX (Kirkland, WA)
item.description:
INRIX is on a path of unprecedented growth. The development team is aggressively driving innovation, design, implementation and deployment of large scale distributed applications and web services. Our core mission is to solve complex problems around big data and analytics. To develop and modify software to drive (pun intended!) the accuracy of predicting traffic flow and deliver the most valuable and accurate results to our customers!
The INRIX development team is a great place to grow your career and skillset. Our roadmap is bursting with opportunity for engineers to bring their best (and then some), solving intriguing challenges, and tangibly impacting the customer experience.
What you’re looking for:



  • A cutting-edge stack that combines open source and custom code to create a high-end traffic data and services platform serving millions of customers

  • Practical experience in working in a fast paced “start-up like” environment with high performing teams

  • Be part of a team where fun, smart, passionate, ambitious engineers are focused on delivering complex data and services that must be delivered with extremely low latency

  • A fast–growing global company where you’ll be challenged (required) to think about things that no one has thought of yet

  • A position where you’re an important voice in development, not one of many

  • Design, implement, and deploy large scale distributed applications and web services

  • Solve complex problems to develop software to drive the most valuable and accurate results to our customers


 What’s so exciting about our platform?

We’re working on a cutting-edge stack that combines open source and custom code to create a high-end traffic data and services platform serving millions of customers.  You’ll be joining a team focused on delivering engineering solutions to support complex services that must be delivered with extremely low latency.  You will have a strategic role driving decisions that will shape INRIX's capabilities and the future technical direction of our products.
Ideal Candidates have:



  • Strong experience in open source stacks and some experience in MSFT stack

  • Working knowledge in probability, statistics and analytics,  GIS/LBS concepts highly desired

  • Experience delivering and operating SaaS product offerings in an iterative, agile software lifecycle in AWS or Azure

  • Experience in Big Data architectures, NoSQL DB’s, Hadoop/HDFS/map/reduce, real time streaming analytics, visualization, or other technologies in the Big Data Analytics stack


Why make the move:



  • INRIX motorboat – Get your boat license and we’ll pay for the gas. You can walk from your office to the dock in 15 minutes. Take your family and friends skiing or tubing.  Yes, it’s big and it’s fast!

  • Free BMW – Well…. not really free.  But we have test cars with the latest traffic technology that you can take home.  We pay for the gas. 

  • Great Benefits – We’re as good as or better than most companies our size.

  • Free onsite snacks and drinks; Free Friday lunches – The food comes to you so that you write lots and lots of good code (at least we’re honest).

  • Bonuses 2x per year and Stock Options – Because you like to be rewarded and recognized for your hard work.

  • No Vacation Policy – You’re an adult and can manage your own vacation time.  Work hard; play hard.  Why does your company still have a vacation policy?

  • Family – We don’t believe that you should miss your child’s play because you have to attend a meeting. 

  • Are you ready to join a different kind of company?

Infusion has partnered with a leader in transportation services.  We are revolutionizing the mobile user experience for consumers, business users, media, and politicians, across a variety of digital platforms.  This set of next generation user apps and associated digital access points requires a strong technical mobile thought leader to help design and architect a set of world class experiences.  You'll partner across functions, organizations, and timezones to work with the most cutting edge consumer technologies, and integrate with existing enterprise support systems.  This is truly a career highlight project.  If you’re keen to set a new standard for mobile user excellence in a high profile consumer vertical, we want to hear from you!

item.title: Healthcare Software Developers sought for fast-growing HIE vendor at CareEvolution (Ann Arbor, MI) (allows remote)
item.description:
Note: this job is open to US Residents only.


What we do actually matters. CareEvolution's Health Information Exchange (HIE) platform creates better patient outcomes.


Our exchanges ingest clinical data from a wide variety of sources - claims, admissions, labs etc. - and supply interfaces by which clients can consume, modify, and aggregate that data in all sorts of interesting and meaningful ways.


One example problem that Health Information Exchange helps solve is the lack of visibility across institutions.  Often, patient care is managed across multiple hospitals, clinics, and practices. Our platform allows caregivers - and patients themselves - to access a patient's complete medical history across all institutions in the exchange. In other words the physician can see everything that's happened to the patient - cross-institution - on one screen.  That kind of access and visibility empowers caregivers to give the most informed care possible to their patients.


Another: the prevention of Never Events. One frequently-occurring Never Event is when a certain type of catheter remains in a patient for too long, in which case the risk of hospital-borne infection increases. If that happens, insurers will refuse to reimburse the hospital for the treatment of the infection, and so the hospital must shoulder the financial burden.  This expense can run tens of thousands of dollars per patient. It is therefore in the financial interest of the hospital to identify which patients are at risk, and to take corrective action. In this case - as is often the case - the financial incentives align very nicely with the mission of creating better patient outcomes. CareEvolution has leveraged many different components of our stack and leveraged all sorts of interesting data - labs, orders, nurse notes, financials, etc. - to create solutions for these types of problems.


There are many other use cases for exchange - many of which we probably haven't even thought of yet.  But, in short, any opportunity in which we can create better patient outcomes is the business that we want to be in, and the business that we find ourselves in.


We are looking for software people to help us solve these problems. Common themes include the expansion of our platform, the setting up and management of new and existing deployments, technical integration with 3rd-party data sources, and development of new applications atop our platform.


But we're not going to tell you what to do. We're looking for people who will tell us what we will do - what needs to be done and why it's important - and then we're going to build something cool.  We're engineered our organization specifically to engender creativity, innovation, and focus on solving some of the most difficult problems in healthcare.  Our team is intelligent, competent, focused, creative, kind, ... and humble.  (Really!)  We have a flat, manager-less company structure - or, perhaps a different way of putting it is that everyone is a manager.  We exclusively hire smart adults who can get things done, and who are committed to helping us solve these problems.


Visit http://letsfixhealthcare.com to learn more - or contact us - and we'll better explain what CareEvolution is all about.

item.title: Senior C# Web API Developer at Coolblue (Rotterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
As a Senior C# Web API Developer, you will make the data flow. We have a lot of friends and they crave well-structured data. We need your help to make them smile!


What you tell your friends you do
"I'm one of the great minds at Coolblue. I weave my magic behind the scenes to craft top notch REST services. I ensure that data flows around Coolblue like water."


What you will really be doing



  • Create extremely well crafted backend services in C# 

  • Help to redesign the data flow into Coolblue's applications in a RESTful manner.

  • Create services that separate the responsibilities of the current back office applications, essentially creating a service-oriented architecture for our new applications.

  • Develop interfaces to any number of required data stores (for example; Oracle, SQL Server, RavenDB, or Couchbase).

  • Write testable code that will be continuously tested and deployed by TeamCity and Octopus Deploy, and will therefore have a real effect on live environments.

  • Coach and provide feedback to fellow developers

  • Think about technical choices, such as our architecture, tools, processes.


How will you be doing this?



  • You will actively participate in your team's (multidisciplinary) Scrum process.

  • You will receive and  pro-actively get feedback from end users and developers. After evaluation of this feedback you might incorporate it in a new iteration.

  • You will initiate and actively participate in discussions about technical choices, such as our architecture, tools, and processes. Choices that were made in the past are not rules.

  • You open pull requests, review the code and give feedback that makes your team even better.

  • You will work in a motivated team, get the time needed to meet ambitious goals. 

  • You will actively improve overall software quality. Write SOLID and testable C# code.

  • There is always a budget for good ideas.


What we have worked on last quarter



  • Incoming Goods. The internal application that supports putting away new stock was re-written. The Web API developers wrote services to interface with both old and new data-stores in order to modernise the new application without interfering with existing business processes. 

  • Mobile Application. The Coolblue iPhone and Android app need real-time information about picking and packing of orders. RESTful services were built to enable this real-time information flow.


What a day in the office might look like
On the way in, you grab very drinkable coffee and make sure you say 'Goedemorgen' to everyone. Drop your bag at your desk and head over to the colleague that has some questions. You'll spend a few minutes with him, before you need to get back for your 9:30 stand-up. Today you need to finish up the service for the purchasing optimisation team; you just need to finish up the test cases and push it into CI by the time you go for lunch - you chuck your headphones in and get on with it. You take a break for lunch at the Markthal with your newest friends; making sure that you're back in time for the meeting with a data engineer that will help you design a new replacement for the current integration with Oracle. You stop on the way back to grab another coffee and discuss the semantics of PUT vs POST with the team next door. You spend the remainder of your afternoon writing a blog post in the IT Wiki on the new queuing methodology you demoed last week, and then pack up and, because it's Friday, head out for a beer with your colleagues.


Team
You will be working in a team with a few other sharp developers, each of them with their own fanaticisms, ranging from code quality and testability, to algorithms and scalability. Your team is complemented by a Scrum Master and a Product Owner. You might want to ensure that you come equipped with your own NERF gun though ... Fortune favours the prepared.


We offer



  • Money.

  • To help you keep your money, we also chip in on your pension, pay for your travels and offer a discount on all the stuff we sell.

  • Heartwarming help with the international relocation process from start to finish.

  • Room for you to do things your way.

  • 25 days of paid leave, so long as you promise to come back!

  • We like to inspire your passion giving you the opportunity to visit events.

  • Lots of things you can learn through our Coolcademy & skilled sparring partners.

  • An office in the heart of Rotterdam so there's plenty to do when you're not at work.

  • And yes, we also have the industry standard perks such as free beer, ping pong tables and awesome parties.

item.title: Senior Engineers -high-volume distributed systems at a growth stage company at Signal (formerly BrightTag) (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
Do you want a chance to contribute to the creation and evolution of products that change the way an industry works?  If so, keep reading.


Signal (formerly BrightTag) is looking for a couple of engineers who share our passion for building platforms that seamlessly scale through orders of magnitude.  Our cross-channel platform makes it possible for our clients to stream their online and offline customer data in real-time (less than 50 milliseconds from data collection to syndication), helping our clients turn life data into knowledge the can use immediately.


Our engineering team is lead by Signal co-founder and CTO, Eric Lunt (prior to Signal, Eric co-founded Feedburner).  Our technology supports top brands that generate more than $1.5 trillion in commerce, including Allstate, Audi, Crate & Barrel, DeVry University, GAP, JetBlue Airways, Macy's, 1-800-Flowers, Starcom MediaVest Group, Starwood Hotels and Resorts, and more.


Sound interesting?  Great! We are adding to our team in 2015 and want engineers who get really excited about writing smart code and creating products that solve problems. 


The neat stuff you’ll be doing:



  • Work on a small, focused, permeable team to drive requirements, architect new products, write great code and stay ahead.

  • Write great code. Provide the technology for a platform that facilitates billions of requests monthly.

  • Collaborate. You'll be working with everyone—dev team, product owners, partner team, and senior management to innovate and get stuff done.

  • Take the lead on new features or products.

  • Help us be the best team we can be by promoting great architectural practices, improving process and always wanting to learn more. 

  • Mentor engineers who have not attained your level of experience.  In turn you’ll learn a lot from your team members.

  • Participate in dev team guilds, HackWeek, Shark Week, demo days. Have fun and experience life at a growing tech company.


Tools:  You will choose the type of laptop you want to do your job and we’ll reimburse you.  Some tools we use: Git, Review Board, Jenkins, Jira, Fabric, Maven. We like to share information about new tools and ways of doing things and hope you’ll participate in that. 



Tech stack:  We are polyglots and use the best language and tool for the job. On the back-end we use Java (Guice), node.js (Express framework). Our data stores include Cassandra, MongoDB, Kairos.  We use Openstack in development and AWS in production.



What we value:  We don’t care about ninjas or rock stars.  We look for people who are really smart, really nice and who want to solve big problems and have the freedom to solve them without slogging through layers of bureaucracy.  Read our Code to code by.



How we’re different:  We believe in code quality, testing, peer reviews, collaboration. We like polyglot programming. We love open source, open communication and have created an environment where we treat people like adults, give them big problems to solve and the power to solve them.  We value building the right team and love that people rarely leave us.  We give back through apprenticeships, open source and community participation as well as doing good.  We are part of the After Hours Gaming League.


What’s in it for you:  We take pride in our culture. We pay well (base, bonus, stock options) and we have great benefits, like: unlimited PTO (we mean this), 401k, laptop benefit, health/dental/vision, STD/LTD, snacks, massage, parental leave, Hack Weeks, great colleagues. We have a programming club, a math club, book club.  Our coffee is from Bow Truss and we have friendly relations with a good many food trucks.


What’s next? Write us.  Send us your resume (see below for contact).  Include your github username and tell me a bit about something cool you’ve worked on recently.

item.title: Full Stack Web Developer at Visual Data Solutions, Inc. (Miami, FL)
item.description:
VDS is looking for a full time developer who loves to get things done. We need an experienced web developer who will spend the majority of their time building our multi-tenant MVC sites. You must also be able to handle some C# only projects and some SQL work. In this role you will be working with our team to continue fulfilling our clients software needs. We are a consulting firm and taking care of our client's software needs is our mission.


These projects are focused on Real Estate management with some interesting twists. They support multiple projects for our clients. Making them flexible will be part of your responsibilities. We are a team of professional developers who are looking for another pro to work with. We take a lot of pride in what we do and want to work with like minded individuals.

item.title: Requirements Analyst at Wiland, Inc. (Longmont, CO)
item.description:
Wiland is a leading marketing intelligence company serving many of the nation’s top companies and organizations. We provide solutions to thousands of clients in a wide variety of markets and industries.  We use data and sophisticated analytics to predict marketing behavior. Our custom audiences and insights help organizations grow their business and improve profitability.  We are committed to providing excellent service and products to our Clients.


We are seeking dedicated, high caliber professionals who are smart and energetic, have a positive attitude and take pride in their work.  Currently, we have an opening for a Requirements Analyst.  The Requirements Analyst is the person responsible for the drafting and completion of comprehensive system requirements for selected product development initiatives with approved Business Objectives.  They will work closely with the assigned personnel and other stakeholders as necessary to produce excellent Requirements Documents as called for by our software development process in order to deliver all of the functionality called for in the Business Objectives document.   The Requirements Analyst will assist with answering questions and providing additional instruction during Design, Development and System Testing phases for projects assigned, and will lead User Acceptance and Internal Launch phases for the project, including training.  The primary responsibilities of the Requirements Analyst position include:


Requirements Development:  Lead kickoff meetings, create and draft Requirements documents that are thorough and within scope, provide estimated completion times for various project phases and obtain approval on Requirements documents for assigned projects.  


Approved Requirements Management:  Provide clarification of approved Requirements, assist with efficient resolution of change requests and update documents to reflect approved changes.


User Acceptance:  Draft User Acceptance plans and obtain approvals.  Ensure User Acceptance begins only after completion of comprehensive system testing.  Schedule User Acceptance testing. Assist with documentation and training, and follow up on identified issues.    


Internal Launch:  Develop procedural documentation that specifies how a new capability will be used.  Work with users to develop and deliver comprehensive training.

item.title: GUI Expert on a trading platform-Senior/Lead Technologist | Full Stack | Java | at Fortis Capital Management (New York, NY) (allows remote)
item.description:
Senior/Lead Technologist | Full Stack | Java | Scala | RESTful | JavaScript | CSS | Angular | Bootstrap | CoffeeScript


We are searching for one or more FullStack engineers ideally with real-time FrontEnd Financial Trading System Experience.  Hire should be familiar with development on trading platforms such as www.theice.com; www.livevol.com; www.cmegroup.com; www.trayport.com; GFI Energy match as a few examples.



We have a platform with over 1million lines of code that is not nearly as agile as we need. We will be breaking and building. This is a once in a life time build with compensation to match. Only the absolute strong and dedicated apply please.



This job offers a fantastic opportunity for a Senior Technologist to join s self-funded cutting edge Startup Company in the Financial Derivatives Trading Field. We are working to take an existing and well-respected product, and transform it into a new experience based on state of art technology.


The successful candidate will have the chance to work across numerous cutting edge technologies, have the opportunity to work with Traders and End users to shape front and back end design a workflow and influence the feel of the product.


Looking for an agile, self-starting communicator that requires little supervision, and can help guide and mentor others.


We can likely offer location and work environment flexibility, and a goal oriented compensation package to the right individual.


Ideal Candidate will have experience in some or all of the following:



  • Angular, BootStrap, HTML5, JQuery, Ajax, Java, Scala and RESTful systems, RealTime Grid Controls, Modern GUIBuilder concepts.

  • Real-Time Front End GUI Experience ideally in a Trading application, using newer JavaScript technologies across a RESTful framework.

  • RESTful systems ideally with TypeSafe Play Framework, Scala, or another Java based Framework.

  •  Agile Team Development utilizing Continuous Integration, Git, Jenkins, Maven, Jira, SBT

  • J2EE/Java/Scala/JMS

  • Strong SQL, Hibernate, ORM, or NoSQL skills, familiarity with MySQL, MongoDB.

  • Designing and developing high-volume, low-latency applications for mission-critical systems.

  • Able to Divide tasks into quantifiable subtasks and reasonably predict the effort to complete those sub tasks.

  • Good knowledge of software development principles, coding standards, and design patterns.


Strongly Desired



  • Experience with Trading systems, STP, trade workflow in an Exchange based environment.

  • Real-Time Feed Experience Bloomberg, Reuters, Tibco, MarketView, ...

  • Strong programming, and tuning skills in Java and related technologies.

  •  Experience with RESTful Web Services APIs.

  • Experience configuring, developing, and deploying scalable enterprise applications within web/application frameworks and servers.

  •  Experience in using profiling tools to identify the bottlenecks and performance tuning.

  •  Experience with ORM and Web Frameworks.

  • Demonstrate superior verbal, written, and presentation skills with all levels of staff and leadership.

  • Domain knowledge of Front End development using Bootstrap and Angular JS.

  • • Understanding of Scala programming.

item.title: Sr. Quality Assurance Engineer at American Express (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description:
Were looking for an experienced Sr. Quality Engineer to work on mobile, mobile web, and web applications that will be used by tens of millions of cardholders around the world. We want someone with expert-­level technical skills who is super creative and enjoys solving tough problems. You should be able to come up with brilliant solutions that no one else does.

Youll be part of the Mobile Engineering team, whose mandate is to develop new
products and platforms for American Express customers. Mobile Engineerings aim is to build interactive experiences at all touch points of a consumer's journey
whether it be before, at, or after the time of purchase. The products will range from new payment vehicles and partnerships with other payment entities to interactive mobile experiences.

Youll be working in a fast-­paced, start-­up like environment, but with the stability of working for a Fortune 100 company. Your primary responsibilities will be to
work on a small team of engineers in developing mobile products and proof-­of-concept applications. Youll be expected to work with product managers to help define product direction, provide thought leadership on emerging technologies and create "best of breed" mobile and mobile web experiences that will set the standards for future development. You should be familiar with modern
software development methodologies, and able to dive deep and rapidly iterate on ideas despite ambiguity.

Make no mistake - this is an opportunity to influence how millions of people interact with their cards, merchants, and their money.

Responsibilities:

  • Lead an agile team by driving user story analysis and elaboration, designing, and developing software applications, and testing and building automation tools

  • Create and maintain automated tests running in a continuous integration environment

  • Ensure excellent application usability through careful manual testing

  • Contribute to designing test cases and testing in ongoing sprints

  • Self-­motivated and able to independently learn new technologies

  • Work closely with development team to iteratively test concurrently with feature development

  • Analyze and create end-­point mocks to aid in testing

Offer of employment with American Express is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background verification check, subject to applicable laws and regulations.

Qualifications




  • Experience writing automated tests



  • 5+ years of technical experience in a software development organization with a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Science, preferably Computer Science, Engineering, or other related disciplines)


  • Has exposure to a variety of distributed infrastructure technologies and systems

  • Eagerness to work iteratively and collaboratively to build new software

  • Excellent bi-directional communication skills

  • Deals well with ambiguous/under-defined problems; Able to think abstractly


MG2A

item.title: Senior Software Engineer-Java at American Express (Phoenix, AZ)
item.description:
American Express is embarking on an exciting transformation driven by an energetic new team of high performers. This group is nimble and creative with the power to shape our technology and product roadmap. If you have the talent and desire to deliver innovative payment products and services at a rapid pace, serving our customers seamlessly across physical, digital, mobile, and social media, join our transformation team!

Senior Software Engineers that join our Technologies team can be assigned to one of several exciting teams that are developing new virtual Internet-based payment solutions, customer service portals, online merchant services support and integration, credit management tools, and suites of web-based applications for cardmember targeted offers that will span over 20 international markets.

You will be part of a fast-paced, entrepreneurial team responsible for delivering world-class cardmember experiences across multiple channels, including native iOS, Android, web, social integration, Java services, and APIs. You will be challenged with identifying innovative ideas and proof of concept to deliver against the existing and future needs of our customers.

Responsibilities include:

  • Serving as a core member of an agile team that drives user story analysis and elaboration, designs and develops software applications, and tests and builds automation tools

  • Owning all technical aspects of software development for assigned applications; Performing hands-on architecture, design, and development of systems

  • Performing hands-on software development and testing, typically spending about 50% of time writing code, API specs, conducting code reviews and testing in ongoing sprints, or doing proof of concepts/automation tools

  • Driving consistent development practices - tools and common components; Developing deep understanding of tie-ins with other systems and platforms within the supported domains

  • Working with technical product managers contributing to blueprints, and assisting with annual planning of feature sets

  • Identifying exciting opportunities for adopting new technology to solve existing needs and predicting future challenges

  • Mentoring engineers, and may have management responsibilities over 2-3 engineers

Qualifications


This high energy Senior Engineer must have:

  • 6+ years of software development experience, and preferably a BS or MS degree in computer science, computer engineering, or other technical discipline

  • Demonstrated experience in Agile development, application design, software development, and testing

  • Thorough understanding of XML, JSON , web services technologies, and data structure fundamentals, with experience in multi-threaded programming

  • Experience with Java applications design and development in an Enterprise setting using J2EE, Spring, SQL DBMSs

  • Experience with a broad range of software languages and payments technologies is a plus

  • Expertise in objected oriented analysis and design across a variety of platforms

  • A proven hunger to learn new technologies and translate them into working software

  • Ability to effectively communicate to internal and external business partners on solution design

MG2A

item.title: C# / .Net Web Developer at MakeMusic (Boulder, CO)
item.description:
Join the team that is transforming music technology.


If you are interested in playing a role in the future of music technology then you have come to the right place. At MakeMusic we all share a passion for creating the next best thing in the world of music and we are always searching for great talent. MakeMusic is an industry leader in interactive music learning, notation software and virtual instrument technology.


SmartMusic is award-winning interactive music software that provides a deliberate practice environment for students in band, orchestra, and choir. With a subscription to SmartMusic, students have unlimited access to the world’s largest accompaniment library for all ages and skill levels, which includes thousands of pieces of music.


MakeMusic has an immediate opening in the new Boulder, CO office for a C# / .Net web developer.  You will work in an open and collaborative environment, developing the Learning Management System for teachers and students to exchange information in SmartMusic, working closely with CI and Ops engineers for operational-ready systems, and reducing complexity where necessary. Your job will be to support modifications to the existing system while learning how the system works. In the near term, you will be helping to move our production infrastructure to AWS.  In the long term you will be on the team to consolidate API’s into a single RESTful endpoint, deprecate legacy systems and unnecessary code, and collaborate with SmartMusic desktop engineers on thick client integrations.


What you’ll be doing



  • Work with architectural lead to improve our educator onboarding process workflow

  • Modernize MakeMusic content versioning system to a BLOB storage like S3

  • Implement an automated email queuing system

  • Work with TechOps to implement error monitoring with a tool like Rollbar

  • Develop a simplified SSO system based on product priorities

  • Build integration platform with other partners. That includes either a MakeMusic externally hosted API (WebAPI), or pulling content from externals systems.

  • Enable a shift towards a web based solution, including API consolidation across our product platform (Web, Desktop, and iOS)


Our Stack:



  • C# (SOAP / MVC / ASP.NET / WebForms)

  • Javascript/JQuery

  • SQL Server

  • Jenkins, Mercurial, SubVersion

item.title: Software Quality Assurance - Team Lead and Team Members at FBS (Fargo, ND) (allows remote)

item.title: Java Developer Digital Asset Management at Quotient, Inc. (Washington, DC)
item.description:
Description:


Java Developer – Digital Asset Management



Location:


Washington, DC



Why THIS job?


Your work will be used by hundreds of historians, archivists, researchers, and staff at the Smithsonian Institution who are “preserving our heritage, discovering new knowledge, and sharing our resources with the world.” Your work will affect millions of digital assets images, audio and video.



What Quotient seeks in a Candidate:


Strong ability to think through business use cases, a passion for the end user experience, and an intellectual curiosity to learn new tools and technology.



Why work with Quotient?


An Employee-centric Company with marvelously skilled developers on staff to provide mentoring and ongoing Java and SQL training. A calm and encouraging team spirit that encourages team "think tank" where our team leadership facilitates discussion but does not dominate the conversation in pursuit of our objectives



About this role:


You will be working directly with stakeholders to help them integrate their digital assets and collections data into a Smithsonian-wide Digital Asset Management System. You will be developing and managing custom integration solutions in Java that bring together existing systems, helping the Smithsonian automate the process of connecting its holdings with users and applications inside and outside the Smithsonian.



You will be able to apply your expertise to many interesting technical problems while working with a team of developers, administrators, and subject matter experts.

item.title: Database Administrator at Jonas Fitness (Webster, TX)

POSITION


The Database Administrator will provide conversion support to customers in the health and fitness industry by writing Transact-SQL scripts and stored procedures to convert source data into proprietary Jonas Fitness formats. 


JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Write T-SQL statements to analyze customer data

  • Interface directly with the customer to define mapping specifications based on data analysis

  • Create, debug, and execute T-SQL scripts and stored procedures that match data mapping specifications

  • Perform ETL (extract, transform, load) data imports, exports, and modifications

  • Perform quality assurance and database validation on all test and live conversions

  • Work on assigned tasks as a member of a project team as required

item.title: QA Engineer at Freelancers Union (Kings County, NY)

Other Responsibilities:

  • Financial Planning & Forecasting: Prepare strategic plan, operating, capital and fundraising budgets, and rolling forward forecast.

item.title: Mentor - Android Development at Thinkful (New York, NY) (allows remote)

item.title: Software Engineer Media Processing Team at Cisco Systems (Feltham, UK)
item.description:
Collaboration Infrastructure Technology Group
Cisco is changing the way we work, live, play and learn. If your desire to work with leading-edge technology is matched by your drive to succeed in a highly collaborative, fast paced and global environment the Cisco Development Organization (CDO) is the right opportunity for you. CITG deliver collaboration infrastructure – call control, gateways and conferencing bridges – in a tightly integrated solution, alongside clients and endpoints that together produce an enterprise-grade collaboration experience. 

The Media Products Group
Based in Bedfont Lakes, Feltham, the Media Products Group has become a specialist R&D center for the design and implementation of the most technologically advanced video conferencing infrastructure solutions available in the market today. 
The Agile Development teams in CDO play a crucial role in achieving this and work as part of the R&D organization alongside the hardware and software development engineers. As a member of a scrum team you will play an integral part in the R&D process working on new products and technology throughout the full product development lifecycle (requirements capture, through design and implementation to system testing and integration). Products are designed, for Enterprise and Cloud deployment, from the ground up with test in mind with an emphasis on scalability, performance, interoperability and usability. 

Role & Responsibilities
A successful candidate for this job will be the type of person who can be flexible in playing a developer or tester role in the scrum team. You should be comfortable writing portable, maintainable code and/or automation scripts. You will be expected to deliver significant features on your own as well as work with colleagues in collaborative tasks. You will be called upon to deliver timing estimates for implementation and assess risks involved. You will be working as part of an Agile team, creating unit test and functional automation scripts. You will be working with large and complex existing code bases, and collaborating with teams around the world using the latest technologies and tools, with opportunities for international travel. 

Programming in C/C++ or Python Scripting. 
Involvement in the specification, design and implementation of new products and features. 
Architectural and system design of applications in an embedded or server environment. 
Deliver code, unit test software modules and feature test. 
Test the module on simulated and real hardware in typical customer scenarios as well as automated stress and scale scenarios. 
Contribute to test automation at unit, integration, feature and system level. 
Maintain the quality of the software, fix defects and regression test the fixes on available releases. 
Plan, design and improve the automated test tool system; write, deliver and maintain tests for the toolset.

item.title: Cyber Developer / Software Engineer at Communications Security Establishment Canada (Ottawa, ON, Canada)
item.description:
CSEC is currently looking for Cyber Developers / Software Engineers to fill several indeterminate positions at the junior, intermediate and senior levels. The incumbents work in a fully matrixed operational environment to deliver software solutions for clients. As CSEC is the only Canadian authority in the field of Cyber Defence, the challenges you will faced are unique and will be commensurate with your ability to demonstrate ingenuity and flexibility in various fields of expertise, such as:
• Operating system level development
• Networking protocols
• Computer and network security
• Vulnerability analysis

Key activities:
• Gather and analyze client requirements.
• Conceiving, proposing, designing and building software projects in support of the R&D work being done in order to develop cyber tools and techniques.
• Analyzing software and communications protocols of computer and telecommunications products to determine the product architecture and security vulnerabilities.
• Researching computer security vulnerabilities.
• Develop test plans and test software applications for research and development in CSEC technologies and for operational deployment throughout the entire systems life cycle.
• Document software applications and produce project and activity status reports.
• Maintain software applications after migration to production, including troubleshooting and recommending/implementing improvements.
• Collaborate with 2nd Parties and other CSEC elements to ensure a compatible environment that promotes exchange of software applications and components.
• Advise on the capabilities of software systems, including providing technical support and advice to other CSEC areas, Government of Canada departments and agencies or allied agencies.
• Lead teams & manage projects, as required.

Salary Range: (Salary range upon hire will be determined based on the level of competency demonstrated during the selection process):

UNI-07 level:  $70,105.00 - $82,475.00 per year
UNI-08 level:  $74,823.00 - $88,029.00 per year
UNI-09 level:  $80,264.00 - $94,426.00 per year

These positions are currently eligible for a market allowance ranging from $7,557 to $10,933 annually.

Le CSTC cherche actuellement des candidats pour doter plusieurs postes de cyberdéveloppeurs et d’ingénieurs en logiciel à tous les niveaux (subalterne, intermédiaire et supérieur). Le titulaire travaillera dans un environnement opérationnel entièrement organisé et fournira des solutions logicielles pour les clients. Puisque le CSTC est l’autorité canadienne dans le domaine de la cyberdéfense, les défis que le titulaire devra relever sont uniques et correspondront à son niveau d’ingéniosité et de souplesse dans divers domaines de spécialité, comme:
• le développement au niveau du système d’exploitation;
• les protocoles de réseautage;
• la sécurité informatique et de réseau;
• l’analyse des vulnérabilités.

Activités principales :
• Rassembler et analyser les besoins des clients.
• Concevoir, proposer, programmer et élaborer des projets logiciels à l’appui des activités de recherche et de développement menées pour développer des outils et des techniques liés à la cybersécurité.
• Analyser les logiciels et les protocoles de communication de produits informatiques et de produits de télécommunications pour déterminer l’architecture du produit et les vulnérabilités de sécurité.
• Mener des recherches sur les vulnérabilités de sécurité informatique.
• Élaborer des plans et des applications logicielles de test pour mener des activités de recherche et de développement liées aux technologies du CSTC et pour assurer le déploiement opérationnel de ces systèmes tout au long de leur cycle de vie.
• Rédiger des documents sur les applications logicielles et produire des rapports d’état de projet et d’activité.
• Assurer la maintenance des applications logicielles après leur mise en production, y compris le dépannage, et recommander et mettre en œuvre des améliorations.
• Collaborer avec les organismes de seconde part et d’autres éléments du CSTC pour assurer le maintien d’un environnement compatible qui favorise l’échange d’applications et de composants logiciels.
• Donner des conseils sur les capacités des systèmes logiciels, ce qui comprend la prestation de soutien technique et de conseils à d’autres secteurs du CSTC, à d’autres ministères et organismes du gouvernement ou aux organismes alliés.   
• Diriger des équipes et gérer des projets, au besoin.

Échelle salariale :  
(Elle est établie lors de l’embauche en fonction du niveau de compétence démontré par les candidats au cours du processus de sélection)
UNI-07 : de 70 105,00 $ à 82 475,00 $ par année
UNI-08 : de 74 823,00 $ à 88 029,00 $ par année
UNI-09 : de 80 264,00 $ à 94 426,00 $ par année

Ces postes sont admissibles à une indemnité en fonction du marché qui varie de 7 557 $ à 10 933 $ par année (voir remarques).

item.title: Senior Software Engineer (C++, Mac, Unix) at comScore (Reston, VA)
item.description:
comScore is looking for people who love to code. We need people who want to sink their teeth into an issue to understand it and push the limits on what is possible. The Internet is a dynamic environment and we constantly need new solutions for problems that no one has ever considered before.



This job is primarily design and development on a client based OS X application using C++. We dig deep into the OS, network protocols, and other applications to understand how they work so we can find the ultimate solution. Creativity and innovation are required. We are looking for senior people who never want to stop honing their skills since stagnation is death.

What you'll do:



  • Participate in the design and development of new components

  • Develop components that will run on millions of computers

  • Develop enhancements to current solutions

  • Research OS X, application and network protocol internals

  • Participate in research and evaluation of new related technologies

item.title: Microsoft .Net professional at Capgemini (Utrecht, Netherlands)
item.description:
Microsoft .Net professional

Microsoft .Net Specialist
Utrecht, fulltime

Zie jij jezelf als (toekomstig) architect, projectleider of top-developer en is Microsoft .NET jouw passie? Heb je ervaring in software-ontwikkeling op het Microsoft platform en wil je dit ontplooien naar topniveau? Bij Capgemini bieden we je de mogelijkheid waarin je alle ruimte krijgt deze ambitie waar te maken. Bij Capgemini werk je in teams waarbij je niet alleen je eigen talenten en vaardigheden ontwikkelt, maar waarbij je ook elkaar helpt groeien. Leren van elkaars ervaringen is essentieel voor wederzijdse groei en optimaal resultaat. Het is vooral belangrijk dat je ambitie hebt om verder te groeien.

Jouw rol
Als Microsoft .NET professional sta je in de frontlinie als het gaat om innovatieve projecten en het toepassen van nieuwe technologieën. Je werkt aan uitdagende projecten in complexe omgevingen, zowel nationaal als internationaal. Mogelijke rollen zijn .NET developer, architect of specialist op het gebied van een bepaald Microsoft product zoals bijvoorbeeld SharePoint, BizTalk, CRM of Commerce Server. Een meer coördinerende rol bij projecten waarvan een deel van het werk in India wordt uitgevoerd is ook mogelijk.

Wat kun je bij ons verwachten
Het werken bij een topspeler op jouw vakgebied. De Academy staat garant voor het bieden van zowel vakinhoudelijke opleidingen als trainingen op het gebied van persoonlijke vaardigheden. Capgemini is toonaangevend op het gebied van .NET certificeringen. Alles stellen we in het werk om jouw talenten volledig te ontplooien. Daarnaast werk je bij Capgemini in een informele, persoonlijke omgeving waarin je alle vrijheid krijgt om zelf vorm en richting te geven aan je eigen carrière.

item.title: Senior Data Scientist General at Booking.com (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
Booking.com is looking for data savvy professionals to join our team of data scientists. You will be working with stakeholders throughout the company to generate understanding, strategy and suggest actions based on data. As a senior data scientist you will be hands on, but also be expected to take on coaching of more junior co-workers and some management responsibilities. If you consider yourself to be that unique hybrid of data hacker, business analyst, communicator and mentor that maintains a strong customer focus and values pragmatism over perfection, then we’d like to hear from you.


There are several data science teams within Booking.com each consisting of 3-8 people. All of these teams have their own scope within the business; we have Data Scientists focusing on the front end of our website, content of the pages, demands of our products, customer satisfaction and loyalty. Every team takes full responsibility for all data analysis within their area; however there is also considerable collaboration amongst teams. We often align on business goals, learn from each other and socialize after work almost every Friday.


B.responsible



  • Transform large, complex datasets into pragmatic, actionable insights.  

  • Leverage data to identify, quantify and influence tangible business gain.

  • Ability to see beyond the numbers, be the voice of data when communicating to decision makers, product owners and team leaders.

  • Have the capacity to thrive in our fast-paced environment, adapt quickly and take ownership of your work.

  • Challenge ideas and methods while working together with talented, highly skilled team members.

item.title: Java Software Developer at Capgemini (Utrecht, Netherlands)
item.description:
Java Software Developer

Ben jij een gedreven en ondernemende Java specialist met de ambitie om omvangrijke projecten succesvol af te ronden? Wil jij alles uit jezelf halen in een omgeving met vakbekwame professionals? En ben jij op zoek naar een werkgever waar je werkt op uitdagende opdrachten voor grote organisaties? Lees dan verder voor de functie van

Java Software Developer
Utrecht, fulltime

Jouw rol
Brug slaan tussen ICT en de business van grote klanten
Als Java Software Developer geef je advies aan klanten over en werk je mee aan de ontwikkeling van software in Java technologie. Je bent in staat om de behoefte bij klanten aan gestroomlijnde processen en flexibele informatievoorziening te vertalen naar oplossingen gebaseerd op leidende Java technologie zoals JEE, Spring Framework, etc.
Binnen opdrachten sla je een brug tussen hoogwaardige technologie en de specifieke behoefte van nationale en internationale organisaties. Je bent (mede) verantwoordelijk voor tijdige oplevering van projecten binnen budget en volgens de vanuit de klant gestelde normen. Met jouw sterke persoonlijkheid en technisch inhoudelijke kennis weet jij zowel de klant als collega’s te winnen voor jouw ideeën. Hierbij maak je optimaal gebruik van je gevoel voor business bij klanten waarvoor opdrachten worden uitgevoerd. Ook weet je bestaande opdrachten verder uit te bouwen en heb je oog voor nieuwe kansen bij opdrachtgevers.

Wat kun je bij ons verwachten
Jezelf verder ontwikkelen in een kennisomgeving
Bij Capgemini is het delen van kennis een van de belangrijkste speerpunten. We organiseren regelmatig events waar je kennis maakt met de nieuwste technieken en waar je de belangrijkste ontwikkelingen deelt met collega’s. Ook internationale online communities waar Capgemini medewerkers discussiëren over methoden, ontwikkelingen, projecten en al het andere wat je interessant vindt, worden veelvuldig gebruikt. Capgemini biedt je bovendien de mogelijkheid jezelf verder te ontwikkelen aan de Capgemini University, waar je bijvoorbeeld aanvullende certificaten op jouw vakgebied kunt halen.

Daarnaast bieden we een uitstekend arbeidsvoorwaardenpakket met onder andere:
• een vast contract met uitstekende faciliteiten voor flexibel werken waaronder een laptop en telefoon;
• een vaste eindejaarsuitkering aangevuld met tantièmes, bepaald op basis van behaalde resultaten;
• premievrij pensioen;
• een geheel naar eigen keuze te besteden mobiliteitsvergoeding;
• en 26 vakantiedagen met de mogelijkheid extra dagen bij te kopen.

We provide specialist software to allow secure access to confidential documents as well as the ability to safely share them with third parties beyond company firewalls. Confidential business processes such as commercial real estate sales, mergers & acquisitions or Executive Board Communication are handled securely, transparently and efficiently with Drooms.


Customers include the world's leading real estate companies, consultancies, law firms and corporations such as Metro Group, Evonik, Morgan Stanley, JLL, JP Morgan, CBRE, Heuking and UBS.


We are looking for excellent


C++ DEVELOPERS (F/M)


with deep domain knowledge and plenty of hands-on experience to join us. Beyond the required technical ability, we are looking for individuals with a "just do it" attitude, a passion for building awesome stuff and a desire to disrupt industries.


What you’ll be doing



  • Be involved in projects requiring development of core software components for the Drooms platform



  • Developing innovative, complex and high-performance stand-alone, mobile, client, server and web-based applications



  • Working on complex IT architectures based on web-based and service-oriented architecture concepts



  • Work closely with developers, testers and product managers



  • Ownership of code and maintaining platform functionality and availability

item.title: iOS and Android Engineer (Multiple Levels & Positions) at GrabTaxi (Petaling Jaya, Malaysia)

GrabTaxi is an automated smartphone based booking and dispatch platform for the taxi industry in South East Asia. GrabTaxi aims to introduce simple, cost effective mobile-based technology to both the supply (dispatch companies) and demand (passenger) sides of the distribution chain. With this technology, GrabTaxi hopes to optimize the matching process between taxi fleets and passengers.


We believe GrabTaxi is uniquely positioned to capture these market opportunities as we are using leading edge technology to develop a more cost effective and functional solution than other available alternatives.


Responsibilities:



  • Technical design, coding and unit testing.

  • Producing detailed specifications and writing the program codes.

  • Understanding of embedded development constraints

item.title: Engineering Manager, Backend Data Tier at New Relic (Portland, OR)
item.description:
New Relic
Engineering Manager, Backend Data Tier
Portland, OR

Are you a technically deep engineering manager, with a background in building high-performance services? Do you daydream about distributed server architectures and thrive on coordinating agile, cross-team projects? Does the idea of pitching in as a hands-on contributor to implement systems that handle more bytes per second than Twitter seem exciting? If so, then we’d like to hear from you!

We’re looking for a hands-on manager to lead one of the backend teams that designs, implements, and operates the underlying data ingestion, storage and query services that make New Relic go. We accept a stupendous amount of data from applications, servers, mobile devices and browsers every minute of every day, and there is more each day than the day before.

In addition to helping guide our technical decisions; you’ll also be an active personnel manager, guiding the career development of your team, and an entrepreneurial project manager, coordinating cross-team efforts to deliver great products. If you’re a command-and-control supervisor, or want to focus on technology at the expense of projects and people, this is not the right place for you. If you’ve been a software engineer yourself, love coaching a team to bring out the best in everyone, and want to build tools that delight other developers, we might be a perfect fit.

You’ll be our ideal candidate for this position if you have:



  • At least 3 years of technical team and project management experience

  • Expertise with hands-on development in either Java or C/C++

  • A history of building complex, high-throughput backend systems

  • Experience managing, and participating in, an on-call rotation

  • Experience working in a startup, or startup-like setting


In your cover letter, tell us about your management philosophy and give examples of your role in delivering software with a team. And, of course, we want to hear why you might be particularly interested in New Relic.

A little about us:

New Relic is a software analytics company that, on behalf of our customers, makes sense of billions of metrics about millions of applications, all in real time. Our comprehensive SaaS-based solution for web and mobile applications consolidates the performance monitoring data into a single, powerful interface. Our 90,000 customers use New Relic every day to optimize more than three million applications.

New Relic is a San Francisco Best Places to Work award winner, an Oregon “Top Workplace” award winner, named a leader in the Gartner’s 2013 & 2014 “Magic Quadrant” for APM companies, a Top 100 OnDemand Company, Best of SaaS (THINKStrategies), Top 100 Coolest Cloud Computing (CRN); 10 Cloud Management Companies to Watch (NetworkWorld) – the list of accolades goes on. More important than all of that: we provide challenging work, opportunities to learn, high quality teammates, a standard-setting product, and a company on the move.

Our office is in the tech mecca of Portland, with easy commute access and a plethora of good eats and great coffee. We provide competitive compensation including stock options and big-company benefits (medical, dental, etc.)—all while maintaining the energy, agility and fun of a start-up. We can help with relocation and are open to H1-B transfers.

New Relic is most decidedly an equal opportunity employer. We eagerly seek applicants of diverse background and hire without regard to race, color, gender, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, individuals with disabilities, age, sexual orientation, protected veterans, or any other characteristic protected by law. Note: Our stewardship of the data of many thousands of customers means that a criminal background check is required to join New Relic.

To get started, click on the link below.



Apply Here



PI87731144

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Platform at PagerDuty (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
At PagerDuty, were building an alerting and incident tracking system to help IT operations groups detect and respond to issues. Start-ups, Fortune 100 companies, and everything in between rely on us to alert them quickly when they have operational troubles. Weve got interesting technical problems in spades, but were still very much a start-up. We want people who are passionate about building good products, designing great systems, adding 9's to up-times, and mentoring other developers.

We are looking for a stellar Software Engineer that understands the importance of best software practices codified into high quality libraries and services and how it can improve up-time, and how to increase engineering speed.

Responsibilities:

You are passionate about writing high quality software that helps other engineers build great products. You are a force magnifier and understand that the goal of abstraction is to make the right thing the easy thing to do. You get excited about having other engineers as customers and helping them.

  • Joining a new team whose purpose is to own and innovate on central pieces of critical infrastructure like shared libraries and components.
  • Working with other Sr. Engineers to help architect and design new reliable and robust systems that engineers actually want to use.
  • Building and maintaining core libraries used by engineers on all teams.
  • Helping set the direction of our Service Oriented Architecture and figuring out what components we need to build.
  • Helping engineering teams across the company integrate their tests into our end to end functional testing infrastructure.
  • Participating in the hiring process and mentoring junior engineers.

Requirements:

  • Youve designed and implemented distributed and highly available systems. Youve had experience with different system architectures, and have opinions about what works and what doesnt. Concepts like consistency, availability, real­-time dispatching, and distributed queuing arent merely buzzwords for you.
  • Passionate about writing well documented, high quality idiomatic code.
  • As a polyglot, youre comfortable learning new tools and programming languages.
  • Your above-average written and verbal communication skills provide comfort in discussing the pros and cons of various solutions to a problem.
  • You have a broad background in Computer Science fundamentals backed by years of experience in designing, developing, and debugging software.

Desired Skills:

  • You know about CAP, but also know that it is very easy to misinterpret. The world isnt as black­ and ­white as the one in the theorem.
  • You know how to make the appropriate tradeoffs when designing a system, and that the right choice will often differ based on requirements, not on dogma.

Our Environment:

  • We dont hire based on experience with a handful of tools. Instead, we want smart, capable, and experienced people who can learn our tools quickly (and suggest new ones!) as needed. Experience with our stack is just a bonus.

Some technology you may encounter and work with here:

  • Scala
  • Finagle
  • Ruby / Rails
  • MySQL
  • Cassandra
  • Zookeeper
  • Percona Xtradb Cluster
  • Linux (Ubuntu)
  • Amazon AWS (EC2, EBS, S3)
  • HAProxy, NGinx
  • Postfix

Sweet Benefits

  • Enough money to pay your bills and buy cool stuff
  • Dental and Vision coverage
  • 3 weeks paid time off your first year, 4 weeks afterwards
  • Catered lunch, EVERY DAY
  • Snacks and a beer fridge along with occasional foosball matches!

item.title: Senior Wearables & Mobile Developer at VitalMedicals (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Do you want to work with some of the most exciting emerging technology, to really make a difference?


Break new ground building software for Google Glass and mobile platforms that will empower surgeons and their teams, and ultimately enable the Smart Hospital of the future.


You'll join the core team as one of our startup's first employees, together with two technical co-founders, so you'll have a big part to play in how this company and technology gets built. We've just closed our seed funding round and we're in StartX accelerator's Fall '14 class, so this is an amazing time to jump in now that we have momentum and will be growing quickly.


You'll be involved in all aspects of design and development of a software platform for Google Glass and other Smart Glasses, as well as Android and iOS mobile devices. We integrate many data sources -- vital signs, x-rays, medical records, and more and make those data sources mobile and shareable. Together with voice and text communications and streaming video of the user's point of view, the platform allows incredibly powerful collaboration in environments where that's never been possible.


We are also working with a major aerospace company to apply our technology for satellite construction engineers.

item.title: Senior Software Development Project Manager at Quorum Review IRB (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Quorum Review is a leading Independent Review Board (IRB) operating in the US and Canada.  Our review of clinical research information ensures the safety and well-being of people participating in clinical trials and we strive to provide researchers with services that are always accurate, expedient, fully compliant, and easy to navigate.  We are passionate about service and about the role that technology plays in supporting a customer focus that has grown our business. 


Description: We are a growing organization and the Senior Software Development Project Manager plays a key role in leading multiple concurrent projects to completion and delivering high quality business solutions on time and within budget. The ideal candidate will follow a project management methodology to initiate, plan, execute, control and close out projects. 


You will have the opportunity to work on small, medium or large projects and cover a wide range of solutions including, but not limited to, software development, package implementation, application integration and business process improvement.  Your motivational leadership skills will be highly valued for managing cross-departmental project teams and activities.  The ability to effectively measure success through the development of metrics and reports as well as present the results to Senior Management will be key. 
 
The ideal candidate will have a Bachelors Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems or Business/Economics or an Associates degree and equivalent work experience. 


At least 10 years of project management experience is required as well as proven experience managing full system implementations and web-based software development projects utilizing .NET and SQL, expert level experience with Microsoft Project, expertise in SDLC methodologies, and familiarity with project related documents such as project charters, project plans, requirements specifications, test plans and implementation plans, etc.   


Our top candidate will also have strong communication skills, analytical and problem solving skills, the ability to interact with all levels within the company while applying good customer service skills and the ability to prioritize multiple concurrent projects.
 
Quorum’s workplace environment offers an informal office environment, open door policy, and strong mentorship from existing staff and management.
 
Our office is in downtown Seattle with customers across North America. Quorum offers competitive pay and benefits for this position. 
 
Quorum Review is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. To request reasonable accommodation for the application process please contact Human Resources.

item.title: Full Stack Engineer at Imgur (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
overview 


We're looking for strong full-stack engineers to focus on tasks involving both frontend and backend. You should have a passion for creating elegant, responsive web interfaces that will be used by millions of people. You'll be creating new features and improving existing features to support our growing community. 


the role

item.title: Senior Linux Systems Administrator at Real Estate Webmasters Inc (Nanaimo, BC, Canada)
item.description:
We are Real Estate Webmasters, the world's leading real estate website company, located in beautiful Nanaimo, BC. We’re on the hunt for a Senior Linux Systems Administrator who will be responsible for day-to-day administration and on-call duty. REW has 100+ staff, and we plan to double in the next 12-18 months with your help! We hire awesome people--if you are AWESOME (& completely qualified), read on. 


What do we need you to bring to the table? As a Senior Linux Systems Administrator, you’ll be responsible for managing a private cloud-based web hosting solution and legacy-managed dedicated servers hosted in Texas. In short, REW needs an expert Linux Administrator who can run a command line, build monitoring and reporting tools, and streamline email configuration.


Down to the nitty-gritty. We are looking for a candidate with 3-5 years of experience as a system administrator who have expertise in the following:


A taste of what you'll be doing:



  • Establishes Web system specifications by analyzing access, information, and security requirements; designing system infrastructure.

  • Establishes Web system by planning and executing the selection, installation, configuration, and testing of server hardware, software, and operating and system management systems; defining system and operational policies and procedures.

  • Maintains Web system performance by performing system monitoring and analysis, and performance tuning; troubleshooting system hardware, software, and operating and system management systems; designing and running system load/stress testing; escalating application problems to vendor.

  • Secures Web system by developing system access, monitoring, control, and evaluation; establishing and testing disaster recovery policies and procedures; completing back-ups; maintaining documentation.

  • Upgrades Web system by conferring with vendors and services; developing, testing, evaluating, and installing enhancements and new software.

  • Meets financial requirements by submitting information for budgets; monitoring expenses.

  • Updates job knowledge by tracking emerging Internet technologies; participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks; participating in professional organizations.

  • Accomplishes organization goals by accepting ownership for accomplishing new and different requests; exploring opportunities to add value to job accomplishments.

item.title: Software Developer (Front-end or Back-end) at Beansprock (Boston, MA)
item.description:
What makes Beansprock so good?


Many people take a job because the role allows them to use their skills.  Others take a job because they admire the company and believe in the problem it’s solving.  Users on Beansprock know their next job will have both.  Beansprock has developed artificial intelligence to search all around Boston for your best role and company. http://www.beansprock.com/ 


Unlike current search tools that only allow you to find jobs by job title and location, Beansprock takes it to the next level - What are the skills you'll use and learn? What does the company do? What is the culture like? Salary? Commute time? Beansprock tells our users exactly why a specific job matches his preferences.  Furthermore, with Beansprock, no longer is it necessary to waste hours and hours browsing job openings and reading job descriptions. Beansprock evaluates the thousands of relevant job openings posted every day and delivers only the best one to you in a daily email.


Mission matters


Only a quarter of professionals are truly engaged in their jobs.  Choosing your next job is one of the most important decisions you will make.  Please only apply if you believe in our mission of helping people find and attain their best jobs. http://www.beansprock.com/


Who we are & who we're seeking


We are a small team from MIT based near South Station looking to add developers with either front-end or back-end expertise.

A Java Architect is expected to collaborate easily and effectively with creative and experience design team leads to ensure a successful technology designs and implementations of solutions for clients.

Quantum StorNext is a family of appliances that provides the infrastructure behind Scale Out Storage. With our launch of 11 new products and receiving 5 new awards last year, we are continuing our growth and success with MINT, a centralized managing and monitoring toolkit for enterprise customers. Under this umbrella, multiple large projects are planned over the next few years so we have an incredible opportunity for well-rounded web developers to have significant impact to this next generation of appliances. Imagine being on the top end of the performance spectrum, pushing hardware, software and servers to optimum scale and speed. Software Skills:

Attitude Skills:

-  Has a habit of setting goals and exceeding them.

item.title: Junior Ruby on Rails Developer at Forever, Inc. (Pittsburgh, PA)
item.description:
The Junior Ruby on Rails Application Developer at Forever, Inc. will be responsible for the development and design of web applications and components for external customer facing products using Ruby on Rails.  The developer will design, develop, test and deliver web sites, applications and components.  Enhancements and defect resolution will be required on an ongoing basis.  Best practices and design methods will be utilized to insure the success of the projects. The developer will have the ability to create web applications and components from the requirements stage, through design, through production deployment.  They will be required to have experience in software programming as well as development involving compatibility and seamless integration with various technologies in addition to Ruby on Rails such as, but not limited to, HTML5, Java, JavaScript, PHP, Python, Apache Tomcat, Perl, Flash and CSS.  Some experience with a Ruby on Rails application is required.  The developer will solicit and incorporate feedback from customers, development team members, and FOREVER.com team members.


Flexibility, adaptability and the ability to learn quickly in various technical and creative environments, while delivering quality work by tight deadlines, are key attributes of this individual.

item.title: Software Engineer / Architect for fast growing SaaS company at S5 Stratos Inc (Dallas, TX)
item.description:
About S5 Stratos


At S5, we are building Supply Chain and Planning Systems for the Millennials - Systems that are Beautiful, Simple and Fun with unparalleled and sophisticated analytics & planning algorithms. S5 Apps are grounds up pure bred cloud software that are comprehensive and span the entire spectrum of Analytics, Planning and Reporting.

item.title: Bioinformatics specialist with NGS experience looking to change the world... at Stirplate.io (New York, NY)
item.description:
We are looking for a bioinformatics wiz who wants to help the poor unfortunate biologists who don’t know what multi-core processing means. At Stirplate.io, we are building automated tools that make NGS data processing (alignment through statistics and interpretation) ultra simple. You would be working directly with a web developer to make a new, easy and simple way for biologists to run their NGS data. 


You will use a variety of open source tools, such as the Tuxedo suite, R,  Star and many more to build fully automated pipelines. Ideally, you have an interest in building your own as well, imagine being able to just sit and program without having an annoying post-doc asking for their data!


We have cool tech, really awesome science across every biological field, and are doing something that most people think is impossible. Come join us!

item.title: Web App Lead Software Engineer at Net2TV Inc (Redwood City, CA)

As the lead engineer for this Web Application you will be expected to work closely with our existing internal publishing team and external customers to determine feature sets, make UI/UX descisions, and develop both the front-end and server-side parts of the application.


The Net2TV engineering team is a small team of developers with many years of experience developing video and television-related products at companies such as Netflix, TiVo, ReplayTV, OnLive and Sony. You will also be expected to contribute at various times to other parts of the Net2TV software stack, developing back-end and front-end code, and recommending new features that enhance our service.

item.title: Full Stack Software Developer at Intelliware Development Inc. (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Intelliware is looking for full stack software developers to join our dev team. If you’re looking to work on everything from front-end to server-side code and database architecture, we’d love to hear from you.


At Intelliware you’ll have the opportunity to be part of a top-notch team and work on a wide range of complex projects. We have a unique team-based Agile environment with collaborative project rooms where you’ll find continuous learning opportunities and challenging work. Project teams work closely with client subject matter experts, end users and IT teams to deliver anything from proof-of-concept prototypes to bulletproof, long living, high volume production applications.


While working within a team in an Agile environment, you will be:



  • Designing high quality applications that are highly scalable and extensible

  • Estimating, tasking and prototyping

  • Contributing clear and maintainable code to a shared codebase

  • Collaborating with cross-functional team members on features, design and implementation

  • Investigating, learning and applying new technologies/processes

  • Clarifying requirements with team and client representatives



Intelliware’s niche is delivering mission critical software applications for complex business or technical challenges. The nature of our work allows project teams the opportunity to work with a wide variety of technologies although our core development is in Java and JavaScript. Recent projects we’ve delivered include technologies such as: AngularJS, jQuery, Meteor, Node.js, MongoDB, Apache Wicket, Spring Batch, Spring Data JPA and Hibernate.

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer - Full Stack Web Application Development at Udemy (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Senior Software Engineer - Web Application Development

ABOUT UDEMY

Udemy is the global marketplace for online learning and teaching, offering people everywhere the opportunity to advance careers, change professions, develop personal passions, or simply learn something new. Our team is dedicated to helping individuals and companies master the skills they need to compete and thrive in the new global economy.

As part of our commitment to our mission, Udemys Social Innovation program helps nonprofits and global NGOs scale their impact by providing them with tools to teach and learn online.

Founded in 2010, privately-held Udemy has raised a total of $48 million in venture capital and is headquartered in San Francisco, California.

JOB DESCRIPTION

  • Build robust and scalable software systems to support high traffic website.

  • While having expertise in specific areas, the job may require enhancing code up and down the software stack

  • Function as a technical lead for various projects/tasks as needed. This may involve some project planning, resource planning, and deployment planning in additional to his/her current software engineering responsibilities

  • We practice agile development methodologies with two week sprints.

  • Mentor junior engineers to become proficient developers using best software development practices and processes

  • Lead by example and contribute to a team culture that values quality, robustness, and scalability while fostering initiatives and innovation.

  • Continue to research and evaluate new technologies that may improve performance and elegance of our software implementation

Technologies currently in use:

  • PHP, Python, Django (experience with Python/Djando a big plus)

  • Javascript, JQuery, AngularJS, RequireJS

  • MySQL, Solr, Mahout, Redis

  • Jenkins, Selenium

  • Git, Github

  • Datadog, Mixpanel, Newrelic

  • Akamai, CloudFlare

  • AWS

  • Apache, Nginx

Qualifications:

  • Shown success as an individual contributor. Have consistently demonstrated ability and commitment to deliver major initiatives from beginning to full deployment in a timely manner.

  • Embrace good development practices including design specification, coding standards, unit testing, and code reviews.

  • Exhibited passion for delivering high quality products that meet business requirements

  • Demonstrated knowledge of well known software technologies and services and curiosity to continue to evaluate new technologies to strengthen our platform.

  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively within a team and with cross-functional technical and business teams.

  • Demonstrated ability to solve time-critical problems

  • Exhibited passion for mentoring and contributing to the development of others through code reviews, tech talks, or personal coaching.

  • Willingness to "go the extra mile" when needed.

How to Apply:

Join our team! If you're interested, e-mail us with your resume and an explanation of why you'd be a good fit we look forward to hearing from you.
