item.title: Software Engineer - Full Stack Web Development at Udemy (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Full Stack Web Development

ABOUT UDEMY

You can learn anything on Udemy.

Today, over 5 million students in 190+ countries are taking online courses on Programming, Yoga, Design, Photography, Spanish, Marketing, Guitar, Finance, Cake Decorating, and so much more.

More than 22,000 courses (in 40+ different languages!) have been published in our marketplace. Each course is designed and taught by an expert instructor and hundreds of new courses are published every month. So whether you want to advance your career, change professions, develop your personal passions or simply learn something new, Udemy is here to help you achieve your goals.

Founded in 2010, Udemy has raised a total of $48 million in venture capital and is headquartered in San Francisco, California.

Position Description:

  • Build robust and scalable software systems to support high traffic website.

  • Require enhancing code up and down the software stack

  • Practice agile development methodologies with two week sprints.

  • Use best software development practices and processes including unit testing, code reviews, and site monitoring post deployment

  • Contribute to a team culture that values quality, robustness, and scalability while fostering initiatives and innovation.

  • Continue to research and evaluate new technologies that may improve performance and elegance of our software implementation

Experience in the following areas preferred :

  • PHP, Python, Django

  • Javascript, JQuery, AngularJS, RequireJS

  • MySQL, Redis, Memcache

  • Git, Github

  • Rest API

  • Design patterns

Qualifications:

  • Shown success as an individual contributor. Have consistently demonstrated ability and commitment to deliver major initiatives from beginning to full deployment in a timely manner.

  • Embrace good development practices including design specification, coding standards, unit testing, and code reviews.

  • Exhibited passion for delivering high quality products that meet business requirements

  • Demonstrated knowledge of well known web development technologies and services and curiosity to continue to evaluate new technologies to strengthen our platform.

  • Experience building high-traffic, scalable websites used by 2-3 million customers

  • Demonstrated ability to work effectively within a team and with cross-functional technical and business teams.

  • Demonstrated ability to solve time-critical problems

  • Exhibited passion for learning and contributing to the development of others through code reviews, tech talks, or personal coaching.

  • Willingness to "go the extra mile" when needed.

WORK STRUCTURE & COMPENSATION

Udemy is based in SOMA, San Francisco. Compensation includes full time base and equity and competitive benefits (including healthcare, commuter benefits, an unlimited vacation policy, and company-sponsored volunteer opportunities).

item.title: Sr. Software Development Engineer in Test at Rapid7 (El Segundo, CA)
item.description:
Rapid7 is looking for a Software Development Engineer in Test to join the engineering team in our offices in El Segundo, CA. This team is focused on expanding Rapid7’s existing products and creating new product lines. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record of shipping enterprise-class software to a large installed customer base.


Candidates must be able to quickly ramp up, learn our product suite and immediately set to transforming product stories into a functional test suite developed in Cucumber, specifically identifying key high risk quality targets. Prior experience in the security, networking and/or data analytics space is a plus. Candidates must have the ability to quickly grasp Rapid7’s current product designs, become proficient with Rapid7’s products, and become knowledgeable in company tools and technologies. This is an extremely hands-on, technical role.


Using our current suite of framework tools, along with introducing appropriate new solutions to creatively build a world class verification automation framework, we expect out-of-the-box thinking from candidates as with all engineers. This SDET is a key member of the core Engineering team and will be responsible for creating a reliable, scalable test toolset approach for assigned product coverage, as well as contributing to the improvement of our release framework. The ideal candidate has a solid track record of day-to-day test automation framework development in Ruby or similar and contributing on verification strategy and risk mitigation improvements.

item.title: PHP/Python Developer at SiteCompli LLC (New York, NY)
item.description:
SiteCompli is looking for a talented Software Developer/Programmer who will have a key stake in building new products and features for an award winning, innovative software engineering company in the Commercial Real Estate business. Our product suite makes NYC real estate compliance easy to navigate for the largest building owners and property managers in the world.


We need someone who is passionate about back-end development.  You’ll be working with complex data models, Amazon Web Services and using test-driven design to shape and create critical new infrastructure and platforms.  


As a Software Developer, you will work in the full spectrum of the stack.  You’ll be working on PHP, MySQL, Apache and will need to know your way around a Linux box.  You’ll even work on some Python, NoSQL, Message Queuing and other terrific technology.  You’ll bring new ideas to the table, champion new processes and technologies, learn new stuff and most importantly – have a great time doing it.


Day to Day:



  • Use technology practices and tools that you are passionate about to build great ideas for our business.

  • Learn about new technology and practices that will help grow your career and improve our client experience.

  • Challenged with the task of building innovative solutions to large, complex issues with big government data.

  • Build out new functionality within our successful products, improving existing features and smashing the occasional bug.

  • Perform unit testing.

  • Work exclusively on the LAMP stack (PHP and a bit of Python), message queuing systems, large-scale MySQL/PostgreSQL databases and in-house RESTful APIs.

  • Be immersed in the full SDLC process using Agile/Scrum methods.

item.title: MySQL/PHP Web Developer at ShoppersChoice.com (Baton Rouge, LA)
item.description:
ShoppersChoice.com has an exciting opportunity for a highly motivated, results-oriented MySQL/PHP Web Developer to become a long-term member of their successful family in Baton Rouge. 


As part of a team of 6 developers with more growth to come, you'll be be responsible for back end coding changes to e-commerce websites, as well as internal database-driven business applications.


To be considered for this role, you will possess a Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science/ISDS/Technology or similar, as well as familiarity with object-orientated programming concepts and MVC architecture . Ideally, you will have a few years experience in a similar role and environment and while not essential, PHP 5 experience will be highly valued.


In addition, you will be familiar with the following:



  • MS Windows OS

  • MySQL

  • PHP

  • HAML

  • Yii

  • HTML

  • CSS

  • Javascript

  • jQuery

  • Github


ShoppersChoice.com is looking for someone who can work well both autonomously and in a collaborative team, who places a high value on work ethic, is talented at problem solving, and when faced with a challenge, are driven to go a step further to find the solution. As an adaptable, self-motivated individual, it piques your interest to learn about new technologies and web user experiences in the industry.  


You will be a strong communicator, with a passion for programming, a high attention to detail, and you never compromise on quality. You will apply your logical thinking to assess and solve problems on the run, will take ownership of your projects, seeing them through to completion, and will have the ability to analyze needs and identify problems, creating innovative design and solutions.  


If you are passionate about the user experience, and can work effectively in a fast-paced atmosphere while working on multiple projects simultaneously, adapting to unfamiliar systems and applications with ease, then we are looking for you!

item.title: Senior Web Developer at Xander e-Solutions Inc. (Kansas City, MO)
item.description:
Xander e-Solutions is a small, boutique style custom applications firm, located just north of downtown Kansas City, Missouri.  We are locally owned and operated, and believe strongly that our development team is happiest with a balance between work and play. And happy developers mean higher quality deliverables to our customers. That is why our team rarely, if ever, works weekends and a normal work week is 40-45 hours. In fact, our team consists of long term employees, and turnover is rare. However, due to our customer-centric philosophy, Xander is once again growing, which means that we have some amazing opportunities for someone who lives to take an abstract vision and turn it into an incredible web experience.

We are looking for talented a Web Developer who has a passion to design sites that are not only creative and impactful, but also perform effortlessly and effectively.  We believe in open web standards, progressive enhancement, and accessibility. We are a team of individuals with diverse skills who love learning and sharing knowledge (we also like to have fun once in a while). 


Our Web Developers (ok, all of us) work out of our newly remodeled office, located just north of downtown  Kansas City, MO.

item.title: Senior Ruby on Rails Developer at Forever, Inc. (Pittsburgh, PA)
item.description:
The Senior Ruby on Rails Application Developer at Forever, Inc. will be responsible for the development and design of web applications and components for external customer facing products using Ruby on Rails.  The developer will design, develop, test and deliver web sites, applications and components.  Enhancements and defect resolution will be required on an ongoing basis.  Best practices and design methods will be utilized to insure the success of the projects. The developer will have the ability to create web applications and components from the requirements stage, through design, through production deployment.  They will be required to have experience in software programming as well as development involving compatibility and seamless integration with various technologies in addition to Ruby on Rails such as, but not limited to, HTML5, Java, JavaScript, PHP, Python, Apache Tomcat, Perl, Flash and CSS.  Experience with a Ruby on Rails application is required.  The developer will solicit and incorporate feedback from customers, development team members, and FOREVER.com team members. 


Flexibility, adaptability and the ability to learn quickly in various technical and creative environments, while delivering quality work by tight deadlines, are key attributes of this individual.

item.title: Senior iOS Developer at 14Zen LLC (Denver, CO) (allows remote)
item.description:
Help us develop iOS applications used by major sports leagues (NFL, NHL, MLS)  and top college conferences. If you've always wanted to write software for Wes Welker, Peyton Manning, or Sidney Crosby now is your chance!


You'll have the opportunity to help stem the tide of sports related head injuries and bring some amazing technology to consumers world wide with a new iPhone app. 


You'll be working remotely a majority of the time living on Slack with the rest of the team. We travel occasionally and you're always welcome to join us to meet the customer face to face. We're looking for the best developers with real opinions on the right way to build applications and how to deliver an amazing user experience. 


 You'll be expected to deliver well tested high quality code and you'll have the opportunity to work with a great QA team that will assure that the team ships a perfect user experience. If you have solid UI/UX experience that's a big bonus for us.

item.title: DBA (MongoDB) for Healthcare Platform Company at Remedy Partners Inc. (New York, NY)
item.description:
Key Responsibilities:



  • Maintain, monitor, tune, and support existing MySQL and MongoDB database environments for production, staging, QA and development

  • Troubleshoot any problems that may come up with the database environments; performance issues; replication issues; or operational issues

  • Manage database security, disaster recovery, and capacity planning

  • Architect database schemas and layouts and

  • Monitor and ensure 24x7x365 databases availability and stable operation

item.title: Front-End Engineer at Schrödinger (New York, NY)
item.description:
Who we are: We are passionate engineers, entrepreneurs, and thinkers. Our team members have gained their skills by working at elite companies like Google but have made the decision to work on something to help mankind. Our clients include many large pharmaceutical companies and our investors are fellow technology visionaries, including Bill Gates.


What we do: We are developing a software platform to allow scientists to leverage the power of physics-based simulations through all stages of the pharmaceutical and biotech drug discovery process.


You are: A CS hacker that enjoys building large scale user interfaces. You try out the latest web frameworks, ORM’s, and javascript libraries. You build and deploy web apps in your spare time. You care deeply about usability, understand the difference between a power user and a noob (and can simultaneously design an interface for them both!), and obsess over pixel perfection. You have an MVC tattoo. You believe that low test coverage in a UI is for chumps and code reviews, if done correctly, improve end product quality.

item.title: Backend Developer at Millicom Digital Ventures (Stockholm, Sweden)
item.description:
Our start-up, mi.tv, is currently looking for a backend software developer to join our team in Stockholm. Your responsibility will be to architecture, build and ensure uptime for our world-class product that has the potential to reach tens of millions of customer in Latin America.


Together with an awesome team of highly skilled engineers you will continue building our great team, our culture and our product. Working with a Greenfield project, you will experience the pace and liberty that comes with working with a data driven startup.


You will get a once in a lifetime opportunity to be part of a digital boom in Latin America, to have a first hand experience as millions of people get connected in the emerging markets. You will be working with a state of the art Web Backend System, cloud hosted and scaled to meet millions of users.


THE WAY WE WORK


You need to have a strong sense of responsibility and be an inspiration for your colleagues, both younger and more senior. You should have the ability to take decisions, initiatives and getting things done. You should have strong analytical skills and be able to draw conclusion without a full set of data and you should be able to think outside the box and have an open mind to innovation and new solutions. You’re a team player with the ability to describe complex problems to others, you listen and involve others in discussions and you have the ability to tailor technical information to different audiences. You should have worked with customer service related tasks. We also think you have a university degree or a strong work based experience.


CORE RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Participate in design + implementation + testing and release

  • Define requirements and approaches

  • Write code to scale to millions of users, terabytes of data

  • Understand and address latency, performance, and security issues with cloud development

item.title: Software Architect at Panther Premium Logistics (Medina, OH)
item.description:
GENERAL SUMMARY:


The architect is a key leader in the IT area who working together with the Business and IT Management sets the technical direction for all IT efforts, constantly keeps an eye on the technology trends, and evaluates new technologies, solutions, and approaches.  The primary responsibilities of this position is to guide system design and development activities in a way that best ensures functional requirements are met while also addressing current and future non-functional requirements.  The architect is responsible for technical quality, integrity and evolution of the application portfolio sustaining all Panther operations.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Defines product requirements and creates high-level architectural specifications, ensuring feasibility, functionality, and integration with existing systems/platforms.

  • Collaborates with Technical Leads and IT Management to ensure the translation of requirements into architecture specifications and high level design that fit within the overall software architecture strategy.

  • Recommends design direction or modifications of system components.

  • Leads thorough technical design reviews and code inspections. Provides clear, actionable feedback for project team members. Insures adherence to development policies and procedures.

  • Develops and maintains strategies, blueprints and roadmaps for all Panther systems.

  • Manages technology risk, technical currency, and technical debt for the entire portfolio of applications.

  • Ensures applications supporting Panther operations are technically resilient enough to meet established non-functional requirements.

item.title: Manager PHP Development at Coolblue (Rotterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
As the manager of PHP Development at Coolblue you and your team define the shopping experience of hundreds of thousands of people daily.


What you tell your friends you do
"I'm like Yoda. I help out my team with my wisdom, but also plenty of code I still write. Wait... You don't know Yoda?"


What you will really be doing



  • Building and leading a great team of PHP developers.

  • Still working on the software that powers Coolblue yourself, by writing code and tests.

  • Helping our Product Owners in aligning the functional with the technical needs.

  • Acting as the technical conscience of the team, keeping a birds eye view on the state of our codebase and initiating projects to keep it up to date and in tip-top shape.


How will you be doing this?



  • Actively coaching and continuously providing feedback to PHP developers, you will make them 'a little bit better every day'

  • Selecting and interviewing candidates for your team in collaboration with our IT recruitment department.

  • Taking part in team meetings to provide your knowledge and insights where needed.

  • Reviewing code, evangelising best practices and sustaining a culture of pragmatism as well as craftsmanship.

  • Keeping up to date with the latest in PHP development, improving our tools and processes where needed.


What we have worked on last quarter



  • Introduced dynamic product combination offers, requiring less manual work while optimising sales.

  • Improved overall website performance and created additional headroom for handling large traffic spikes.

  • Built new product search functionality, which is currently undergoing A/B testing.


What a day in the office might look like
You meet a candidate over lunch. You aren't looking at skills yet, you just want to get to know her. How would her personality mesh with the rest of the herd? Can she communicate ideas clearly and concisely? Can she talk fluently about the technologies Coolblue deploys? It's your shot at filtering out candidates that don't fit the mould. Not bad, not bad at all. She passes. For now. Of course, your senior team members will pick her apart technically later. Next stop: Helping Hans to get over his test writing anxiety. During your last sync, you only gave him two pointers: 1) find a way to pass dependencies into your code, and 2) find a way to break down your code into the smallest modules possible. You quickly scan the 'homework' he's handed in. No more static method calls, good. Got rid of those private and protected methods. Stopped creating new objects inside a method. Excellent. 'So, tell me. Why are these things barriers to having an easily-testable codebase?', you ask. And at this point, you're sure his answer won't disappoint. 


Team
You'll lead a team of PHP developers with various levels of experience. Each of them is part of one our product teams, where they work on projects involving every part of our webshops, from the search engine to the shopping cart.


We offer



  • Money.

  • To help you keep your money, we also chip in on your pension, pay for your travels and offer a discount on all the stuff we sell.

  • An indefinite contract (that's for ever, and ever, and ever).

  • Room for you to do things your way.

  • An extensive relocation package. Just pack your toothbrush, we'll take of the rest.

  • Lots of things you can learn through our in-house Coolcademy.

  • We like to inspire your passion for technology by giving you the opportunity to visit events

  • 25 days of paid leave if you promise to come back.

  • An office in the heart of Rotterdam so there's plenty to do after work.

  • And yes, we also have the industry standard perks such as free beer, ping pong tables and awesome parties.

item.title: DevOps Engineer at Coolblue (Rotterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
As a DevOps Engineer you know there's no such thing as "it works on my machine".


What you tell your friends you do
"I'm like a ship mechanic. I may work below deck and need to get my hands dirty every once in a while, but without me we'd be dead in the water."


What you will really be doing



  • Work on the software that powers Coolblue by writing code and tests.

  • Identify and keep track of metrics that tell you how your software is performing.

  • Make improvements to the deployment pipeline to ensure smooth and frequent releases.

  • Keep your eyes and ears open for ways we can further streamline our development process.

  • Evangelise and spread your DevOps mentality to your colleagues.


How will you be doing this



  • You're part of an agile, multidisciplinary team. You bring your own unique skill set to the table and collaborate with others to accomplish your goals.

  • You prioritise your work with the team and its product owner, weighing both the business and technical value of each task.

  • You experiment, test, try, fail and learn all the time - with one thing at a time.

  • You don't do things just because they were always done that way. You don't ignore the lessons learned, however - even those learned by others.

  • You don't wait for things to come to you. You go out and get them. You're self motivated, communicative and get things done.


What have we worked on last quarter



  • Continuous deployment. Implemented an improved pipeline allowing us to do continuous deployment.

  • New Infrastructure. Set up a new infrastructure fully managed by Puppet.

  • Coolblue API. Created the first new RESTful services in Node.js as part of our new Coolblue API.


Team
You'll become part of an agile, multidisciplinary team, ranging in size between four and six members. You get your own team room, a scrum master to help guide the process and a product owner to represent the business' needs.


We offer



  • Money.

  • To help you keep your money, we also chip in on your pension, pay for your travels and offer a discount on all the stuff we sell.

  • Room for you to do things your way.

  • Lots of things you can learn through our in-house Coolcademy.

  • 25 days of paid leave if you promise to come back.

  • Cycle awaaaay with the bike reimbursement plan.

  • We like to inspire your passion for technology by giving you the opportunity to visit events.

  • Heartwarming help with the relocation process from start to finish.

  • An office in the heart of Rotterdam so there's plenty to do when you're not at work.

  • And yes, we also have the industry standard perks such as free beer, ping pong tables and awesome parties.

item.title: DevOps Architect at Workshare Limited (London, UK)
item.description:
We are:


Currently migrating our infrastructure to the cloud. Delivering a game changing hybrid solution to a problem that plagues many companies in today’s market.


We seek:


A natural born problem solver who is at home in the Open Source world. Confident working in a logical, structured manner even though the infrastructure around them is changing at a rate comparable to an Olympic sprinter. We need to build an appliance deployment solution using some of the bleeding edge tech such as Packer, Riak and RiakCS. Our development environment is Ruby and Java currently transitioning to a Service Oriented Architecture (SOA). Daily you will be automating Infrastructure deployment using OpsCode Chef and your awesome scripting ability. You will have a natural flair for solving problems and given free rein to experiment with new technologies as you see fit.


Our tech stack:


AWS, Ubuntu, Rails, Solr, Redis, NodeJS, MySQL, MongoDB and anything else you can prove will do the job that is required.

item.title: Javascript Developer (Backbone.JS, Angular.JS) at Workshare Limited (London, UK)
item.description:
We seek:


Working in our HQ in East London, as a Senior JavaScript Front End Web developer, you will be part of a talented agile development team building the upcoming ground breaking release of the Workshare platform. Re-building the UI that touches the experience of millions in finding, sharing and comparing sensitive data you will be tasked with writing scalable code that is tested and rapidly deployed. Adopting the LEAN Start-up culture we work in an Agile/Kanban software delivery environment and deploying code rapidly must be something you thrive on.

item.title: Product Owner Discovery (f/m) at Home24 GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
We are Home24, Europe‘s largest online furniture store. With over 100,000 products from more than 350 manufacturers, we offer our clients a unique range of furniture, lamps and home accessories.


Our Home24 loft is situated in a former cigar factory in Berlin, Prenzlauer Berg. From there, our young and international team manages our web shops in Germany, France, Austria, the Netherlands, Switzerland and Belgium. Since 2009 we have been working with great passion and enthusiasm for a great cause: We revolutionize the furniture market.


Therefore we are looking for you from now on as:


Product Owner Discovery (f/m)


We are looking for an entrepreneurial leader in the field of showing the perfectly matching products to each individual customer browsing through our catalogue. 


Your passion to provide excellent shopping experience to our customers will combine with your ability to identify, prioritise and initiate projects in a rapid manner - thanks to our release cycle we are able to launch new features basically right after finalizing them.


You will be embedded in a small team of developers and quality engineers, dedicated to improve product search, sorting & recommendations in all of our international shops. The team itself is based in our Headquarter in Berlin.

item.title: Product Owner Backoffice Tools (f/m) at Home24 GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
We are Home24, Europe‘s largest online furniture store. With over 100,000 products from more than 350 manufacturers, we offer our clients a unique range of furniture, lamps and home accessories.


Our Home24 loft is situated in a former cigar factory in Berlin, Prenzlauer Berg. From there, our young and international team manages our web shops in Germany, France, Austria, the Netherlands, Switzerland and Belgium. Since 2009 we have been working with great passion and enthusiasm for a great cause: We revolutionize the furniture market.


Therefore we are looking for you from now on as:


Product Owner Backoffice Tools (f/m)



We are looking for a strong analytical leader to continuously improve our self-developed backoffice-tools. Those tools are used by hundreds of people each day and manage product data, pricing, international delivery times and many more functions underlying our E-Commerce platform.


Your passion to deeply dig into complex requirements and logics will combine with your ability to identify, prioritise and initiate projects in a rapid manner - thanks to our release cycle we are able to launch new features basically right after finalising them.


You will be embedded in a small team of developers and quality engineers, dedicated to improve and elaborate both productivity and functional scope of the tools. The team itself is based in our Headquarter in Berlin.

item.title: Senior System Administrator Windows (f/m) at Home24 GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
We are Home24, Europe‘s largest online furniture store. With over 100,000 products from more than 350 manufacturers, we offer our clients a unique range of furniture, lamps and home accessories.


Our Home24 loft is situated in a former cigar factory in Berlin, Prenzlauer Berg. From there, our young and international team manages our web shops in Germany, France, Austria, the Netherlands, Switzerland and Belgium. Since 2009 we have been working with great passion and enthusiasm for a great cause: We revolutionize the furniture market.

We as a team try to ensure performance, high availability and scalability in our heterogeneous infrastructure. Besides the monitoring and development of an enterprise cluster of windows machines, you are supporting the users of the systems to scale up and keep their apps fast. Problem analysis, incident management and documentation are our daily tasks.

item.title: Scientific DevOps Engineers at D. E. Shaw Research (New York, NY)
item.description:
Exceptional DevOps Engineers are sought to join an ambitious, well-funded high-performance computing and research group based in New York City.  These hires are expected to contribute to the development of scientific workflow systems, deployment of software and infrastructure, standardization of tools, regression testing, configuration management, and/or third-party support for our simulation tools packages. 


Ideal candidates will have strong Python programming and scripting experience, exceptional communication skills, and a demonstrated track record of academic, industrial, and/or open source accomplishments.  Other relevant areas of expertise might include high-throughput workflows, structured and unstructured data management and analysis, distributed systems software, software release management, automation testing, and quality assurance, but specific knowledge of any of these areas is less critical than a track record of achievement and innovation.


Our group is developing multiple generations of the Anton supercomputer, a massively parallel special-purpose machine that speeds up molecular dynamics simulations by orders of magnitude and is designed in part to fundamentally transform the process of drug discovery.


If you are interested in working closely with a team of the world’s leading biologists, chemists, and computer scientists, please use the link below to submit your application materials.  We take great pride in the caliber of our team, and we offer above-market compensation. 


To submit an application, please use the link provided below:
http://www.deshawresearch.com/recruit/jobs/Ads/StackOverflow/SciDev


D. E. Shaw Research is committed to building a diverse team.  We offer an intellectually rigorous and stimulating work environment that is also supportive, flexible, and welcoming.  We do not discriminate in employment matters on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, pregnancy, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other protected class.

The screen is your easel as you paint delightful UX and data visualizations using HTML, CSS and JavaScript. You’re fluent in RESTful APIs and JSON. You write a failing test before fixing a bug. item.title: VP Site Engineering at New Relic (Portland, OR)
item.description:
New Relic
VP, Site Engineering
Portland, OR or San Francisco, CA

As a customer-first, product-first company, we've built an amazing set of products for our customers Software Analytics needs. As a SaaS company, we also operate those products in our data centers, thereby providing a lower TCO for our customers -- a double win for everyone. 

As we continue to grow, both in the number of customers and the size of those customers, as well as in number of products, the demands on our operations and infrastructure continue to grow while at the same time the requirements for flawless operation, efficient operation, sufficient headroom, and good fiscal choices also increase.

As the VP of Site Engineering, you will be a key member of the Engineering organization, chartered with continuing to build the technical operations side of the business. This includes 24x7 global operation of our data centers, our storage technologies, our PaaS, and our internal engineering tooling.

We call this role 'Site Engineering' because we are looking for someone with a larger vision than traditional operations: we are looking for someone who views infrastructure as software in the Google SRE model (http://bit.ly/1i8Crfg) -- someone who views automation as better than hands on keyboards. We are looking for someone to scale all aspects of our platform as we continue our rapid growth. People, processes, financials, and technology are key aspects of this role.

You will have extensive experience in building private clouds (datacenter, network, systems, storage) on an international scale as well as expert knowledge of public clouds, their ideal applications and how to leverage both to keep costs (both financial and development) in budget.

As a VP, you will have a passion for the business; it's goals and a strong drive to use the technical operations team as a solution rather than a cost.  Driving down internal costs, increasing margin and improving time-to-market through innovative architectures and strategies are core tenets of your team.

As a VP level position, you are a strong visionary leader and will have:



  • 10+ years of experience leading internationally distributed technical teams

  • Proven track record of building high performance teams, process and infrastructure for a global SaaS platform

  • Experience managing data systems in public, private, and hybrid cloud environments, including Amazon AWS, VMware, and OpenStack based cloud technologies

  • Detailed knowledge and deep experience operating a mission-critical, revenue-generating, 24x7 SaaS platform including NOC operations

  • Strong automation and orchestration experience, including experience leading development teams on large-scale software projects

  • Executive-level leadership.  Experience working with other executives, presenting to boards, reporting to the rest of executive staff

  • Strong communication skills, both internally to the company and to external customers

  • Experience in implementing and maintaining various compliance standards, including ISO27001, SOC2, FedRamp and others

  • Skilled at building budgets, managing to them and working with the finance team to create accurate cost models/forecasts

  • Desire to win - strong drive to be successful and lead a winning team


A little about us:

New Relic is a software analytics company that, on behalf of our customers, makes sense of billions of metrics about millions of applications, all in real time. Our comprehensive SaaS-based solution for web and mobile applications consolidates the performance monitoring data into a single, powerful interface. Our 90,000 customers use New Relic every day to optimize more than three million applications.

New Relic is a San Francisco Best Places to Work award winner, an Oregon “Top Workplace” award winner, named a leader in the Gartner’s 2013 & 2014 “Magic Quadrant” for APM companies, a Top 100 OnDemand Company, Best of SaaS (THINKStrategies), Top 100 Coolest Cloud Computing (CRN); 10 Cloud Management Companies to Watch (NetworkWorld) – the list of accolades goes on. More important than all of that: we provide challenging work, opportunities to learn, high quality teammates, a standard-setting product, and a company on the move.

Our offices are in the tech-rich urban centers of Portland & San Francisco, with easy commute access and a plethora of good eats. We provide competitive compensation, stock options and big-company benefits (medical, dental, etc) -- all while maintaining the energy, agility, and fun of a start-up. We can help with relocation and are open to H1-B transfers.

New Relic is most decidedly an equal opportunity employer. We eagerly seek applicants of diverse background and hire without regard to race, color, gender, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, individuals with disabilities, age, sexual orientation, protected veterans, or any other characteristic protected by law. Note: Our stewardship of the data of many thousands of customers means that a criminal background check is required to join New Relic.  We will, nonetheless, consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accord with applicable law, including the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

To get started, click on the link below. To fast track your application, let us know in your cover letter why this job, product, and/or company is of particular interest to you. We look forward to talking!



Apply Here

PI87724288

item.title: Software Developer -- iPad/Web Applications (Cambridge, MA) at EnerPath Services, Inc. (Cambridge)
item.description:
Software Developer -- iPad/Web Applications (Cambridge, MA)


EnerPath http://enerpath.com is building world-class software in the Energy Efficiency sector. Our success is accomplished with the help of talented engineers interested in software design, architecture and coding. Our proven processes throughout the years continue to expand into the Mobile and Wireless realm. If there is an interesting new way to use new technology, we make it happen. If you are interested in an opportunity to play a key role in every aspect of software design and implementation, then we are interested in you. Requirements:


-        Experience with front-end and/or back-end development for web applications, web services APIs, and/or real-time applications


-        Advanced knowledge of JavaScript, CSS, HTML5


-        Experience using JQuery and other JavaScript libraries like jQT


-        Ability to understand complex business requirements


-        Experience in some or all of the following technologies/processes: .NET, SQL, C#, JavaScript, development, debugging and troubleshooting

Preferred:


-        Experience with ASP.NET, MVCs


-        Experience with API development, services and system interoperability


-        Experience in distributed application design


-        Experience in creating Mobile Applications/Websites (Android, iPhone, iPad, etc.)


-        Experience with Agile software teams


Company Summary:


Our relationships with major Energy companies across the country since 1990 and the renewed interest in Efficiency have uniquely positioned us for growth. Our enterprise mobile/wireless/web technology and our proven processes allow us to execute on Energy Efficiency application development at an unprecedented, and unmatched, scale - orders of magnitude greater than any competitors. We make our customers more energy efficient and clients more business efficient.



In a market space full of startups, EnerPath has the track record, high-visibility references, and experience to set us ahead of the pack. We are aggressively launching our nationwide expansion, and are seeking the right people to make it happen.



If you are ambitious and enjoy seeing your efforts put into production, EnerPath offers attractive benefit packages and the opportunity to advance rapidly in your career.

item.title: Full Stack Developer at Spoon University (New York, NY)
item.description:
Spoon University needs a rockstar dev who’s capable of recruiting and leading a team (and overseeing freelancers and dev shops) and has a vision of how we can take our site technologically to scale.


We need a full-stack developer who has experience on scaled sites, doing both front-end and back-end work (although backend is the priority). The current technical infrastructure is build in PHP with WordPress, and a smaller Ruby on Rails app that supports training. It is required that any candidate has experience with PHP/MySQL/RoR. In adddition to strong development skills they need to be able to manage teams, and have an understanding of development operations, helping us setup the right foundation to grow the core product. They need a desire to make video content simple and mobile, to make our site navigable and prioritize social, and to make analytics accessible and insightful. We have the opportunity here to build a site for the future of media — and to shape how people interact with and talk about food — and we need someone with the technological expertise and vision to help us.

item.title: .NET Web Architect - MakeMusic at MakeMusic (Boulder, CO)
item.description:
Join the team that is transforming music technology.


If you are interested in playing a role in the future of music technology then you have come to the right place. At MakeMusic we all share a passion for creating the next best thing in the world of music and we are always searching for great talent. MakeMusic is an industry leader in interactive music learning, notation software and virtual instrument technology.


SmartMusic is award-winning interactive music software that provides a deliberate practice environment for students in band, orchestra, and choir. With a subscription to SmartMusic, students have unlimited access to the world’s largest accompaniment library for all ages and skill levels, which includes thousands of pieces of music.


MakeMusic has an immediate opening in the new Boulder, CO office for a hands on .Net Web Architect.  You will work in an open and collaborative environment, mentoring other engineers, working to improve system layout, working closely with CI and Ops engineers for operational-ready systems, and reducing complexity where necessary. Your job will be to support modifications to the existing system while learning how the system works.  In the near term, you will assess a plan to remove complexity and improve the Continuous Delivery system including: creating seams, writing unit tests, working with CI to improve deployment systems, and determine longer term architectural modifications with the CTO.  In the long term you will lead the effort to consolidate API’s into a single RESTful endpoint, deprecate legacy systems and unnecessary code, and R&D thick client integrations with SmartMusic desktop engineers.


What you’ll be doing



  • Work closely with Operations and CI team members to improve configuration management practices and architecture

  • Remove SubVersion as a means of versioning our musical content from download.  Move to a more modern BLOB storage like S3 with built in versioning

  • Rebuild automated email queuing system

  • Work with TechOps to implement error monitoring with a tool like Rollbar

  • Help prioritize operational feedback based on monitoring input from APM tools like NewRelic

  • Review SSO system and make recommendations on simplifying complexity based on product priorities

  • Help hire and mentor other .Net engineers responsible for supporting content delivery and general services on the SmartMusic platform.

  • Build a permissions engine that properly delineates authentication and authorization based on acceptable levels of user responsibility

  • Build integration platform with other partners. That includes either a MM externally hosted API, or pulling content from externals systems.

  • Responsible for making architectural improvements that will enable a shift towards a web based solution, including API consolidation across our product platform (Web, Desktop, and iOS)


Our Stack:



  • C# (SOAP / MVC / ASP.NET)

  • SQL Server

  • Jenkins, Perforce, Mercurial, SubVersion

item.title: Programmer Extraordinaire at Expensify (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Perfect for new college grads or people who are bored with school and want to get started in the real world!*


Hey there! Allow us to introduce ourselves. We are Expensify and we do "expense reports that don't suck!" (Google "expensify" to read more.) We're getting crushed under an ever-growing pile of super awesome work, and I need one bright soul to help us dig our way out. I can guarantee you fun, an amazing opportunity to learn, and the siren's call of distant riches. But only if you are all of the following:


- An incredibly hard worker, even when it's not so fun. There is a ton of work to do, and a lot of it downright sucks. After all — we do the sucky work so our customers won't need to. I need you to buck up and grind through server logs, user emails, source code, and bug reports, without complaint or supervision, and come back asking for more.


- A cool person to be with. Not a crazy party animal, just someone we can trust, rely upon, hang out with, bounce ideas off of, and generally interact with in a positive way, both personally and professionally. In fact, this is one of the most stringent requirements we have: would you be fun to hang out with day and night on some remote, exotic beach? This isn't a rhetorical question, either: every year we take the company overseas for a month (on your own dime, sorry) and work incredibly hard while having a ton of fun. We've done Thailand, Mexico, India, Turkey, Croatia and the Philippines. Where do you want to go next?


- Super talented, in a general way. We're going to throw a ton of work at you of every possible sort, and you need that magic skill of being able to figure it out even if you have no idea where to start. On any given day you might bounce between super low-level coding, super high-level technical support, marketing-driven data-mining, updating our user documentation, inventing/designing/building some new feature, etc. This is not a code monkey job — you're going to be a full participant in the process, and you need to bring your own unique blend of skills to the table.


- Specifically talented in a programming way. You can instantly visualize solutions to problems big and small. Your code is always clean, well commented, has good nomenclature and indentation. You can switch on a dime between C++, PHP, Bash, Cron, HTML, CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, Dwoo, SQL — not because you know them all, but because you're the sort of person who can just pick it up and figure it out. If you're this sort of person, you'll know what I mean. If not, then this position isn't for you.


And there are a bunch more, but odds are if you got this far, nothing I can do would stop you from applying. That's a problem because while I know *you* are awesome, it's actually really hard and time consuming to find you in the midst of the literally hundreds of other applications I get from everyone else. So this is where I'm going to ask my first favor: can you make it really easy and obvious how great you are, so I don't accidentally overlook you?


There are probably many ways to do that. But the easiest way is to help me out by answering the following questions:
1. What's the URL of your website? If you don't have one, why not?
2. What's your coding history? When did you start, and what have you done between then and now?
3. What do you want to do with the rest of your life, and how is Expensify a step toward your long-term goals?
4. Tell us where you heard about this opportunity.

item.title: Software Engineer at ThyssenKrupp System Engineering, Inc. (Auburn Hills, MI)
item.description:
Job Description


The Programmer’s role is to define, develop, test, analyze, document and maintain new software applications in support of the achievement of business requirements. This includes writing, coding, testing, and analyzing software programs and applications. The Programmer will also research, design, document, and modify software specifications throughout the production life cycle.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities.


• Collaborate with developers, programmers, and designers in conceptualizing and development of new software programs and applications.


• Analyze and assess existing business systems and procedures.


• Assist in the definition, development, and documentation of software’s business requirements, objectives, deliverables, and specifications on a project-by-project basis in collaboration with internal users and departments.


• Assist in defining software development project plans, including scoping, scheduling, and implementation.


• Research, identify, analyze, and fulfill requirements of all internal and external program users.


• Conduct research on emerging application development software products, languages, and standards in support of procurement and development efforts.


• Liaise with vendors for efficient implementation of new software products or systems and for resolution of any adaptation issues.


• Consistently write, translate, and code software programs and applications according to specifications.


• Write programming scripts to enhance functionality and/or performance of company applications as necessary.


• Design, run and monitor software performance tests on new and existing programs for the purposes of correcting errors, isolating areas for improvement, and general debugging.


• Administer critical analysis of test results and deliver solutions to problem areas.


• Generate statistics and write reports for management and/or team members on the status of the programming process.


• Develop and maintain user manuals and guidelines.


• Train end users to operate new or modified programs.


• Manage and/or provide guidance to junior team members.


Supplemental Duties and Responsibilities


• Liaise with, and provide training and support to, help desk support staff on application issues.


• Develop and maintain training materials and documentation.


• Act as an escalation point for advanced or difficult help requests.


• Apply diagnostic utilities to aid in troubleshooting.


• Access software updates, drivers, knowledge bases, and FAQ resources on the Internet/Intranet to aid


• On-call availability 24x7 in problem resolution.

item.title: Production Support Developer at Tk20, Inc. (Austin, TX)
item.description:
Tk20, Inc. is seeking a Production Support Developer to work closely with our business and technology teams to support and maintain all deployed web applications.  This is a customer-facing position that requires strong technical skills, exceptional time management ability, and exemplary communication skills. Key Responsibilities

  • Design and develop new tools for technical and non-technical Production Support teams using Java/J2EE, web services, scripting, SQL and other web application tools.

  • Collaborate with Project Management and Development teams to identify, test, and resolve the impact of functionality enhancements on the existing production environment.

item.title: Senior Software Developer at Tk20, Inc. (Austin, TX)
item.description:

This position requires strong knowledge of Java/J2EE, JSON, XML, web services, REST API, and other technical skills as listed below, as well as exceptional communication skills. item.title: Principal Software Engineer at SteadyRain, Inc. (Saint Louis, MO)
item.description:
SteadyRain is seeking a Principal Software Engineer who will be responsible for analyzing project requirements, developing a plan of technical action for the satisfaction of those requirements, and to research, develop, and design new technologies and techniques for accomplishing these tasks.


The Principal Software Engineer is also responsible for the drafting of high level technical architecture designs, understanding and applying design patterns, working with project managers for the organization of work and work packages, and understanding system design and interdependencies. The individual in this role is expected to provide consistent and vocal feedback to their peers on code quality, correctness, and estimates.


The Principal Software Engineer is expected to continuously evaluate the design and development methodology and systems that are in place, continuously seek to refine & improve them, and be the most vocal critic about our processes, procedures, and standards. The Principal Software Engineer is expected to not only identify areas of potential improvement, but to propose means to improve them, to supply fact based arguments for the same. The Principal Software Engineer is expected to drive an atmosphere of continuous improvement and focus on consistency, quality, and correctness.

item.title: Senior Web Full-Stack Developer at Third Iron (Minneapolis, MN) (allows remote)
item.description: We are looking for a great developer to help refine our current products and to join with us in pioneering new ones.  With Third Iron, you will work with a top-notch team, creatively work to build and improve products, and help plan for future growth.  We are invested in continuous learning so you will be working with leading technologies, including Ember, Node.js, Java, TypeScript, Heroku and more.  We are based in Minnesota but our team is mainly distributed so we welcome remote employees.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Neverware (New York, NY)
item.description:
As a Senior Software Engineer at Neverware, you'll help to lead the development team in improving the current core offerings and quickly bringing new products to market.  You'll architect and develop large scale deployment systems for our many servers distributed nationally.  You should also have an in-depth knowledge of Linux and have had a moderate amount of exposure to Python.  Experience (work or otherwise) with Google's Chrome OS or virtual machines is a plus as well.


After you join our software team, you'll begin to write code and architect components that will be deployed to numerous schools in both NYC and around the country.  You'll take part in daily scrums and architecture meetings, becoming an integral member of our software team.  We have fast release schedules, so the ideal candidate would have no problem hitting the ground running.

item.title: Chromium OS Engineer at Neverware (New York, NY)
item.description:
As a Senior Software Engineer at Neverware, you'll help bring a new product to market and get functioning computers to thousands of kids across the USA.  You'll be working with our software team to modify Google's Chromium Operating system to get it to boot on hundreds of machines.  You'll be touching everything from the linux kernel to the graphics stack, so in depth linux operating system and linux kernel knowledge is a must.  Chromium uses Gentoo's build system, making Gentoo knowledge a nice to have.


New members of our software team tend to start committing code on their first day, so a dedicated and self motivated candidate is ideal.  We also have a several case of Startup Mentality so don't be surprised if you end up spending a couple days working on other tasks, such as fixing up our build system or unpacking our weekly fresh direct order.  This job requires a fair amount of hacking chops though, so expect to be challenged.

item.title: Senior Java Software Engineer at Glassdoor (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Want to work at a start-up where you can really make a difference?   
 
Glassdoor, the world’s fastest growing career community and 2013 Webby Winner for “Best Employment Website”, is looking for a talented Sr. Java Software Engineer to help take our product to the next level.  This is your chance to share your work with a worldwide community of over 20M members and make your mark on the #1 employment app on Facebook – and we’re just getting started. 
 
Responsibilities


As a Senior Java Software Engineer, you will play a central role in the design and development of the Glassdoor product.  The ideal candidate will have a passion for development and a strong background in building dynamic, high-volume web sites with Java using an Agile development methodology.


 
As a fast-growing startup, we look for self-starters who thrive in a fast-paced, agile environment – which means wearing many hats, being able to change direction quickly, and showing an eagerness to learn new technologies as the need arises.  In this role you work with a small, collaborative team of engineers, product managers, and designers – so excellent interpersonal and communication skills are also a must.  And most importantly – we look for people that can prioritize, multi-task, and deliver – because it’s a lot more fun to get things done.

item.title: Engineering Manager, Search Infrastructure at Glassdoor (Sausalito, CA)
item.description:
Want to work at a start-up where you can really make a difference?  


Glassdoor is growing every day. We leverage data to help people find jobs they love. We are looking for curious and brilliant individuals who are up for revolutionizing the way people find jobs.  Glassdoor is in a great position with over 20M members, thousands of business customers and $50M in new funding. We are looking to scale rapidly and shake up the $90B+ talent acquisition market. Join us!


Glassdoor is backed by some of the best venture firms like Benchmark Capital, Tiger Global and Battery Ventures. Our founders are the same visionaries behind companies like Expedia, Trip Advisor and Zillow. 


Responsibilities


Our mission is to "help people everywhere find jobs and companies they love”. Search is core to that mission. We are looking for a data-driven engineering leader with strong technical and management experience in the search arena. Your role is to help set the strategic direction of the search team as well as manage the daily and weekly deliverables of a team of smart, high performance engineers, so that the team consistently delivers on its commitments.

item.title: Senior Dev Ops Engineer / Build Release Engineer at Glassdoor (Sausalito, CA)
item.description:
Want to work at a start-up where you can really make a difference?   


Glassdoor, the world’s fastest growing career community and 2013 Webby Winner for “Best Employment Website”, is looking for a talented Build and Release Engineer to help take our product, and specifically Dev Ops to the next level.  This is your chance to share your work with a worldwide community of over 25M users and make your mark on a product that is disrupting a $90B+ talent acquisition market – and we’re just getting started. 


Responsibilities


Glassdoor’s engineering team is growing. We need to create a strong Dev Ops team to lead our configuration management and release platform. You will have shared responsibility for deploying releases. You will also play a large role in helping us make the transition to be a fully cloud based platform. To succeed, you should have experience with various version control systems (perforce, svn, git, etc), build tools (ant, maven, etc) and cloud automation tools (Chef, Puppet). Your goal is to fully automate the provisioning of servers, deployment of code and general configuration management.  You will be working closely with development, QA, and product teams and your opinion and the code you write will define how we ship our product.


As a fast-growing startup, we look for self-starters who thrive in a fast-paced, agile environment – which means wearing many hats, being able to change direction quickly, and showing an eagerness to learn new technologies as the need arises.  But most importantly – we look for people that can prioritize, multi-task, and deliver – because it’s a lot more fun to get things done.

item.title: Senior Web Developer at Glassdoor (Sausalito, CA)
item.description:
Want to work at a start-up where you can really make a difference?  

Glassdoor, the world’s fastest growing career community and 2013 Webby Winner for “Best Employment Website”, is looking for a talented Sr. Web Developer / Front-End Engineer to help take our product to the next level.  This is your chance to share your work with a worldwide community of over 20M members and make your mark on the #1 employment app on Facebook – and we’re just getting started. 
 
Responsibilities


As a Senior Web Developer / Front-End Engineer, you will play a central role in the design, development, and delivery of all front-end features for Glassdoor’s web and mobile web products.  The ideal candidate will have a passion for web development and a strong background in building highly dynamic web pages using HTML5, CSS3, Javascript, jQuery, and AJAX using a Scrum/Agile development methodology. Java and JSP experience are big plusses.
 
As a fast-growing startup, we look for self-starters who thrive in a fast-paced, agile environment – which means wearing many hats, being able to change direction quickly, and showing an eagerness to learn new technologies as the need arises.  In this role you work with a small, collaborative team of engineers, product managers, and designers – so excellent interpersonal and communication skills are also a must.  And most importantly – we look for people that can prioritize, multi-task, and deliver – because it’s a lot more fun to get things done.

item.title: Senior Security Engineer at Glassdoor (Sausalito, CA)
item.description:
Looking for your next challenge? How about helping us disrupt a $90B+ talent acquisition market! Glassdoor is the world’s fastest growing career community with more than 25M members and thousands of business customers and our mission is helping people everywhere find jobs and companies they love.


We are revamping our IT infrastructure and processes to handle explosive growth and preparing for a potential IPO. This individual will own all of corporate security and the security of our site glassdoor.com, reporting to the Director of IT.  You are someone who has a deep understanding of the new threats of today’s networks and have a passion to protect against them. You must have experience securing a world class, high usage, highly visible production site.  You are someone who is able to effectively work across teams both, internally and externally, to gain buy in. Finally, we are looking for someone who can be strategic while also taking a hands-on approach to get things done.


Key Responsibilities:



  • Secure the company network by use of existing and new tools to protect against all known and zero day threats.

  • Run regular vulnerability tests to make sure, all systems and devices are patched and free of all vulnerabilities.

  • Support governance and compliance audits such as payment card industry (PCI) and Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX).

  • Design and development of tools to automate security or security reporting tasks.

  • Harden Windows (desktop and server), OS X, and Linux.

  • Establish policies and procedures for users with mobile devices to safely give them the best and secure access to Glassdoor systems.

  • Work with engineering to make sure the site is secure and free of any vulnerability.

  • Implement single sign-on technologies for enterprise apps using SAML and WS-Fed.

item.title: Experienced Software Engineer at Carnegie Robotics, LLC (Pittsburgh, PA)
item.description:
Carnegie Robotics is seeking creative, energetic and driven Software Engineers with strong hands-on development skills to work on a variety of interesting and challenging robotics perception and control projects.


This position provides the opportunity to join a team of talented veterans in the robotics field and program advanced sensors and autonomous robots from the ground up. The ideal applicant for this position has brains, creativity, and strong experience developing and testing software for robotics and/or sensing applications. We seek candidates who take pride in building solid, rigorously tested systems. 


Carnegie Robotics offers a very competitive benefits package. Due to the nature of some of our work, all applicants must be US Citizens or Permanent Residents to be considered.


Please send a cover letter when applying to this position.

item.title: ASP.NET Developer and/or Team Lead at 80/20 (Norfolk, VA)
item.description:
We're a growing software agency doing great work for our clients. We have clients all over the Norfolk/Virginia Beach area, and several other clients as far away as California. After just 1.5 years, we're up to 5 employees and numerous clients. 


Hate working on one project forever? That won't happen here, and you won't be stuck with the same technology stack either. We rotate across projects and stacks, teach each other new stacks and frameworks, and share tips and tricks along the way. Bonus: once a year, usually in the spring or summer, we take a group trip to a developer conference. 


Start 2015 off on the right foot...apply to work for 80/20!

item.title: Lead Android Engineer at PHHHOTO (New York, NY)
item.description:
PHHHOTO is searching for the Greatest Android Developer of All Time.


What started as the next generation photobooth seen at parties all over the world has become the next generation camera app and social network. PHHHOTO shoots Instant Moving Pictures from your phone and lets you to share them with friends.


We launched an iPhone app in July of 2014 and were fortunate to see some great press. Android users are lining up. Help us help them.


This is a big opportunity for the right person.

item.title: System Administrator at Carnegie Robotics, LLC (Pittsburgh, PA)
item.description:
This position will be the primary system and network professional for a small (50 employee) but growing company that develops robotic components, sensors, and systems, along with their related software.  We are an multi-disciplinary engineering powerhouse and we need a System Administrator who has ingenuity and good ideas on building reliably computing and network infrastructure.  


We try do things correctly:



  • VMWare based cluster for tool hosting, testing, and development with an attached SAN. 

  • Tape backup system and off-site storage are in place.

  • Redundant links to local ISPs.

  • LDAP based authentication for network services and internal applications.


We want our network and servers to be faster, more reliable, and setup for growth.  


Position is responsible for managing business systems (VMware Server, Small Business Server, Exchange), development systems (Linux), and the interoperability of those systems and related workstations. Position is also responsible for implementing and monitoring network security, and supporting engineering staff. 


The position is located in Pittsburgh, PA.  Due to the nature of some of our work, this position requires US Citizenship.


Please include a cover letter with your resume.


Carnegie Robotics is an Equal Opportunity Employer that welcomes applications from all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, marital status, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable laws and Carnegie Robotics’ employment policies.

item.title: Software Engineer at Opera Mediaworks (San Mateo, CA)

Opera Mediaworks is seeking a talented Software Engineer to support various products within the AdMarvel platform. AdMarvel is a mobile ad management optimization platform designed to boost ad revenue and to provide a comprehensive management interface to drive the mobile advertising business goals of our customers.


As a Software Engineer on the AdMarvel team you will:



  • Maintain and implement new features for the Opera Mediaworks Studio product which is used by publishers and advertisers to create rich media and video creative for mobile ads

  • Make improvements on the AdMarvel Campaign Platform, a web-based dashboard interface for all advertising operations including performance metrics, campaign sourcing, management and optimization

  • Function as a member of the Core Engineering team, maintaining the entire Opera Mediaworks delivery platform. This includes troubleshooting and debugging ad delivery issues on Android and iOS

  • Work on the revenue mining system and perform Root Cause Analysis (RCA) on revenue scraping failures

  • Interact with cross-functional and international teams for issue resolution

item.title: PHP Full Stack Developer for MedTech Startup at 83bar (Austin, TX) (allows remote)
item.description:
We're looking for smart, motivated PHP software engineers who love what they do and enjoy working in a team environment.


What you get to tell your friends you do


I create software to help people live longer, happier lives. And no, I won't fix your computer for anything less than a lifetime supply of free beer.


What you will actually do


Write the next generation of mobile marketing automation software for the medical industry. Mobile ad platform integration, tools to iterate 10x faster, health quizzes and landing page campaigns, automated text message flows connecting people to our 24/7 nurse contact center and advanced dashboard reporting for clients to track their business.


Position


You will be part of a lean development team focused on building mobile and web software for the medical industry.  This is a great opportunity for developers who want to learn more about an industry ripe for new technology.  


Be part of a relaxed work environment with a team of driven people.  You'll work closely with other developers, product managers, designers and marketing to develop business critical software.


No previous medical experience required. Operation and Dr. Mario on the Gameboy sadly doesn't count as medical experience, otherwise medical experience would be a requirement.


A day in the life


You attend a daily stand up informing the team of what you did yesterday and you will be focusing on today. Your primary form of communication is Slack with conference calls sprinkled in as needed.  Posting of cat photos and funny gifs on Slack are highly encouraged.  Before coding on your editor of choice, you write your unit tests to satisfy the requirements of your task. You then jump back and forth between PHP and Javascript code to put together the perfect web page.  After which you create a pull request in Github with your latest changes.  High fives and drinks all around.


No visa sponsorship available at this time.

item.description: You will teach Software Manual Testing theory and practical application to a group of students. Students come with analytical background and are handpicked by our admissions advisors.

item.title: Sr DevOps Engineer at Gravity4 (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
As a Senior AWS DevOps Engineer, you will be part of one of the most important technology groups within Gravity 4, Inc.  As part of the DevOps Group within the Global Engineering organization, you will work across multiple global product teams.  You will be responsible to understand and anticipate the agile Gravity4 infrastructure needs, and create an environment where Dev/QA/Staging/Production work can proceed securely, efficiently, and flexibly.  In addition you will have the following responsibilities:

• Implement and manage continuous delivery systems and methodologies on AWS
• Understand, implement, and automate security controls, governance processes, and compliance validation
• Define and deploy monitoring, metrics, and logging systems on AWS
• Implement systems that are highly available, scalable, and self-healing on the AWS platform
• Design, manage, and maintain tools to automate operational processes 
• Develop automation to quickly and rapidly deploy instances from hardened images
• Using monitoring tools to find problems, resolve and/or escalate to development and ensure that we exceed our SLAs
• Build and manage development and testing environments, assisting developers in debugging application issues using tools
• Participate in the building of tools and processes to support the infrastructure
• Contribute to the creation of system support documents such as run books
• Operate the platform within our security and privacy guidelines

Requirements:

• 3+ years experience with CentOS systems administration, with the 2 most recent years being Linux
• 4+ years working with AWS and familiarity interacting with the AWS APIs and working with tools such as Boto or Knife; experience with networking, properly architecting high availability systems, and security in an AWS context
• 4+ years working with a modern configuration management tool such as Chef, Puppet, or Cfengine 3; thorough understanding of configuration management concepts
• Understanding of protocols/technologies like HTTP, SSL, LDAP, JDBC, Servlet/JSP, SQL, HTML, XML
• Application clustering / load balancing concepts and technologies
• Java development experience
• Solid experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS) technologies such as EC2, RDS, DynamoDB and S3
• Clear written and verbal communication
• Proficient knowledge of virtualization technologies
• BS in Computer Science or related field, or equivalent experience is required
 

Benefits:

Working with bleeding edge technologies for a global media company is just one of the rewards of joining Gravity4.  Our exceptional compensation packages are built to reward employees for the long-term including providing a workplace environment that’s second to none:

Competitive base salary
Bonus schemes
Stock options
Core benefits program including: 80% medical, dental, and vision and a 401k plan
Exceptional onsite services, including in-house masseuse, gym, steam and showers, catering, and expense packages.
Our offices are some of the finest real estate; we are headquartered in San Francisco at One Market in the heart of the Embarcadero and have offices in New York and Chicago.  

About Gravity4:

At Gravity4, we’re changing the world of advertising and are actively looking for talented engineers to join us in our amazing journey to build and deliver turnkey solutions for marketers and advertisers across the globe.  Are you passionate about demonstrating the future capabilities of big data and automation?  Do you think that data should drive decisions and automation, instead of just displaying data points?  If you think the world should #belimitless, then come join us!

Desired Skills and Experience:

- Strong OO design and programming skills

- Google Adx or other Ad Exchange Platform Integration experience with server side and standalone application development experience using Python.

- Experience creating design specifications

- Solid working knowledge of current Internet technologies

Benefits:

Working with bleeding edge technologies for a global media company is just one of the rewards of joining Gravity4.  Our exceptional compensation packages are built to reward employees for the long-term including providing a workplace environment that’s second to none:

Competitive base salary
Stock options
Core benefits program including: 80% medical, dental, and vision and a 401k plan
Exceptional onsite services, including in-house masseuse, gym, steam and showers, catering, and expense packages.
Our offices are some of San Francisco’s finest real estate, located at One Market in the heart of the Embarcadero

At Gravity4, we’re changing the world of advertising and are actively looking for talented engineers to join us in our amazing journey to build and deliver turnkey solutions for marketers and advertisers across the globe.  Are you passionate about demonstrating the future capabilities of big data and automation?  Do you think that data should drive decisions and automation, instead of just displaying data points?  If you think the world should #belimitless, then come join us!

About Gravity4:

Gravity4 is the World's First High-Frequency Marketing Operating System that unites an experience - allowing marketers to connect with their customers in the most effective way - by taking them on a journey from awareness to action through social, web, mobile, CRM and email.  In one single click, brands, agencies, advertisers and CMOs are now empowered with transparency, automation, simplicity, and control in a $100 billion global market that is still manually driven.  By offering a full software stack that integrates social, web, email, CRM, and mobile, Gravity4 allows marketers to save millions of dollars annually and automate their marketing budgets across all consumer touch points.   This move marks the first full-suite of digital marketing solutions for the advertising marketplace!  


Gravity4 is headquartered in San Francisco with offices in New York and Chicago.

item.title: Senior Database Developer at Interpreta (San Diego, CA)
