item.title: Senior Web Engineer at AtreNet (Santa Cruz, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
We are seeking an exceedingly talented senior web engineer to join our team of creative and technology experts. The ideal candidate will possess expert level knowledge of WordPress including advanced theme and custom plugin development in addition to religious devotion to best practices and clean code standards.

Responsibilities:



  • Develop cutting edge, responsive WordPress themes from design comps using semantic markup with HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript

  • Collaborate with team members on effective solutions for provided challenges

  • Contribute to our internal code libraries and development guidelines to improve department performance

  • Set realistic goals and continually deliver assigned tasks in a timely and efficient manner

  • Clear verbal and written communication with the team members

  • Ongoing daily maintenance updates and additions from our current client base


You should be an individual that has a natural ability to find creative and elegant solutions to the challenges presented to you. Usage of SEO best practices with semantic HTML markup coupled with responsive behavior and advanced CSS and JavaScript should be second nature to you. Familiarity with source control in GIT, SVN and Linux command line are also a must.

We're looking for the best. If this describes you then we want to hear from you!

Work Environment:

You will be tasked with working independently, but will also take direction from the department head and project managers. We foster a team-based, supportive atmosphere that is focused on delivering diverse solutions that exceed our client’s expectations. A deadline is always looming, so being able to work efficiently without sacrificing quality is essential.

item.title: Serveradministrator (m/w) at INTERNETONE AG (Köln, Deutschland)
item.description:
Die INTERNETONE AG Gruppe mit Hauptsitz in Köln ist führender Full-Service-Provider für High-Performance Online Marketing. Hierbei steht ausschließlich die messbare Nutzensteigerung unserer Kunden im Mittelpunkt unseres Handelns.
Wissen, Erfahrung und vor allem harte Arbeit machen uns zu einem Partner für messbare Ergebnisse und Vertrauen darin, gemeinsam ehrgeizige Ziele zu erreichen!
Im Unternehmensbereich VentureONE baut die INTERNETONE AG gemeinsam mit hochmotivierten Gründerpersönlichkeiten erfolgreiche Start-ups im Online B2C Bereich auf.

Zur Unterstützung unseres Teams suchen wir derzeit einen


Serveradministrator (m/w)


Ihre Aufgaben:


• Betreuung und Verwaltung der gesamten Serverlandschaft (Inhouse, IaaS, PaaS)
• Sicherstellung des störungsfreien Betriebs und der kontinuierlichen Verfügbarkeit
• Erstellen von Backup-Szenarien
• kontinuierliche Optimierung der Prozesse und Performance

item.title: Android Developer at CÜR Media (Glastonbury, CT) (allows remote)
item.description: Come join our Android team and help us build a modern social music streaming app, working remotely (U.S. only) or from our Glastonbury, Connecticut office.

item.title: Software Development Engineer in Test (SDET) at Rackspace, the #1 managed cloud company (San Antonio, TX) (allows remote)
item.description:
Do you believe in the power of Open Source? Were you the kid that took apart the family TV not just to see how it worked but because you thought you could make it better? Can you detect and prevent the invasion of bugs better than the Orkin man?  If you answered yes to any/all of these, then you really need to be a Software Development Engineer in Test at Rackspace.


 With the largest OpenStack public cloud in the business and our commitment to provide our customers the best platform to continue changing the world, the life of an SDET at the Rack can be quite unique and rewarding. How is this possible? Easy—we help match your passions, birthday wishes, and Sherlock skills with the right opportunity to be GREAT. Here’s a preview to get you started:


 Pushing the Limits of the Cloud:


Rackspace has some of the most notable upstream OpenStack contributors on the planet. Duh…we co-founded the thing so of course we do. Whether for our public or private cloud offerings, our Devs are pounding out code in Python, Ruby, Java or whatever’s the next big thing at a break-neck pace. So when it comes to SDETs, we take pride in being true partners in excellence; not some robot or second-tier Dev whose only task is to cross off test cases from a checklist. Our SDETs have a tinker’s mind with a natural curiosity to know where we are going and to anticipate the unexpected. Diversity drives innovation people so our teams are dispersed across the globe—even working from their favorite Cheetos stained gaming chair at home.


 Internal Innovation:


Ten data centers around the globe with several hundred thousand servers that all need to seamlessly interact like one of your LAN parties back in college. If you like HUGE environments then jump on into this playground. Our DevOps Engineers, Software Developers, and Infrastructure Engineers have to keep up with the demands of the industry that didn’t exist, oh 5 minutes ago.  Our SDETs who partner with these teams are literally building their dreams to insure what’s new today is built to withstand the strains of tomorrow. Bulletproof code—that’s how we roll.


 This is NOT your uncle’s Quality Engineering team where there was a lack of software development to accomplish testing and the job was just about manual button pushing. Are you ready to change the game doing what they said can’t be done? Are you ready to automate bigger things better and faster? What are you waiting for? Click that apply button, talk with one of our talent specialists and get ready to jump on in to the best adventure you’ve ever had.


 Still not convinced? Hear from the Rackers who do this day in and day out but still can’t believe this is their job. QE at the Rack

item.title: Junior .NET Web Application Developer at Travelzoo (Mountain View, CA)
item.description: Travelzoo is looking for a Junior Web Application Developer with the ability to design and build scalable web applications. The ideal candidate will have development experience with the Microsoft .NET / MS SQL stack, as well knowledge of front-end technologies like CSS and JavaScript. The position is full-time and based in Mountain View, CA.

item.title: Lead Software Engineer at Huron Consulting Group (recognized, Best Firms to Work For) (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
A Lead Software Engineer / Team Lead is responsible for establishing the low level design on one or more projects. In addition, the Lead will provide technical leadership for one or more platforms for application development used by the Huron Legal team.  A team of software engineers (target size is 3 – 6 engineers per lead) in implementing features and fixing bugs within that design.  The Lead is a key role on Huron Legal software projects and will work closely with one or more Software Architects to ensure the design fits well within the overall architecture for the product line as well as working closely with the project manager to ensure that delivery time-lines are met and risks are managed.


This is an outstanding opportunity to lead solutions, development teams and projects to ongoing success.  The group is working on new development and enhancements that will continue to help make a positive impact on our Legal Technology solutions.  Due to success and future needs, we are taking the Engineering team from 20+ to 40 full time employees.  This is an entrepreneurial technology group within an accomplished stable company Huron Consulting Group. 


Hands-on versus managing projects %: Great opportunity for an individual to remain hands-on while leading projects and a development team (with future potential growth).  The percent of managing projects and leading developers versus hands-on development depends on the mixture of projects.


Please Note: This is not a traveling consultant role; this is an internal opportunity, working with Huron technology teams at our Chicago HQ. 


Job Details:



  1. Contribute to software projects by signing up for and completing items off backlog. The amount of work assigned may be lower than that for an Associate Software Engineer given the non-code driven responsibilities of the position.

  2. Conduct design and code reviews.

  3. Coordinate work of developers.

  4. Resolve technical issues which are keeping developers from being productive.

  5. Review, understand, and, if necessary, identify deficiencies in requirements on backlog items.

  6. Keep the project manager informed of progress, risks to delivery milestones and blocking issues.

  7. Provide estimates (referred to as T-shirts) to the project manager to allow for release planning.  Work with the architect and developers as needed to produce estimates.

  8. Review the task break downs of developers to ensure they are complete and accurate.

  9. Review inflow of features and bugs with Project Manager and Architect.

  10. Provide technical expertise and leadership within one or more technology areas. 


People:



  1. Work with the architect in the establishment of guidelines, processes and templates to facilitate development.  Examples would be .NET coding standards, code patterns, and helper objects.

  2. Mentor junior developers and ensure the quality of their code including but not limited to pairing, code review and informal feedback. 

  3. Promote a positive team atmosphere with other developers, QA and Business Analysts.

  4. Provide feedback as necessary to Project Manager and/or Architect on developer performance.

  5. Interviews for new developer positions as assigned.


Training:



  1. Work with your coach/supervisor to create quarterly training goals to keep yourself current in with core technologies, tools and processes. 

  2. Work with coaches to contribute to the training plans of more junior developers.

  3. Contribute to formal training and distribution of technical information to the broader teams and appropriate parties in other departments.


Processes: 



  1. Consistently follow established coding, code check in, task tracking and other processes.

  2. Make recommendations to improve process.


Tools: 



  1. Gain mastery of one or more of the business tools which the team is responsible for, and remain a top domain expertise resource as those tools evolve and/or are replaced with other tools.

  2. Develop an understanding of the overall eDiscovery process and Huron’s V3locity solution including how the different elements of the technology stack and architecture fit together and the implications of changing one piece. Keep yourself and encourage others to be up to date with core technologies and development environments used by the team. Examples include .NET, HTML5, and WCF. Become an expert in the components of these systems we use in our daily work.

  3. Make recommendations to the Project Manager, Architects, and senior management on the tools and scope of work for internal initiatives. 


Quality: 



  1. Adhere to and communicate coding standards.

  2. Facilitate the ongoing quality of builds. Ensure developers on team do not break builds, and, in the event of a build failure, track down the cause and have the developer responsible correct it.

  3. Refactor code when there are clear opportunities and it would not materially impact the size of the story you are working on.  Make recommendations for larger refactoring / redesign efforts when the scope would materially increase the size of the Story you are working on.

  4. Proactively identify industry and company best practices and techniques that can be applied to increase quality and productivity.

item.title: DevOps Engineer at Rackspace, the #1 managed cloud company (San Antonio, TX) (allows remote)
item.description:
Do you believe Open Source will always innovate faster? Is “Automate Everything” printed on the back of your hoodie? Are you most comfortable on the cutting edge of technology? If this describes you and you’re ready to attack some of the most complex problems in the industry, then it’s time for you to take on the challenge of being a DevOps Engineer at Rackspace.


With over 200,000 customers hosting their environments from ten data centers across the globe, the opportunities to solve the complex problems they present or to build the infrastructure they rely upon is endless—you choose which path you want to take. Put that genie LAMP away (pun intended)…this isn’t a wish, it’s the real deal.


Customer Facing:


A recent winner of Rackspace’s fifth Stevie Award from the American Business Awards since 2012, our DevOps Automation Services is setting the industry standard for DevOps while pushing the bounds of constant deployments and scalability to new limits. Without question this team requires masters of the LAMP stack and Chef gurus that can bend spoons with their minds. With customers like UnderArmour and MapMyFitness, custom requests for business critical applications are the norm while the solutions are always one-of-a-kind, cutting edge.


Internal Infrastructure:


Ten data centers around the globe with several hundred thousand servers that all need to seamlessly interact like one of your LAN parties back in college. If you like HUGE environments then jump on into this playground. Ansible, Chef, Puppet, Salt and whatever comes next. These are the toys of the trade and our DevOps Engineers always share their toys with our Software Developers, Infrastructure Engineers and Quality Engineers. This is a team sport, kids. Silo workers need not apply.


Now you’ve got a sample so come on a get some of what we’ve got cooking. Get it? Chef? Cooking… Whatever just hit the apply button already, talk with one of our talent specialists and start building a better future for you.


Still not convinced? See what the Rackspace teams are doing for our customers. MapMyFitness Story

item.title: Software Engineer - Server Applications at Curbside (Palo Alto, CA)
item.description: Responsible for designing and developing large scale distributed server applications, software API's, persistent data store and client/server communication architecture. Candidates must be familiar with distributed computing theories and have experience building distributed systems and client/server applications.

item.title: Full-Stack Web Developer at Stack Exchange (New York, NY) (allows remote)
item.description:
Come help us create the future of Stack Overflow and Stack Overflow Careers. We're looking for passionate, creative developers who are excited about solving new problems. As a full-stack developer, you'll work with everything from front-end HTML, CSS and JS to server-side C# and several different data stores including MSSQL Server, Redis, and Elasticsearch. We don't expect you to know everything coming in, so we'll pair you with mentors who will help you grow and develop your skills.


We want to hire the right person wherever you are in the world. If you’re in New York or interested in relocating to our office, you’ll enjoy some amazing amenities like private offices and in-house chefs. If not, we’ll help you create your dream office at home, wherever that might be.

item.title: Lead Mobile Games Developer (iOS/Android) at GameDuell (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Work in Berlin for one of the world's largest games websites and excite more than 125 millionusers with a "wow" experience

As Lead Developer, you will actively help to shape an exciting area of our company and will be the driving force in the development of our mobile and social games platform. You will work with our creative team of product managers, developers and marketing specialists as well as our graphic designers. 

Our commitment to high quality standards as a market leader is to develop the best games and to inspire our customers through an exceptional gaming experience. Unleash your superpowers!





Your Tasks




  • You will lead a cross-platform team (iOS, Android, Flash) alongside our Technical Director

  • You are responsible for the design and implementation of one game

  • Ensure that teams follow architectural guidelines and deliver high quality code

  • Identify weaknesses and optimize functionality and performance

  • As first contact person for technical questions, you guide development teams, transfer knowledge and coordinate communication between teams

  • Participate in concept development, review and pair-programming

  • Contribute to all phases of our development cycle (analysis, design, implementation, test)

item.title: Java Lead Developer at GameDuell (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
Work in Berlin for one of the world's largest games websites and excite more than 125 million users with a "wow" experience.

As a market leader, our commitment to high quality standards is to develop the best games and to inspire our customers through an exceptional gaming experience.




Your tasks




  • Integration of the unique GameDuell gaming experience into Facebook and mobile devices

  • Design and implementation of game-related backend logics

  • Create innovative solutions for managing game-related data on a massive scale

  • Involvement in all technical levels of game development

  • Implementation and expansion of our software

  • To ensure your team follows architectural guidelines and delivers high quality code

  • Knowledge transfer to the Scrum teams (which you are part of) through participation in concept development, reviews, coaching and pair programing

  • As lead developer, you will accompany the Scrum team over a longer period of time to improve quality and efficiency on a step-by-step basis

item.title: Platform (python backend) engineer at Lifesum (Stockholm, Sweden)
item.description:
We are looking for a product driven engineer, even with little documented experience. Our small team is international and diverse, so we are welcoming everyone


Focus will be on handling large amount of data in multiple formats, not all normalized, work with services integration (REST, OAuth, analytics, payment) and finally with algorithms for graphs (social, content relationship, ...), search and statistics.


Product-wise, you will be taking features from the idea stage to scalable production deployments. You will work on making highly scalable solutions, get feedback from analytics and monitoring tools and be able to refine and perfect your solution at each iteration.


Tech-wise, our server code is written in Python (Django) and you will be exposed to distributed computing (scalable stack, queue-driven distributed processing), cloud hosting (Amazon), database optimization (MySQL, Redis, MongoDB), search solutions (Sphinx, ElasticSearch), test driven development, load testing, etc.

item.title: ASP.NET MVC C# Software Developer 'Best Medium-sized Companies To Work For in 2014' Glassdoor at Paylocity (Chicago, IL) (allows remote)
item.description:
Delivering one-of-a-kind cloud technology, accompanied by award winning customer service, Paylocity is a software development company in a category of its own. We are a publicly traded company that offers an Employee Stock Purchase Program (ESPP) which enables employees to share in the long-term growth and future success of the company.


Poised to revolutionize the world of human capital management for hundreds of thousands of small and medium sized businesses, we are seeking the best and the brightest ASP.NET MVC / C# web development professionals.


Our lean development process enables our small product oriented teams to innovate, collaborate and bring amazing features to market.


Our talent anywhere philosophy nurtures a diverse and dynamic group of colleagues with a shared mission to make great products and have fun doing it.


Are you the teammate we are looking for?


How we work:



  • Small, self-sufficient product oriented teams with an entrepreneurial spirit. We don't add more folks to our teams, we add additional teams to scale.

  • Casual, collaborative, Agile environment which embraces and operates under our shared principles.


What we offer:



  • Annual training allowance, a license for Pluralsight, and a subscription to Safari Books Online

  • Vast market opportunity – which means more growth and opportunity

  • Lean enabling process that focuses on putting our developers in a position to succeed


Who you are:



  • Enthusiastic about developing the best software available and providing the ultimate customer experience

  • An advocate for continuous improvement of our software development process

  • Interested in staying current by applying new technologies

  • Able to work in a collaborative environment with a willingness to share your ideas

  • Able to work independently on modules and complete tasks with high quality, but unafraid to seek out suggestions from other team members

  • Excited to work on cutting-edge technology!

item.title: Senior UI Developer (JavaScript) at Bracket Computing (Sunnyvale, CA)
item.description:
Our management application is written in Javascript, and we've made a very large investment in Javascript code to support it.  Our product is built on a mix of Backbone.js and jQuery, and we strive for exceptionally clean and reusable code. This engineer has a solid understanding of MVC (model view controller) design, and has done user-facing products before. 


As a Senior UI Developer, you will be the bridge between design and engineering. You bring a solid understanding of JavaScript, HTML/CSS, and up-to-date knowledge of web standards.

item.title: Web Application Developer at SpotXchange (Westminster, CO)
item.description:
SpotXchange is the most transparent programmatic video advertising platform with more than 2.7 billion video auctions per day. We are seeking a highly talented Web Application Developer who can contribute brilliantly to our team located in Westminster, CO. We are a fast-paced but casual environment with highly talented peers. The most successful team members are versatile, disciplined and enjoy focusing on new challenges.


We don’t believe in “culture fit”. We believe in well qualified candidates who are genuine human beings and are pleasant to work with. Sure, we might share a beer at work or after work but you don’t have to. You just need to be a contributing member of our team who is thoughtful and wants to do quality work.


What your day-to-day will look like:


Developing new tools and technologies in the video ad serving space


Collaborating and problem solving


Work on a scrum team comprised of 4 to 5 developers


Participate in daily standup meetings and all meetings of the agile SLC: planning, estimation, retrospectives, demos, etc.

item.title: Growing Quantitative Trading Firm seeks Software Support Engineer at Old Mission Capital, LLC (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
Old Mission Capital is a fast growing quantitative trading firm. Technology is at the heart of what we do and we believe that combining carefully engineered systems with constant refinement of our strategies and execution is the basis for our long term success.


We are a small company of about 30 people, split about equally between technology and trading, with considerable overlap between the two. As a technologically driven firm, we have many systems to manage on a daily basis, from our large collection of custom written software, to various database systems, to terabytes of research data across a handful of file shares.  Our ability to organize, configure and expand this set of tools is what allows us to respond quickly to changing conditions, take advantage of new opportunities, and to expand our own understanding of the markets we operate in.


We are looking for someone to join us who will head up daily maintenance, configuration and organization of our tools and environment. You will work side by side with our developers, system administrators and traders, and will quickly become an integral part of our operations.


On a daily basis, you will be responsible for making configuration changes, troubleshooting production issues, and writing new code and scripts to automate management and configuration. As your knowledge of our systems and our markets grows, you’ll be bench marking and optimizing various systems, networks, and exchange interfaces, and will help manage and add to our research infrastructure.

item.title: Sr Site Reliability Engineer at OpenX (Pasadena, CA)
item.description:
Would you like to work on one of the world’s hottest advertising technology platforms? Do you revel in the challenge of managing web-scale services and their underlying infrastructure, including thousands of globally distributed servers? Do you enjoy combining your software engineering, networking, and systems administration experience and expertise to build highly available, reliable, secure, and performant services? Are you passionate about DevOps?


OpenX, a leading provider of digital and mobile advertising technology, seeks a Sr Site Reliability Engineer to join our Application Engineering team responsible for the operability and support of OpenX systems and services. OpenX serves hundreds of thousands of requests per second from thousands of servers across a worldwide datacenter footprint.


You will take a proactive approach to maintain and improve service uptime and you will scale our systems for continued rapid growth. You will take part in the design of our services and be an active participant in the software development lifecycle, partnering with software engineers and product to deliver a world-class service. Additionally, you will handle planned or unplanned maintenance events and will execute a consistent software release process.


You ideally have experience with large-scale management of thousands of physical servers. You have excellent communication skills that enable you to collaborate with varying disciplines, both technical and non-technical. You are a self-starter, able to self-manage with minimal supervision, and have demonstrated the ability to lead groups to the right decision.


Developing for and supporting our infrastructure presents many interesting technical challenges. We especially desire candidates with a passion for open-source software and an interest in the latest system architecture trends, for example: OpenStack, Docker, CoreOS, Dais, Flynn, or other container-based or PaaS solutions.

item.title: Software Engineer (Scala/Spark) at Sharethrough (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
We believe data should be tightly integrated into the engineering and product flow.  As a data engineer at Sharethrough, you’ll be expected to ship production code: from recommendation systems and real-time click prediction to our stream analytics and Scala- and Hadoop-based data pipe, all the way through to the models that power our real-time auction platform.


Let’s talk if…




  • You know Java and have always wanted to give that Scala thing a shot.




  • You’ve worked with big data processing systems and infrastructure - Hadoop, Spark, Storm, etc.




  • You derive deep satisfaction from participating in the problem definition and solution process with a diverse group from around the company.

item.title: Lead Software Engineer at OpenX (Pasadena, CA)
item.description:
The engineering team at OpenX is looking for Python experts to build and maintain high-performance distributed systems. This is a Lead Software Engineer role with emphasis on Python/Django.


OpenX solutions provide unique Software as a Service platform by combining ad serving and an ad exchange which includes Supply Side Platform technology. OpenX is backed by leading investors including Accel Partners, Index Ventures, SAP Ventures and Samsung Venture Investment Corporation.

item.title: Hardware Operations Engineer at Two Sigma Investments (New York, NY)
item.description:
Hardware Operations Engineer Position


We seek a sharp, detail-oriented and technically savvy hardware operations engineers to join our Systems team.  The Hardware Operations Engineering team operates and manages physical infrastructure of our data centers; including building and configuring servers, networking equipment, power strips and machines.  Responsibilities include:



  • Installation and configuration of data center hardware.

  • Build out next generation data center and co-location site.

  • Lifecycle management of hardware; such as servers and network switches.

  • Hardware troubleshooting and break/fix tasks.

  • Interface with data center facility providers, remote hands, and hardware vendors.

  • Design and implementation of physical infrastructure and rack design

  • Inventory management.

item.title: Software Engineer at Two Sigma Investments (New York, NY)
item.description:
We are seeking a diverse set of software engineers to join our team. With a group that includes a Unix Lifetime Achievement winner, Putnam medalists, ACM Programming competition finalists, and International Mathematics Olympiad medalists, we are always looking for new talent to join this energetic team of high achievers.


Our challenges require mastery of areas such as, but not limited to:



  • Kernel level development;

  • Machine learning;

  • Distributed systems.

item.title: STP Application Engineer at Two Sigma Investments (New York, NY)
item.description:
STP Application Engineer Position


We are seeking an application engineer to join our Strategic & Technical Projects (STP) team. You will work within a cross-divisional group and will consult with researchers and developers to drive a variety of projects impacting business-critical operations.


Responsibilities will span full project life cycles, from business requirements, design, and architecture to hands-on development. Past initiatives have included:



  • Designing and implementing firm-wide automated project portfolio management and metrics reporting tools;

  • Rolling out new trading and operations platforms;

  • Evaluating third-party vendor tools and products against in-house solutions to inform build vs. buy decisions.

item.title: Software Engineer - Houston, TX at Two Sigma Investments (Houston, TX)
item.description: We are seeking a software developer with innate problem-solving skills to join our innovative financial engineering team. In this role, you will develop and enhance financial software packages that enable and expand our world-wide trading operations, partner with users to determine requirements for software enhancements, write programs to connect software packages to internal and external data sources, and get a behind-the-scenes look at the financial industry as the veritable "mission control" of our business.

item.title: Tools Software Engineer at Two Sigma Investments (New York, NY)
item.description:
Tools Software Engineer Position


We are seeking a diverse set of software engineers to join the team responsible for software engineering productivity.


You will tap into your coding skills to tackle the following challenges:



  • Enhancing the tools we use to review, build, test, package, and release our software;

  • Collaborating with engineers, testers, analysts, and system administrators;

  • Leveraging your experience to effectively improve and automate the procedures that make up Two Sigma’s development iterations.

item.title: Technical Support Engineer at Edgewater Networks Inc. (San Jose, CA)
item.description:
Edgewater Networks is Hiring!


Location: San Jose, CA, USA


Company Overview


Edgewater Networks, Inc. (edgewaternetworks.com) is a leading provider of Enterprise Session Border Controllers that address the challenges to secure and deliver reliable enterprise Unified Communications including device and protocol interoperability, security and policy management, troubleshooting and QoS. With more than 150,000 systems deployed worldwide to enterprises, carriers, cable operators, service providers and partners, Edgewater shipped an estimated 21% of all enterprise session border controller sessions in 2010.


We are in an exciting, growing market and our technology is helping to build next generation networks capable of supporting real time IP based voice and video applications. You will join a highly motivated, experienced and results-oriented team developing truly innovative products that solve real problems.


We have a dynamic, entrepreneurial corporate culture that recognizes achievement and encourages creativity and self-initiative. We offer a fun and challenging work environment where you can make a difference everyday.


Tier 3 Technical Support Engineer.


We are currently looking for a Tier 3 Technical Support Engineer in the Technical Assistance Center (TAC) to provide technical support for our customers.


Activities include assistance with the installation, configuration, design and troubleshooting of converged voice, video and data networks involving Edgewater Networks products.


The Technical Support Engineer interfaces directly with customers using phone, web and email interfaces and works with other members of the Edgewater Networks development and support teams as needed to isolate and resolve problems. The candidate should be able to cope with the quick turnaround of cases and be able to multitask multiple issues at once.

item.title: Customer Support Engr. at VC-Funded Legal Software Startup at CS Disco Inc. (Houston, TX)
item.description:
As a customer support engineer at Disco, you will be a goto for all manner of customer-facing technical support for Disco. A normal day might involve:



  • loading new data into Disco (often writing code to massage the data into a proper format)

  • helping a customer with advanced search queries on the phone

  • assisting and training first-level support personnel on technical issues

  • identifying customer-reported feature requests and bugs (and testing/submitting them to engineering)

  • advanced technical training for customers and resellers


You'll get to work with some of the brightest people you'll ever meet, both at Disco and in our customer base (most often lawyers at major law firms working on very important litigation).


And at Disco, operations and customer support are a first-class department within the company. We strive to give phenomenal support to our customers every day, and staff the department with only the most elite people out there, giving them all the resources they could want to do their job!


This position is also compensated very well ($70K and up). Come work with some of the smartest people you'll meet (including the youngest-ever Harvard Law graduate and a Y Combinator graduate) working on very important problems at one of the fastest growing startups in Texas (recently secured $10 million in funding from Bessemer).

item.title: Web Applications Engineer (Rails+) at Sharethrough (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
As a full-stack engineer here you’ll contribute to everything from our 3rd-Party CoffeeScript deployed across hundreds of publishers like Time Inc. and Forbes, to our self-serve native content exchange with significant growth opportunities - from jumping into our Scala-based data pipeline and microservices to provisioning AWS resources with Chef.


Let’s talk if…


-You speak (or are interested in speaking!) our stack: Rails, RSpec, CoffeeScript, Backbone.js, HAML, LESS, etc.


-You take pride in treating software development as a craft and delivering SOLID well-tested code.


-You derive deep satisfaction from participating in the problem definition and solution process with a diverse group from around the company.

item.title: Distributed Systems Engineer (Spark/Scala) at Sharethrough (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Sharethrough is looking for engineers interested in applying new tools and techniques to tackle the problems of building large-scale distributed- and stream-processing systems.  As a Distributed Systems Engineer, you will work on problems ranging from architecting fault-tolerant micro-services to building out our low-latency decisioning engine responsible for complex predictive behaviour at thousands of requests per second.  All of this is powered by analytics captured by our streaming data pipeline, which you’ll also be building.


Let’s talk if...




  • You have experience with delivering multithreading and/or distributed JVM-based systems (Java, Scala, Clojure, etc.).  No experience with Scala?  Come learn!




  • You have experience with Spark and/or Spark Streaming or similar stream-processing systems.  Experience with Hadoop-based pipelines, maybe a bit of Cascading or Scalding?  That works too, come give Spark a shot.



  • What you’re building is as important to you as why you’re building it.  You derive deep satisfaction from participating in the problem and solution design with a diverse group from around the company.

item.title: Senior Back-end ROR (Ruby on Rails) developer at EchoStar (Superior, CO)
item.description:
Summary:


Dishanywhere com, a wholly owned subsidiary of EchoStar, in Superior, CO, is looking for a Senior Back-end ROR (Ruby on Rails) developer to be part of a talented team working on our Backbone.js/Ruby on Rails web application.


Responsibilities:



  • Working with the product owner, and the UI developer to define, design and implement new backend services for backend and mobile client for dishanywhere.com. 

  • Enhance existing features and perform tuning of code.

  • Design, implement and write unit tests for new backend services on dishanywhere.com. 

  • The backend end restful services will be implemented using Ruby and elastic search.

item.title: Web Developer - PHP & JavaScript at trivago GmbH (Dusseldorf, Germany)
item.description:
Join trivago in Germany and ride the wave of success with us. On our website, travellers compare prices of over 700,000 hotels worldwide from more than 200 booking sites. Over 45 million users visit trivago every month as an independent source of information to find their ideal hotel.

Do you want to help us deliver requests in less than 50ms? Are you constantly seeking new challenges? Then we are the right company for you! Help shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Work with top-notch technologies in a company that promises a unique work environment and fantastic career perspectives. Enjoy the freedom to question the status quo, to broaden your horizon and to develop new things!


Your tasks:



  • You are responsible for the development of our high traffic web applications (e.g. price comparison, community or B2B applications).

  • You demonstrate excellent technical skills while creating and implementing new website features.

  • You set up efficient and high performing database queries in MySQL.

  • You breathe new life into our front-end development utilizing event based and asynchronous JavaScript.

  • You keep an eye on new technologies to ensure trivago stays a trend setter and not a trend follower.

item.title: Front End Developer at Platingaming Ltd. (Ta' Xbiex, Malta)
item.description:
As a front end developer, your main responsibility is producing, modifying, maintaining user


interfaces in different platforms. These not only include websites and web applications but also


online games' interfaces. You need to work closely with our designers to convert Photoshop designs


into cross browser compatible webpages both for mobile and desktop environments. You also need


to implement fluid user interface logic communicating well with backend using Ajax or Websocket.

item.title: IT Sr. Engineer/ Manager at Edgewater Networks Inc. (San Jose, CA)
item.description:
Edgewater Networks is Hiring!


This position is based in San Jose, CA, USA


Company Overview


Edgewater Networks, Inc. (edgewaternetworks.com) is a leading provider of Enterprise Session Border Controllers that address the challenges to secure and deliver reliable enterprise Unified Communications including device and protocol interoperability, security and policy management, troubleshooting and QoS. With more than 150,000 systems deployed worldwide to enterprises, carriers, cable operators, service providers and partners, Edgewater shipped an estimated 21% of all enterprise session border controller sessions in 2010.


We are in an exciting, growing market and our technology is helping to build next generation networks capable of supporting real time IP based voice and video applications. You will join a highly motivated, experienced and results-oriented team developing truly innovative products that solve real problems.


We have a dynamic, entrepreneurial corporate culture that recognizes achievement and encourages creativity and self-initiative. We offer a fun and challenging work environment where you can make a difference everyday.


Job Title Information Technology Sr. Engineer / Manager


We are looking for an IT Engineer / Manager who will be responsible for day by day IT activities and company wide network infrastructure and operation. Should be well-rounded team player who will be working with team members and employees to deliver high quality in-house IT support for LAN/WAN network, IP Security, desktop / printer support, in-house and hosted server maintenance and hosted VoIP telephony support.

item.title: Java Software Engineer at Kareo (Irvine, CA)
item.description:
You'll be



  • Joining a growing team of tech heads who love building things with ones and zeros.

  • Working in a fast-paced work environment that sometimes fails fast and early, but always learns and improves.

  • Unshackled by conventional thinking and allowed to use cool tech to solve hard problems.

item.title: Manager of Software Test Engineering at Kareo (Irvine, CA)
item.description:
The gig:


We are looking for a strong leader to join our Quality Engineering Team. You will be working with cutting-edge technologies, highly-adept test engineers, and have the opportunity to create a first-class test engineering team. Our next testing guru should have strong management skills, solid understanding of testing methodologies, and Computer Science fundamentals including databases, algorithms and problem solving techniques.


What you'll do:



  • Manage and lead a team of bad-ass SDETs

  • As we grow, mentor and grow new test engineers 

  • Coach and align your team members to build a highly-scalable and reliable automation infrastructure

  • Execute the test strategy for several key features that power Kareo’s Medical billing software

  • Coordinate test plans between product management, engineering, and quality engineering to ensure we have the right tests – and that they are always running

  • Be an expert on our products from Use Cases down, down to API contracts to performance characteristics

  • Develop automation tests (unit, API, integration, UI, and load), test tools, and harnesses

  • Collaborate with other teams to review design/technical architecture and drive testability of our products

  • Help us ship high quality software- all the time!

item.title: Principal Systems Engineer at Kareo (Irvine, CA)
item.description:
Who We Need 


Multifaceted enterprise infrastructure engineering talent, the kind that other large web providers wish they could keep. Eat, live, and breathe continuous delivery and process automation. Must have a passion for DevOps, capable of meeting in the middle between operations and development, have an overwhelming need to conquer the world one bit at a time, and not afraid to reach new levels of awesomeness. Collaborative team player that is excited to work alongside some of the most talented resources in all of Southern California, maybe even the world  - we are working on an official award.


What You Will Do



  • Acts as the highest level of infrastructure support for all Kareo production systems/services

  • Plan, install, and maintain infrastructure components across multiple technologies (server hardware, storage, networking)

  • Maintain Kareo’s online services ensuring all incidents are tracked and remediated and changes are implemented under the auspices of Kareo’s defined policies and procedures

  • Provide exceptional technical leadership across a broad range of topics – load balancing, firewall design, LAN topologies, Linux architectures, virtualization (VMware, Hyper-V, etc.), scalability, security, and whatever else you can bring to the table that you know most places need.

  • Design, engineer, and automate across multiple open source and off the shelf technology solutions (software, hardware, mungeware…paying attention?)

  • Liaison with product development and engineering in a true DevOps role

  • Firmly believe that most things in life can be automated, it’s ok to love Puppet, Chef, PERL, Python, Jython, Bash, Java, .NET, Powershell, but must be adaptable to learn and support new technologies.

  • Enjoy mixing it up across different operating systems, storage, and network technologies.

  • Work hard to keep Kareo’s infrastructure up 99.9% of the time, and for you overachievers we have a special prize just for you.

  • Work extended hours when required under considerable pressure, including holidays and weekends if necessary to ensure operational compliance with Kareo service level agreements. Providing 24/7/365 support for all Kareo’s production services

  • Collaborating with others as we attempt to build another deathstar, well, maybe that was a bit over the top but that’s how we expect you to roll

item.title: Senior iOS Software Development Engineer (FTE), Cutting-Edge Mobile Team at Kalles Group (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Our Seattle client is seeking a software development engineer to help build next generation mobile applications. Their core innovation team is chartered with pursuing strategic opportunities which are difficult to address incrementally with existing systems, such as UI responsiveness and security, rich applications that span devices, new data-driven programming models, and effective use of sensors, GPUs, and multi cores.

The successful candidate is an experienced software development engineer who is passionate about building next generation mobile applications, enjoys start-up environments, and loves to code.  This world-class dev team is a small hand-picked team of developers passionate about building real systems that extend the current thinking in Operating Systems and Platform technology. This is a high visibility position with impact in product and technology incubation, in the company, and in the overall mobile devices market. Because this is an incubation group, a candidate must have a high tolerance for uncertainty and changes in direction. Expert proficiency in Objective-C is required, knowledge in C++ is a plus. Additional desirable, but not mandatory, skills include familiarity with asynchronous programming models, concurrency, data-driven UI frameworks.

What you get to do every day:



  • As a software development engineer, you will be building complex software that must be elegantly designed, cleanly written, and efficient when executing.

  • You will also be responsible for helping us break ground on new, innovative tools, and technologies from the chipset to user interface.

  • You will help define what goes into new mobile devices given latest trends, directions, and available features.

item.title: Mobile Software Engineer -iOS at TeleSign (Marina del Rey, CA)
item.description:
Are you an experienced iOS developer who is passionate about security and authentication? Do you have hands-on experience with iOS applications and SDKs? If so, then TeleSign is looking for you! We’re looking for a strong engineer to join our team to build client applications and SDKs in iOS.


This position reports to Director of Development and is based in Marina del Rey, CA.


Responsibilities



  • Work on TeleSign’s iOS authentication apps

  • Produce well designed and well tested production quality code.

  • Accountable for complete development process; design, development, testing, and deployment.

  • Participate in design and code reviews to help increase the quality of our products.

  • Pick best technology for situation.  The ability to tell the difference between cool and useful.

  • Ensure best practices for building secure software are followed.

  • Interact with Product Owner effectively regarding features and specifications.

item.title: QA Automation Engineer at TeleSign (Marina del Rey, CA)
item.description:
The Quality Assurance Automation Engineer will perform automated functional test creation and execution as well as performance test creation and execution and mentor others. You must be able to master complex business process flow in addition to design and execute robust and dependable testware for our applications. You should also be able to initiate “gray box” testing projects against Python applications.


Responsibilities



  • Developing tests and test plans.

  • Interacting with other engineers to understand the system under test.

  • Testing in both Windows and Linux environments.

  • Creating and executing automated and performance test scripts.

  • Evaluating responses from engineering teams on reported issues.

  • Overseeing release testing, product maintenance releases and new development projects

item.title: Network Engineer at TeleSign (Marina del Rey, CA)
item.description:
The Network Engineer is responsible for taking ownership over the day-to-day operations of TeleSign’s networking infrastructure ensuring proper functioning, upgrades, monitoring and security. Facilities to be supported include TeleSign’s corporate offices and several collocation facilities. In this role, the Network Engineer will be required to exercise strategy, discretion and judgment in designing, building and supporting computer facilities and communication networks. Additionally, this role will require experience and involvement to work together with System Administration team accomplishing the various tasks as they arise.


Responsibilities



  • Support fast, scalable, secure, highly available network infrastructure.

  • Implement, monitor and maintain networking infrastructure.

  • Configure, administer and monitor Routers, Firewalls, Load balancers and Network Switches and other Network devices

  • Analyze and troubleshoot all network and communication devices.

  • Tune and monitor application and networking infrastructure.

  • Perform Linux system administration tasks as required.

  • Provide regular status updates on projects and the state of networking infrastructure.

  • Provide technical guidance and training to other staff members within the organization.

  • Available on call as part of rotating 24/7 NOC team.

  • Primary contact for networking infrastructure during routine maintenance.

  • Assist the primary helpdesk support team with end client calls as a point of escalation

  • Manage vendors and service providers to assist with their products and services to ensure company needs are being properly met

item.title: Linux Systems & Database Engineer at PageFreezer Software, Inc. (Vancouver, BC, Canada)
item.description:
Key Responsibilities:



  • Manage the PageFreezer SaaS infrastructure

  • Take personal responsibility for the availability, scalability and reliability of our service.

  • Manage user accounts, creating, updating and removing access as necessary.

  • Constantly monitor and assess systems to make sure that processes are operating as designed and recommend / drive the necessary corrective measures if needed.

  • Troubleshoot errors and fix system issues via periodic testing, help desk tickets, and other methods.

  • Collaborate with other staff to ensure database integrity, security, and ongoing performance.

  • Manage and optimize databases (MySQL, Percona, NoSQL)

  • Manage and implement security management procedures

  • Support our existing production cluster management system while you improve it. Our current system is in Java/JSP/Spring, Python, MySQL, Debian Linux, shell for infrastructure management.

  • Manage and support hosted operations, able troubleshoot and identify the root cause/bottleneck with minimal supervision.

  • Provide support for deployment related issues.

item.title: Software Engineer: Cloud at Bracket Computing (Sunnyvale, CA)
item.description:
As a Cloud Engineer, you’ll be responsible for full stack feature development in Bracket’s management and cloud resource orchestration environment. Our backend is implemented primarily in Python, utilizes Django, and provides a RESTful api to our management interface. Our management interface is a single-page Javascript application that is built on our REST api.


Engineers working in this codebase should have a solid background in software engineering and CS fundamentals, and would be considered a software generalist.

item.title: Senior Cloud Architect at Bracket Computing (Sunnyvale, CA)
item.description:
Essential Functions:


Provide technical leadership in the areas of cloud infrastructure and operations


Work with product managers and other architects to define requirements and use cases for new cloud initiatives in the areas of performance/capacity planning, security, scalability, operational automation, SLA monitoring/reporting, regulatory compliance, and BR/DR.


Research the architectural underpinnings and strategies of best of breed SaaS providers and adapt them to RMS(one)


Find opportunities to increase efficiency and mitigate risk through process improvement and technology selection


Participate in the translation of architectures to implementation plans around infrastructure and operations


Participate in budgeting and financial scoping activities


Present to executive management and clients as required


Continually sharpen your own skills to be a thought leader in all aspects of cloud architecture


Get hands-on when necessary to demonstrate architectural concepts

item.title: Storage Engineer at Bracket Computing (Sunnyvale, CA)
item.description:
Bracket is looking for a senior software engineer well versed in storage technologies to help Bracket build storage solutions for the public cloud. This is a chance to work with industry experts and rethink how data is stored and accessed in a cloud environment.


Engineers working in this codebase should have a solid background in systems software engineering and CS fundamentals.

item.title: Software Engineer; C/C++ and Python at Bracket Computing (Sunnyvale, CA)
item.description: We are looking for mid- to senior-level engineers to join the Bracket Security development team and help us secure the public cloud. You will own one or more security features related to encryption, key management, or large scale system security, working directly with customers and our Product Management team to define and deliver future versions of Bracket.

item.title: The Force.com is strong with this one at Cloudreach (London, UK)
item.description:
Our ally is the Force, and a powerful ally it is.


The Force.com is what gives our Dev's their power. It's an energy field created by all living things. It surrounds us and penetrates us. It binds the galaxy together.


Don't be too proud of this technological terror you've constructed. The ability to destroy a planet is insignificant next to the power of the Force.com.


There is currently a great disturbance in the Force.com, and the Force.com can have a strong influence on the weak mind.


Remember, a 401 Dev can feel the Force.com running through him.


A 401 Dev uses the Force.com for knowledge and defence, never for attack.


A 401 Dev's strength flows from the Force. But beware of the dark side.


If once you start down the dark path to another company, forever it will dominate your destiny.


Strike me down and ignore this offer with all your hatred and your journey towards the dark side will be complete.


Now in order to move down the path of enlightenment write a java program no more than 20 lines long that will transform this html fragment:

<html><a title="bbb" href="http://www.google.com">Google</a><br/><a href="http://www.yahoo.com">Yahoo!!</a></html>

into this:

Google!: http://www.google.com


Yahoo!: http://www.yahoo.com



The Force.com will be with you . . . always

item.title: Frontend Developer at ParkWhiz (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
ParkWhiz is looking for a Frontend Developer with a passion for optimizing user experiences. We're in an exciting and rapidly evolving industry that requires constant innovation, evaluation, and iteration.  Help us perfect the parking experience.


You will be taking the lead on all frontend development, and have a great deal of influence over site and mobile UI and UX.


Some examples of things you'll do include:



  • Identify opportunities to A/B test potential site improvements, and implement them

  • Work with the Art Director to design site-wide refreshes, landing pages, email templates, then implement them

  • Audit the site on a mobile device to find and fix points of friction

  • Keep a UI pattern library and work with the rest of the engineering team to enforce consistent interactions

  • Work with the mobile developers to improve the time and duration UIs

  • Conduct hallway usability tests

  • Find and recommend new FE tools, plugins, and frameworks

  • Be the primary developer, shepherd, and guardian of our frontend frameworks

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Biamp Systems (Beaverton, OR)
item.description:
Senior Software Engineer


BIAMP Systems is seeking a highly motivated Senior Software Engineer with 5+ years of development experience on Windows platforms. Our products stand out in the industry as highly innovative, and have a complex but intuitive user interface that is fully customizable. A strong interest in developing a complex graphical user interface that enhances the customer experience is required for this position.


The Senior Software Engineer will join a team of dedicated and experienced developers, and will contribute to all aspects of software development. If you enjoy solving highly nuanced problems at a quick pace, if you’re an innovative thinker with a collaborative spirit and strong design skills, if you have experience building complex Windows desktop applications in C#, then we invite you to join us. Your well-rounded development experience and ability to work on complex presentation and system level features would be a welcome addition to our team. This is an opportunity to help continue Biamp Systems’ proud history of building innovative, high quality, and high performance software in a dynamic team environment.


If you enjoy writing world class user interfaces, working on complex algorithms, are interested in an active and engaged workplace, and want to help create cool products, Biamp is the place for you.


Position Responsibilities:



  • Collaborating with domain experts to understand user needs

  • Writing appropriate design documents and functional specifications

  • Providing estimates and completing work assignments on schedule

  • Working effectively in a dynamic team atmosphere


This position is available immediately. Submit your resume and cover letter.

item.title: Linux Administrator at Hudson River Trading (New York, NY)
item.description:
Working on the Systems team at Hudson River Trading (HRT) means working on a small and efficient group with broad responsibilities. We know you see "Trading" in our name and assume you'll be relegated to some dark corner to code for the "business" but this impression is entirely wrong. At HRT, a fully automated trading firm based in NYC, the computers you build and manage *are* our business, so it is everyone's job to make sure the systems team has everything they need to do their jobs well.


We are looking for all-star sysadmins who like being challenged, hate to climb corporate ladders, and don't mind the added bonus of having hard work rewarded through recognition and very competitive compensation. At HRT, sysadmins are integral to the success of our trading and research, and they know it. You can always expect to be challenged by the ever-changing financial markets, and find yourself working on critical projects in an extremely fast-paced environment.


Linux Administrators manage state-of-the-art servers and networking equipment in our datacenters. Responsibilities are broad and include hardware and software installation and configuration, tool development, automation, monitoring, performance tuning, testing new hardware and software, and planning changes. We are jacks-of-all-trades who can effectively multitask yet retain a high attention to detail that keeps our systems running as efficiently as possible.

item.title: Desktop Guru at Hudson River Trading (New York, NY)
item.description:
At HRT the systems team deals primarily with a large research cluster and unix servers and a low-latency global network for our worldwide trading operations. Additionally, systems is in charge of supporting the general IT needs of about 100 employees at HRT, who range from highly technical programmers with complex coding environments to very basic users.



We've grown a lot over the last few years, and we've also vastly increased the complexity of our desktop/laptop distributions. This role will focus on improving our automated build process for Mac/Windows/Linux machines, improving our ability to manage changes to configurations and deploy updates, and generally providing employees with an excellent end-user experience. We're looking for someone who has experience with Active Directory, enterprise Mac management, Linux, end-user support, and who can also take ownership of managing and improving our current processes.

This is a new role for us, and one with a lot of opportunity and freedom to take on more responsibility and make an immediate impact.

item.title: Python Developer at Hudson River Trading (New York, NY)
item.description:
Our Systems team is looking for a Python programmer with strong systems knowledge. We know you see "Trading" in our name and assume you'll be relegated to some dark corner to code for the "business" but this impression is entirely wrong. At HRT, a fully automated trading firm based in NYC, the computers you build and manage *are* our business, so it is everyone's job to make sure the systems team has everything they need to do their jobs well.


We are looking for coders who like being challenged, hate to climb corporate ladders, and don't mind the added bonus of having hard work rewarded through recognition and very competitive compensation. At HRT, sysadmins are integral to the success of our trading and research, and they know it. You can always expect to be challenged by the ever-changing financial markets, and find yourself working on critical projects in an extremely fast-paced environment.


Our Systems team manage state-of-the-art servers and networking equipment in our datacenters. We're looking for someone who can focus on tool development in Python, integrating with existing tools and building new ones to make our trading, research, installation, and monitoring systems more robust. Strong Python skills and development experience are required, along with general unix experience. This position includes an on-call rotation.

item.title: DevOps Engineer at VM Farms (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description: System Administration utilizing devops methodologies in a web hosting company is a challenging job, requiring both skill and resourcefulness. As a devops engineer you serve as the gatekeeper to the Internet for our clients, getting their web applications in production and ensuring they are always performing at their peek. You troubleshoot, respond to inquiries and find solutions to technical challenges. Along with the day-to-day, you contribute towards VM Farms ongoing drive for greater automation, which includes researching, planning, implementation and documentation. You are highly technical and are comfortable problem solving on a Linux platform and a range of automation and web-based technologies, such as Puppet, Chef, PHP, Python, Ruby, etc. You occasionally partner with various teams including development, management ,and vendors. You're a fast learner and great communicator who can support the system administration needs of our clients’ technical teams.

item.title: Front End Optimization Engineer at Sprout Social Inc. (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
Sprout Social builds world-class social media management software used 24/7/365 by names like Yammer, Twilio, McDonald’s and Urban Outfitters. This software is expertly crafted by some of the best software engineers in the industry. Our Engineering group is composed of teams for mobile, front-end, back-end, and operations.


We’re looking for an engineer who is focused on making our website and web application as fast as possible. If you open up your browser’s developer tools to analyze the waterfall chart of a slow loading site, then keep reading. We want an engineer who knows the difference between Time to First Byte and Time to Interaction and which is more important from a performance standpoint. If you’ve tuned a website to load the base HTML with less than 14KB of data, that’s a plus. You’ll also be auditing internal application code so basic understanding of a JavaScript MVVM framework is needed.


Responsibilities include:



  • Brainstorm performance enhancing ideas, present ideas to a team, and implement selected concepts

  • Design, develop and execute load testing scripts using modern standards

  • Help plan infrastructure that is needed to A/B test performance-related changes

  • Analyze performance testing results and provide actionable recommendations

  • Design and develop software features based on visual mockups or user stories

  • Demonstrate a deep appreciation for good design

item.title: Software Engineer - Full Stack at Sprout Social Inc. (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
Sprout Social builds world-class social media management software used 24/7/365 by names like Yammer, Twilio, McDonald’s and Urban Outfitters. This software is expertly crafted by some of the best software engineers in the industry. Our Engineering group is composed of teams for mobile, front-end, back-end, and operations.


But you…you break this model.  You consider yourself a polyglot who is eager to contribute code across the tech stack. As a Full Stack Developer, you will define and implement a RESTful Django API endpoint and also write the Backbone.js code that interprets and renders the API response. You’ll work with fellow engineers, product managers, and QA, to build web application features and the underlying server-side code. While doing all of this, you should have an eye towards writing optimized code.  You are eager to pioneer our new full stack model and idea.


Responsibilities include:



  • Develop new product features, front to back (i.e. JavaScript to Python)

  • Be a major individual contributor of coding on the team

  • Design and develop software features based on visual mockups or user stories

  • Deliver production-ready, maintainable code in a timely manner that is performant, optimized and tested

item.title: Software Engineer in Test at Sprout Social Inc. (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
Sprout Social builds world-class social media management software used 24/7/365 by names like Yammer, Twilio, McDonald’s and Urban Outfitters. This software is expertly crafted by some of the best software engineers in the industry. Our Engineering group is composed of teams for mobile, front-end, back-end, test/QA, and operations.


The Software Engineer in Test role is critical in Sprout Social’s success as it is responsible for accelerating delivery, increasing quality and tackling some of our most difficult problems.  SETs create scalable and efficient test automation, verify performance against real-world scenarios and data, and create specialized testing tools for use throughout the diverse Sprout stack.  This role works closely with every part of the Sprout Engineering team, giving exposure to a broad set of technologies, people and challenges.


Responsibilities include:


Primary



  • Design, implement, and maintain test automation systems for continuous integration

  • Work with manual testers to evaluate test cases for inclusion in automated regression tests

  • Work with manual testers on automation tests of newly developed features

  • Develop toolsets to augment QA and developer testing

  • Assist in performance and scalability testing

  • Collaborate with product engineering when specialized testing tools are needed

  • Work closely with front and back-end engineers for support and code review

  • Work with front-end and back-end engineers to insert certain automation at appropriate times during coding, code review and deployments; specifically ensure a defined set of tests are run before code deployment

  • Work with QA and Engineering leadership to ensure that coded scripts align with business goals/objectives for Sprout

  • Gather and present metrics related to test automation, ensuring deviations from standards and procedures are made visible in a timely manner

  • Maintain our automated test library and perform routine checks to ensure that scripts are current


Secondary/Additional



  • Train and mentor others on the test automation framework and test scripts

  • Ensure any automated tests created by others meet standards

item.title: Software Engineer - Performance and Scale at Sprout Social Inc. (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
The Role and The Team
Sprout Social’s Performance and Scale Engineer will be like a physical trainer for the Sprout platform: you will evaluate and make improvements to keep our large, diverse tech stack happy, healthy, and, most importantly, fast. You'll work up and down our back-end stack - from our RESTful API through to our myriad data systems and into the Java services and Hadoop clusters that feed them - searching for SPOFs, performance issues, and places where we can shore things up.


Here’s a little about us: Our Engineering group is composed of teams for mobile, front-end, back-end, and operations. This role is part of the back-end team, which we call Platform. You know, the group who builds and maintains the services that power our products. On Platform we design and build for scale, reliability and product agility. That means picking the right tool for the job while being pragmatic and scrappy. We build services in Python and Java using technologies like Cassandra and HBase, Memcache and Redis, Scribe and Storm and Finagle, and, of course, MySQL. Above all, we believe bad software penalizes the user and great software gets out of the way.


Responsibilities include:



  • Work on all aspects of performance, availability and scalability at Sprout

  • Seek opportunities to improve Sprout from the hardware and network upward

  • Build and improve monitoring systems (Zipkin/New Relic/statsd/Nagios)

  • Advise project teams on architectural approaches during the creation of new products

  • Bring vision in the form of technology recommendations, ideas and approaches

item.title: Product Designer/Developer at Sprout Social Inc. (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
The Role and The Team
Sprout Social’s Design team is a dynamic, creative group of professionals, and we are looking for a Product Designer/Developer. You will collaborate daily with Product Managers, Software Engineers and other Designers to push new products and enhance existing products at a very fast pace. This role is very technical and requires strong HTML, CSS and JavaScript fundamentals.


Responsibilities include:



  • Work with other designers to implement markup on high-level concepts

  • Take ownership on projects and see your work through the production phase under minimal supervision

  • Serve as a liaison between Design, Experience, and Engineering

item.title: Senior Android Mobile Architect at GEICO (Chevy Chase, MD)
item.description:
GEICO – a proven online, mobile and industry leader -- seeks a highly collaborative, experienced Senior Android Mobile Architect to join our growing mobile team. With more than 2,000 people working in IT at GEICO, not only are we a top employer for tech pros, we’re also at the cutting edge of our industry. We’re utilizing emerging technologies to drive results, enhance our customers’ online experiences, and impact bottom line results.

As a team member to our Architecture team, you will be responsible for overseeing and driving application design for the GEICO mobile apps. You will work with iOS, Android and Java development teams and architect peers to implement solutions, provide guidance on overall architecture and design and enforce the use of best practices and standards across mobile platforms. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in evaluating and recommending architectural solutions resulting in successful application implementations.

item.title: iOS Software Engineer at Sprout Social Inc. (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
The Role and The Team
Sprout Social's Mobile Engineering team is searching for a developer to continue building our award-winning, universal iOS app. You will take us from good to great (moving from 4.5 stars in the app store to the full 5) while continuing to thrill the 2k daily users who rely on the Sprout iOS app. Conceptualize, build, and improve our iOS app and take pride in every line of code you write.


Here’s a little about us. Our Engineering group is composed of teams for mobile, front-end, back-end, and operations. In iOS, we build features that match and complement our web-application so that customers have a seamless experience wherever they consume Sprout. Our iOS engineers are responsible for building new features that are innovative to the mobile experience, are performant, and are reliable with any type of network connectivity.


Responsibilities include:



  • Be a major individual contributor of coding on the team

  • Design and develop software features based on visual mockups or user stories

  • Monitor the mobile ecosystem for iOS changes and innovative apps that can be leveraged internally for performance or user experience improvements

  • Extend testing capabilities by writing unit tests, creating integration tests and assisting in QA testing during development

  • Ensure reliability by always taking into consideration performance and different network connection scenarios

  • Prototype user experience concepts prior to new feature implementation

  • Demonstrate a deep appreciation for good design

This job will be a great learning experience! As the lead mobile developer, you will work directly with the founding team to develop the product on a technical level. You will collaborate with hardware and algorithm developers while working with and leading all facets of the mobile development process. We are a wearable device company building a hardware/software platform. 


You will have the opportunity to shape longer term software and product development.

item.title: Full Stack PHP Developer for Fast Growing, Agile Team at Issuer Direct (Morrisville, NC)
item.description:
We’re a rapidly growing, technology-first financial services company looking for a talented full stack PHP developer who is interested in joining our agile Software Development team.  We constantly evaluate new technologies and integrate them into our technology stack.  All of our software is developed under a loosely coupled architecture, enabling individual projects to use the best technology available for their purpose.


Are you a self-starter who wants to work for a fast-growing business?  If you are interested in a fast-paced work environment with the opportunity to see your work paying off, then apply today!
