item.title: Ruby on Rails Developer at Mercaris (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
Working at a startup is stereotypically super long hours, pizza parties and terrible pay. We aren't really in to stereotypes. We don't have endless deathmarches, a bottomless icebox of features we don't remember why we're building, or particularly long hours. Everything we build is because we made sure it was solving a problem for our customers. Every member of the team wants our company to succeed, and our customers companies to be better because we were there for them. We aren't doing a good job if you aren't excited to come to work with a great group of people every day. Oh yea, we offer competitive pay, great benefits and equity too. 


Mercaris provides market data reports that help our customers make critical business decisions. We get our data through ongoing customer trade surveys and auctions. These products are built on a Ruby on Rails platform, and now that we've got happy, paying customers and raised a Series A, we are looking to expand our development team to take our products to the next level.


Upcoming projects include upgrading our reporting system from fixed to customizable reports, upgrading our auction system to live trading, a graphic and UX design overhaul, putting more tools around build and testing, building a dashboard that can track delivered features to customer metrics to make sure we are always improving our customer's experience.

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer, Windows at Cylance (Irvine, CA)
item.description:
At the heart of Cylance Product Development is our state of the art threat detection system. Unlike traditional approaches, Cylance does not rely solely on signatures or even pre-determined behaviors to determine if something is known to be good or bad. Instead, we have developed a mathematical approach to identifying advanced threats. This intelligent system evolves in real-time as new threats emerge, providing continuous detection.


We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to help contribute to the design, creation, and testing of our cutting edge cybersecurity platform. You'll design architectures and interfaces, and write high quality, secure code and unit tests. You're a Windows expert, a Security expert or a Kernel expert; and we want you on our team. Do good. Make a difference.

item.description: We are looking to hire a UX Designer who wants to create great applications and user experiences. This position will work across all product lines and be involved in both web and mobile app development. This is a great opportunity to hone your craft and make a profound impact on the applications Sonian is building.

item.title: Sr. QA Automation Engineer at Cylance (Irvine, CA)
item.description:
At Cylance, solving the world’s most difficult problems is our mission.  At the heart of Cylance Product Development is our state of the art threat detection system.  Unlike traditional approaches, Cylance does not rely solely on signatures or even pre-determined behaviors to determine if something is known to be good or bad.  This intelligent system evolves in real-time as new threats emerge, providing continuous detection.  Come join our dynamic and energetic team!


SUMMARY



  • Contribute to the Automation of SQA Engineering team activities

  • Actively test/validate/verify/automate Cloud application and web service API

  • White box testing / verification of our Cloud threat classification system

  • Develop, execute, and maintain test cases within an Agile SDLC from business requirements for Cylance products

item.title: Senior Cloud Software Engineer - Full Stack at Avigilon (Billerica, MA)
item.description:
Avigilon’s Cloud Services Group is seeking an experienced software developer to participate in the development of an online system to configure and mange security cameras and devices remotely with technologies relating to data mining and visualization, embedded systems, distributed systems, mobile and cloud application development.



Responsibilities include: 



  • Build a scalable architecture that interacts and processes video and data from thousands of security cameras and devices

  • Design and implement scalable multi-threaded object oriented features in C# for our cloud platform to manage cameras and devices

  • Collaborate with product teams to integrate devices with the cloud platform

  • Research, evaluate and assess new products and technology



    • If you have a code repository or portfolio of your work, please include the link in your submission. Principals only, please, no recruiters.

item.title: Full Stack Developer at Enflick, Inc. (Waterloo, ON, Canada) (allows remote)
item.description:
Way back in 2009, two University of Waterloo grads created Enflick with a mission to deliver a better messaging solution that would empower people to stay closer with their friends and family.


Today, TextNow and Touch Mobile, the company's two core products, are in the hands more than 40 million users worldwide and continue to grow exponentially.  We are the world's first all IP, cloud based, mobile phone carrier. Building clever systems and weaving technologies across platforms is what drives Enflick's growth. Of course we'll take good care of you during your time with us, but the excitement lies in our work. Work with us and impact the millions of people who rely on our products. If you want to change the rules of the game then we want to hear from you!

item.title: Senior Software Developer at INTEGRATED Healthcare Strategies (Kansas City, MO)
item.description:
We’re looking to add a talented, creative and experienced developer  who would thrive in a energetic and fast paced consulting firm.   Join our team for the opportunity to work on varied and challenging projects working directly with the consulting practices and senior leadership to develop solutions that support the company’s growth and success.


The Senior Software Developer manages technically diverse and complex software projects throughout the organization. This role serves as an active member of the IT team and key contributor to the analysis, requirements definition, design, construction, integration, testing, troubleshooting and maintenance of legacy and customized business and web applications.


You will be responsible for:


Analysis and Design



  • Communicate and consult with business areas to understand their business challenges and identify the right technology solutions and software improvements for them.

  • Analyze system and business specifications for the development of web-based applications and related sites.

  • Evaluate and analyze client computer system needs and ensure proper articulation of scope, architecture, development and documentation over a broad range of web and enterprise software projects.

  • Ensure code is developed in a manner that is efficient, scalable and provides high-availability and high-impact design features.

  • Author technical design documentation that fully defines all application code and the underlying methodology for the design decisions made.

  • Provide accurate resource estimates, timelines and forecasts for development activities.

  • Review and verify code accuracy and documentation of other team members.

  • Develop and assist with system customizations, implementing process work flows, deploying custom plug-ins.


Development



  • Develop applications according to functional and technical design specifications.

  • Use and enforce best practices for code repositories and version control management.

  • Create efficient, scalable, reusable logic using department approved languages and technologies.

  • Create intuitive, logical and dynamic user interfaces.

  • Thoroughly test version releases and code changes prior to deployment.

  • Create and design databases, views, stored procedures, queries and user-defined functions of varying complexity.

  • Manage underlying server and database infrastructure with regards to administration and performance tuning.

  • Assist in continual improvement of software configuration management process.

  • Coordinate activities of 3rd party software/web development resources, when needed.

  • Maintain awareness of development trends and technology improvements and capitalize on opportunities.

  • Create and maintain current documentation of customized applications and activity including development requests, changes and time/effort expended.


Maintenance



  • Oversee, assess, troubleshoot, document, upgrade and develop maintenance procedures.

  • Review and troubleshoot code for potential performance issues, reusability, and/or anomalies.

  • Troubleshoot customer problems both remotely and onsite.

  • Research and identify cause of reported defects and issues.

  • Develop patches and defect fixes.

  • Perform, direct and assist with quality assurance activities.

  • Provide training and customer support activities.

  • Prepare progress reports summarizing development activities, identifying potential risks and mitigation strategies.

  • Prepare custom reports for business areas by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information including progress, risks, and trends.

  • Provide as-needed after hours and weekend support for business and web applications.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Lob.com (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Lob is building a suite of APIs for the enterprise. Our most popular API is our print and mail API that enables companies to send physical mail as effortlessly as sending emails. We are growing our customer base and product offerings quickly and are looking for talented senior software engineers to join our team and shape the future of Lob. As a senior member of Lob’s engineering team, you will have the unique opportunity to drive the product roadmap, define engineering best practices, and create great products on a modern infrastructure.


Responsibilities:



  • Design and create new API product offerings from the ground up.

  • Improve upon existing API offerings to offer our users the best possible product and experience.

  • Architect and develop systems that are scalable, maintainable, and secure.

  • Tackle challenging problems in distributed systems, cloud computing, API design, and more.

Remedy Partners is seeking a Front End Web Developer who will be responsible for writing standards-compliant front-end code for websites, web applications, and mobile solutions using HTML, CSS and JavaScript. This individual will collaborate openly with other members of the team, including Interaction and Visual Designers, as well as Product Managers, Technical Developers, and QA. They will focus not only on the code, but also on the way users interact with the things we create. Front-end technology has evolved to the point where it can shape the user experience, and we are passionate about finding ways to do that.

  • Support various range of web browsers and devices.

item.title: Technical Business Analyst at ArcheMedX (Charlottesville, VA)
item.description:
We’re looking for a Technical Business Analyst (who loves data) to join our Product Management and Operations team. This position will help to conduct data analysis of ArcheMedX-powered education and shape the features and functionality of our next generation e-learning delivery and analytics platform.


In this role, you will define product requirements, perform complex data analysis, drive the inclusion and acceptance testing of new features in product releases, and provide end-user support.


This position requires close interaction with multiple stakeholders and team members, including the product team, operations team, partners / customers and end-users.

item.title: Software Engineer / Developer at iQagent, inc. (Alpharetta, GA) (allows remote)
item.description: iQagent is looking for a career minded mid-senior level software development professional to work in our Alpharetta, Georgia location. As part of our product development and integration team, you will have the opportunity to hone your .NET skills daily, as well as to learn or expand your experience with the latest Microsoft Mobile platform, XAML, IOS/iPhone/iPad, Android and other technologies and platforms. You will contribute ideas on new products and features as well as develop solutions to current challenges. Your efforts will contribute directly to our current success with award-winning and patented apps designed for the plant floor. You may also have the opportunity to travel in the US as well as Europe to our end customers and integrate and extend our product using ASP.NET and other Microsoft web technologies. Boredom is definitely NOT part of the job position: there are always many parallel projects and efforts that will require your attention. Our focus is to provide a challenging and rewarding position with growth potential and opportunity available to those who contribute to our success.

item.title: Enterprise Software Engineer at Denodo Technologies (New York, NY)
item.description:
YOUR OPPORTUNITY 


Love to deal with multiple technologies in complex environments? Want to create the solutions you envision for the largest organizations in the world? Ready to advise the modern software engineering practice on pioneer projects?


We invite you to materialize your aspirations in a company where opportunities abound for building an amazing future, where discovering the value and potential of a new technology, Data Virtualization, will be the beauty of your daily routine.


Our customers span all market segments and geographies. And we partner with leading and reputable companies across the globe. This combination makes Denodo a fun and exciting environment to work. A place where your work will have an impact. A place where you're invited to push the boundaries of possibility.


Primary location for this position is New York (NY, USA) but experienced and proven candidates will have the ability of working remote/telecommute.


Join an international team in pursuing mastery, value and success in a global environment.


ABOUT THE JOB


Denodo is always looking for technical, passionate people to join our Services Engineering team. We want a professional who will travel, evangelize, consult, develop, train and troubleshoot to enhance our clients’ journey around Data Virtualization.


Your mission: to help people realize their full potential through accelerated adoption and productive use of Denodo solutions.


In this role you will successfully employ a combination of high technical expertise and client management skills to conduct on-site and off-site consulting, product implementation and solutions development in either short or long-term engagements being critical point of contact for getting things done among Denodo, partners and client teams.


Product and technical knowledge:



  • Obtain and maintain strong knowledge of the Denodo Platform, be able to deliver a superb technical pitch, including overview of our key and advanced features and benefits, services offerings, differentiation, and competitive positioning.

  • Constantly learn new things and maintain an overview of modern technologies.

  • Be able to address a majority of technical questions concerning customization, integration, enterprise architecture and general feature / functionality of our product.

  • Capable of building and/or leading the development of custom deployments based and beyond client’s requirements.

  • Provide timely, prioritized and complete customer-based feedback to Product Management, Sales, Support and/or Development regarding client’s business cases, requirements and issues.

  • Presentation and organizational skills:

  • Train and engage clients in the product architecture, configuration, and use of the Denodo Platform.

  • Know when and where to escalate within the Denodo technical organization, and make effective use of those resources.

  • Promote knowledge and best practices while managing deliverables and client expectations.

  • Customer engagement:

  • Manage client expectations, establish credibility at all levels within the client and build problem-solving partnerships with the client, partners and colleagues.

  • Provide technical consulting, training and support.

  • Develop white papers, presentations, training materials or documentation on related topics.

item.title: PHP Python software developer at Uniregistry.com (George Town, Cayman Islands) (allows remote)
item.description: Uniregistry.com is an exciting domain name company located in The Cayman Islands and Newport Beach CA. We are the registry operator for dozens of exciting new name extensions like .SEXY, .PHOTO .LINK .. We're the newest retail domain name registrar and the fastest growing secondary marketplace for domain names at our DomainNameSales.com division. We require an senior PHP, Python, Javascript, JQuery, Mysql/Postgresql, Git wizard to help us grow our secondary marketplace and integrate it with our registrar.  This is going to be an exciting journey with a company doing great things in an interesting high growth business. In the process we are going to change the way the next 100 million people buy and use domain names!~

item.title: Full Stack Developer at Sony Music Entertainment (New York, NY)
item.description:
The Full Stack Developer, Digital Production role is responsible for coordinating and executing the development of digital tools for Columbia Records' artists and the label as a whole. Digital tools include official websites, web apps, splash pages and other marketing tools such as contest pages and email templates. The Full Stack Developer will work closely with all internal departments, be in direct contact with artists and artist management, and collaborate with outside designers/firms to create innovative and effective digital content. Responsibilities also include mentoring and managing the technical development of the Developer, Digital Production.



  • Lead the development of websites and digital tools, which includes working with and managing the needs of artists, artist managers, label representatives and internal/external creative and technology teams

  • Communicate regularly and fluidly with all project members. Provide accurate, complete, and consistent updates on project road maps

  • Utilize emerging technology, including APIs, SDKs, plugins, etc. to develop unique, engaging, and cutting-edge digital tools with optimized UI for all digital devices types

  • Strong understanding of user experience design and usability principles

  • Ensure adherence to established Sony Corporation security and quality assurance standards and guidelines


Do you love music? We do too... and that's why this position focuses on working on creative projects for our impressive Columbia artist roster, working closely with artists and artists' managers. This isn't your typical behind the scenes developer role. We are looking for someone who wants to jump right in, roll up their sleeves, and help us continue to create amazing work.

item.title: Support Engineer - Great Opportunity for Growth into Development Role at Axomic (New York, NY)
item.description:
Our Support Engineers:



  • Aren’t your typical technical support folks. You aren’t telling people to refresh their browser or where to click. It is much more technical than that.

  • Develop scripts to migrate client images into OpenAsset

  • Script custom InDesign and PowerPoint templates that integrate with OpenAsset

  • Help our clients use our REST API to integrate OpenAsset with other solutions

  • Troubleshoot server side, end user and code base issues

  • Own and manage client support tickets through to resolution and to the client's satisfaction

  • Communicate clear and concise answers to complex technical questions

  • Work closely with OpenAsset Account Managers to maintain client satisfaction

  • Identify areas of improvement within the product and communicate them to the product development team


Great Opportunities for Growth



  • Our Support Engineer position is the gateway to the technical side of our company. In fact, we are recruiting this position because we are transitioning a great Support Engineer to our development team.

  • Interested in joining our awesome development team? The Support Engineer role is how you get your foot in the door. Our VP of Engineering, VP of Technical Operations and most of our software and operations developers all started out as Support Engineers.

  • Interested in growing into a leadership position within our customer facing Account Operations team?The Support Engineer role is a great place to start. You’ll learn the ins and outs of the product and our client base.


What technologies do we use?



  • The OpenAsset System (our amazing product) is a web-based LAMP/WAMP product. The front end is HTML5, with heavy use of ReactJS, Flux, and jQuery.

  • .NET/C# is used in a number of places, from server side processing to desktop plugins and API test code.

  • Data is stored in a MySQL database.

  • We have mobile apps for iOS (Objective-c and Swift) and Android.

  • OpenAsset is currently an on-premise solution installed on a client server, but we’ll be releasing our Cloud offering using Amazon’s AWS infrastructure in early 2015.


We offer:



  • A competitive salary

  • 20 days paid time off per year + federal holidays (UK style!)

  • Great health benefits

  • Commuter benefits

  • A fun office with casual dress code and open fridge (free fruit, soda & other beverages)

  • All this within a world class company, with a proven track record in the design, implementation and delivery of industry leading digital asset management solutions.

item.title: PHP Developer (full stack, Drupal focus) at GiantGoat Web Development (Guelph, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Can you wrangle Drupal views and content types with one hand tied behind your back? How about getting that messy pile of client data cleaned, loaded, and displayed on a map with charming bubbles? What about building an e-learning system from registration through to courses, quizzes, and completion certificates, all inside Drupal? Can you do all of that with the systemic, high quality approach required by public sector clients?


Come work at GiantGoat and help us make Canada a Drupal-er place! We are launching five Drupal 7 sites in the first half of the year followed with two brand new Drupal 8 project launches in the second half of 2015.  Our growth plan for 2015 is rolling out fast, the time to join GiantGoat is now!


GiantGoat has built a small team of highly skilled individuals, so bring your A-game and be prepared to wear many different hats. Every day brings exciting new challenges and we're looking for people with the right skills to tackle them with us.


You'll be focusing primarily on the down-and-dirty construction of our projects - ensuring things are architected and built right!

item.title: Senior Java / Scala Developer at BioDiscovery (El Segundo, CA)
item.description:
Spend your time working on projects on the cutting edge of human health and disease. These are projects that will **make a difference** in people’s lives. BioDiscovery is a leader in the field and you will be challenged by developing solutions to both scientific and technical problems that have immediate impact on human health. You will have the satisfaction of knowing that your contributions will be put into immediate use at leading top-tier academic institutions, cancer centers, and biopharmaceutical companies who are in pursuit of better diagnoses and treatments for disease.


What we are looking for
----------------------
We are looking for a talented software engineer to join our experienced development team to create new products for the genomics market.  Our technology development ranges from native desktop applications to scaled enterprise systems.  A biology background is not required as the technical team is complemented by a scientific team of PhD-level biologists and bioinformaticians. A solid technical education is, however, important (computer science, engineering, hard sciences, etc).  While we have no specific criterion for "years of experience", the type of developer we are looking for would possess "senior" level skills.  We are genuinely looking for knowledge, skill, and ability.


What's in It for You
--------------------
These keywords will give you an idea of some of the technologies or like-technologies that we use in our products and stack: Scala, Java,  Python, Bash, Linux Shell (Bash, etc), cloud computing, AWS Amazon Web Services, application servers, Jetty, NoSQL, REST, Git, SVN, algorithms, computational biology, bioinformatics.

item.title: Senior Front-End Developer at ArcheMedX (Charlottesville, VA) (allows remote)
item.description: We’re looking for amazing JavaScript application developers who love crafting cutting-edge user experiences. You will play a key role in transforming the way healthcare professionals learn online as we develop the next generation of the ArcheMedX learning delivery and analytics platform.

item.title: Associate Software Engineer at Dart Container (Mason, MI)
item.description:
The Associate Engineer position is the first level of Engineer in the Engineering Department.  This level is for the newly degreed engineer who is hired with no or very little work experience.


The focus of this position is to apply knowledge, skills and abilities while learning and receiving information about the company, procedures, processes, and environment at Dart and applying it appropriately.


Specific Duties:



  • Collaborate as a productive member of project teams (with a mentor as necessary) and lead projects of limited size and scope.

  • Learn and demonstrate Engineering Professionalism and Dart VCPs in customer-related interactions actively work to do exactly as the customer requests, and provide efficient service to internal and external customers.

  • Schedule daily activities to complete assigned tasks, communicate and document requisite information while following established Dart policies and procedures (with assistance as needed).

  • Demonstrate fundamental technical knowledge for the resolution of process and equipment problems, implement basic solutions, maintain data and verify the results.

  • Perform control system or software design, including hardware and software design, implementation and deployment.

  • Assist in coordinating and deploying new software or systems releases.

  • Develop knowledge of processes, equipment, and raw materials.

  • Participate in troubleshooting and analysis of problems to learn to identify, evaluate, and implement solutions.

  • Receive and review process and product requirements, work with suppliers to obtain information and quotes, and generate specifications.

  • Work with other personnel in Engineering and other departments to improve equipment, processes and products.

  • Document and track technical changes and/or improvements.


Dart Container is an equal opportunity employer and will consider all candidates for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, marital status, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

item.title: Data Scientist at Melinae, Inc. (Hoboken, NJ)
item.description:
We are looking for immediate help - 20 hours minimum per week - in some intersection of the areas of data engineering, software development, and machine learning guided algorithm design. A large portion of our work is spatially (GIS) oriented, so any experience working with and analyzing spatial data is a strong plus. Fluency in Russian is also a tangential but strong plus.


As a small team, we are looking for people who are willing and able to be multi-faceted contributors.  As such, we have broken down the qualifications we are looking for into 4 buckets – Modeling, Data Engineering, Software Development, and GIS Analysis – and are looking for people that have deep knowledge in at least one area with the ability to contribute in others.

item.title: CONTRACT Junior Designer/Illustrator at Maark (Boston, MA)

Maark is seeking a Junior Designer/Illustrator to help create branded interactive experiences for a variety of clients across many verticals. The Junior Designer works closely with art directors and creative directors to execute on the team’s vision and create final designed assets for our clients. Final designed assets can include user interfaces, infographics, and marketing materials for websites or presentations. The Junior Designer should be confident creating their own graphics, illustrations, and icons with direction and guidance from art directors. * Translate sketches into finished designs

item.title: Senior Backend Search Feature & Platform Developer at Salesforce (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Senior Backend Search Feature & Platform Developer

Like the limelight? How does the opportunity to shape the experience of over a billion interactions a month sound? The Search team at salesforce.com is looking for exceptional Developers to help us build the underlying search features, infrastrucutre and APIs that help us redefine and build the User Experience across all of our products, whether it be on the desktop, tablet or mobile device. 

Ideal candidates are experienced, full stack engineers with a passion for pushing the envelope of search technologies and features, but also not afraid to roll up their sleeves and get in the trenches with our UI Development to make sure that the features work at Salesforce Cloud scale end to end. 

If you are excited by the opportunity to work with a world-class technical team, to deliver a highly-evolved search solution, and see your work delights millions of users, then we want to talk with you.

Responsibilities:



  • Be a Full stack Superstar - Architect, design, and implement features at scale that go from the db to search index through the search stack and then finally to the UI for our desktop, tablet and phone applications

  • Understand and optimize how features you build interact with the Salesforce Infrastructure

  • Value team excellence over individual productivity

item.description:
The Network Platform Engineering team is a dynamic, global team delivering and supporting technology infrastructure to meet the substantial growth needs of the business and is essential to deployment of all new equipment and upgrades to hardware and software.   Our network automation team is essential to development of automation of consistent and stable infrastructure, and the deployment of all new equipment and upgrades to hardware and software.   In this role, you will be a critical part of owning, driving & delivering network automation solutions to the broader network engineering organization customizing our existing toolset & expanded our tools portfolio where necessary.   

Successful candidates will be someone who is not only a network engineer, but will also possess a proven ability to develop automated solutions at scale within a matrix team environment.

  • Provide input into long-range networking requirements and operational guidelines, with a focus on automation and improving the performance and reliability of the network and the overall service.

  • Partner with network organization to understand the operational automation requirements and their impact on the network.

  • This role will be expected to do hands-on work, either coding or other concrete scrum team deliverables, and will be held accountable to those.

  • Some travel may be required

item.title: Search Architect - SOLR at Salesforce (San Francisco, CA)

Software Engineer, SOLR Team

Ideal candidates are experienced, hands-on search software architects who can deliver innovative solutions to real world challenges.

If you are excited by the opportunity to work with a world class technical team to deliver a high traffic, high performance, highly evolved search solution that satisfies millions of requests a day and delivers an experience that delights millions of users, then we want to talk with you. 

Responsibilities:



  • Lead efforts across teams to design and implement major pieces of the salesforce.com end-to-end search experience.

  • Lead by example as a hands-on developer, contributing high quality, production ready code and providing detailed feedback in design and code reviews.

  • Work closely with the rest of the technology leadership team, including development, quality engineering, product management, and technical operations to establish our technical strategy and communicate it to the executive team and externally.

item.title: Senior Devops Engineer - SCM at Salesforce (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
DevOps Engineer – SCM

Source control is a cornerstone of R&D Operations at Salesforce. The R&D SDLC here is highly robust with a packed pipeline. The SCM team needs to drive and enhance the mission critical application. The team collaborates with thousands of customers/users spanning multiple departments, time zones and whose skill sets may be technically-focused or business-focused.  

The successful candidate must enjoy communicating with the customer base, have the ability to develop and drive training material and demonstrate a clear appetite for customer success. This is a dynamic position that allows the candidate to hone skills in automation, architecture and administration.  

You will use your experience to increase productivity for the development team, as well as research, design and implement solutions that make our product release process seamless on the Salesforce platform. You will create and maintain technical documentation used by the team to understand product release management process, best practices on Dev/QE environment signups and how to access test or signup automation tools. You will also increase effectiveness of our build and release cycle by developing and continued tracking of metrics around the product release process.

Responsibilities:
This team is responsible for a multitude of functionality surrounding the Perforce/GIT Infrastructure including:



  • Lead team in transition from Perforce infrastructure to a Perforce and GIT infrastructure

  • Systems monitoring

  • Systems Analysis & Administration

  • Service Orientated User Experience, Outreach and Communication for internal customers

  • System documentation

  • ETL of log files for capacity planning and systems analysis

  • Crafting Disaster Recovery (DR) and High Availability (HA) strategies

  • Defect Tracking Integration

  • Performance Analysis and Capacity Planning

  • Process Engineering

item.title: Lead Software Engineer in Test - Platform - Apex at Salesforce (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Lead Software Engineer in Test - Platform - Apex

Our Force.com platform lets you implement a large percentage of your business logic using point-and-click declarative features such as workflows and approval processes. But sometimes you need more control than these features provide for. That's when you can leverage the power of Apex Code.


Apex is an object-oriented programming language that allows developers to write custom business logic on the Force.com platform. Apex is a strongly-typed, object-oriented programming language that lets you centralize and execute flow and transaction control statements on the Force.com platform in conjunction with application calls to Force.com APIs. Using syntax that looks like Java and acts like database stored procedures, Apex lets you add powerful custom business logic to most system events.


We push the boundaries of enterprise scale by processing and running billions of transactions each month. Learn more about our Apex code HERE.

item.title: Extraordinary Angular / Hybrid Mobile Developer at Clevertech (New York, NY) (allows remote)
item.description:
About You


You are in love with Web and Mobile Development (even though your friends don’t approve);


You are comfortable with node.js and angular.js and love trying out new languages, frameworks, libraries, and leveraging them off, whenever necessary.


You’ve been developing Hybrid mobile apps for at least three years;


You understand the advantages of Native vs Hybrid and vice-versa;


You’ve previously worked with, know famo.us or are willing to learn it;


You love challenges and solving them;


You know when to ask more questions and where to look for answers;


You understand the advantages of working remotely, and have a good internet connection and some quiet space to video chat or share your screen to do some pair programming;


You are ok with working at least 4-5 hours in EST time.


About Clevertech


We at Clevertech help companies (mostly startups) hatch and grow to reach their ambition.


We’ve been doing that for over 13 years and have over 35 developers, scattered all over the world working together.


Our clients have been featured in the NY Times, Forbes, TechCrunch and Mashable. You can see (our CEO) Kuty Shalev’s presentation at Lean Startup Conference http://goo.gl/MsTcp or go to our websitehttp://www.clevertech.biz to learn a bit more about us.


We have a ton of work from amazing companies who are starting up and testing the market with their ideas, and we help them find out if its worth pushing ahead or try to find something else.


Some of our clients have raised money and have been featured in the press. Others have successful, established businesses. Some discover that its worth trying something else.


We use the latest technologies — our focus in is full-stack JavaScript. Node.js + AngularJS + PostgreSQL/MySQL (+ MongoDB + Redis + Solr/Lucene as needed).


We also love to contribute to Open Source. Check out our GitHub @ https://github.com/clevertech


About the Job


If you think we fit each other, reach out with some recent work and tell us a story about your ambition and how working with us will help you achieve it.


This is a full-time, fully remote, 8h/day, 40h/week, 160h/month offer.


Note for US residents: this is corp-2-corp (1099, not W2).

Do you want to join a team of 300+ professionals working on the future of secure, mobile payments? An established company that’s still hungry (and growing) like a start-up? An industry leader who processes over $10 billion annually from nearly 100k merchants? Read on for more details.

item.title: Intermediate Software Developer at Big Viking Games (London, ON, Canada)
item.description:
The nitty-gritty:

The London, ON studio is on the hunt for a highly motivated individual with an eagle eye for detail that thinks, eats, and dreams in code. You’ve got a strong knowledge of HTML5, Javascript, Java, Node.js, AS3, and PHP, and for you, awesome code means it’s as beautiful as it is functional and efficient. You have a range of high-quality projects under your belt and you excel in solo and team settings. You’re a big picture thinker who can analyze technical requirements and make sure deadlines are met on time. 


The Duties:



  • Design, program, test, optimize, and support an array of web and mobile games from start to finish. Your projects are your babies.

  • Work on various titles and related engines from implementing web interfaces using HTML5, CSS3, AS3, and Javascript, to writing server code using PHP & Java. There is no coding task you can’t handle!

  • Work collaboratively with fellow Vikings from our art & design teams to bring projects to life that shine, inside & out.

  • Identify system issues, anticipate problems, provide estimates, and implement solutions. You’re the Justice League of developers. That’s right. The whole league.

  • Engage in design reviews and discussions to provide feedback. After all, identifying a problem is the first step to solving it.

  • Write functional documentation for projects as necessary. Organization makes every Vikings life easier.

  • Research and stay ahead of the pack on emerging web and game development news and tech. Who said Vikings aren’t well-read?


The Loot:



  • Competitive salaries with generous time off policies

  • Health, dental, vision, life and disability benefits

  • Employee stock option plan; this way we all get to celebrate in the success

  • We are proud to be self-funded because this allows us to work and deliver the projects we are proud of

  • We frequently celebrate hitting milestones after work or even in the middle afternoon by going to paintball, movies, Canada's Wonderland, and a patio to name a few in addition to various in-studio events.  All work and no play makes for a dull Viking.

  • Stocked kitchen, breakfast & hot catered lunches daily! Viking can't work on an empty stomach.

  • A gaming lounge with competition grade foosball, Street Fighter 2 Classic Arcade Machine, XBOX 360 & PS4. Kick back and relax or dominate your fellow Vikings (in a totally HR friendly way).

  • If you cannot live without caffeine like us, we have an arsenal of freshly roasted coffee beans which can be crafted into great coffees, espressos or lattes just for you!

  • Free in-studio registered massage therapy. Viking muscles need love too.

item.title: Lead Software Developer at ThoughtWorks (London, UK)
item.description:
We are looking for passionate developers & engineers who care about software excellence. We want people who are aware of latest trends and know how to adopt the most appropriate technology. We're looking for people who are strong advocates for best engineering practices and love learning new skills. Our current positions require significant experience and the ability to shape a new client engagement, coach other team members and provide technical leadership - but our flat organisational structure means you'll be someone who is unconcerned with titles and hierarchy. What really excites you is problem solving and delivering innovative technology that carries real business value. There are opportunities to make an impact beyond your day-day project too - our consultants regularly speak at conferences, get published and provide thought leadership as experts in software delivery.


As a Lead Developer at ThoughtWorks, here's what you can do:


  • Work on large-scale, custom-designed, multi-tier, enterprise-level software development projects using Java, Ruby and/or .NET

  • Lead teams software engineers

  • Be responsible for the quality of software and resolving any issues regarding client satisfaction

  • Be a mentor and role model to less experienced developers

  • Employ Agile development including task estimation, test automation, deployment automation and Continuous Integration to improve overall execution speed and product quality

  • Travel the world.

  • Learn something new everyday

  • Speak at conferences. 

  • Write blogs and books.

  • Start new offices in places you’ve never been before

  • Think through hard problems, and work with a team to make them reality.

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, transparent, non-hierarchal, and ego-free culture where your talent is valued over a role title

  • Develop your career outside of the confinements of a traditional career path by focusing on what you’re passionate about rather than a predetermined one-size-fits-all plan

item.title: Lead DevOps at ThoughtWorks (London, UK)
item.description:
(Okay, so we know DevOps is a movement and not strictly a role .. )


ThoughtWorks is synonymous with innovation. We’re a diverse community of bright and passionate individuals striving to have a positive impact on the world. We’re dedicated to the art of software delivery, by keeping it lightweight, Agile and open-source. Our clients are organisations with ambitious missions, where we deliver complex enterprise systems. We help our customers to adopt DevOps best practices, break out of rigid, traditional ways of working and move to more customer-focused and agile approach. We currently have multiple positions for experts in the DevOps field to join us in London.  As a DevOps consultant at ThoughtWorks you are responsible for ensuring that the team and client have an understanding of the infrastructure needed, take a shared responsibility for setting up the build pipeline and collaborate on automating the provisioning of cloud infrastructure where applicable. There are a lot of moving pieces to fit together so communication is essential to ensure stuff is not missed. You will be depended upon for advice regarding the cross-functional aspects of user stories which may not always be obvious from the start. Watching out for performance bottlenecks and scaling pitfalls are all within the realms of a DevOps consultant at ThoughtWorks. In addition to technical skills, at ThoughtWorks we also need excellent coaches so your patience and a desire to take others along with you is absolutely key. If this sounds appealing then we want to talk to you!

item.title: Mobile Developer for Travel Startup at Triposo (Berlin, Germany) (allows remote)
item.description:
We’re looking for engineers that share our passion for travel and who believe in our mission: to make the best travel guide. If that description fits you, we’re sure you will be excited by what we offer.


Code with the best


Our team consists of very talented engineers, with great coding skills and years of experience working for some of the best companies in the world, including Google. For anyone who loves to code, it will be great to work with us.


A creative environment


We don’t sit in an office all day. We like to get around and work where we are most creative. This can be at home, or in an internet café down the street, or at our HQ, in Berlin, one of the most exciting cities in Europe and a real hub for startups. Everyone who starts working for us, will work from Berlin for the first couple of weeks to get to know the company culture, but has a big amount of freedom to choose where to work from. Regular stays in Berlin will be part of everyone’s schedule, as will our Jamborees: a week of coding in an exciting location with our whole team. We’ve been in Amsterdam and Marrakech and are planning a Jamboree in Budva.


Be part of the adventure


We’re building something special. A smart travel guide that understands who you are and where you are and uses that information to come up with inspiring suggestions on what to do now. We think it’s a great adventure to try and build the travel guide of the future. If you agree, send us an email.

item.title: Java Developer JAVA, .NET, Spring, RabbitMQ, JavaScript at Totaljobs Group (London, UK)
item.description:
The Totaljobs Group, the UK’s largest and fastest growing online recruitment advertising business is currently recruiting for Java Developer’s to join our cutting edge technology team.


This is an opportunity to work on a new product with some very talented engineers. The team will be given freedom to explore and innovate solutions to some very tough and interesting big data challenges. The team will be autonomous and have everything you will need to deliver successful products.


Our core architecture is based on JAVA / .NET / Spring / RabbitMQ / JavaScript running out of AWS. However we are not tied to any of these and we are looking for people who are quick to adapt to the best tool for the job at hand. We would expect you to be happy coding in at least 2 or 3 languages.


Ultimately you will be part of a team that will control the destiny of this product and as such, should be the type of engineer who is not afraid to voice their opinions as well as accept those of others.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer in Test at iRobot Corporation (Bedford, MA)
item.description:
iRobot delivers innovative robots that are making a difference in people’s lives. From cleaning floors to disarming explosives, we constantly strive to find better ways to tackle dull, dirty and dangerous missions—with better results.


iRobot is seeking a Senior Software Engineer in Test.  This software test engineer will create test plans and define test approach, lead and execute test efforts and help enable automated test developers by working with the software development team to design and implement software test approaches/mechanisms as well as develop and automatetests for continuous regression testing.  A successful candidate will have a passion for quality, testing, delivering great products – all, while inventing the future. 


Software Test (SWT) – Mission Statement -- Plan and execute software focused testing to quickly identify defects early in the development and integration process, reduce regression and configuration testing time through automation, and confirm that the product functions as intended.



  • Develop and enhance automated tests and frameworks.

  • Influence software design to maximize testability and automation potential.

  • Work side-by-side with developers and functional testers to create test specifications from user stories/requirements and transform selected tests into an automated test suite.

  • Triage defects and effectively communicate parameters to developers for rapid reproduction and fix.

  • Develop test plan and procedures for testing new products and sustaining efforts.

  • Install / setup of test environment.

  • Prioritize automation and manual efforts.

  • Effectively communicate results and issues to developers, managers and program through direct communication, use of bug tracking system, triage abilities, etc.

  • Provide mentorship and coaching to test execution resources for running tests (manual and automated), collecting results.

  • Promote and implement automation capabilities throughout the entire software development lifecycle including, functional, performance, scale and stress.

  • Lead software test effort for individual products.

item.title: .NET Software Engineer to Join a Small, Innovative, Consulting Team at Vitreo, LLC (Philadelphia, PA)
item.description:
I’m looking for a developer with C# and ASP.NET experience. I run a small distributed consulting team, but am hoping to find someone local (Philly/Northern Burbs) to do some co-located work with me, as well as work-from-home. This would be a full-time, contract position with an initial 6 month term, and potential to extend or hire beyond that. Rate is negotiable, primarily based on experience.


This is a unique opportunity to join a small team of passionate coders and problem solvers, and do a variety of work, much of it with modern and leading-edge technology, though there are certainly some legacy applications to maintain and improve. Our goal is to keep the systems of our clients from becoming outdated while extending and improving them, so we are continually refactoring legacy code and moving toward a service-oriented


The right candidate will be a self-motivated, continuous learner who is always looking to improve in their work, but also recognizes that “perfection is the enemy of good (enough).” If you’ve spent your own time dabbling in alternative languages, tech, and/or tools, but felt stuck in your day job doing the same old thing, I’d like to talk to you!


Experience with C#, ASP.NET, and Microsoft SQL Server is required. Other desirable skills are listed below. Please let us know what other relevant skills or experience you may have. Accountability and good communication skills are important since our team is distributed.


If you are interested, please reply with a short note about why you think this may be a good fit for you. Please include your resumé, and have references available upon request.

item.title: Software Engineers (to work in Python/Django) at Fusionbox (Denver, CO)
item.description: At Fusionbox, the engineers work on tasks that span from server provisioning and system administration to server-side development to JavaScript fronted interface developing. We use git, Puppet, nginx, Postgres, memcache, Django, Backbone, AngularJS, Ember.js, and React--but we are always open to trying out new things. In addition to working on client projects, we have our own portfolio of open source projects that the engineers maintain.

item.title: Software Engineer - Mobile, Backend & Tools at Pocket Gems (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
As you know, the mobile games industry is marked by rapid growth and incredible potential. Problems we're currently working on include: Optimizing our code and algorithms to give our players the best possible experience even on low end devices. Advancing our 3D engine rendering and animation tech to achieve novel look and feel that’s optimized for mobile. Fault tolerant real time synchronous multiplayer networking that provides a smooth playing experience on mobile networks. 


At Pocket Gems, we're making the great games of tomorrow by building our own proprietary mobile technology today. This includes: - 3D game engine (Amber 3D)  - Synchronous multiplayer (Bloodstone Multiplayer)  - Backend and game server (Geode Server) - Character creation and scripting language (Sapphire Story)

item.title: Software Engineer, Application UI Infrastructure at Salesforce (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The Application UI infrastructure group is looking for an exceptional Software Engineer to help us build the foundational UI technologies that will deliver the next generation user experience for Salesforce.com. The position requires not only rock solid UI development skills, but also a background or interest in creating tools, frameworks, and libraries for other developers to build upon. 


Responsibilities:



  • Be a UI Superstar - Architect, design, and implement shared user interface components and technologies to help power our next generation mobile and desktop user experiences.

  • Value team excellence over individual productivity

  • Have a passion for quality and writing clean, solid, readable code that scales and performs well

  • Analyze, design and develop test cases and implement automated test suites

  • Contribute to the analysis of functional requirements

  • Participate and promote architectural initiatives, balancing long-term velocity with short-term customer needs

  • Salesforce.com will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.

item.title: Full Stack Engineer - Node.js/Backbone.js/React.js at DataHero at DataHero (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Mission:


At the same time that the big data push has been happening over the last 10 years, there has been another transition happening - which has the potential to be more seismic to the industry - and that is the movement of data to the cloud.  Data is becoming decentralized as workers increasingly rely on SaaS-based services for everything from CRM to marketing automation to source code repositories.  Today’s business users have direct access to more data in more places than ever before, and are demanding self-service tools to get insights from their data.


Our mission is to help ordinary users find insight into their data that may be scattered across multiple different SaaS services through smart visualizations and intelligent systems.


Work:


You will work on providing intuitive smart visualizations and interactions, work on building a scalable compute & service engine that allows people to share these great visualizations to the world, build an optimized data ingest framework with custom connectors and data decoders, and build state of the art machine learning and recommendation systems that will enable DataHero to recommend the best visualizations for the users.


You will be one of the early engineers that will make a key difference in the outcome of the company - doing whatever it takes to get the job done, while working alongside with smart & passionate people.

item.title: Experienced Python/Django developer needed for awesome teaching position at RocketU (San Francisco, CA)

We are RocketU, the only San Francisco based full-immersion code school working with the Python/Django stack. We have a great opportunity for an experienced full-stack Python developer who wants to take a hands-on role in shaping the next generation of web developers.


As a RocketU Staff Instructor you would:



  • Lead daily curriculum lectures for our 12-week intensive class

  • Provide 1:1 instructional help to our highly motivated students

  • Contribute to the iterative development of the best curriculum in the field


 This is a contract-to-hire position located in downtown San Francisco, with the initial term starting January 5th 2015 and lasting for 3 months. To apply for this opportunity, please forward your resume and cover letter to Wes Bailey, General Manager of RocketU at wbailey@rocket-space.com.

item.title: Game Developer at fast-growing healthcare technology startup at Jintronix (Montreal, QC, Canada)
item.description:
Jintronix is a fast-growing venture-backed startup that’s redefining the field of physical rehabilitation through motion capture technology. Our system allows patients with poor mobility to engage in fun, gamified rehabilitation from the comfort of their own home, all while being guided remotely by their clinician online.


If you are an exceptional programmer with a passion for game development and working on life-changing technology, Jintronix wants you to join our team.


This is a full-time position at our office in Montreal, QC, Canada.


Responsibilities



  • Work on all aspects of patient-facing Kinect v2 game software in Unity/C#

  • Engage in a highly iterative development process that is fueled by feedback and learning from customers & leading experts in the field


Requirements



  • 2 years professional programming experience or equivalent skill level

  • Strong object-oriented design, architecture skills and some experience with C#

  • Experience in the design and implementation of various game systems

  • Ability to contribute to all aspects of development on a multi-disciplinary team


Pluses



  • Unity3D development experience

  • Passion for video games and game design

  • Experience with Kinect or other motion controllers

  • A degree in computer science or related field


Benefits



  • Build impactful games that are redefining the field of physiotherapy

  • As a small and collaborative team, you will shape all aspects of game development from game concept and design to completion

  • Extensive health, dental, and vision coverage

  • Generous vacation and personal time off policy


To apply, please email your cover letter, resume, URL, and/or work samples to careers@jintronix.com

item.title: Lead Android Developer at bop.fm (Y Combinator Summer 2013) at bop.fm (Y Combinator Summer 2013) (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:

Here's the preview video that we showed at LeWeb 2014: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=57Ojw9ZMr0Q


Lead development of bop.fm's Android app. Full-time, on-site (no recruiters please).

item.title: Full Stack CakePHP Developer at Symphosize, LLC (Phoenix, AZ) (allows remote)
item.description:
Symphosize is a company that started out to help serve super small businesses with really high-end technology. We believe that by bringing world-class tools to super forgotten businesses we have the most opportunity to do something worthwhile, and also grow like crazy.


Right now we have one full-time, full-stack developer who is really talented and would love to have a partner in crime. We have 2 pretty big projects going and are looking to bring on someone to help us to move faster...


Project #1 started a few years ago. It is a bidding & proposal tool that revolutionizes the outbound service industries we have targeted including automated follow-up and reporting on how to close more jobs within individual businesses.


Project #2 is a really awesome job application tool. We would have loved to use it for this particular job opening, but since the bugs are bound to create more frustration than it would solve... but it's getting closer every day! This tool would allow businesses to be able to disrupt the whole online form system by being able to ask questions in the form of video or text and respondents would be able to use video to text to respond. It will make the whole application process much smoother and flow directly into the interviewing process.


We need developers who can help us to scale this business quickly and in a really fun way since our roadmap is so incredibly long. 


At this point every developer needs to be a "full-stack" developer since we are still so small. Everyone will be doing back-end work, front-end work and even a bit of dev-ops for a while. We're pushing hard to get to where development will be more segregated, but since the position we are hiring for will be able to say they were here back in the day when you had to know everything... we gotta hire that person.


A culture fit is most important for us.


And we are a startup...


So if you have another job, we won't have our feelings hurt. But we are looking for someone who can help us to cross the gap that we're crossing right now and wants to see this thing through to the long-haul.

item.title: QA Engineer at Peerlyst (Colorado Springs, CO)
item.description:
About us


Peerlyst is a network of security professionals, including some of the top CISOs in the business.  Our goal is to make our members’ jobs easier by giving them a place to find and compare security solutions – and learn from their peers’ real-world experiences.  Peerlyst is the place where security pros can instantly connect with each other, rate and learn about products, securely collaborate on projects, grow their expertise, and discover new career opportunities.



We’re just getting started


Our vision is a future where information is more transparent and security projects become simpler and faster.  We are working with information security’s best and brightest to help transcend the fragmented security market and protect enterprises around the world.



Currently, we are in need of a QA Engineer.  This position will be located in Colorado Springs, Colorado.

item.title: Junior Software Developer at Plaxis bv (Delft, Netherlands)
item.description:
To stay on top and to reach even more customers we keep enriching and improving our software every day. We are looking for talented new employees who want to work with us towards reaching this goal.
For our Development Team we are looking for a Junior Software Developer (1,0 FTE)


 PLAXIS applications are used to create and manipulate models of soil and structures (for example foundations of high rise office towers, tunnels, dikes). They offer diverse functionalities, such as: highly interactive CAD-like graphical user input (both 2D and 3D), command-driven model manipulations, geometric calculations, intuitive visualization of calculation results and interfacing with finite element kernels developed by the scientific team. Each application is built by a project team consisting of developers, quality engineers and scientists, which makes for a stimulating and informal working environment. 


Job description


As a junior software developer, you participate in the development of our software with the support of a senior team member. The innovative nature of our products requires an agile and pragmatic mindset, in addition to attention for high quality and usability - you are interested in these aspects and want to contribute to maintaining and improving our performance in these areas.


You will be part of the team responsible for:



  • core library code shared between the 2D and 3D product lines

  • geometry handling code (intersections, preprocessing for the mesh generator, etc.)

  • user interface design and development

  • general maintenance and bugfixing in the existing codebase

  • development of tools that integrate with or drive the main Plaxis products

item.description: Be a part of a fast-paced development project building out a new cloud-based registration software line for continuing education providers.  Challenge yourself to participate in the complete product life-cycle from initial requirements, design and development to product maintenance and customer support.

item.title: Entry/Junior-level C#/ASP.NET Developer at Advise Technologies (New York, NY)
item.description:
We’re looking for a sharp developer with one solid enterprise experience (1-2 years), or a recent CS graduate with a great project/intern record, to join our seasoned dev team here in NYC. The ideal candidate will have a skill for tough puzzles, a talent for communicating complex ideas simply, and a drive to meet high expectations with great software. If you’re interested in working on a large-scale n-tier application, but need a bigger challenge than the average enterprise experience can offer, we’d like to talk to you.


Advise Technologies is a successful and fast-growing vendor to the private fund industry. Our flagship regulatory application is a complex n-tier platform built on the Microsoft stack: .NET 4.0/4.5, C#, WCF, SQL Server 2012, WinForms, WPF, ASP.NET MVC. The platform is metadata-driven, so the problem solving is intense, and our fierce attention to both tech- and product-side details means a fantastic opportunity for developers to grow.


Responsibilities



  • Collaborate on development of new data-driven application features and behaviors

  • Integrate with and maintain existing code base using industry and firm best practices, including source control (Mercurial/Kiln)

  • Participate directly in the complete SDLC, working closely with our product, QA, and legal teams

  • Build smart internal tools to streamline platform development

  • Learn and work with independence, merge with an established dev team with decades of collective experience building best-in-class enterprise software

  • Deliver under pressure
