item.title: Senior Systems Engineer at NORC at the University of Chicago (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
NORC at the University of Chicago is seeking a senior systems engineer to join our Infrastructure and Systems Operations team. The successful candidate will play a lead role in enhancing and maintaining a unique service offering – NORC’s Data Enclave enables secure remote access to sensitive social science data for a diverse population of analysts and researchers. The technology involved includes Microsoft Windows and RHEL servers, VMware, Citrix, thin clients for remote access, multiple enterprise storage arrays, a Vertica High Performance Analytics cluster, a Hortonworks Hadoop cluster, and several applications enabling data reduction and statistical analysis. The senior system engineer will lead projects that improve systems availability, performance, capacity and functionality. He/she will provide ongoing technical support to the user community, coordinate users’ access to resources, and interact directly with senior program management on systems operations, project status, technical issues and future vision for the Data Enclave service.


Responsibilities


Design, configure, and support the technology platforms of the Data Enclave environment. Build and maintain servers on both physical and virtual platforms. Assist with the development and implementation of server standards, procedures, and guidelines for the production platforms. Coordinate and manage system upgrades and perform maintenance tasks. Develop recommendations and solutions for upgrades and improvements to ensure a stable, available, protected environment and a competitive service offering. Work closely with program management and the user community to improve and expand capacity of existing systems and develop new features and applications. Diagnose and resolve system problems. Must be willing to learn new technologies and adapt to a fast paced environment.

item.title: Windows Cloud DevOps Engineer at eFolder (Atlanta, GA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Are you ready for your next big challenge? eFolder has an immediate need for an experienced Windows Cloud DevOps team member. We are growing exponentially—join our passionate team as we deliver mission-critical cloud services to businesses worldwide and help thousands of channel partners build successful businesses based on the services we deliver.


You will be responsible for designing and maintaining our technology stack that powers our large-scale Windows Cloud services, designing our systems to handle growth of many orders of magnitude quickly.


NOTE: This is a remote position based out of a home office.

item.title: Intelligent, Creative and Curious Software Developers Wanted at Waterfield Energy (Tulsa, OK)
item.description: As a Software Developer, you'll design/implement software solutions based on customer needs and requirements.  Our developers work together to build and support our web-based software applications.  Software developers play an active role in the evolution of the product.  You’ll have the opportunity for rapid growth within a fast growing, high-tech, oil and gas software provider.  No two days are the same - you'll never stop learning and growing. You'll have the autonomy to make important decisions while receiving support and guidance along the way. You bring your intelligence, creativity and curiosity; we'll teach you the rest.

item.title: Software Engineer - Platform at Sprout Social Inc. (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
In this role you’ll design, build, maintain and scale our backend services, the lifeblood of our products. You’ll be expected to design and code high performance, high scale systems, in collaboration with senior engineers on the team.


Here’s a little about us. Our Engineering group is composed of teams for mobile, front-end, back-end, and operations. This role is part of the back-end team, which we call Platform, the group who builds and maintains the services that power our products. On Platform we design and build for scale, reliability and product agility. That means picking the right tool for the job while being pragmatic and scrappy. We build services in Python and Java using technologies like Cassandra and HBase, Memcache and Redis, Scribe and Storm and Finagle, and, of course, MySQL. Above all we believe bad software penalizes the user and great software gets out of the way.


Responsibilities include:



  • Design and develop software features based on visual mockups or user stories

  • Maintain the features you are responsible for. Strive to fix problems before customers notice by using heartbeaters, monitoring, cron tools, etc. Monitor them routinely for issues that haven't yet occurred like scaling/growth.

  • Take ownership of any step in the software development process, from design through maintenance

  • Deliver high quality code while working and communicating in a team environment

  • Contribute to the infrastructure that the team leverages for local development

  • Extend testing capabilities by writing unit tests and assisting in basic QA testing during new feature development

  • May be asked to lead or mentor other team members

item.title: Solutions Architect for Healthcare Business Unit at EPAM Systems (New York, NY)
item.description:
Are you a top notch software engineer with a desire to understand the health care industry and provide guidance for mission critical projects? Join EPAM's New York City based healthcare unit as a solutions architect to work on healthcare problems at a time of great change.


The solutions architect is a problem solver and acts as the liaison between the business analysis and engineering teams to provide context and guidance on large-scale technology engagements.


The solutions architect has the responsibility of working with product managers to understand the needs of the client and design a solution that fits the client needs and vision. The solution architect communicates the solution vision by modeling and diagramming the different aspects of the solution for business and technology stakeholders.


Essential Duties:



  • Work with product managers to understand product vision

  • On a daily basis work with development team to guide and advise the team on best practices to ensure successful product delivery

  • Communicate the solution design by modeling different aspects of the solution

item.title: Senior DevOps Engineer at Xoom (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Xoom Corporation, one of the fastest growing digital money transfer companies in the world, is revolutionizing the international money transfer market by providing people with an easy, convenient and cost-effective means of sending money worldwide. We are seeking a Development and Operations Engineer on our infrastructure team to configure and maintain efficient and frictionless tool suites for internal application development.

Xoom’s operational infrastructure serves our customers with an unparalleled network of banks and service partners, backed by enterprise server and database deployments, providing financial transaction movement, fraud, compliance, settlement, security and reporting services that span multiple geographies. Our customers rely on our service and fast product development. Critical to our business is our development efficiency and the ability to deliver new features quickly and reliably.

As a member of Xoom’s Development Operations team, you will work in Xoom’s Engineering department in collaboration with Platform, Risk, Partnerships and QA teams to configure and maintain internal development tool sets. You will be focused on integrating and maintaining the software utilities that facilitate frictionless development flows, version control, bug tracking, test result tracking and archive, code and coverage review, test and development metrics and agile product tracking. You will configure and support these tools and deployments with the goal of optimizing development efficiency, supporting engineering and identifying and responding to the evolving needs of the development organization. You will personally develop custom solutions as needed to integrate and refine systems, and identify unmet needs and opportunities for improvement of our internal tooling suite and implement their solutions.

item.title: Programmer/Systems Analyst at Commonwealth Computer Research, Inc. (Chantilly, VA)
item.description:
Programmer/Systems Analyst, Chantilly, VA
Location: Government customer site, Chantilly, VA
Clearance required: TS/SCI

We are looking for smart, innovative engineers with a mix of analytical, software engineering, and problem solving skills to join our team. CCRi provides a fun and challenging work environment, competitive pay, generous retirement, and a very flexible vacation policy. If you meet any of the qualifications below, we encourage you to get in touch.

Job Description
Provides expert advisory and software development support on-site to an intel community customer in Chantilly, VA, including work involved in one or more of the phases of developing and/or integrating software or tools used in data processing and analytic capabilities. Possesses technical knowledge of intelligence collection programs and activities, and the analytical and evaluative methods and techniques for assessing program development or execution.

May develop/modify/integrate/test intelligence applications or systems during the design and evaluation process. May conduct studies, technical assessments, system analyses, and architectural-level analyses to determine system performance and effectiveness. May formulate and use mathematical models or representations to conduct systems analysis. Contributes subject matter expertise and advice to the customer at a level that is typically obtained via a related technical education. May perform work in which the principles, theories and general body of knowledge of remote sensing technologies or other engineering disciplines is required.

Applies fact-finding and investigative techniques; oral and written communications; and development of presentations and reports. May provide analysis of existing, emerging and conceptual intelligence systems and other advanced technologies. May analyze and format information developed and used to evaluate a government program / processing system / similar complex program. May develop, plan, coordinate and integrate systems-related requirements to support operational needs.

item.title: Software Engineer (Ruby, Rails, MySQL, AWS) at Medidata Solutions (New York, NY)
item.description:
Medidata Solutions (NASDAQ:MDSO) is seeking a passionate Software Engineer to join one of our cloud based web application development teams. Our mission is to work with the absolute best engineers to provide clinical research organizations with the most advanced tools for planning and managing their clinical trials.


Have you ever wondered how the drug that you pick up in a drug store goes from an idea in a researcher's mind to being approved for use around the world?  We make the software that medical researchers use to manage clinical trials -- enabling researchers to verify the efficacy and safety of new drugs -- which allows the industry to bring new drugs to market quickly and efficiently.  This position will allow you to work with a team that helps connect clinical trial subjects with new and innovative medicines following all regulatory requirements to optimize the clinical study process. 


We are continually building and improving our cloud-based clinical trial solution to put innovative technology and insightful data into the hands of researchers allowing new treatments to reach markets safely, efficiently and effectively. 


If you are interested in applying your passion and skills to truly impact society in a positive way and not just work for a company that creates yet another social media network app please read on.  


What we are looking for:
Software Applications Engineers with 2+ years experience building cloud based web applications. You’ll demonstrate a passion for your craft, be self motivated and eager to engage in high impact, challenging, engineering problems while continuously raising the standard of quality in our products and services in a full solutions-oriented SaaS environment.  Your responsibilities will include hands-on implementation and development with Ruby on Rails and MySQL amongst other tools 


What’s in it for you?
We offer our engineers a highly competitive compensation that includes base, bonus and a strong benefits package that includes medical and dental insurance, vision care, short- and long-term disability insurance, life insurance, health care and dependent care flexible spending accounts FSA, commuter FSA, 401K, tuition reimbursement program, paid company holidays and unlimited paid time off.

We send engineers to conferences and seminars to learn and get exposed to new ideas and bring back the knowledge and the contacts that they acquired.


We provide top of the line computers (PCs or MacBook Pro), adjustable standing desks and the most comfortable work spaces. We have plenty of space for collaboration, game room and a private rooftop terrace.

item.title: SOFTWARE ENGINEER (Ref: 2603-6) at The Intellisis Corporation (San Diego, CA)
item.description:
Come join the Intellisis team as a Software Engineer!


Intellisis is developing new technologies in pattern recognition, speech processing, and high-throughput computing. We are currently looking for highly motivated Software Engineers to join our dynamic team. 


As a key member of our software team, you will develop applications and interfaces wrapping novel, bleeding-edge signal processing algorithms – as well as help implement those algorithms as part of a small, agile engineering team.


Imagine an opportunity where you can be creative and be challenged in tackling complex technical problems.  Strong preference will be given to candidates with demonstrated intellectual curiosity and the ability to independently solve problems.

This position will:


Assist in the design, development and security of the university’s windows and web based applications.


Assist in coordinating and communication with vendors and manufactures to maintain current software; works closely with the Microsoft Programmer –Lead to ensure the best technology solutions are pursued.


Monitor all applications performance and is responsible for pro-actively preventing problems.


Coordinate all changes to applications and may lead a team to implement changes.


Be responsible for the resolution of applications issues and/or settings, and for moving applications from development to production.


Be responsible for all documentation changes.


Assist in the deployment and security of the university’s windows and web based applications.

What are we looking for?


A data engineer who is passionate about harnessing massive amounts of data that we generate from our users on a daily basis.  You will play a key role within our engineering team as a major contributor to the architecture behind data collection and storage at MeetMe.   


Daily Responsibilities

item.title: Data Warehouse - Business Intelligence Technical Manager at Wisconsin Foundation & Alumni Association (Madison, WI)
item.description:
Note – when submitting application materials, cover letter and resume must be combined into a single attachment


The Wisconsin Foundation and Alumni Association (WFAA) is the “doing business as” name of the merged organization comprising the University of Wisconsin Foundation (www.supportuw.org) and the Wisconsin Alumni Association (www.uwalumni.com), whose legal corporate name is registered as the University of Wisconsin Foundation.


The WFAA is recruiting for an experienced Data Warehouse – Business Intelligence Technical Manager to join our Information Technology Department. 


Primary responsibilities will include:


I.     Data Warehouse and BI Strategy and Leadership



  • Lead definition, communication and support of WFAA Data Warehouse strategy.

  • Collaborate with both IS and Business stakeholders, providing expertise in the capabilities of reporting alternatives as it relates to business needs.

  • Coordinate and oversee database administration activities at WFAA and with our hosting service provider.

  • Monitor design deliverables to ensure flexibility and scalability of each solution.

  • Plan and manage Release Cycles, prioritizing the execution of bugs, enhancements, and project requests against the resources of the BI Team.

  • Provide thought leadership on the development, evolution and practice of best practice BI methodologies.

  • Research and recommend new BI technologies to maintain the appropriate solution portfolio for the enterprise.

  • Collaborate with Business Analysts and Project Managers on major initiatives, providing recommendations on reporting opportunities that capitalize on the strengths and capabilities of the Data Warehouse.


II.    Team Management and Leadership



  • Provide management and leadership to the Data Warehouse and Business Intelligence and Reporting Teams. 

  • Determine staffing needs, design jobs, write/update job descriptions, allocate staff and assign duties.

  • Establish, delegate, communicate, monitor, and reinforce staff assignments, accountabilities, performance expectations and goals

  • Recruit highly talented and qualified staff for open positions.

  • Oversee the orientation, training, mentoring and coaching, encouraging an appropriate level of independence and supporting professional growth.

  • Provide ongoing feedback and recognition as well as periodic formal performance appraisals to staff as part of a comprehensive performance management system

  • Collaborate with staff on their work, providing guidance, problem solving, insight, etc.

  • Collaborate with management of other IS teams to ensure cross-functional issues, tasks or projects are coordinated and completed within a timely manner.

  • Communicate, support and apply UWF policies and procedures in collaboration with Human Resources and other management team members.

  • Develop and implement systems for identifying and satisfying communication needs of staff, including organizing and leading staff meetings.

  • Foster a positive work environment, characterized by open communication, collegiality, support, accountability and motivation to optimize staff performance, satisfaction/morale and retention

  • Serve as the liaison between these teams and other entities including WFAA Research and Analytics, other technical teams, consumers of WFAA information, external partners and service providers and the Information, Data and Reporting committees at the WFAA.


III.   Data Warehouse Development



  • Design and develop ETL structures to extract, transform and load data from multiple data sources into data warehouse and other databases based on requirements.

  • Analyze, define and document technical requirements for data, workflow and interfaces with other systems and outputs

  • Design BI dimensional models

  • Perform unit and integration testing activities and participate in user acceptance testing as needed

  • Performance tune the application to meet operational production requirements

  • Lead troubleshooting episodes and communicate solutions / resolutions to the team

  • Provide technical knowledge of ETL solutions for application integration and BI projects

  • Monitor DW environment to ensure all jobs and processes are functioning as expected

  • Create and maintain documentation for all projects

  • Perform occasional report development against the data warehouse and transactional databases as needed


IV.    Support a service-oriented atmosphere in accordance with WFAA mission, values and     philosophy



  • The transforming impact of the UW Madison;

  • The treatment of all with high ethical and behavioral standards including honesty, integrity, respect, courtesy, and dignity;

  • The spirit, involvement, participation, engagement, and impact of alumni and friends with the UW-Madison and with each other;

  • The joy of giving and the power of philanthropy;

  • The interdependent nature of all aspects of the Parties’ collective relationships in fulfilling their missions; and

  • The highest level of stewardship of the investment of donors’ philanthropy in support of the UW-Madison and the relationships and trust accrued through alumni development and engagement activities. 


This is an exempt full-time position requiring 40 hours per week. This position reports to the Director of Information Technology.  We offer an excellent work environment as well as competitive pay and benefits.


To apply, please submit cover letter and resume in a single attachment to:


https://home.eease.adp.com/recruit/?id=11810451


Please contact Human Resources if you have any questions at hr@supportuw.org. 


Application deadline is January 18, 2015.


Amber Aquino


Human Resources


Wisconsin Foundation & Alumni Association


(608) 262-6219


hr@supportuw.org The Wisconsin Foundation & Alumni Association is an Equal Opportunity Employer

item.title: Senior DevOps at When I Work (Saint Paul, MN) (allows remote)
item.description:
Who We’re Looking For



Do the words “automation” and “open source” make your brows perk up? Are you a developer who gets a kick out of problem solving and system administration in a Linux environment? Have you heard of ChatOps? Want to help us take what we already have make it more awesome? Then this is your job! 



You'll be in charge of maintaining production servers and the applications that run on them. You'll ensure that our MySQL databases are not only performant, but being backed up properly. You'll work with the development team to automate our deployment processes, as well as monitor performance and uptime. You’ll also be responsible for scaling our infrastructure as our relevant business continues to grow.




What You’ll Be Doing




  • Help improve our infrastructure and software through monitoring, performance tuning and high availability solutions

  • Define and develop system reporting and infrastructure health monitoring

  • Create tools to build and deploy our apps that can be used by both full stack and mobile devs

  • Troubleshoot production infrastructure and load issues

  • Develop and maintain configuration management solutions

  • Understand and use best practices for deployment processes and support

  • Consult on overall production systems architecture

  • Document configuration procedures

  • Maintain security updates and patches



What’s In It For You




  • Medical and dental benefits

  • Paid vacation and holidays

  • Flexible work environment

  • Dynamic and dedicated team

  • Casual dress code



Sound Like a Good Fit?


 We’d love to talk to you!  How to apply: 


Along with your resume, please submit a cover letter explaining why you’d like to work at When I Work, and not somewhere else.



*Must be authorized to work in the United States on a full-time basis for any employer.

item.description:
Attention all master programmers! Warby Parker is on the lookout for stellar Software Engineers to join our 50+ person, on-site Engineering team and to help build the next great lifestyle brand. So, if you’re an excellent programmer that’s looking to work on small, collaborative teams, then you’ve come to the right place. Sound good? Take a peek below (plus check out our blog The Oculists).

item.title: DevOps Engineer @ Top VC-backed Image Optimization Startup at Neon (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Are you a Chef master who loves tinkering away in the kitchen to produce novel recipes with the power to set thousands of machines marching to your orders? As a DevOps engineer at Neon, you will be responsible for ensuring the serving infrastructure is more scalable than the Borg and as bulletproof as a wall of Kevlar. We like to sleep soundly, and we need your help.


You will build solutions and tools that support Neon APIs, infrastructure services, and Neon analytics, enabling them to operate at scale. Neon’s infrastructure is primarily based in AWS, uses Opsworks/Chef for deployment, and consists of both individual services and long-running analytics clusters.


Joining our team means you'll become part of a high performance engineering group that has built underwater robots, massive gaming infrastructures, and streaming services at Rdio, Zynga, Google, Brightcove, and Amazon. We have fun by cultivating hobbies such as sailing in the Bay, flying helicopters, judging robotics competitions, exploring caves, and leading Cub Scouts.

item.title: Developer - Ski in the morning, code during the day at Inntopia (Stowe, VT)
item.description:
We are the leading software provider for the ski, golf and travel industries enabling people to book the vacations of their dreams.  Sure we have great comp and benefits, but we also give you a place to challenge yourself, build your skills, and feel a sense of accomplishment on products you can believe will make a difference. Imagine starting your day snowboarding knee-deep powder 10 minutes from work or walking across the street at lunch to do a loop on world-class mountain biking trails.


The Application Developer is responsible for the design, development, testing, debugging and documentation of Inntopia’s high availability, high transaction volume, multilingual, PCI compliant E-Commerce applications.  This may include hands-on new development as well as support, maintenance or enhancement of existing applications. The individual will be involved in the full project life cycle while working with project managers to take requirements through design, development, QA, and implementation.

  • Facilitates architect, design, and implementation of new and existing testing tools and methods.

item.title: Senior Distributed Systems Engineer (Mountain View, CA and Bangalore, India) at Aerospike Inc. (Mountain View, CA)
item.description:

  • Successful in shipping and deploying products in large-scale environments with 3+ years of core industry software experience.

item.title: Maya Technical Director at Axis Animation (Glasgow, UK)
item.description:
Axis Animation is looking to hire experienced Maya Technical Directors to maintain, support and trouble-shoot new and existing Maya workflows, through close collaboration with our Rigging, Layout, Animation and Pipeline teams.


The ideal candidate should have a deep knowledge of animation pipelines and workflow, and have  previous experience in a similar role.


Candidates are required, and must be eligible at time of application, to work on-site in Glasgow, starting in February for a minimum of 6 months, with likelihood of work stretching beyond this.


Responsibilities :


• Maintain, and improve where necessary, techniques and processes that increase animation quality and efficiency across disciplines, departments and teams.


• Work closely with the Rigging, Layout, Animation and Pipeline team to develop processes to solve production and project challenges


• Write utility scripts and tools to streamline new or updated processes and workflows where necessary

• Keep CG Supervisor and/or leads and management informed of progress, changes and other critical issues



Please apply via recruitment@axisanimation.com


Be sure to include “Maya Technical Director Application ” in the subject line

item.title: Data-Obsessed Engineer at Periscope (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Periscope makes really fast charts and dashboards. We're constantly making the SQL faster and the charting more powerful. You'll be working on the full stack: from the Go and Java servers managing giant database clusters to the Rails and CoffeeScript frontends.


Some recent engineering projects include:



  • Speeding up metrics calculations by over 10,000X by implementing them as parallel bitwise operations on bitsets.

  • Improving chart render speed by over 100X by reimplementing on top of Canvas instead of SVG.

  • Auto-ETLing entire customer databases into our data cache while targeting < 1hr freshness on all customer data.

  • Implementing cross-database query translation and cross-database joins.


But Periscope's most important feature is our phenomenal development speed. We ship new code to production an average of 9.7 times per day. Much of this is cultural, and much of it is investing in anything that will reduce drag on the team, like fully automated testing, one-click test-and-deploys, and great whiskey. (Wait, what?)


We're adding another engineer to our family. We're open to new grads and many-year vets, as long as you learn fast and have that get-shit-done-itude.

item.title: Hybrid Mobile Developer at Photon Infotech (Minneapolis, MN)
item.description:
The Hybrid Mobile Developer will help us build a Proof of Concept involving Cordova Plugin development for a large retailer. The right candidate brings both strong UI architectural skills and expertise in frontend development.


Our team is chartered with testing this POC across the length and breadth of the customer’s stores around the country. If successful, it may progress to larger implementation.


You will be an integral part of our team, leading from the front. Since we’re a small group, you’re needed to take ownership of deliverables and drive quality throughout the work.


* Open to Contract or Regular Hire *


* H-1B Transfer available for a Regular Hire *


* Relocation Benefit available for a Regular Hire, moving more than 75 miles to Minneapolis *


A short phone interview is available to you immediately; we will onboard a new start right away.

item.title: Software Engineer (Senior and Entry Level Acceptable) at Bad Rabbit (Hoboken, NJ)
item.description:
What You'll Do


The position will require working within the Huron-Click® Portal Solutions framework to help maintain large existing web-based applications, and to assist in new application development. Huron-Click Portal is a proprietary object oriented web application framework that requires learning custom tools, APIs, and terminology.   • Build brand new web applications in the Huron-Click® Portal.

  • Review fellow team member's code and provide constructive feedback.

  • Help maintain our customer wiki with relevant code samples and documentation.


Compensation



  • Senior Level Full Time (2,000 hrs / year)  = $120k/yr + health + 3% 401K match + significant profit share bonus (>$10K)

  • Entry Level Full Time (2,000 hrs / year) = $70k/yr - $100k/yr + health + 3% 401k match + significant profit share bonus (>$10K)

item.title: Front End Developer at Beatport (New York, NY)
item.description:
We're building a next-generation platform for fans and artists of electronic music culture to connect. We've been hard at work on our product for a year, and we're ready for your help. You'll be working on a modern music product that's beautifully designed and filled with dozens of interesting user interface challenges.


You'll be expected to use these skills and software:




  • A keen eye for visual design




  • Semantic HTML markup




  • Mobile-first responsive design




  • CSS preprocessors (we use Sass)




  • SVG animation




  • Git and GitHub




  • Command-line tools like npm and bower




  • Design tools like Photoshop and Sketch




  • Familarity with JavaScript




  • Willingness to touch and learn Ember code




You'll be building out new features for our application in code, but also expected to create visual mockups or suggest improvements with wireframes. Experience working on products with modular large-scale CSS systems will be a big plus. We take pride in writing styles that are easy to maintain for the long haul.


We offer a competitive compensation package, plenty of vacation days, and VIP access to select music events. You will work with a team that values collaboration and mentorship. We are always helping one another—someone almost always has the answer for any question you've got.


We’re based in New York, but flexible for remote workers if the fit is right. Some of our team is already remote, so being able to communicate clearly in writing and on video chats is a must.  Applicants must be authorized to work in the United States.


To Apply:


Please send a short note introducing yourself and why this position appeals to you. Include a resume, links to code samples a link to a portfolio.

item.title: Ember App Developer at Beatport (New York, NY)
item.description:
We’re building a next-generation platform for fans and artists of electronic music culture to connect.  We’ve been hard at work for a year, and it shows. The application is carefully written, tested, and running on the latest versions of Ember and Ember Data. We offer a competitive compensation package, plenty of vacation days, and VIP access to select music events. You will work with a team that values collaboration and mentorship. We are always helping one another—someone almost always has the answer for any question you've got. Being into EDM is a plus!


We’re based in New York, but flexible for remote workers if the fit is right. Some of our team is already remote, so being able to work collaborative over Flowdock and Google Hangouts is a must.  Applicants must be authorized to work in the United States.

item.title: Systems Admin / Operations Engineer at TapInfluence (Boulder, CO)
item.description:
Come work with our engineering team in an Agile and flexible environment in Boulder, CO.  We perform relaxed daily releases with a very cooperative and fast moving team.  We also like to have fun playing foosball, ping-pong, or going next door to the local brewery or coffee shop.  


If you work well with other people (and dogs) and can hit the ground running in AWS, Bash, Git, and MySQL, we want to talk to you.  We offer a competitive salary, excellent health, dental, life insurance, and disability, and generous stock options.


This is a hands-on type role responsible for build-out, maintenance, releases, monitoring, and security of all infrastructure components while working closely with all other teams.  


As the Operations Engineer, your responsibilities will include:



  • Coordinate and perform daily releases and maintain release processes/scripts with input from the Engineering team for all application components running on the platform.

  • Build out, configure, and update infrastructure running on AWS including EC2, S3, ElasticCache, RDS, Route53, CloudWatch, and CloudFront

  • Maintain all security throughout the platform by ensuring software versions are up to date and being patched in a timely manner

  • Maintain and enhance Amazon Relational Database Services (RDS) MySQL Infrastructure.  Assist the business in obtaining critical data and ensure that all data is backed up and highly available.

  • Test and Update DR Infrastructure in AWS.  Ensure that DR Environment is ready for any DR events and any infrastructure changes are reflected in the DR Enviornment.

  • Enhance and maintain Nagios/NewRelic monitoring infrastructure to ensure that all aspects of the platform are fully functional and end user performance metrics meet expected levels

  • Manage higher level support issues that span across infrastructure and code on the platform.

  • Assist the development team with higher level testing efforts that include infrastructure components

  • Own all office IT infrastructure and end user provisioning/deprovisioning activities


Qualifications:



  • 5+ Years of operations/sys admin experience

  • 3-5 Years of *nix experience preferably CentOS/RedHat based Linux

  • Fundamental understanding of networking, firewalls, dns, routing, etc..

  • Must have managed a software environment running on Amazon Web Services (AWS) including ElasticCache, RDS, EC2, ELB, AutoScaling.

  • Must have familiarity deploying Java and Ruby on Rails software projects into a production environment

  • Experience with build servers such as Bamboo and Jenkins to support continuous deployment

  • Ability to work on and manage complex technical projects on your own and own the work from start to end

  • Must be able to write operations/deployment/monitoring code using a toolset such as bash or ruby

  • Should be SQL savvy and be able to write your own data gathering and update scripts

  • Experience with DevOps principles are a plus

item.title: Front End Engineer at TapInfluence (Boulder, CO)
item.description:
Come work with our engineering team in an Agile and flexible environment in Boulder, CO.  We perform relaxed daily releases with a very cooperative and fast moving team.  We also like to have fun playing foosball, ping-pong, or going next door to the local brewery or coffee shop.

As a Front End Engineer, your responsibilities will include:



  • Working with members of the engineering and product teams on architecture, design, estimates and development of existing and new features 

  • Coordinating with other developers and QA to ensure best practices in application design, coding and testing

  • Working as part of a collaborative team while being self-motivated and capable of learning new technologies

  • Contributing to product and architectural discussions

  • Working with the development and QA team in troubleshooting and fixing issues

item.title: Senior Software Engineer (java/J2EE) at Nativ Limited (London, UK)
item.description:
Nativ has developed a ground breaking media asset management platform, MioEverywhere. Our customers are some of the biggest brands in the broadcast, content production, post production and distribution markets. In 2012 we doubled in size and grew by a further 50% last year which we plan to repeat in 2014. On the back of this we are looking to strengthen our software engineering team in London.

You will be required to build elegant, engineering focused, efficient and robust solutions which you will prototype first, you will liaise with our development manager and professional services team, understand requirements and specifications, and explore internal roadmap working alongside our on and offshore teams. Joining the Product team, you will help convert both roadmap and client requirements and specifications into elegant technical solutions, taking into account the technical, business and financial benefits of the design approaches you choose to take.


You will have a deep technical knowledge and naturally you will be highly intelligent. You are also upbeat, motivated and a self-starter; disciplined in managing your own time and capable of inspiring your colleagues on and offshore. Above all you will be passionate about technology.

Ideally you will have a background in designing and building world-class media management products and have full life-cycle product development experience. You will come from an enterprise software development background with at least 3 years’ experience of writing software, ideally spanning a wide range of technology-based disciplines and paradigms. You must be an expert in high-level and low-level component design and interface specification. You must also be able to consider cross-cutting concerns such as logging, reporting and event-frameworks; and have a pragmatic approach to refactoring and continuous improvement. Expect your software development skills to be thoroughly tested as a part of our selection process.

You will be working in a team, so communication skills must be first rate and you must be adept at expressing software design decisions to offshore teams. You must be able to quickly prototype potential solutions and analytically weigh up the pros and cons of alternative design decisions quickly and methodically.

If you have these skills and are enthused by the challenge then we look forward to hearing from you.

item.title: Full Stack Game Developer (Unity, Java) at Rising Tide Games (New York, NY)
item.description:
Rising Tide Games is looking for bright, talented developers to help build the next generation of social casino games. We are working on launching world-class, mobile-first products in 2015, and are seeking smart, passionate developers to get us there faster. We’re looking for people with both frontend and backend experience, and we really love developers who are curious and excited to learn new technologies.


Why work with us?



  • We use the latest tech and processes (Unity 5, Java 8, NoSQL, Git, Agile, etc)

  • Solid engineering culture, where we solve problems in curious, thoughtful, and intelligent ways

  • We take a very analytical approach to live product, including sophisticated cohorting and simulation


Note: This is a full time position, and you must be on-site in our NYC office. Students - this should be obvious, but please do not apply if you have not yet graduated.

item.title: Data Engineer at Rising Tide Games (New York, NY)
item.description:

item.title: Site Reliability Engineer- San Diego at Rockstar Games (Carlsbad, CA)
item.description:
Want to be a part of a tight-knit team responsible for creating and publishing some of the most popular and critically-acclaimed games in the world including such videogame franchises as Grand Theft Auto, Max Payne, Red Dead and much more?


At Rockstar Games, we focus intently on quality and content to proudly produce exactly the kind of games we would want to play ourselves.


A career at Rockstar Games is about passion and commitment, to the projects and to each other, all the while working on some of the most creatively rewarding and challenging projects to be found in any entertainment medium with some of the most talented people in the industry.


Rockstar Games is seeking a Site Reliability Engineer to join our platform team in San Diego. The successful candidate will be responsible for architecting and troubleshooting public facing Linux web architectures in various hosting environments with an emphasis on database technologies (traditional and emerging).



  • Along with the Online Engineering team, work closely with development teams to develop, deploy, and support applications.

  • Work with development groups to architect solutions for new and existing projects.

  • Utilize configuration management and custom scripts to deploy and manage systems.

  • Ensure all critical systems and services are properly monitored with relevant alerts enabled.

  • Manage backups including ongoing policy refinement.

  • Migrate applications off of legacy environments with minimal downtime.

  • Be able to respond to critical requests during off-hours.

item.title: Backend developer at SCM Ventures AB (Stockholm, Sweden)
item.description:
SCM Ventures is an internal startup incubator within Schibsted Classified Media with quite a few successfully ramped up companies in our history. We are an eight developer strong team, many of us with international background, and we're now strengthening the team with one more backend developer. In central Stockholm you'll work in a very experienced, yet extremely downto-earth team that will give you a lot of support but also freedom. The job involves working on our current products as well as being a part of new ones we come up with. Our tech stack has an extensibly proven track record of being scalable and we value clean code just as high as user experience and stability in our launches.


We are at this point Not interested in contacts from recruiters or agencies.


You consider yourself more of an all-around software engineer, having skills and expertise in several different areas from developing backend systems, to hacking on client side JavaScript or even fixing broken Apache/NGINX configuration. Your daily tasks would consist of maintaining existing platform codebase as well as bringing to life new features and other requirements coming from the Product team.

item.title: Senior Java Developer at Mirriad Ltd (London, UK)
item.description:
As a business we are developing technology in readiness for a growing digital placement market. Brands are increasingly looking to find advertising solutions within content and opportunities to engage their audience more effectively and in a more measured way. As an organisation we are providing a solution that does exactly that. 


In the next few months we expect to deliver our advertising platform to a global audience and build the business to support the immediate opportunity in the marketplace. 


The Senior Java Developer role will see you join the development team for the on-line workflow system linking offices and clients world-wide. The platform runs on a JVM and JavaScript technology stack. 


The role involves working on the business microservice architecture producing a wide range of functionality.  This includes elements such as video asset catalogue management, video project on-line portal services, workflow system and workflow management, the sales platform and system performance and functional and acceptance testing. 


In your current role you are undoubtedly seen as a talented individual who is a team player as well as being someone who can develop solutions on your own. 


You have a solid knowledge of Java, OOD, TDD, Refactoring, Data Store Design, HTTP, Web Applications and ReST Web Services.  You have commercial experience of Tomcat, ReST Web Services, Angular.js, Node.js, JSON, XML, Git or any distributed modern VCS, and use of JS and HTML5 would be highly beneficial, as would experience of Spring and Hibernate.  You are able to work on Linux/Unix environments for development and production and have a minimum of five years commercial experience on at least three completed project with the above technologies.  On those projects you will have been involved on the full life cycle. 


You are confident in continuous refactoring, reducing entropy, evolving the data stores and the architecture and have solid knowledge of Cloud architectures and patterns, ideally with experience in online selling/shopping field, distributed High Availability systems that are AWS based.  Knowledge of the NoSQL ecosystem, such as MongoDB and Dynamo and polyglot persistence is also required. 


You are collaborative in style, very much a team player and are genuinely excited by the thought of sharing ideas and delivering robust, well thought out solutions as an outcome.  


Any experience of working on advertising platforms or services for a content owner or agency is of great advantage.

item.title: Front-end Web Developer at Ceresti Health (Carlsbad, CA)
item.description:
We are a startup.  You will be one of the early employees.  As such we are looking for a front-end developer willing to grow with us.  You need to live and breathe web technologies - HTML 5, CSS 3 and Javascript.  You will be part of a small development team where every member is a key individual and where everything you build will matter to the success of the company and to the future of many families.  


The culture is highly collaborative and creative.  We want the best ideas from everyone.  We expect you to embrace good development habits - thoughtful designs, careful test cases and effective build and deployment practices.  We expect you to be transparent, courageous and enthusiastic.  Have a great idea?  Tell us about it - we want to learn - and be open to suggestions - so you can learn.


If this is something you are interested in, read on for the details.

item.title: Software Engineer at Harvard University (Cambridge)
item.description:
The Teaching and Learning Technologies (TLT) Program is a strategic Harvard IT initiative that supports teaching and learning across all the schools, facilitates pedagogical innovation, and contributes to educational research. Reporting to the Senior Manager, Development and Open Source Community Lead, the Senior Software Engineer will work as part of an agile team to build software that supports the pedagogical mission of the University.  
Basic Qualifications:



•    Bachelor degree with 3 years software engineering experience or equivalent.
•    Familiarity with design patterns, algorithms and data structures, and the ability to apply them effectively.
•    Experience building web-delivered applications using one or more of Python/Django, Ruby on Rails, Spring, NodeJS or similar platforms.
•    Experience building and consuming REST APIs.
•    Experience in client-side development, including UI development in HTML5, CSS and Javascript.
•    Demonstrated ability in testing and quality assurance, including experience with appropriate unit testing suites.
•    Flexibility with regards to development platform and a demonstrated ability to adapt to new development languages and libraries.
•    Ability work in a team.
•    Strong aptitude and desire to learn



Additional Qualifications:


•    Experience working with an agile development methodology.
•    Experience with test-driven development practices.
•    Experience in requirement capture and direct client engagement.
•    Experience using an LMS or MOOC platform as a student, instructor or teaching assistant would be a plus.

item.title: iOS Developer at Hot Salsa Interactive (Scottsdale, AZ)
item.description:
Hot Salsa Interactive is a Scottsdale-based company that specializes in entertainment apps and branded mobile applications for businesses.

Other Skills:

 The is a full-time position. Compensation is DOE.

item.title: Principle Systems Engineer at Brightcove (Boston, MA)
item.description:
As a member of the systems engineering team, you will be responsible for building scalable solutions and infrastructure using the latest technologies. You will work as part of a team on projects that will benefit the Brightcove platform by increasing stability, efficiency and scalability.  These solutions encompass provisioning, cloud operations, configuration management, security and networking. As a Principal Systems Engineer at Brightcove, you will build, operate, scale and troubleshoot all of Brightcove’s SaaS infrastructure.


You will:



  • Lead efforts to build and automate our next generation infrastructure and tooling.

  • Serve as a technical lead on demanding, cross-functional projects.

  • Provide expert knowledge in performance, security, scalability, enterprise system architecture, and engineering best practices.

  • Exert technical influence over multiple teams, increasing their productivity and effectiveness by sharing your deep knowledge and experience.

  • Provide operations coverage as part of an on-call pager rotation.



Responsibilities:



  • Design architecture, standards, and methods for operating services and systems

  • Play a significant role in career development of others. Mentor individuals within the team and company on advanced technical issues.

  • Implement metrics for availability, performance, and capacity monitoring

  • Keeps up to date with the latest technology trends and make suggestions to other members of the systems engineering team

  • Lead team initiatives or projects

  • Optimize our infrastructure at both the software and hardware level

  • Analyze and improve efficiency, scalability, and stability of Brightcove services

  • Provide expertise in understanding system interdependencies and limitations.

  • Create optimizations to reduce or control technology-related bottlenecks.

item.title: Software Developer - Application Systems at CarMax (Henrico, VA)
item.description:
Do you love the web? Do you get excited about using leading tools and development practices to make software for a high-traffic website? Do you like Cars? (OK, that last one is not that important...)


Then we’d like to talk to you!


CarMax, one of "Fortunes Best Companies to Work For" has revolutionized the used car buying experience...and we couldn't have done it without technology.  Our Carmax.com team is growing and we are looking for those who want to build a career with us.  If you are interested in working with cutting edge technologies for a growing Fortune 500 that is an industry leader, click apply! 


Technical Expertise

Software Development Methodology and Support

item.title: Back End Software Developer (C#) at Viewpost (Maitland, FL)
item.description:
Job Description:


Are you ready for a revolution?


At Viewpost, we see business differently and are on the cutting-edge of a really cool product that is still in stealth mode.  You have to apply to find out more.   Of course, we need some of the best and brightest .Net engineers to make this possible, and that’s where you come in.


Your primary duties would be working on the core components of an invoicing and payments platform. Aspects of this work include integrations with 3rd party bank systems and popular accounting packages, in addition to full-stack web development for our browser-based application. The platform also leverages NServiceBus for queued, asynchronous processing. We greatly value testing here as well, so be prepared to validate all business logic with a set of unit and/or integration tests.


Our team is flatly structured, so you won’t find any Junior or Senior titles here. We are all developers at various stages in our career, working together to solve a very difficult problem. All opinions hold equal weight and can contribute towards the way we build our software.


We’re a startup; thus working here nets you some interesting perks, such as no dress code, a fully-stocked kitchen with plenty of caffeine and snacks, weekly “lunch-and-learns” with full catered lunch, and various forms of entertainment, including ping-pong, an Xbox room, and all the Ms. Pac-Man you can stomach.


Think you’ve got what it takes? Shoot us an email, making sure to attach your resume and preferably a cover letter telling us why you’d be a good fit. We look forward to hearing from you!

item.title: Front End Mobile Web Developer (JavaScript) at Viewpost (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
About Viewpost


We’re a highly-funded, unconventional startup that is set out to revolutionize the way businesses connect and pay each other. We’ve been heads down for 24 months inventing the impossible, and while we’ll soon be ready to introduce our product, there’s still so much to do if we’re truly going to change the world — that’s where you come in.


Job Description:


Viewpost is seeking an exceptionally talented and motivated Front End Developer – Mobile. As part of the front-end team, your primary responsibility includes using Javascript, HTML, and CSS to build out a large-scale, SPA-like web application. We’re especially interested in candidates who have experience using frameworks and libraries such as Angular, Ember, Backbone, or Knockout to build rich user experiences. You’ll also have the opportunity to contribute to our front-end architecture as it continues to grow and evolve.


Our team is flatly structured, so you won’t find any Junior or Senior titles here. We are all developers at various stages in our career, working together to solve a very difficult problem. All opinions hold equal weight and can contribute towards the way we build our software.

item.title: Senior Frontend Developer at 6Minutes Media GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
The last mile belongs to you. As a frontend developer, you are responsible for taking the work of everyone else on the team, and finally bringing it together. You will need to be a really keen problem solver, with a sharp eye and attention to detail to make sure that everything comes together perfectly. You should be obsessed with beauty and performance, and be constantly looking for new opportunities that are popping up in the form of new web standards and new libraries.



Your daily tasks will include working together with designers and backend developers to create the perfect user experience for any type of device or screen size. You will be working to push the limits of whats possible in a web experience using new technologies, as well as being a guiding influence in making sure what is implemented meets web standards. You will use HTML, CSS, and javascript as well as a plethora of javascript and css libraries and tools to make sure that no pixel is left behind.


Your responsibilities include:



  • Write awesome code

  • Implement and tweak awesome features

  • Stay on top of the latest advancements in HTML5/CSS3/Javascript

Some perks of working for 6Minutes are:

item.title: JavaScript Developer at Bitovi (Chicago, IL) (allows remote)
item.description:
We’re looking for passionate JavaScript developers who identify with our mission.


We want someone who enjoys identifying the hard parts of application development and simplifying them, talking about software architecture, and teaching others. We also want someone who can lead others and be an integral part of a team, but can also vibe with the dev team after the workday.


Specifically, the following attributes are major positives, but not all hard requirements:



  • Some experience contributing to (or at least using) open source projects

  • Doesn’t mind a bit of travel, averaging one week every couple months

  • Has strong opinions about the right way to develop

  • Has a lot of JavaScript experience

  • Has some experience with back-end systems and databases


We’re a team of 25ish developers and designers located around the US, Canada, Europe, and South America with our headquarters in Chicago.  This is a remote position, but due to travel requirements, we have a strong preference for US-based developers.


The Job


As soon as you begin, we’ll train you to become an expert in JavaScript application design, front-end architecture, and our JavaScriptMVC stack of tools. You’ll work with clients creating applications, discussing and designing architectures, reviewing code, and researching new front-end technologies.


In addition to client work, you’ll have the opportunity to shape a small and growing company by applying your talent and passion to the JavaScript community in your own way. Bitovi developers:



  • Present at conferences

  • Give trainings

  • Plan and run meetups

  • Create and maintain open source projects

  • Write articles



Benefits


Bitovians get a slate of great benefits. Bitovi offers:



  • Competitive salary and yearly bonuses

  • Bi-annual company retreats to places like Las Vegas, New Orleans, and Amelia Island, Florida

  • 401(k) plan with matching

  • 4 weeks of paid vacation

  • Health and dental insurance

  • Gym membership reimbursement

  • Maternity & paternity leave

  • Working from home with flexible hours



How to Apply


Write a resume and a thoughtful cover letter that shows us that you’re the kind of person we’ve described above, and send it to jobs@bitovi.com.

item.title: Senior ETL Developer - 55038 at Liberty Mutual (Portsmouth, NH)
item.description:
Liberty Mutual Insurance At Liberty Mutual Insurance, doing the right thing is essential to all that we do. Our commitment to building and sustaining a talented and diverse workforce has helped us to become a global leader in property and casualty insurance. As of December 31, 2012, Liberty Mutual Insurance had $36.9 billion in annual consolidated revenue. Our financial strength and profitability rely on the skills, knowledge, and creativity of our more than 50,000 employees in over 900 offices worldwide. As number 81 on Fortune Magazine’s list of the 100 largest corporations in the U.S., we have the resources and training our employees need to drive our business forward and be successful in an ever-evolving, complex world. surety. Liberty Mutual Insurance (www.libertymutual.com) employs over 45,000 people in more than 900 offices throughout the world.

Advance your Information Technology (IT) career at Liberty Mutual Insurance - A Fortune 100 Company.



At Liberty Mutual Insurance, doing the right thing is essential to all that we do. Our commitment to building and sustaining a talented and diverse workforce has helped us to become a global leader in property and casualty insurance. Our financial strength and profitability rely on the skills, knowledge, and creativity of more than 50,000 employees worldwide. As number 76 on Fortune Magazine’s list of the 100 largest corporations in the U.S., we have the resources and training our employees need to drive our business forward and be successful in an ever-evolving, complex world.

item.title: Business Intelligence Technical Lead - 52977 at Liberty Mutual (Portsmouth, NH)

As the Technologist of BI and Data Integration you will provide technical leadership on all aspects of Business Intelligence, Data Warehousing, Data integration, Reporting and Visualization. In this position, you will drive design patterns, standards and leading edge practices and their adoption with the broader Information Management team to ensure quality, effective solutions and maximize business value from reuse in a global environment. item.title: Front End Developer (Node.js, JavaScript, CSS, Responsive Design) at The LateRooms Group (Manchester, UK)
item.description:
Calling all Full Stack Node.js, JavaScript, CSS & Responsive Design Engineers!


Passionate about great design – be it full stack code or UX? We're looking the brightest minds to join our talented teams at The LateRooms Group.


At LateRooms.com we are looking for talented Full Stack Web Developers to join our team to help us in the next phase of our growth. You will be helping deliver our new platform which will support all our brands - serving millions of customers each year.


The agile manifesto is central to how we think about working; we like learning new things and sharing them – be that whilst pairing or perhaps with brown bag sessions.


You’ll release code from the first day, and you’ll see how it’s improved our sites immediately as we continue to implement DevOps & a Data driven decisions culture within the team.


We already have some of the best Web Developers & Talent in the industry and you will be working alongside them in a fun and exciting atmosphere where discussing new ideas and technologies is part of everyday life…


So what does this role involve?



  • Competent & proficient in full stack development.

  • Developing high quality responsive web sites using the latest methods and technologies.

  • Releasing your changes at least daily to a stable, secure live environment serving millions of customers.

  • Working closely with the site UX team to create the best possible experience for our customers.

  • Helping the business assess new ideas & see what’s possible in the fast paced web industry we operate in.

  • Participating in sprint planning, retrospectives, and showcases.

  • You will have as much passion in HOW you work & deliver as you do in the technology you use, so terms like 'Craftsmanship', 'Clean Code', 'TDD', 'Self Organising', 'Metrics', 'Fast Feedback', 'Automate Everything' ... is not just a pipe dream but your daily environment!

item.title: Software Developer (Exciting opportunity: Intelligent people and great variety) at Pleasant Solutions (Edmonton, AB, Canada)
item.description:
Not your everyday software developer position. Challenging and fast moving, yet friendly and supportive: a career you will look forward to every day. Work with intelligent people in an exciting environment where every month is different.


Positions Available:



  • 3 positions ranging from intermediate up to team lead (based on skill, regardless of the amount of experience or education)

  • We take into consideration specialists (for example, Android programming, user interface programming, etc). Tell us your strengths and we’ll go from there.


Position Overview:



  • Full time and permanent.

  • Fast moving in terms of variety of work and expectations.

  • Flexible hours (for example: choose to start your day between 6am and 10am, work late some days and shorter on others).

  • Gain valuable career experience in the newest technologies (C#, .NET 4, WPF, XAML, MVC3, WCF, web services, SOA, Objective-C, F#).

  • Gain experience with many advanced software engineering tools and techniques (code generation, object relational mappers, advanced .NET reflection, etc).

  • Gain experience with both small and large projects, with involvement throughout the product life-cycle.

  • Opportunities to be involved with higher level architecture and design.

  • Mentoring from experienced software architects and some of the smartest peers in the country, on exciting projects that you can really sink your teeth into.

  • A blend of programming methodologies (deliberately part way between agile, Kanban, and waterfall plus occasional extreme and pair programming methodologies).

  • Does not involve a lot of boring technical support or fixing broken legacy applications.

  • Most of the learning is through hands-on trying and doing. Meetings and formal training is minimized.

  • Rarely requires meeting with a client for those who prefer not to.

  • Environment allows for some privacy at your workstation as well as time to concentrate without distractions when you need it.

item.title: Software developer at CSC - IT Center for Science Ltd. (Espoo, Finland)
item.description:
CSC is the largest provider of computing capacity in Finland and is now growing in the area of data science. We are looking for  2 software developers to our agile development teams with focus on data intensive systems (big data) and cloud computing. We work with and develop open source software (for example, see https://github.com/CSC-IT-Center-for-Science ). Our customers include the leading research groups, who we help to tackle their data intensive computing challenges. 

Tasks include: 

• Full-stack software development in agile environment 
• Expertise development in data intensive and cloud computing 
• Close interaction with customers 
• Cross-organizational collaboration with ICT infrastructure providers

item.title: Senior Big Data Engineer at Qubit (London, UK)
item.description:
Qubit: Cutting Edge Big Data Engineering


Qubit's Big Data platform collects, stores and processes over 1 billion external api calls per day, supporting business critical solutions for some of the world’s largest e-commerce companies.


Our core systems include high performance, low latency HTTP services and frameworks, ETL systems with dynamic schema management, machine learning and categorization / AI, Hadoop / MapReduce based workflows, RBDMS (Postgres and MySQL) and Business Intelligence solutions.


We’ve developed and deployed a hybrid cloud (AWS and Google Cloud); a dedicated platform tuned for high bandwidth data flows. We primarily work in Java, Scala, Clojure, Python, R and C on Linux based systems, but we're pretty agnostic.


What You'll Be Doing



  • Platform engineers at Qubit work to solve hard technical problems: designing, building and enhancing our core large scale distributed data infrastructure system

  • We work in small, agile teams with comprehensive domain expertise and a culture that champions innovation and continuous improvement

  • Wherever possible, we have a policy of contributing back to the open source software that we use extensively at Qubit

item.title: Open Source DevOps Engineer - Yammer, Services Scaling to Millions! at Yammer (Microsoft) (London, UK)
item.description:
We're looking for engineers to join our London Production Engineering team. Our team is cross-geographic, and is split between our offices in London and San Francisco. Our London office is in Shoreditch, <5 mins from Old Street Station.
We provide the foundations of Yammer.com and our job is to accelerate, scale and automate our rapidly growing infrastructure to support the engineering teams delivering all of the facets of our product.

You'll contribute to the build out of our new Linux-powered multi-site datacenters, backed by our own leading-edge network, provisioning and scaling technologies. We operate our own datacenters, on our own tin.
You'll undertake cross-functional engineering projects, working in small teams with other engineers in different knowledge spheres, building supportable, sustainable and reliable services. 
You'll be expected to have a wide range of experience in many different web technology areas - from distributed databases and automation engineering, to Linux containerisation and metrics gathering.

item.title: JavaScript/Application Developer at eCreations (Phoenix, AZ)
item.description:

Since 1997, we have maintained responsible growth and don’t believe in turnover. If you’re looking for a career and not just a job, we want to hear from you.

item.title: Senior Web Developer at Razorfish (Atlanta, GA)
item.description:
The Senior Web Developer at Razorfish is responsible for all aspects of presentation layer development-including all project related front-end technologies. The role requires someone with mastery of presentation layer coding concepts and paradigms as well as the ability/desire to quickly learn new technologies and implement them into production ready deliverables. Passion for bleeding edge technology is a must, as is the willingness to explore and propose interesting solutions to client business problems.



  • Responsible for executing clean and progressively enhanced code for complex designs that reflect the creative and artistic direction provided within the established technical framework.

  • Able to approach development with modularity in mind to accommodate shifting priorities and the challenges associated with rapid prototyping and Agile methodologies.

  • Willing to take the initiative to research and learn emerging technologies that may improve the quality, success, and performance of deliverables.

  • Participate in project scoping and planning, write detailed level technical and functional specifications documentation, and help mentor junior engineers.

  • Works well as a team member within technology and other disciplines (creative, delivery management, etc.) on large accounts.

item.title: Microsoft Stack DevOps Engineer w a Side of Cloud at Mercury New Media (Tampa, FL)
item.description:
We are a closely-held web and mobile (don't forget the data!) consulting firm and we are looking for an experienced DevOps Engineer.  Are you a system admin or system engineer who is interested in application development?  Are you a .NET developer who is interested in system engineering?  Know and/or love Azure?  Looking for a no-politics zone to do your best work?  Mercury is the place for you!


We are a Westshore-based group of talented designers and developers devoid of heavy corporate structures, approval processes and tight boundaries.  We're situated just right for Tampa AND Pinellas residents and ya, we work from home sometimes, too.

item.title: Ruby on Rails Developer at SunGard Consulting Services (Philadelphia, PA)
item.description:
We are looking for a highly motivated Ruby on Rails Developer to join SunGard Consulting Services business and help us deliver unique, product agnostic, custom solutions to our customers. Our clients are seeking out a competitive edge through technology solutions, and leverage our team of technical experts to design and deliver it. Here’s your chance to join a dynamic, global team of domain and technology subject matter experts, developers, quality assurance experts and business analysts who are helping shape the future of technology.

The position is based in Philadelphia, PA

Does this describe you?

Passionate about reading and writing elegant code
Able to translate complex business needs into user-focused technology solutions
Always curious and have the intellectual agility to learn quickly and adapt to change
Enjoy tackling challenges
Are results-oriented, flexible and able to succeed within a fun and collaborative environment
Take your responsibilities seriously and hold yourself – and your work product – to the highest standards of excellence and quality
At the same time, are eager and willing to try new things, embrace the latest technologies and pursue innovation that will benefit your clients, uncover better ways of doing things and push the frontiers of what’s possible
If you have the experience and passion to ….

Design and implement custom development and interfaces for our clients.
Work with the latest tools and frameworks to build complex user interfaces, some of which may require you to stretch the boundaries of existing technology sets.
Optimize applications to ensure high performance and scale, factoring in aspects such as responsive Web design to cater to a wide array of form factors, including mobile.
Write robust code that adheres to defined standards and raises the bar with respect to quality.

item.title: Systems Developer - Hong Kong at Jane Street (Hong Kong)
item.description:
Jane Street is a technology-focused proprietary trading firm. We are looking to hire great software developers with an interest in functional programming. OCaml, a statically typed functional programming with similarities to Haskell, Scheme, Erlang, F# and SML, is our language of choice. We've got the largest team of OCaml developers in any industrial setting, and probably the world's largest OCaml codebase. We use OCaml for running our entire business, supporting everything from research to systems administration to trading systems. If you're interested in seeing how functional programming plays out in the real world, there's no better place.


We also have extensive benefits, including:



  • 90% book reimbursement for work-related books

  • 90% tuition reimbursement for continuing education

  • Excellent medical and dental insurance

  • Free lunch delivered daily from a selection of restaurants

  • Catered breakfasts and fresh brewed coffee

  • An on-site, private gym with towel service

  • Kitchens fully stocked with a variety of snack choices


You can learn more about our technology here:


http://janestreet.com/technology/


Watch our talk given at CMU about why Jane Street uses functional programming:


http://ocaml.janestreet.com/?q=node/61


Our programming blog:


http://ocaml.janestreet.com


To apply, please visit our website and submit your application online!

item.title: Java Developer at Tradeweb (Jersey City, NJ)
item.description:
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES/ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:

item.title: Front End Engineer Boston startup Develop for Developers! at AppNeta (Boston, MA)
item.description:
At AppNeta, we strive to provide an elegant and powerful interface for exploring mountains of web application performance data. Summarizing and visualizing it all is a big challenge, and we’re looking for a front-end engineer to help us develop new charts, visualizations, and features.


We’re looking for someone who is as passionate as we are about building clean interfaces (with tbonejs.org, LESS, HTML5) and cool charts and graphs (D3, SVG).  If you can dig into the backend occasionally (Python), or are interested in building your backend chops, that’s great too. You’ll join our small, agile team and work to build smarter end-to-end web app performance monitoring.


We work on elegantly answering questions about performance that web developers face each day. Our work is distributed, agile, and test-driven.  We’re based in Boston, MA, with an office in Providence, RI. If you’d like to join our team, please get in touch!


Job Responsibilities



  • Build our front-end interface’s application logic and data models (JavaScript, tbonejs.org)

  • Implement charts, graphs, and other cool visualizations (D3.js, SVG, Less CSS)

  • Work with design and engineering to bring data and features to life

item.description:
Full-Stack Engineer

Our technology monitors full stack applications, so we like engineers who can work across all layers.  You’ll join our small, focused team and work on building cool new web app performance tools.


We work on elegantly answering questions about performance that web developers face each day.  Our development cycle is distributed, agile, and innovative.  If you’d like to join our team, please get in touch!
