item.title: Touch Screen Technology Innovator-The Future Is Now at Engrain (Littleton, CO)
item.description:
At Engrain the touch screen developer is responsible for implementing approved interface designs for both web and Flash applications. The developer must possess a demonstrable balance of technical and design skills and the ability to quickly learn new languages and technology.


Candidates will be working closely with Engrain’s interface design team and back end engineering team to deliver multi-touch, interactive touch screen applications for Engrain’s TouchTour products.

item.title: Front End Developer at ThoughtWorks (New York, NY)
item.description:
• We embrace design thinking in the way we work, marrying lean and agile approaches by pairing designers and developers. 

  • You will shape the practices on an opinionated team and revolutionize the industry through technology.   

  • No two projects are the same here at ThoughtWorks, so you can expect to be delighting our clients in various ways all the time – constantly developing and honing your craft to keep ahead of the game in both hard and soft skills.

item.title: Architect/Senior Developer and Leader Scale, Java Backbone, js, Bootstrap at TIM Group (London, UK)
item.description:
We will be looking for a passionate developer to join us in the new year and help us bring new products to market and find creative ways to build and enhance systems that solve our financial clients’ needs. We expect a Senior Developer to mentor and lead other developers, as well as add to our technology teams skill set that ranges from deep technology knowledge to start-up experience to financial systems knowledge.


Our Business


Our systems help manage billion-dollar portfolios, feed complex quantitative financial models, and fuel the sales and trading desks of the world's largest investment banks. We give our teams the freedom to use the tools and languages that they need to solve the problems inherent in these systems.


Due to our rapid business growth since launching our products in 2005, we have grown our development teams both in our London office and remotely. We offer a fun, challenging, and rewarding working environment and the opportunity to work with world-class talent to help you build a world-class career.


Our Technologies


Our systems are written primarily in Scala and Java on the server-side, and for our web-apps, we largely develop rich front-ends using Javascript and tools like Backbone.js and Bootstrap. We integrate into MySQL and MongoDB databases, as well as MQ services and our continuous delivery infrastructure. We contribute into the open source community, and you can browse our work here:  https://github.com/youdevise. As well as hear our thoughts about this and everything else on our blog here: https://devblog.timgroup.com/


Our Process


We enter new markets using a lean start-up approach based on minimum viable products. We believe discipline allows us to go faster. We use agile development techniques such as test-driven development, pair-programming, and continuous delivery. We actively seek to learn and improve through retrospectives, lightning talks, and various meet-ups that we host in our offices. We expect our developers to care about how to design software and systems that our clients will love, and will want to solve their problems quickly and iteratively seeking creative ways to build valued systems.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer - Android at Appian Corporation (Reston, VA) (allows remote)
item.description:
We’re looking for a Senior Android Developer that not only wants to write code, but also wants to build a great product.  As a Software Engineer working on Appian’s Android app, you will be responsible for the mobile face of Appian to our customer’s end users. From the News feed and Task list, to the custom UIs our customers design on the Appian platform, you must make them look good and perform well on any modern Android device. Your scope extends from RESTful web API design on the server, to the Android-specific renderer for Appian’s cross-platform user interface framework, to the final user experience of the Appian app. This role is for you if you aren't satisfied with doing things the way they've always been done.

**Relocation assistance and remote work opportunities available to those in the US**

item.title: Expert System Engineer at TomTom (Amsterdam, The Netherlands)
item.description:
'Five years from now we'll be active in areas we haven't yet dreamed of', Harold Goddijn, CEO TomTom.

Where do you want to be?

We are looking for the best and brightest minds in System Engineering to join our team in Amsterdam. You are an ambitious developer/system engineer willing to help us "Automate All The Things", starting with the TomTom infrastructure. Along with automation, your job will include researching and integrating any new beneficial technologies or tools into the TomTom stack. As a member of this team, you are asked to deliver the following:



  1. This is a team-orientated atmosphere and good communication skills are a must. You will improve your co-worker’s skill set with your knowledge and receive the same in return;

  2. Whilst you're successful, you're always looking to improve. You keep a broader view in which technology, however cool, is only useful if it gets applied in simple but meaningful ways;

  3. You will actively contribute to writing APIs, glue, and tools in a team that applies TDD and has peer reviews to ensure quality. We love elegant, maintenance free, solid code that runs efficiently. Our stack is based on Puppet, AWS, CloudStack, KVM, CentOS, and in-house gluing (mostly Ruby and a bit of Python). For monitoring the parts we put in place, we use Logstash, Kibana, and graphite.



What do we offer? 



  1. An adventure in the cutting-edge field of digital mapping, traffic and navigation solutions;

  2. The chance to work in a fast moving, innovative and international environment, dealing with all kind of different countries and cultures;

  3. Indefinite contract, flexible benefits, 25 annual leave days, flexible holiday plan, collective health insurance, pension scheme, up to 50% discount on products, bonus scheme;

  4. Among others, an online learning platform (1500 courses & 11000 e-books) as well as live speeches from software development gurus, like Uncle Bob;

  5. International relocation package and professional support (if applicable).

item.title: Embedded Network Software Engineer at Xirrus (Thousand Oaks, CA)
item.description:
The Embedded Network Software Engineer is responsible for the development of Xirrus Array product software for all Xirrus embedded platforms. In this role you will leverage a wide range of experience and related knowledge in areas that encompass enterprise switching and routing features (L2 and above), functions and operating systems, including development for both wired and 802.11 wireless products and  programming in a Linux O/S environment.


Additionally, you will drive development as a member of a dynamic, software engineering team, define the implementation of sustaining/features on the Xirrus Array OS (AOS) and develop WIFI standards to support specific features on the Xirrus Array.

item.description:
Changing the world is all in a day's work at Apple. If you love innovation, here's your chance to make a career of it. You'll work hard. But the job comes with more than a few perks.

Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, great ideas have a way of becoming great products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish.
Apple’s Emerging Technology group is seeking a highly motivated, result-oriented Engineering Manager to oversee Quality Assurance of very large-scale, distributed server side applications and platforms. The candidate should be a leader with a passion for quality and be able to thrive in a bleeding edge highly agile environment with no blueprints.

Description:
Define and Drive the QA vision for end to end functional and performance testing for key platforms and applications
Recruit, train, and setup an Engineering Quality Assurance team.
Manage, coach and mentor quality assurance engineers
Oversee communication and co-ordination with international teams
Work closely with cross-functional organizations, project teams and clients to develop project schedules, execute test plans and cases, and deliver high quality products
Enhance Quality Assurance processes, environments, tools and frameworks
Act as a strong advocate for quality in the product development process for software engineering

Self-motivated and must be able to grasp issues quickly and make educated, critical judgment in the absence of complete information.
Able to multi-task in a dynamic, fast-paced environment
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Good interpersonal skills and able to work with various cross functional teams to deliver high quality products.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer, Maps API - 37256225 at Apple, Inc (Cupertino, CA)
item.description:
Changing the world is all in a day's work at Apple. If you love innovation, here's your chance to make a career of it. You'll work hard. But the job comes with more than a few perks.

Apple Maps is front and center on hundreds of millions of devices, and the Maps API is the front door to the services powering them all. We’re looking for cross-functional leaders to craft the service that receives, dispatches, and composes responses for the smorgasbord of actions that go into creating the Apple Maps experience.

Description:
Does working on the team that is the primary interface to Apple Maps for hundreds of millions of devices, serving billions of requests per day, sound interesting?

The Maps API is the doorway to all systems powering the Apple Maps service for our various clients. It receives requests and actions, dispatches them to appropriate services, and composes responses for a broad range of request types with vastly different scaling profiles. Working on the Maps API, you’ll be a key cross-functional contributor to almost all new projects for Maps.

We’ve got big plans for our API - we’re looking for leaders that can design and build clean, scalable, and performance APIs, as well as design and build systems to trace, monitor, and debug requests once they enter our distributed backend systems with their complex dependencies. We’re overhauling things front-to-back and want engineers that live and breath distributed systems and services.

item.title: Maps Search infrastructure Engineer - 31734940 at Apple, Inc (Cupertino, CA)
item.description:
Changing the world is all in a day's work at Apple. If you love innovation, here's your chance to make a career of it. You'll work hard. But the job comes with more than a few perks.

Apple is looking for experienced, self driven, Search Engineers to deliver the next generation of Local Search. This is an opportunity to be part of a team which is re-architecting search infrastructure from the ground up to deliver the best in class local search experience for our customers. This is an ideal role for someone who is passionate about search, cares about innovation, software craftsmanship, building high performance software products, always thinking about optimizing software for best utilization of resources and provide a high quality of customer experience by providing the best search results.

Description:
As a member of the Maps Search Infrastructure team you will be working on various components of the Maps Search Infrastructure. As a member of the team you will be responsible for design, development and maintenance of core search components which serves millions of customers worldwide.

You will be working closely with the data, search relevance and analytics teams to develop new features and ensuring our customers have the best search experience. You will be working on high performance and highly available search systems using Lucene, Java in Linux environments. You will participate in design and code reviews and work with engineers and QA to deliver high quality search experience to our customers.

item.title: Maps Build Engineer - 37209972 at Apple, Inc (Cupertino, CA)
item.description:
Changing the world is all in a day's work at Apple. If you love innovation, here's your chance to make a career of it. You'll work hard. But the job comes with more than a few perks.

The Maps team is rapidly expanding and has an enormous momentum towards building first class continuous delivery capabilities. The build team needs capable engineers with a passion for how to build and release software at scale. Imagine the impact you can have on the cycle time by para-jumping into different development teams and working collaboratively with them to enhance their builds. This role requires you to solve difficult problems in polyglot build environments and be exposed to a variety of toolchains while working closely with extremely knowledgeable and talented people. These people will challenge you every step of the way in order for you and the project to achieve excellence.

This is an exciting role demanding a strong background in technology, build engineering, fostering partnerships and ability to collaborate. This role will challenge you with problems regarding everything from issues of high scalability and multi project complexity to the knowledge depth required to enhance the performance in distributed C/C++ builds. It requires a deep insight into the software development lifecycle for production services and also gives you lots of freedom with the responsibility to complete your goals. A person in this role will thrive in an ambiguous and fast-paced environment, operating at the tactical level, while solving difficult problems. In this role you will be part of a team that is responsible for:

Designing and implementing a build system and infrastructure that delivers high quality software at a rapid pace.

Communicating with a wide variety of teams to gather requirements and build collaboration.

item.title: Maps Community Client Software Engineer - 37207190 at Apple, Inc (Cupertino, CA)
item.description:
Changing the world is all in a day's work at Apple. If you love innovation, here's your chance to make a career of it. You'll work hard. But the job comes with more than a few perks.

The Maps team is looking for a talented and passionate software engineer to help develop the next generation of community services. Join us in building and extending the Maps application to allow Apple to crowdsource improvements to the Maps experience.

Description:
As an engineer working on Maps Community, your primary responsibility will be high-level UI development and architecture of the “Report a Problem” feature of the Maps application, and you will work closely with designers and engineers across the company to add new features and build the very best crowd-sourcing experience. You’ll also be working on the frameworks and plugins that enable Maps to integrate deeply and seamlessly with parts of the system such as Siri and Passbook, to extend and enhance the feedback experience.

To meet these demands, you’ll need to be a fantastic iOS developer, able to debug with great proficiency, and ready to eek out the best-possible application performance using a variety of tools and techniques. An aptitude for crafting both user and developer interfaces will also serve you well. As Maps community feedback is gathered on multiple platforms (iOS, OS X), understanding and developing shared codebases between the two operating systems is a must.

Changing the world is all in a day's work at Apple. If you love innovation, here's your chance to make a career of it. You'll work hard. But the job comes with more than a few perks.

item.title: Senior Software Developer (Android) at TrueCar, Inc. (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Are you a mobile engineer looking to create innovative new projects working with the latest technologies? Are you looking to work on new products that are constantly evolving and challenging your skills? Have you seen us on TV? Heard us on the radio? 



TrueCar is newly public and we are one of the fastest growing, well-funded technology companies in Los Angeles.  Since 2005, we have been on a mission to make the car-buying process simple, fair and fun. The results have been amazing.  TrueCar consumers have purchased over 1.6 million cars by partnering with over 9,600 of the most reputable, customer-focused automotive dealers.  We power over 400 websites for their auto purchasing programs including truecar.com, USAA, American Express, Consumer Reports and AAA.  We have a great product you can stand behind. 



TrueCar is looking for a Senior Android Developer responsible for leading and building the technology used to power our native applications for TrueTrade on Android phones and tablets. Ideal candidates will have more than seven years of professional software development experience building data-driven, interactive applications with two years of experience building specifically for mobile devices, including Android applications written in Java.



TrueCar offers base salary, bonus (twice per year), equity, 100% paid benefits (for you and your family), 401k match, over 3 weeks of paid time off, gym membership reimbursement, catered breakfasts, lunches, and all the snacks you can handle. We are a company who takes care of our employees in every way.



Responsibilities:



  • Designing and writing production-ready code and unit tests meeting both technical and business requirements

  • Optimizing and enhancing systems for high interactivity and high performance with limited computing resources

  • Contributing domain-specific expertise by reviewing code, reviewing design docs, and giving technical talks

item.title: Software Engineer- Accessibility -30522897 at Apple, Inc (Cupertino, CA)
item.description:
Changing the world is all in a day's work at Apple. If you love innovation, here's your chance to make a career of it. You'll work hard. But the job comes with more than a few perks.

Apple's Productivity team is looking for a software engineer to build accessibility features and user interfaces for iWork applications. Come help us improve the accessibility of iWork on iOS, Mac, and on the Web!

This position requires attention to detail, aggressive preparation of demos, and a willingness to quickly adapt to change. Responsibilities include implementing high-level accessible user interfaces and tracking new APIs coming from Apple's operating system teams. You will work closely with other software engineers, product designers, and different groups across Apple.

item.title: Senior Software Developer (Python/Django) at TrueCar, Inc. (Santa Monica, CA)
item.description:
Have you seen us on TV? Heard us on the radio?  Newly public, we are one of the fastest growing, well-funded technology companies in Los Angeles.  Since 2005, we have been on a mission to make the car-buying process simple, fair and fun.  The results have been amazing.  TrueCar consumers have purchased over 1.6 million cars by partnering with over 9,600 of the most reputable, customer-focused automotive dealers. We power over 400 websites for their auto purchasing programs including truecar.com, USAA, American Express, Consumer Reports and AAA.  We have a great product you can stand behind. 



We are growing and looking for a talented Python Developer who will be responsible for building the technology used to power our production websites, APIs, widgets, and internal tools. Ideal candidates will have more than seven years of professional software development experience building database-driven, web-based systems in a Linux environment.  You will be utilizing the latest web technologies to solve challenging problems, create innovative web applications from the ground up and understand exactly what it takes to create an outrageously good Web experience for our customers. You’ll be all about finding ways to increase customer conversion and satisfaction. 



Responsibilities:




  • Designing and writing production-ready code and unit tests meeting both technical and business requirements

  • Optimizing and enhancing systems with high-volume data logging and processing needs, and high performance requirements

  • Contributing architecture input to new systems as well as rewriting legacy systems

  • Contributing domain-specific expertise by reviewing code, reviewing design docs, giving technical talks, and mentoring junior members of the team

  • Helping support the operation of our production services

item.title: Software Engineer- Maps Services -30087446 at Apple, Inc (Cupertino, CA)
item.description:
Changing the world is all in a day's work at Apple. If you love innovation, here's your chance to make a career of it. You'll work hard. But the job comes with more than a few perks.

Do you like to take ownership of a feature and drive it to completion? Do you enjoy engineering the best solution while meeting various constraints? Do you enjoy working with multiple teams to support an awesome user experience? Then we have the job for you!

Ideal candidate would have experience with system architecture, as well as the design, implementation, and testing of individual components but also be comfortable with multiple scripting languages. Must be able to work with other teams to understand their needs, define requirements and interfaces, and implement a solution.

Successful candidates will need to have strong programming skills, superb communication skills, be an effective team member, and be able to take ownership of a project.

item.title: Full Stack Software Engineers (Mobile & RoR) at TrueCar, Inc. (La Rioja, Argentina)
item.description:
Who Are We? TrueCar.com is a revolutionary Internet company whose mission is to reinvent how cars are bought & sold and make the car buying experience awesome! Driven by industry leaders, successful entrepreneurs and superior technologists, we are growing quickly, and we’re looking for energetic new talent.



Why TRUECar?  We use lean, startup / agile development processes.  


Lone wolves – No!


Great teammates – Yes!



Who Are We Looking For?  We’re looking for talented full stack Ruby developers to build the technology used to power our APIs, mobile apps, production websites, and internal tools. We’re lucky enough to have an amazingly great (and fun) team and are smart enough to know that only by keeping our team’s DNA at the top of the chart can we continue to grow into the game-changing company we feel destined to be.



We are:



  • Highly energetic and committed to a great product and culture

  • Newly public, fully funded, and have a great upside

  • Highly experienced industry and start up veterans

  • Growing with viable revenue streams



Qualifications:

item.title: Senior Mobile Game Developer / Dev Team Leader at Space Inch (New York, NY) (allows remote)
item.description:
We are a small but very fast growing mobile game company.  We’ve released very successful games like: Make it Rain: The Love of Money (recently #1 app in the app store!), Disco Bees, and Say the Same Thing (both featured by Apple editors).  

We have extremely high standards for quality and our user base is expanding quickly.  We have several new games under development.  Our team has grown from 4 people to 18 in the last 12 months.

We are looking for a very smart and experienced developer to join our company and potentially lead a team.  This is a key position for us.

We need someone with full stack skills-- client, server, 3rd party tools -- who is also a leader.  Someone who is able to make smart efficient decisions, is able to solve the most challenging technical problems personally, and is able to learn and implement new systems quickly.

item.title: Sharepoint Application Developer at MidwayUSA (Columbia, MO)
item.description:
MidwayUSA, located in Columbia, MO, is a leading internet retailer of shooting and hunting products.  We currently have an exciting position for Application Developer with Sharepoint experience.   ThisApplication Developer will work closely with our development staff and will assist in supporting our Quality Management Systems team doing Sharepoint development.  



The ideal candidate will have:

item.title: Systems Architect at WorkXpress (Harrisburg, PA)
item.description:
General Job Requirements/Roles:


* Responsible for availability of fleet of Ubuntu Server systems running Apache, PHP, Percona MySQL, MemcacheD, Lighttpd (the stack).


* Responsible for reporting usage information into a central collection area, graphing that data and making those graphs available inside our proprietary platform. 


* Responsible for maintaining and improving our proprietary self-healing mechanics when a problem is detected in one of the critical stack components. 


* Responsible for automation of requisition of new Ubuntu Server systems, automatically provisioning for the stack (on demand) on multiple IaaS providers: Amazon AWS, LiquidWeb, Linode, etc. 


* Responsible for automation to scale existing Ubuntu Server systems up and down, interfacing with the IaaS provider API's as well as the WorkXpress proprietary systems for billing purposes. 


* Responsible for building and maintaining the automation of clustering, assigning roles (Web, Application, Database) to systems and management of systems that leverage each other to host web applications dynamically.  This will also include multi-site clustering, with failover capabilities for disaster management. 


* Responsible for live snapshot and secure offsite storage of application backups. 


* Responsible for DNS management, and automation.  This includes simple *.workxpress.com registration of new sub-domains, and also assisting business team with processing client's domain requests in an automated way.

item.title: Full Stack Engineer at YouNoodle (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Build the infrastructure behind the largest startup competitions in the world.


YouNoodle is looking for a talented and experienced full-stack engineer to join our San Francisco-based team of hackers, designers, and architects. We are helping tens of thousands of startups step forward on our global competitions platform, and we are effectively building the world’s largest innovation engine. We are looking to add an exceptional engineer to help scale our existing product as well as build out tomorrow’s global startup movement platform.



Our new product is based on AngularJS and Laravel, our codebase is very structured and neat, and we want to keep it that way. We’re looking for someone who can dive in and take responsibility where needed to make sure that the app works and flows well, from the backend to the frontend. You will be given a lot of independence in your work and a real opportunity to influence the product in a meaningful way.

item.title: Software Development Engineer at Wyatt Technology Corporation (Santa Barbara, CA)
item.description:
What we’re looking for


WTC is looking for highly skilled software developers to help us design and implement amazing new features to ensure that we remain the undisputed leader in our industry.


Our development team is small, brilliant, talented, and passionate.  We expect every member to make a significant contribution. As an ideal candidate, you will have had a meaningful influence on a number of projects in the commercial or Open Source world. You will probably have a positive Stack Overflow reputation, a number of Twitter followers, and your friends and coworkers think of you as the go-to person for one or more of the following:

  • Troubleshooting algorithms

item.title: Drupal/Javascript/PHP Programmer at Perfectly Posh (West Valley City, UT)
item.description:
Perfectly Posh is a fast-growing company in the bath and body products industry. We're looking for a senior-level Drupal back-end developer and site architect.  We're looking for someone who is comfortable managing the software development for a complex e-commerce website and various other pieces of Perfectly Posh's online presence and technologies. (Our current e-commerce platform is built on the Drupal Commerce framework for Drupal 7, so while any PHP developer is welcome to apply they would have a significant uphill climb.)


Responsibilities


A good candidate for this position will be comfortable managing and troubleshooting existing software (primarily on a web-based e-commerce platform), developing new software to meet business needs, and understanding how the company's business logic drives software engineering choices and data architecture. You should also be comfortable working with other developers in order to implement complex feature sets and come up with the best solution for the business's needs.


Qualifications


- At least 3-5 years of professional web development experience, the majority with the Drupal platform


- Experience architecting e-commerce solutions for unique business logic needs


- Experience writing custom modules and leveraging all layers of the Drupal API:


--- Form API and AJAX wizardry


--- Views and Views Bulk Operations APIs


--- Queue API


--- Entity API


--- Drupal Commerce (general config and API layers)


--- Organic Groups (general config and API layers)


- Familiarity with the direct sales industry is a big plus


- Front-end development skills are a bonus but not strictly required -- we have an excellent creative department

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Appian Corporation (Reston, VA)
item.description:
As a Senior Software Engineer working on the Appian platform, your mission will be to ensure Appian is always fast, scalable and up to whatever tasks our customers configure it to do. You will be solving problems of scale and flexibility that most engineers never see, building a product capable of serving our customers in ways you never imagined. Your scope extends from the high-performance data layer to the cross-platform user interface. This position requires the mental agility to jump from the deep code-level view of Appian, to the designer’s view, to the end user’s view, and back again. Learn how to write software that runs software, and enhance Appian's cross-platform functional programming language.

You will design and develop systems that let our customers build amazing enterprise apps for mobile and the web without writing a line of code. The design decisions and judgement calls you make will impact millions of Appian users worldwide. You will be looked upon as an expert and advocate to fellow engineers on making design and reliability trade-offs in running large-scale services and engineering complex systems that fail gracefully and transparently to users.

As a successful candidate for this role you will have strong analytical and troubleshooting skills, fluency in coding and systems design, solid communication skills and a desire to tackle the complex problems of software design and delivery which are uniquely Appian’s.

item.title: Software Developer II at Ontario Teachers' Pension Plan (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Position Summary:


Provide technical solutions required by the Ontario Teachers’ Pension Plan to meet its business objectives. Contribute considerable amount of business and/or technical knowledge to projects.


Duties and Responsibilities:



  • Under direction of a project leader or supervisor and with code/design reviews completes high quality, well designed and implemented systems that make appropriate use of technology.

  • Develops/communicates personal work plan and the task details appropriate for the on time completion of all work assignments.

  • Maintain currency in technological trends and directions through research/education/self-motivated technology experimentation.

  • Other duties as assigned.

item.title: Full-stack Python & Node Engineer at Net Access (Hanover, NJ)
item.description:
Net Access is a datacenter operator and hosting provider; we are seeking experienced software engineers to join us in re-imagining the way we manage modern hybrid hosting environments that combine colocation with bare-metal servers, public & private cloud, and IaaS offerings.


Our team is implementing a new platform to provide our staff and customers with a unified interface that exposes colocation and bare metal services in the same way we are accustomed to managing cloud services. It ties together our array of backend systems using a microservices approach, with Python-powered RESTful APIs for both internal and customer use, and clean web interfaces implemented with node.js.


Job responsibilities include design & development of new features, performing code reviews, and being involved in shaping the direction of the platform. You will have the opportunity to work with a broad selection of technologies including Python, Node.js, RabbitMQ, Redis, Graphite, ElasticSearch & Openstack.


Net Access prides itself on having a highly collaborative and entrepreneurial environment that values innovation, agility, and insight -- and is full of smart and interesting people, too.


We offer a very competitive salary package, medical & dental insurance, 401k, and have a flexible vacation policy.

item.title: Linux Systems Administrator at ScientiaMobile (Reston, VA)
item.description:
NO RECRUITERS OR AGENCIES PLEASE


The Position: 
We're looking for an experienced Linux Systems Administrator to manage our infrastructure of 50+ production GNU/Linux physical and virtual servers. You must have an intimate knowledge of Ubuntu and other popular Linux distributions, and real-world experience building, upgrading, monitoring and managing servers in a production environment. Among other things, we are the provider of multiple highly-available, low-latency web services, and you will be responsible for the smooth operation of these and our other systems, as well as building instances of various distributions for software testing and quality control. Previous experience with Amazon Web Services is required.

item.title: Server Application Developer at Propeller Health (Madison, WI)
item.description:
This is your opportunity to make an impact solving big, important problems in a small but vocal team. Your primary responsibility will be designing, building and consuming RESTful web services for our disease management platform. 


We have a modern, but very deep, coding stack. The back-end services run on Node.js and Mongo. The client applications include native iOS and Android applications as well as multiple browser interfaces. The most successful developers will wear multiple hats as needs arise. This will include front-end and back-end development in JavaScript, as well as customer support. In your primary role, your responsibilities include:



  • Implementing JSON-based web services.

  • Implementing data analytics and finding answers inside a vast amount of data.

  • Researching and experimenting with third-party data sources.

  • Working in a collaborative development environment.

  • Implement and follow development processes that comply with medical regulations while enabling the team to work efficiently.

item.title: Mid Software Engineer at R2integrated (Baltimore, MD)
item.description:
Work with engineering team to develop web based applications.  Document, track and provide updates on project status.  Participate in code reviews and knowledge transfer sessions.


All duties are performed under the guidance of a VP of Technology.



  • Provide progress updates to team lead/project manager

This job includes working closely with our creative directors and clients to design sustainable, creative strategies for our Fortune 500, non profit and government clients.

item.title: DevOps Engineer at Beatport (New York, NY)
item.description:
The SFX team prides itself on building fast, responsive and engaging web applications to connect EDM fans together with the music, artists and each other.


We are looking for a DevOps Engineer to join our team working on an exciting new music platform! We are looking for someone with a strong background in infrastructure as code, task automation, and a focus on stability and maintainability of server environments.


Responsibilities:




  • Direct ownership for scaling systems




  • Capacity management for all environments




  • Supporting dev and test infrastructure for the team




  • Implementing best practices (server configuration, security, etc)




  • Staying current on software updates for technologies in use and determine appropriate timelines for upgrades




  • Reporting on the state of the infrastructure and making recommendations for change as appropriate




  • Working closely with the team to ensure the needs of the platform are defined and met





You definitely:




  • Are an expert in Linux system administration




  • Have experience with the AWS stack (EC2, S3, ELB, ElastiCache, CloudFront, RDS, IAM, SES)




  • Have experience deploying, maintaining, and scaling Web applications




  • Get a kick out of defining and working on infrastructure as code




  • Enjoy collaborating with developers to design, build, deploy, and evolve sophisticated systems




  • Have previous Python development experience and are comfortable writing code if needed




  • Have proficiency with at least one configuration management framework (Chef, Salt, Ansible, Puppet, etc) and have opinions on their relative strengths and weaknesses




  • Understand the Unix philosophy




  • Have opinions on the right way to do things, and are comfortable sharing them, respectfully and collaboratively





It would be nice if you:




  • Have experience configuring, deploying, operating, and maintaining sophisticated relational databases, including replication




  • Have an interest in, or want to learn more about, Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment




  • Have used Ansible previously for configuration management




  • Are familiar with the 12 factor methodology





Benefits:




  • Highly competitive compensation package




  • Flex Schedule






  • An Employee Development Program, including a budget for conferences and classes




  • Creative outlets for side projects, including hackathons and lab days




  • VIP Access to select music events




  • The opportunity to work with new and emerging technologies




  • Relocation stipend




  • We have a culture of collaboration and mentorship. We are always helping one another -someone almost always has the answer for any question you've got




  • Weekly company lunch





About SFX:


SFX is the platform for the EDM revolution. With the leading festivals in the world, like Tomorrowland, the leading online destination, Beatport, and FX1, the marketing solutions agency for the millennial generation, SFX delivers the most exciting work environment for people in contemporary music, arts, culture and technology.


Our culture is open and entrepreneurial. Entertainment is fun, and we think work should be too.



How to Apply:


Please send a short note introducing yourself and why this position appeals to you. Include a resume and samples of your work.


Candidates must be authorized to work in the United States.

item.title: Senior Mobile Software Developer (Android) at iBwave (Montréal, QC, Canada)
