item.title: Front End Web Developer at Zendo (Fort Lauderdale, FL)
item.description:
WHY WORK FOR ZENDO?



  • Collaborate with outstanding people:  We hire only the best. Our quality standards are high and our employees enjoy working alongside other high achievers.      

  • Make an immediate impact:  New employees can expect to be given responsibility quickly for bringing new technologies to the marketplace. You are empowered to perform as soon as you join the team!  

  • Gain well rounded experience:  We offer a diverse and dynamic environment where you will get the chance to work directly with executives and gain a broad knowledge base across multiple areas of the business.

  • Work with latest technologies:  As we lead the industry, we require expertise across a broad spectrum of technologies including short and long-range wireless communication, video surveillance, lighting, web development, and backend application development and hosting.


POSITION OVERVIEW


A fast-growing entrepreneurial technology company, Zendo, is seeking an Front End Web Developer to join the team. The successful candidate will ultimately have a wide range of responsibilities, but will focus on updating features and functionality in our online store, evaluating new technologies, translating designs as a programmer/developer, and creating and maintaining tools to support marketing initiatives and engage users.


COMPANY BENEFITS


Zendo offers competitive pay and benefits including a wide choice of healthcare options with generous company subsidy, a health savings account option with company contribution, 401(k) with employer match, paid holidays and paid time off increasing with tenure, paid maternity and paternity leave, company paid STD/LTD and life insurance, flexible spending accounts, and a casual and fun work environment.


Zendo is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

item.title: Senior Application Architect at TD Ameritrade (Ann Arbor, MI)
item.description:
Application Architects will champion and drive TD Ameritrade's application rationalization efforts aimed at improving availability, scalability, and flexibility. The candidate will be a thought leader for App Dev and will participate in all aspects of high-level architectural reconstruction and re-factoring, including technology standardization and modernization. He/She will participate in the Architecture Review Board (ARB) and will be an advocate for developers in this forum and to both the CIO & CTO organizations. Application Architects should be a subject matter expert in one or more technology space which spans horizontally across business domains (e.g. user interfaces, messaging/middleware, caching, persistence, etc.). They should serve as a resource for developers and an evangelist for the given technologies we have chosen for Technology. Candidate should have had previously been a developer and have deep experience in both core and enterprise Java as well as ideally other modern languages (python, ruby, Javascript, etc.). In addition they should have extensive experience with the major frameworks and technologies used in the Java space.


Applicants must be eligible to work in the U.S. Immigration sponsorship is typically not available for this position.


Responsibilities:


1: Provide direction and assistance on projects required subject matter expertise in application space



  • Work with project team to understand both functional and non-functional requirements

  • Work with solutions architects to understand inter-system and intra-system dependencies to design integration mechanisms leveraging both existing and net new services

  • Work with app dev and project team to design application solutions in conjunction with other architects (infra, data, solutions)


2: Conduct research & development exercises for new applications



  • Keep track of the industry landscape (both open source and commercial) and perform research in applications and opportunities for improvements over our existing suite

  • Drive POCs with software packages which are chosen for evaluation

  • Work with infrastructure architecture & engineering to understand implications of new products

  • Work with vendors and sourcing to understand and present cost and contractual implications of new products


3: Scope application and development implications for projects in the pre-project phase



  • Participate in scoping efforts in the pre-project state to determine application implications and highlight them to business owners and T2 management

  • Understand application integration considerations such as security, performance, and standards when working with a third party, vendor, or joint-venture/partnership model

  • Communicate with partners in application development to understand cost and LOE implications for projects


4: Act as an application evangelist and mentor to application development



  • Educate and mentor developers on technologies, tools, and software development best practices

  • Socialize new technologies, as well as changes in the technology landscape with developers

  • Create artifacts around use of specific packages and T2 standards in order to help bootstrap new hires in app dev

item.title: Quality Assurance Manager at TD Ameritrade (Jersey City, NJ)
item.description:
The primary responsibility of this position will be to ensure adequate testing of development code prior to release to production. The QA Manager will report to the QA Senior Manager.


This is a “hands-on” QA Manager role. The focus of the QA Manager will be to ensure all changes to applications are tested adequately. The QA Manager will be responsible for ensuring all test plans and test cases created meet all standards established by the QA organization. The QA manager will ensure test plans and test cases are created and executed on a release by release basis. The QA Manager is responsible for using all test management tools according to standard.


Applicants must be eligible to work in the U.S. Immigration sponsorship is typically not available for this position.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Develop test plans and test strategy for each release



  • Review test plans and conduct peer reviews of test cases



  • Identify risks and prepare mitigation plans

  • Provide test estimates to Project managers, Development and Release in preparation of implementation timelines

  • Assist in determining appropriate test environments

  • Work with business analysts to ensure business requirements are adequate

  • Ensure test cases are developed according to standards ' for both manual and automated

  • Execute tests cases manually or automated

  • Provide daily status to project team on test execution progress for the release

  • Perform problem solving and root cause analysis when defects occur

  • Update Quality Center requirement traceability, test cases, test sets and defects according to QA standards

  • Engage application development in defect resolution

  • Lead defect review calls

  • Coordinate tasks with onshore/offshore resources

  • Participate on continuous improvement efforts within the QA organization

  • Research and evaluate new testing technologies and tools

  • Become technically competent in all technologies used by Application Development organizations

  • Evaluate and recommend process or technical changes to partner organizations

  • Use positive influence to engage EPM and business partners

  • Provide guidance around automation strategies, working with the QA Automation Team and Application Development

item.title: Senior Web Developer at Industrial (Ottawa, ON, Canada)
item.description:
We're currently looking for a Senior Web Developer to provide the necessary leadership and technical expertise to help us take the next step in our 15-year evolution.


If you're passionate and care about:



  • Working in an amazing team of designers, front and back-end developers and QA specialists

  • Providing technology leadership to the team and our clients

  • Professional development and self-motivated learning

  • Using best practices, tools, languages and frameworks; and

  • Contributing to open source projects during your day job

item.title: Team Leader / Frontend Developer at Fracture, Inc (Gainesville, FL) (allows remote)
item.description:
We’re looking for a leader for our bread’n’butter e-commerce website. The position bridges all the key components of Fracture's web dev ecosystem. It is personal, technical, visual and organizational as it brings digital projects from the idea stage through development and into the real world. You'll be a cornerstone of the team, being responsible firstly for managing discourse between marketing, creative and programming, building project definitions, scheming actionables/schedules and managing the full A-Z execution of the project. Secondly the position has a front end development component. The final project would come together in your hands and you would be ultimatelyresponsible for making sure that the final product looks, behaves and functions to spec as envisioned and planned.


We believe that combining the roles of leader, project manager and front end developer create the best product in the end. However, we realize that there are limits to how much coding a leader can actually have time for, so the front end dev component is secondary and flexible as it may be supplemented by other team members and we expect this to change over time. The point is to have a lean combination of leadership and hands-on involvement and we believe the workload of both combined is just about right for one person.

item.title: Director of Platform/DevOps at Bracket Computing (Los Lunas, NM)
item.description:
1. Bracket Computing was founded in 2011 with the ultimate goal of delivering enterprise computing that is driven by business needs, not hardware limitations. To that end, Bracket created the world’s first Cloud Virtualization System with the development of its Computing Cell. Today Computing Cells harness the public cloud for the enterprise, combining their scale, elasticity and efficiency with the security, performance and control of a dedicated hardware data center. Bracket Computing is a private company whose investors include venture firms Andreessen Horowitz, Norwest Venture Partners, Sutter Hill Ventures, ARTIS Ventures and Allegis Capital, and strategic corporate investors GE and Qualcomm. The company is headquartered in Sunnyvale, California. For more information, visit www.brkt.com


Technical leadership, strong communication skills and teamwork are essential requirements for this
role as it involves working with both technical and non-technical groups within Bracket Computing.


Key Qualifications:
•Strong systems experience on Linux, and virtual machines
•Understanding of filesystem and storage configurations such as SAN, SSD, data replication
•Understanding of network stack, network tuning, load balancing, subnet/VLANs
Hands  on exp.with Configuration management tools like Puppet or Chef
•Hands-on experience in building continuous integration and deployment solutions
•Knowledge of svn, git and best practices in release management
•JVM tuning, some Oracle DB performance tuning and high availability experience preferred
•Experience with monitoring tools such as Nagios
•Scaling applications for performance and reliability depending on type of workload
•Experience debugging performance issues on Linux
•Experience with Software AG/webMethods integration server, MWS and other products are highly desired


Contribute to architecture of our management and  operational planes in  the following areas:


-       Scale out  of  management  plane


-       Service upgrade


-       Monitoring and  Alerting


-       Service performance


-       Operational  metrics and  statistics


-       Security monitoring

item.title: Quality Assurance Manager - Test Automation Engineer (m/f) - Berlin at Westwing Home & Living (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
To pursue our ambitious growth strategy, we are looking for a Quality Assurance Manager – Test Automation Engineer (m/f). In this position, you will work in an interdisciplinary development team and collaborate with different departments - such as customer service, supply chain management, logistics - by designing, implementing and executing manual and automated test cases to increase the quality of our internal tool set.


Your responsibilities will be:



  • Creating and optimizing test concepts primarily for logistics and fulfillment systems

  • Performing automated and manual regression tests 

  • Filing and maintaining test cases using a test case management system

  • Enhancing and maintaining existing automation frameworks

  • Continuous result reporting

  • Debugging and analyzing failures with developers

  • Planning and estimating new features in an interdisciplinary team

  • Communicating with developers, project/product managers and stake holders

item.title: Product Manager eCommerce (m/f) - Berlin at Westwing Home & Living (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
As Product Manager you and your team will be pioneers who develop and design the Order Management Systems (OMS) for all our international warehouses. Take the unique opportunity to be an architect of our eCommerce fulfillment platform, and part of one of the most interesting and strategic logistics project in the industry.


Your responsibilities will be:



  • Developing a logistics tool for international usage as a strategic part of our eCommerce product

  • Working closely together with our leadership team at both HQ and countries

  • Having decision power about the high impact development roadmap

  • Being in charge of the coordination of feature development and project execution across the full development cycles

item.title: Front End Product Engineer at Squarespace (New York, NY)
item.description:
Squarespace is looking for front end engineers to craft the most sophisticated application interfaces on the web. Front end software engineers at Squarespace specialize in building responsive and elegant web UIs with a strong understanding of our entire application stack. They strive to push the envelope in what is possible in a web browser. We seek individuals with strong design sensibilities and interest in delivering humane interfaces that are a pleasure to use. 

Responsibilities 



  • Specialize in building web applications using advanced HTML, CSS, and JavaScript

  • Contribute to presentation layer standards and practices

  • Contribute to testing and implementation approach for presentation layer

  • Prototype future interfaces

  • Work closely with our product and design teams, as well as other engineers and the data team

item.title: Full Stack Web Developer - Tools at WhatsApp Inc (Mountain View, CA)
item.description:
Full Stack Web Developer



WhatsApp is the world’s largest and fastest growing communication company with over 600M Monthly active users globally.  A Top 25 iOS app in more than 100 countries and an Android app with more than 500M installs on Google Play! Using your startup mindset and your experience developing native mobile apps, you will create new, awesome features used by 600+ Million current WhatsApp users. We are looking for Software Web Developer.   WhatsApp is now part of the Facebook Family!


Downtown Mountain View, CA

item.title: Senior Web Developer at Hubert Company (Harrison, OH)
item.description:
We’re looking for a few good developers. Okay, not a few – just one. We’re currently in the market for a highly skilled, creative, passionate web developer to help us take our e-commerce platform to the next level.


As a Senior Web Developer at Hubert, you’ll work closely with our current web team to advance our e-commerce cause. You’ll get your hands dirty with designing, coding and modifying our websites. From layout to function, you’ll be empowered to be innovative each and every day. While we currently have systems in place for web development, we’re open to new ideas and recommendations for more efficient processes.


The first project you’ll touch as our Senior Web Developer will be creating our new e-commerce platform … from scratch. You’ll have the creative freedom to manage this project in a way that builds our best solution yet. You’ll collaborate with our IT department to set up and maintain the necessary hardware and to integrate with the ERP system. You’ll team up with our Advertising department to incorporate our content management system. See that overarching theme of teamwork? Yeah, that’s important to us.


We want someone who (1) is a team player, (2) drives innovative solutions, (3) builds a successful team, and (4) implements sound work standards. Those are the essential keys for success in this position.


So, to summarize the summary, we’re looking for someone who has a knack for:



  • Maintaining and developing



    • Establish a software development life cycle, coding standards and a code review process

    • Work with other departments to ensure integration of e-commerce, CMS and ERP systems

    • Evaluate, select and implement software and technology to build an in-house web platform

    • Manage website performance in speed, stability and security. Assess and recommend ideal hardware configuration



  • Planning and organizing



    • Collaborate with e-commerce Manager on creation of project plans and tasks for the team

    • Plan development projects by confirming project objective and specifications with internal and external clients

    • Lead team of senior back-end and junior front-end developer

    • Support multiple business units, store fronts  & customer websites

    • Prioritize and schedules projects by importance and feasibility



  • Innovating and leading



    • Challenge paradigms and sees alternative ways to view and solve problems

    • Involve others in finding and implementing solutions

    • Proactively identify key issues and potentials and provides leadership to address them

    • Direct others in keeping projects completed on time and within budget



  • Learning and growing



    • Update job knowledge by participating in educational opportunities; reading professional publications; maintaining personal networks and applies this knowledge to their work

    • Has a good cultural fit with Hubert core values and uses collaborative and cooperative skills in the working environment

item.title: Principal Data Engineer - Hadoop Ecosystem at ThoughtWorks (New York, NY)
item.description:
While there's no typical day or engagement for our Principal Engineers. Here’s what you’ll do a lot of



  • Be the SME. Develop Hadoop architectural approach to meet key business objectives for this large Card Services group and provide end to end Hadoop development solution 

  • You might spend a few weeks  on a deep technical review or a complete organizational review, helping them to understand the potential that Big Data has to solve their most pressing problems.

  • On other projects within the program, you might be acting as the architect, leading the design of technical solutions, or perhaps overseeing a program inception to build a new product.

  • It could be much more about getting stuck into a delivery project where you're equally happy coding and tech leading the team to implement the solution.

  • Whatever your doing, the team always look to draw on your experience when things get tough and you often handle the difficult client conversations allowing the team to continue delivering without undue pressure.

  • You have great relationships with our new business team and work collaboratively to support pre-sales, meet prospective clients and ultimately influence and shape our portfolio of work.

  • You recognize that building your network with the business is absolutely key to enable you to perform in your role. You'll be drawing on all of your passion for technology, hands-on experience and knowledge of latest Big Data and Engineering best practices to help you gain the respect and credibility of those around you.


Within ThoughtWorks, you’ll always have the opportunity to:



  • Think through hard problems, and work with a team to make them reality.

  • Learn something new everyday.

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, transparent, non-hierarchal, and ego-free culture where your talent is valued over a role title

  • Travel the world.

  • Speak at conferences.

  • Write blogs and books.

  • Develop your career outside of the confinements of a traditional career path by focusing on what you’re passionate about rather than a predetermined one-size-fits-all plan

  • Be part of a company with Social and Economic Justice at the heart of its mission.

item.title: Senior Ruby Developer - Green Energy Web Apps at Renewable Funding (Oakland, CA)
item.description:
Renewable Funding (http://renewfund.com) is a venture-backed startup whose mission is to advance climate neutrality, energy independence, and green job creation through the nationwide deployment of renewable energy and energy efficiency finance programs. Our founders and executive management are in Oakland, CA. Our tech teams are in Portland, OR, and Oakland, CA. 


We are looking for senior Ruby developers for direct-hire positions in our Oakland office.


In this position, you will be a member of a small full-stack web app dev team that works closely with our product team to define, develop, and refine our software. You will also be expected to: 



  • contribute new ideas to rapidly evolving architectures.

  • help continuously improve our teamwork and development processes.

  • provide and receive technical guidance, mentoring, and training to/from your team members at all levels.


We work on a wide variety of systems: public information websites, mobile sales tools, energy usage reporting tools, and back-end loan processing software. Our current project is a financial services call center system.


We are Agile, though estimating isn't a huge focus. Our product owners have been well trained so we hum along pulling logically consistent stories from our queue. We architect collaboratively, pair occasionally, but mostly work solo with code reviews and pull requests. We try to keep knowledge silos to a minimum. Everyone works on everything.

We work regular business hours on-site with the occasional coffee shop or work-from-home day.

item.title: DevOps Engineer at SocialRadar (Washington, DC)
item.description:
SocialRadar is on the lookout for an outstanding DevOps engineer to join our team.


You’ll work directly with the teams managing and deploying our cloud-based infrastructure to ensure reliable and secure operations in a 24/7/365 environment.


Your day-to-day work will include core system administrative duties, standing new databases and systems in our AWS cloud and performing basic performance and security monitoring functions.


The team will supplement your skills with work which will teach you how to build, manage and monitor an extremely scalable cloud-based infrastructure.



Benefits



Check out our documented culture deck to ensure it sounds like a good fit for you.


We have most of the standard perks you'd expect from a startup including healthcare, ample beanbag chairs, a few arcade games and a big TV in the breakroom, sodas, snacks, and dinner on late working nights (usually Mondays and Thursdays).


We have a flexible vacation policy and each of our engineers gets a Macbook Pro with a couple of Thunderbolt monitors.


A chance to work with sharp, motivated co-workers in a highly collaborative environment.

item.title: Senior iOS Developer at DoubleDutch (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
DoubleDutch is the global leader in event marketing automation software. We bring events and conferences from good to great with data-driven mobile technology. DoubleDutch needs you to be our Senior iOS Engineer to add to our accelerating sales growth. DoubleDutch has a highly collaborative internal team that builds deep relationships with customers. You are passionate about mobile apps, possess exceptional attention to detail, are an expert communicator, and above all, have energy to burn. Startup experience is strongly preferred.


Mobile applications are already causing massive changes in how people work. If you are interested in helping drive this disruption of legacy enterprise systems, DoubleDutch is the place for you. 


Love iOS? Want to build world-class enterprise mobile applications?


Good. Bring your skills to us. Help build our new generation of mobile-first enterprise apps, to be used by hundreds of thousands of people! And work with a passionate and fun team while you're at it!


Responsibilities:



  • Build beautiful native iOS apps and new features

  • Architect sophisticated multi-threaded apps

  • Write organized and structured code

  • Identify and fix performance problems

  • Prototype new ideas and explore new technologies that are at the forefront of mobile (and iPhone) technology

  • Work across disciplines with team members representing product, design, and web development

  • Work with a small team on projects that directly impact the end user and the company

  • Anything else not listed here


Requirements:



  • Proficient in Objective-C and UIKit/CocoaTouch

  • Have published one or more applications in the App Store

  • Competent in Cocoa design patterns and API design

  • Passionate about end-to-end user experience design

  • Experience with RESTful network architectures, CoreData, and git a plus

  • Sense of humor and affinity for coffee highly encouraged!


Benefits:



  • Fast paced, fun, and energetic company with a friendly culture

  • Incentive based perks including team outings, trips, prizes, and more!

  • Health insurance

  • Unlimited Grand Coffee (That’s right, Four Barrel Coffee at your fingertips!)

  • Opportunity to work at a disruptive SF Startup

item.title: Lead Mobile Engineer at Blank Slate Systems (Boulder, CO)
item.description:
Help us make Zotebook: a totally new kind of design tool! It recognizes freehand sketches and turns them into precise, machinable files for use on laser cutters and 3D printers. Based on prior PhD work from Carnegie Mellon.


You’ll be in charge of implementing the interface and user experience, and sketch recognizers to expand the app’s functionality. As Zotebook is a tablet app, you must also have some experience with iOS (preferred) or Android development.


This is a good gig for someone who likes to work in various areas such as: algorithms, networking, graphics, interaction design, and software architecture. Since the job involves so many different skills, we're looking for people who love to learn and solve new, weird problems. If you think you'd be good at even half of this, please apply!


What You'll Do



  • Develop our existing iOS app using Xamarin.iOS and C#

  • Develop individual sketch recognizers (don’t be scared, we will teach you!)

  • Help refactor, debug and maintain the mobile application software architecture

  • Design and develop platform-specific interactions as needed

item.title: Software Developer at DuPont Pioneer (Johnston, IA)
item.description:
DuPont has a rich history of scientific discovery that has enabled countless innovations and today we're looking for more people, in more places, to collaborate with us to make life the best that it can be. DuPont Pioneer is seeking a software developer to meet ongoing trait informatics research software needs. We are developing leading-edge software to support the development of commercial traits for various crops in all Pioneer markets. We are looking for creative, talented individuals with critical thinking skills to develop robust and innovative solutions to complex problems in an evolving research environment.



Responsibilities:


The successful candidate will work as part of a multifunctional SCRUM team of software developers, analysts, project managers, support personnel, and researchers to develop and deliver multi-tier web based software systems to enhance research capabilities.

item.title: User Experience (UX) Designer / Developer - Fitness - Garmin Connect at Garmin International (Olathe, KS)
item.description:
Our UX Developers understand user-centered design principles that guide user interface design and development. They work closely with associates from across the company to research, storyboard, design, and develop highly-usable web solutions. If you’re passionate about visual and user-interface design, UX methodology, and front-end development, you may be exactly who we’re looking for.


Working with Garmin designers, developers, copywriters, and business stakeholders, our UX team is focused on defining and delivering an incredible user experience for our customers.


We're seeking a full time User Experience Developer for our Garmin Connect team at our world headquarters in Kansas City. Garmin’s UX Designer/Developers leverage user feedback to guide, enhance, and/or produce UX design concepts and other deliverables such as wireframes, user flows, site maps, and interactive prototypes. Development of scalable, reusable, innovative front-end solutions for Garmin’s suite of Internet applications, research and implementation of new UX best practices, design patterns, frameworks, and technologies, and contribution to Garmin’s online standards are other key functions for this role.

item.title: Web Developer - Garmin Connect: Helping our customers achieve their goals! at Garmin International (Olathe, KS)
item.description:
Find your inner-geek at Garmin. We want developers who understand and have a passion for perfecting user experience on the Web. That’s why anyone we hire must have programming experience using Ajax, Java, Javascript, XHTML, and CSS. They also must understand web standards, usability and accessibility principles and be proficient in developing web software. Team-work among other Engineering IT staff is a must as well as the ability to work with limited assistance, regardless of project size. If you think you have what it takes, let’s develop a partnership.


We're seeking a Software Engineer on our web development team, located at our world headquarters in Olathe, KS. In this role, you'll be responsible for developing web services and web applications serving a worldwide community of GPS developers and users.


You will develop rich, engaging, web application components and interfaces specializing in online mapping and geo-social networking using the latest web technologies including AJAX, JSP, XHTML and CSS, work with Product Managers, Design, and Back-end team to incorporate visual design into functional web pages, participate in the full lifecycle of development from conception, analysis, design, implementation, testing and deployment, and use Garmin and Third Party Developer APIs to add dynamic features to web applications.


You’ll also be responsible for performing builds and deployments to various testing and development environments, building and maintenance of automated deployment tools and use your skills to design, develop and perform continuous improvements to the current build and development process.

item.title: Bluetooth Android SW Engineer - Fitness Team - design and develop new products! at Garmin International (Olathe, KS)
item.description:
Associates get the royal treatment at Garmin. Regardless if you’re a newbie or a veteran, engineers dream it, design it and use it. Here, you will be surrounded by others who share the same passion about what they do every day. We offer a relaxed team environment (no dress code!) where advancement is found from sharing knowledge, not hiding it! While we promise you a lot of responsibility, you also will have the opportunity to have ownership over projects…oh, and we promise you there will be some fun mixed in there, too!


Come on board with Garmin engineering. Our team is looking for self-motivated, confident and passionate engineers to create high-quality, state-of-the-art products that give our consumers an unwavering level of confidence when using them.


Our Fitness team in Olathe, KS, is seeking a full time Senior Software Engineer focused on Bluetooth development. In this role, you'll develop embedded software in C, C++, or assembly language with a focus on using industry best practices for developing efficient, optimized code that makes best use of available resources. You’ll also perform new product software design and development as well as maintenance activities for products already in production and test software using debuggers, emulators, simulators, and/or logic analyzers.


This position will also allow you the opportunity to handle Bluetooth driver, stack, and profile development for new features, interoperability, and maintenance for Garmin Consumer products and additional device driver development and overall system performance optimizations. You’ll also participate in product definition activities including feature analysis and system tradeoffs, review product information including manuals and brochures for technical accuracy, and interact closely with hardware engineering.

item.title: Java Developer - Leading EHR Company at Amazing Charts (Boston, MA)
item.description: Want to make a difference?  Amazing Charts is developing technology for getting medical information to hospitals faster and also allows you to work with a talented team to be part of the decision process of next generation technology and applications. Our team is launching a new analytics platform and suite of mobile applications to serve our Electronic Health Record (EHR) and Continuing Medical Education (CME) customer community. We need experienced Java Engineers with a passion for technology and delivering best-in-class solutions to a very committed and loyal customer base. The selected candidates will be highly entrepreneurial, results-oriented, and thrives on delivering solutions that make a positive impact in the day-to-day experience of healthcare delivery and quality for both physicians and patients.

item.title: Software Development Engineer - Work with Trains! at SilverRail Technologies (Woburn, MA)
item.description:
We are seeking a Senior Software Development Engineer who is highly motivated, dedicated, innovative, and has a track record of taking initiative.  This individual must be capable of working in a fast-paced Agile environment, writing clean and solid code, working cooperatively with a multi-functional team and participating in the design process with Product Managers. This individual will be a critical member of a small engineering team developing a highly scalable hosted high-transaction hosted J2EE application. This role reports to the CTO and will be responsible for:



  • The analysis, design, implementation, documentation, and maintenance of software components, APIs, and integration modules.

  • Devising techniques for better modularity, testability, install-ability and maintainability of J2EE applications

  • Assisting in the overall architecture and design of the software.

  • Interacting with the sales and consulting teams where appropriate to help win new customers and make existing customers successful with the software.

item.title: Software Engineer (Python/Django) at Counsyl (South San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Position description



Counsyl is looking for brilliant engineers who want to work on a product that will help people make life changing decisions. We’ve created a revolutionary platform that gives people access to critical health information at key junctures in their lives. 

As a software engineer at Counsyl you'll be building new products, tools, workflows, and infrastructure to solve the challenging problems of a technology startup involved with not just bits and bytes, but also interconnected physical components like lab robotics and patient samples. Our operations are powered by our own custom-built infrastructure on a Python/Django/Postgres stack, from robots to lab processing to billing.

If you're interested in working with modern web technologies, brilliant engineers and products that influence millions of people’s lives, this is the place for you.

item.title: Full Stack Engineer at Tuee (Raleigh, NC)
item.description:
Tuee is seeking an Android Developer to help build components of its GRM platform. This full-time position will lead development of a native Android app, oversee UI and database maintenance, as well as build various other components of Tuee’s GRM system.


To succeed in this role, you'll need to be entrepreneurial minded, love variety, work independently, communicate well, and be very proactive. Excellent Android skills as well knowledge of .NET / C#, various UI template platforms, SQL Server, and HTML5 are required.


This individual will report directly to Tuee’s technical co-founders and will have the opportunity to earn equity in a quickly growing tech startup.

item.title: Software Engineer - Server at Squarespace (New York, NY)
item.description:
Squarespace is pushing the envelope in user-interface design & experience, web-services, distributed caching and grid computing. We are currently looking for software engineers who are eager to solve some hard problems in these areas. The ideal candidate will be able to work well with minimal supervision and be comfortable with working on various layers of a complex system powering millions of websites.

As a member of the team, you will be working with other engineers with years of startup experience developing and integrating large-scale backend systems with tools such as Java 8, MongoDB, Hadoop, and ORM frameworks. You will build the engine powering highly interactive web applications. Our work environment is relaxed and highly collaborative. Give our application on the web a try. If you see yourself working on interesting problems with us, we'd love to meet you.

Responsibilities 



  • Write server-side code for web-based applications, create robust high-volume production applications, and develop prototypes quickly. You should also have a strong understanding of, and practical experience with, Java web application development.

  • Build and maintain platforms and systems infrastructure at the core of Squarespace.

  • Build internal systems with your domain expertise in customer support, finance and marketing.

  • Collaborate with engineers and designers to deliver strong customer-focused experiences.

item.title: Applikationsarchitekt/in at Fielmann AG (Hamburg, Germany)
item.description:
Für die Entwicklung einer Reihe neuer, kundenorienterter Systeme suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt einen erfahrenen Softwareentwickler, der die zentrale Architektur dieser Softwarekomponenten entwirft und die Produktentwicklung technologisch leitet.


Du entwirfst zusammen mit unserem Architekturteam die konkrete Softwarearchitektur, die Datenstrukturen und die Schnittstellen zu bestehenden Inhouse-Systemen und zu den mobile apps sowie der Website. Du stellst ein Team von Entwicklern ein, mit dem Du Deine Pläne in die Tat umsetzt und arbeitest Seite an Seite mit dem Produktmanager an der Herausarbeitung der Anforderungen. Du stellst Dich der Herausforderung ein hochqualitatives, verlässliches und skalierbares Endkundenprodukt für Millionen von Kunden zu erdenken, zu implementieren und zu pflegen. Dabei setzt Du auf schlanke Lösungen, die Du mit hohem Sachverstand lösungsorientiert einsetzt.


Benefits:




  • Wir bieten Dir eine weitgehend selbstbestimmte Arbeitsweise in einem Team, dass Du Dir selbst zusammenstellen kannst. Du arbeitest mit erfahrenen Experten auf der Konzernseite zusammen, die Dir nicht ins Handwerk pfuschen und bekommst die nötige finanzielle Rückendeckung um das Produkt zum Erfolg zu führen.




  • Wir bieten Dir eine Position, in der Du moderne Ansätze und Technologien in ein erfolgreiches Milliardenunternehmen mit boomendem Kerngeschäft und höchstem Qualitätsanspruch einführen kannst. Du gestaltest den technologischen Kern unserer digitalen Expansion. Neben flexiblen Arbeitszeiten und den üblichen Perks wie Getränken, Fruchtkorb und einer subventionierten ProfiCard kannst Du mit einer sehr angemessenen Vergütung rechnen.

item.title: Database Administrator at GAW Miners (Hattiesburg, MS) (allows remote)
item.description:
We are looking for a top performing Database Administrator to join our growing development team at GAW who will develop and maintain our business critical application as well as customer facing applications that facilitates our ability to provide SaaS based mining software along with other related software. We value individuals who offer creative solutions to difficult business issues, who have strong strategic skills and can focus on delivering the customer experiences that allows us to build a new market in technology. We have created some of the best communication technology on the planet!


Our, patent pending, innovative technology allows businesses a whole new way of communicating. Just as uniquely, all of our products and services are built by our Innovator, our CEO.


You will be joining a highly skilled team focused on product delivery and user experience. We guarantee the right person will work with some of the most innovative and hard working entrepreneurs in the technology industry. Our team is made up by individuals that have built many successful start ups before and are looking to do it again. You will also be required to test sprints, deploy, manage, and document software during the project lifecycle. You are required to be familiar with Linux systems in order to manage deployed software. This position reports directly to the CTO.


Are you looking to gain experience building a successful start up and developing software for a growing business with national presence?


At least two years of software development experience in an object oriented environment. Develops, modifies, debugs and evaluates programs for functional areas, including but not limited to Internal software systems and cloud service integrations. Assist in gathering requirements, develop technical documentation, modify existing programs or formulate logic for new systems. Devises logical procedures, performs coding and unit test, and debugs 


programs. Prepares system and programming documentation with the guidance of the CTO or domain leader. Understands and follows GAW design and development standards. Demonstrates the ability to work with Cross functional groups to achieve results.
Demonstrates appropriate communication skills. Knows when to be a leader and when to follow. Follows through with commitments and fosters mutual trust with team members and fellow employees. Proactively manage workload and consults with the CTO when matters of work prioritization arise. Has a good understanding of call control API’s, GIT, cloud service API’s and software version control systems. Is able to appropriately prioritize multiple tasks and assist less senior members with prioritization. Ensure high-quality product experience. Help promote and maintain operational effectiveness within software systems. Assumes additional responsibility without being asked. Requires very little instruction on day-to-day work, and receives only general instructions on new assignments. Implementation of SOAP and/or REST based high volume web applications. Must have experience also in MySQL and relational databases including backup, restore, replication, and configuration Solid working knowledge of current Internet technologies, including HTTP protocol, TCP/IP basics. Occasionally interacts with IT management on matters concerning several functional areas, division, and /or customers. Demonstrated ability to learn new technology. Attend professional conferences and training courses as required.

item.title: Software Engineer in Test (SET) at Guardian News & Media (London, UK)
item.description:
Through every department of the Guardian we are digital-first in both philosophy and practice as we believe the future of journalism is digital. We work in the open on GitHub and use open source software. We believe that many eyes can see many improvements, so you only need initiative rather than permission to improve things. Our lightweight process means that an idea you had on the way to work can be live on http://www.theguardian.com/uk by the afternoon. We embrace innovation and use hackdays to collaborate with other parts of the business to further enhance our products. 

We are seeking a technical, motivated and open minded colleague to join our highly respected, but relaxed Digital Development team as a Software Engineer in Test (SET). As an SET you’ll play a crucial role in making sure our millions of users get the service they expect. But that doesn’t mean you’ll be churning out automated tests every day - often we add the most value when we spot an interesting side problem and fix that instead. You’ll be finding and researching new techniques and tools and leading discussion with the team about whether we can use them. Perhaps most importantly, you’ll help shape the culture of the team.


We don’t expect you to know all of the tools and technologies we use here right now, as we must evolve as quickly as the cutting edge. What’s important is that you can think logically, understand different levels of abstraction, pitch in and solve anything you see that isn’t working, and want to both share and learn.


We use



  • Scala and ScalaTest

  • Amazon Web Services (AWS)

  • Git and GitHub

  • Selenium / WebDriver

  • Saucelabs

  • Appium

  • Play Framework

  • TeamCity and Jenkins


We develop



  • Our iOS/Android Mobile apps

  • Our responsive news web site

  • Soulmates

  • Editorial Tooling including Composer

  • and more!

item.title: iOS Software Developer at Guardian News & Media (London, UK)
item.description:
We are currently looking for an experienced iOS Software Developer who really understands what developing for mobile means. This role represents an exciting opportunity to not only work on interesting projects at The Guardian, but to also help shape the profile of our mobile offering within the organisation. 

As iOS Software Developer, you will be responsible for the programming of software products, features and services for Apple’s iOS platform (iPhone/iPad) within the Apps and Devices team in.

item.title: Android Software Developer at Guardian News & Media (London, UK)
item.description:
We are currently expanding our Mobile Development team and are looking for an experienced Android Software Developer who really understands what developing for mobile means. This role represents an exciting opportunity to not only work on interesting projects at The Guardian, but to also help shape the profile of our mobile offering within the organisation.

As Android Software Developer you will be responsible for programming software products, features and services for Google’s Android platform within the mobile product roadmap as well as help to create a solid Android mobile development capability in-house.

item.title: Cloud Software Engineer - Product Development at Cloud Technology Partners (Boston, MA)
item.description:
Cloud Technology Partners™ (www.cloudtp.com) is growing!   We are expanding our Product Development team and actively recruiting for talented Java Software Engineers.   Reporting to the VP, Engineering, you will be based in our Boston office, located near the Fort Point Channel and South Station. 



  • Work Environment:   Downtown Boston location with open office space and spectacular views, located 384 feet from the Boston Tea Party Ship.  Fun, casual office environment, free coffee, tea, water and snacks, Friday beer hour, and at least 34 lunch opportunities within a five minute walk.



    • Rewards:   Competitive salary, bonus and stock options along with a robust benefits plan including medical, dental and vision plans, 401(k) plan; life insurance, disability plans, pre-tax transit/parking and healthcare flex account plans, a generous paid time off program.  Opportunities for training and skills development, mentoring and career growth.


    As a member of our Product Team, you will actively contribute to the design and development of new and existing cloud SaaS based products for leading edge cloud solutions.

item.title: Senior Cloud Software Engineer at Cloud Technology Partners (Boston, MA)
item.description:
Cloud Technology Partners™ (www.cloudtp.com) is growing!   We are expanding our team and actively recruiting for experienced Java Software Engineers.   Here are a few reasons why to consider CTP for your next career move:



  • You want to be on the leading edge of a monumental change in IT

  • You enjoy venturing into new territory and think of yourself as a “builder”

  • You appreciate the balance of a dynamic and entrepreneurial culture led by an experienced management team

  • You want to contribute to the success of a growing company

  • You are committed to the success of clients and your colleagues


We are the cloud application and infrastructure experts behind some of the world’s most advanced cloud computing initiatives.  We’re not just learning a new way of doing things – we’re defining the best way to do them.   We are innovative, disciplined, passionate and creative individuals who stay ahead of the technology curve and love what we do.  We are building a great company by doing work that matters delivering best practices, solutions and methodologies to accelerate our clients’ cloud transformations.  


Although we are headquartered in Boston, our clients are located across the US.  We are open to candidates interested in either full time employment or contractor status.    We are flexible on location – you may work remotely from any US location, as long as you are able to travel to client locations at least 50%.


As a member of our professional services team, you will work with our clients to develop or modernize software products on public and private clouds and manage dev/test/prod-ops environments.    You will be part of teams designing, implementing and operating world-class cloud solutions with the best technology on the planet.

item.title: Principal Software Engineer - Java at Intronis (Chelmsford, MA)
item.description:
This is an amazing opportunity for a Principal Software Engineer to join a growing team of talented software professionals at Intronis and make a major impact on the technical direction of our product with your knowledge and background in enterprise Java. You will have the best of both worlds: join a software startup in the high-growth cloud market sector that has a real product, real customers, and a rock solid financial picture… and the opportunity to work on some cool technology in a company with a ton of growth potential.


We are seeking an experienced, talented, self-motivated Principal Software Engineer who has a successful track record designing, building and deploying highly scalable, fault-tolerant enterprise Java back ends. This person will join a team responsible for designing and implementing new cloud-based services.  This is a technical leadership position within a fast-paced, collaborative, agile environment where you will have the opportunity to rotate through research and development, mainline development, and sustaining environments while working with our offshore partners.

item.title: Hybrid Mobile Developer at Arbor Education Partners (Belgrade, Serbia)
item.description:
We're not alone in believing that mobile can change the world, but we are alone in having the platform to do it.

By developing task-specific apps for any platform, we can ensure that educational insights are put in the hands of the highest number of users- teachers, students, parents and leaders. This way, we can help make sure that we really do improve educational outcomes through data.

Arbor's hybrid mobile developer will take ownership of all our apps, by packaging the MIS web system into native apps using Phonegap. Features like timeline and messaging will work slickly and smoothly across a range of devices, not just iOS.

Strong javascript (Sencha Touch, SASS) and some PHP needed, as they will be implementing in the mobile app UI screens that already exist in our desktop MIS product, using UI XML.

http://www.arbor-education.com/static/images/snaps/134_s.jpg

item.title: iOS Mobile Developer at Snapsheet (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
Snapsheet is an enterprise startup that is disrupting the outdated auto insurance claims settlement process and turning a $120B market on it's head.  We are growing rapidly and putting together a strong team across technology and business disciplines.  With significant revenue growth, we need our talent to keep up with our success.  We are looking to hire the top software engineers in Chicago to join our growing team.

Job Description

Snapsheet Inc is looking for an experienced mobile software developer to work on  the iOS platform.  If you are interested in working in a startup environment and you're the best at what you do, then you'll fit right in.  We are building the future of insurance companies and world class apps to match.

What You'll Do
- Work as a principal engineer to design, development and maintain our Android and iPhone apps
- Lead the entire app lifecycle right from concept stage until delivery and post launch support
- Maintain our current apps to ensure that they continue to function flawlessly across new iOS and Android releases
- Enhance and update our SDK
- Manage app releases and 3rd party integration
- Work closely with backend development team

What we are looking for
- BS/BA degree in a technical field such as Computer Science or equivalent years of experience
- 2-3 years of software development experience
- 2 years experience in building mobile apps (+ SDKs desired) for iOS - Android a huge bonus
- Experience with mobile development issues related to performance optimization, caching, security, and native hardware components (camera, gps, etc.)
- Experience with RESTful back end APIs
- User/data driven software development. The ability to optimize products based on user feedback and analytics
- An individual willing to take on the responsibility of a tech lead in a high growth startup

Additional Skills (bonus points)
- HTML/CSS/Javascript experience
- Python/Ruby Web Framework experience
- Personal Projects or Open Source work

What we offer
- Competitive Salary
- Stock Options
- Unlimited vacation policy. Work hard and take time when you need it

item.title: Let's Grow! Java Developer Wanted at Drop Tank, LLC (Burr Ridge, IL)
item.description: We need a focused Java Developer to help take our platform to the next level.  We’re in the early phases of building a flexible and scalable Cents Off processing and reporting engine using Enterprise Java J2EE to meet the needs of our existing major oil clients.  Working directly with our VP Technology, this role will play a key role in shaping the future of our core platform.

item.title: Frontend Developer at Neoscape, Inc. (Boston, MA)
item.description: Neoscape is currently looking to add a new Frontend Developer to our growing interactive development team in our main studio in Boston, MA. The primary focus of this position will be to work with the Interactive Director, as well as the full Neoscape creative team, to develop websites for a wide range of uses and clients all around the globe. Successful applicants should be detail oriented, able to work on multiple projects simultaneously, able to work as part of a team or on their own, and troubleshoot/repair existing projects. Good communication skills are essential for our team-based environment to ensure a quality look and feel for all our interactive projects. The ideal candidate has 4 to 6 years of experience, preferably in an agency setting.

item.title: (Senior) Agile Tester Web Applications (m/f) at XING AG (Hamburg, Germany)
item.description:
XING is the social network for business professionals with millions of members all over the world.
Help us shape the future - for a better working life!


We currently have an open position as                                                    


(Senior) Agile Tester – Web Applications (m/f)


At XING, we value the art of continuous improvement. Agile testers who work directly within the development teams are our voice of quality and continuous improvement. They play an active part in releasing the software to our end users, and they help understand the end-user perspective. Agile testers share the improvements and lessons learned with the company, for a better-working software. Popular technologies and tools like Ruby on Rails, MySQL, Riak, Git, Jenkins, Espresso for Android, KIF, Capybara, RSpec, JMeter, TestNG, Chrome DevTools,... are used


A challenging task:



  • Work inside the cross-functional agile teams, closely cooperating with developers, product owners, scrum masters and other stakeholders

  • Contribute throughout the product development lifecycle: from product planning to releasing to production and monitoring the live environments

  • Use testing infrastructure, data and tools to perform manual, exploratory and automated testing 

  • Make quality issues and concerns visible and help others understand the risks and impacts to our end users

  • Propose improvements of our processes to be able to deliver higher quality software on time

item.title: Sr. Software Engineer (Drupal) at R2integrated (Baltimore, MD)
item.description:
Work with engineering team to develop web based applications.  Document, track and provide updates on project status.  Participate in code reviews and knowledge transfer sessions. All duties are performed under the guidance of a VP of Technology.



  • Provide progress updates to team lead/project manager

  • Work with and extend existing code and applications to implement client requirements.

  • Create enterprise-level Drupal implementations and/or expertise in PHP development

  • Develop, review, test, and deploy custom Drupal modules 

  • Assist in training of new staff.

  • Developing and refine development processes

  • Provide technical support for clients.

  • Performs other related duties as required and assigned by management.

item.title: Junior, Mid-level and Senior Java Developers at Boston Children's Hospital (Boston, MA)
item.description:
The Intelligent Health Lab at the Boston Children’s Hospital Informatics Program (http://chip.org/IHLab) is recruiting Junior, Mid-level, and Senior Java developers with exceptional talent and teamwork skills to create and implement a new, national research data sharing platform (http://scilhs.org) and contribute to a spectrum of allied open-source community projects.


For over 20 years, the Boston Children’s Hospital Informatics Program (http://chip.org) has been a leading force for innovation in health informatics — we are once again expanding our software development teams and seek candidates with strong experience building Java applications end-to-end. No prior health informatics experience is needed or expected, and this is an ideal opportunity for skilled Java developers wishing to advance their skills in state-of-the-art clinical health informatics.


As an affiliated laboratory of the Harvard Medical School Center for Biomedical Informatics, we especially seek candidates who wish to contribute to multiple projects and enjoy working within a highly collaborative environment on high-impact, open source software development in a dynamically changing field.

item.title: Senior Java Developer (Eyefreight) at Eyefreight (Bunnik, Nederland)
item.description:
As a Senior Java Developer with Eyefreight you will be responsible for designing and developing new functionality or extend existing functionality of the core product. Meanwhile making sure that quality and robustness of the EyeFreight product are maintained. Next to that you will Implement Eyefreight in the context of a customer. This involves extending standard functionality to suit the customer needs. Typically this results in a product configuration containing a bundle of customized screens, actions and system interfaces.


In order to do this your daily activities will consist of:
• Participating in planning and scoping workshops in order to estimate the amount of effort required to implement functionality and to validate whether the required functionality is within the scope of the standard product
• Participating in the design of new functionality by organizing or attending design workshops and documenting the design
• Developing new functionality of the core product in Java and/or JSF/AJAX related code
• Doing quality assurance of the core product code by performing code reviews and developing automated (unit) tests
• Customizing the product to suit customer needs in Java and/or JSF/AJAX related code
• Fixing production issues by analyzing the problem and develoing a workaround or fix for the issue
• Developing yourself professionally as well as assisting less experienced colleagues when needed

item.title: Linux Engineer (f/m) at zanox (Berlin, Germany)
item.description:
To expand our team we are looking for a Linux Engineer (f/m) at our office in Berlin.


Responsibilities:


You will be part of the team that is operating the zanox network. This environment is highly scalable and automation is the key. It is your job to work with our development teams to ensure we are running the right software with the right tools to provide a highly available and fast system for our customers. Together with the other members of our Ops Team you are part of the on call rotation.


Our offer:



  • Working with cutting edge technology like Chef, Docker, Openstack, etc.

  • The opportunity to be part of a dynamic international team

  • Unique professional experience within an international company structure

  • Diverse exchange program with our country offices in Sao Paulo, London, Paris, Madrid, Amsterdam or Milan

item.title: Software Delivery Manager at Focusrite Audio Engineering (High Wycombe, UK)
item.description:
We introduce a lot of new products each year to an already extensive portfolio, and strong year on year growth means we have created this new full-time role at our High Wycombe head office.


Role Overview


Leading a team of 5+ software engineers, this role will be central to our mission of delivering fantastic software for Focusrite and Novation products. Working closely alongside the Hardware, QA and Production Management teams, you will be supporting the delivery of our New Product Introduction (NPI), as well as maintaining existing products. You will also be involved with software development projects, as well as the evaluation and improvement of development processes and tools. You will help drive new product design, researching new product ideas and technologies.


As a team manager you will provide leadership and coaching, developing the team’s capability and productivity to meet the growing needs of the business, including activity planning, project approach review, technical mentorship and performance appraisals. You will also be involved with the recruitment of new software engineers.


This is a role with plenty of scope for development, and lots of opportunity for you to shape it and make your mark. We work in an exciting area, and our standards are high; you must ensure consistent excellence and reliability, and have outstanding managerial and people skills to engage well with multiple departments at all levels and develop your own team.

item.title: (Wirtschafts-)Informatiker (Projektkoordinator/Junior-Softwareentwickler m/w) at contag AG (Berlin, Deutschland)
item.description:
Sie bringen Berufserfahrung aus dem IT-Bereich mit und haben idealerweise ein Studium der Informatik bzw. Wirtschaftsinformatik oder eine IT-Ausbildung mit kaufmännischem oder technischem Hintergrund absolviert. Ihre strukturierte Arbeitsweise in der Realisierung von komplexen Lösungen runden Ihr Profil ab.


Sie wollen verantworten statt verwalten, mit Kreativität und Leidenschaft erfolgreich Softwareprojekte realisieren und schätzen Teamarbeit sowie kurze Entschei­dungswege?


Sie sind verantwortlich für die inhaltliche und termingerechte Fertigstellung von Softwarelösungen im kaufmännischen und fertigungstechnischen Umfeld. Sie planen und forcieren den Softwareentwicklungsprozess von der Idee über die Umsetzung bis hin zur erfolgreichen Einführung. Als IT-Projektkoordinator (m/w) bestechen Sie bei der engen Zusammenarbeit mit der Geschäftsführung, den Softwareentwicklern und Nutzern in den Fachabteilungen mit Ihrer Koordinations- und Kommunikationsstärke. Der nachhaltige Erfolg der internen Softwareprojekte im gesamten Unternehmen und bei jedem einzelnen Mitarbeiter wird durch Ihre Zielstrebigkeit gesichert.

item.title: Cloud Systems Engineer - New York at Cloudreach (New York, NY)
item.description:
Cloudreach’s Systems Engineers work with challenging technical solutions for industry leading clients. We love all things cloud related and believe passionately in the innovation it can drive.


We’re a global top-tier partner for both Amazon Web Services and Google - two giants of the cloud computing industry, and now we're looking to bring our talents to the American marketplace.  We are looking for Windows or Linux engineers who are capable of delivering awesomeness on cloud engineering projects. Maybe you’re a Systems Administrator, a Systems Engineer, a Site Reliability Engineer or perhaps a DevOps Ninja - we can offer you something new.


Don’t worry about prior “cloud” experience, what we want are smart, friendly engineers with strong systems experience. 


Our Cloud Platforms team are the best at what they do - DevOps meets consultancy. It’s not your average job, because Cloudreach is not your average company.  You won’t be bored - there’s plenty of variety in our project work and you’ll always be learning.


Not if. When will you join the best Cloud engineering team in the industry?



Where has Cloudreach come from?




  • We were an idea formed in a London pub. Now we’re a global business, with hubs across Europe and North America. That growth is fuelled by a special team, developing tech solutions, for interesting clients you've definitely heard of




  • We were voted #1 Small Business to Work For in 2013 and our management won Best Leadership




How will you spend your time at Cloudreach?


You will be working in the following areas (and more!):




  • Green field development of Amazon Web Services infrastructure (EC2, RDS, EMR, etc), e.g. looking at an existing service or data centre and then architecting a more effective solution in AWS. You might work on a major eCommerce platform, a MySQL database migration, or building a scalable mobile backend




  • DevOps: Systems engineering work with frameworks such as Chef or Puppet - as well as helping to break down barriers between silo’d teams. We automate everything




  • Technical deployment and consultancy related to Google Apps for Business - for example designing a complex Single Sign On solution




  • Not doing any out of hours shift work - yay!

item.title: Backend Software Engineering - Search (Java) at Yahoo (London, UK)
item.description:
Responsibilities


Build products that become daily habits for millions of users, partners, and merchants


Use a variety of languages and technologies to make an impact


Develop software that powers experiences on smartphones, tablet, and desktop


Collaborate with and learn from designers, product managers, engineers, and executives


Create technically excellent software iteratively using Agile methods


Drive growth in audience, engagement, and revenue globally




Sample Projects Include:



  • Ingest, categorize, enhance, rank structured data for Shopping, Local, and much more

  • Design algorithms to deliver contextual, personal, and socially relevant experiences

  • Use big data and machine learning techniques to enhance understanding and relevance

  • Define APIs that enable new use cases and engage developers internally and externally

item.title: Frontend Developer at Fyndiq (Stockholm, Sweden)
item.description:
At Fyndiq our tech-team develops everything, from server infrastructure and back-end code in Python/Django to front-end development in Javascript and HTML. In our team you will be working with other highly skilled and motivated technicians that take pride in creating elegant, simple solutions that scale well. In this position you will also work closely with our marketing team. As part of the Fyndiq tech-team you will work in a way that is inspired by the open source community and our work rely on communication via GitHub.


What can we offer you?


You will be using and experimenting with the latest and greatest techniques and tools to keep your knowledge to a cutting edge level in the front end industry. As a front end developer at Fyndiq, you will play an important role in our tech-team. You will be involved in and make a clear difference to our team. It is quick decision-making, hard work, teamwork and results that count. We can offer you a diverse and changing work environment with a highly skilled group of people who are all passionate about their work. We are growing fast and a lot of fun stuff happens as we grow, as well as new challenges that arise on the way. Teamwork, communication and flexibility are important concepts for us. The environment in our office is familiar and created for collaboration and creativity.


If you have questions about this position, please contact Jakob Wallöf, on jakob@fyndiq.se or +4672-577 57 11.

item.title: Senior Front End Developer at Arbor Education Partners (Belgrade, Serbia)
item.description: Key responsibilities: to work on our MIS System (enterprise data platform for schools and colleges) on the Frontend. This means improving our existing Ext JS-based user interface and working closely with our designer to craft new user interfaces and implement them slickly. They may also work on our mobile/tablet apps in a similar role, which uses Sencha Touch.

item.title: Python/Django Developer at Fyndiq (Stockholm, Sweden)
item.description:
Are you ready to join our journey and be a crucial part of our success?


At Fyndiq our tech-team develops everything, from server infrastructure and back-end code in Python/Django to front-end development in JavaScript, CSS and HTML. As a developer in our team you will work together with 6 highly skilled developers that take pride in creating elegant, simple solutions that scale well. With our team you will work in a way that is inspired by the open source community and our work rely on communication via GitHub.


As a developer at Fyndiq you will take full responsibility for the development process of the projects or functionalities you work with. This means that you, together with Head of Engineering and CTO will define the specifications and the scope of the project. Then you will be responsible for developing, implementing and testing the code to assure quality as well as take the full responsibility for the technical solutions you work with. You will work with varied projects and you will be part of developing not only the technical side but also the business side of Fyndiq to make sure that we reach our business targets.


What can we offer you?


As a developer at Fyndiq, you will be part of a team of dedicated developers. You will be implementing your own projects from creating the specifications to delivering the final application. In our tech team it's quick decision-making, hard work, teamwork and results that count. We can offer you a diverse and changing work environment with a highly skilled group of people who are all passionate about their work. We are growing fast and a lot of fun stuff happen as we grow, as well as new challenges that arise on the way. Teamwork, communication and flexibility are important concepts for us. The environment in our office is familial and created for collaboration and creativity.


Are you up for the challenge? Do not hesitate to submit your application!


If you have questions about this position, please contact Jakob Wallöf, on jakob@fyndiq.se or 072-577 57 11.


We look forward to reading your application!


Fyndiq is an online marketplace that offers more than 250,000 products to bargain-hungry consumers. At the same time we are a additional sales channel for e-merchants who want to increase their sales. Over half a million Swedes have shopped on Fyndiq since the beginning and the journey to build "the one stop bargain shop" around the world has only just begun.


Fyndiq established on the market in 2010 and has since had a very strong growth. Today we are one of Europe's fastest growing tech companies. We are an entrepreneurial company with a strong commitment and high goals for the future. In 2015 we will continue to hold the same strong growth with the plan to become largest in Sweden and take Fyndiq into the international market. Today we are 70 ambitious and proud employees and right now we are looking for a Python/Django Developer.

Java Developer

item.title: (Jr.) Cloud Systems Support Engineer, based in London / Shoreditch at Maplin Electronics Ltd (London, UK)
item.description:
Maplin are looking for a talented System (support) Engineer with development skills to join our team. Do you want to engage in the design of the next -generation E-Commerce platform and infrastructure in the Cloud?


As a System (support) Engineer you will deliver the support to build a stable, scalable and distributed E-Commerce platform with Omni-Channel capabilities. The Platform and Infrastructure is the core of our services. In addition, we constantly strive for high availability, scalability and integrity. We are looking for professionals who are committed to help us develop our platform and Infrastructure, regardless of the underlying hardware / software. Our platform needs to be reliable and robust. You communicate directly with a team of highly skilled and independent people’ and internal customers. It is important that you can think from different angles and switch rapidly. It is practical insight and acumen needed. Your support and development will directly affect the people you work with and therefore you need to be very focussed on delivering upon promise.

Are you looking to work with the latest technologies, frameworks and methods? Are you willing to continue to develop your knowledge? Then we are looking for you!

item.title: Java Web Developer at ubicast (Minato, Japan)
item.description:
Would you like to progress your Java career while experiencing Japanese culture? If you are interested in web development, this is the perfect opportunity for you.


You will be working on small teams of up to five people. You will take care of all aspects of projects: defining requirements, setting up servers, writing code, and testing. We use the latest Java, Spring, Velocity, OpenCms (Java-based CMS), JSP, MySQL, and Linux. You don’t need to have framework specific experience, but need to be willing to learn when it’s necessary.


The project you will possibly be working on deals with managing websites for our group company that markets health-related products globally. This involves processing data associated with 40,000+ users. Other projects include developing websites for external clients using OpenCms. We have worked with well-known Japanese companies from publishers to real estate agencies.

item.title: Database Developer at MidwayUSA (Columbia, MO)
item.description:
A Database/Developer with Midway USA will work closely with development staff and the Web production team, and will participate in new projects to identify the best means of storing and retrieving the information needed by new and existing applications.

Sample of specific duties:



  • Participate in project development efforts (compose custom stored procedures, views, or user-defined functions as necessary and create data migration using SSIS 2012)

  • Participate in application design (database design and data access strategies)

  • Participate in system architecture (Recommend and execute improvements to Availability and Disaster Recovery Strategies)

  • Ensuring backups (includes testing restores) for active production databases

  • Assembling and implementing a valid data archiving plan

  • Ensuring database security, including password security as well as keeping patch status up to date

  • Maintaining data integrity of Database server(s)

  • Recommend hardware & software upgrade and proposed changes

  • Ongoing database server tuning

  • On-call 24/7 rotation for critical issue resolution

  • Monitoring and creating documentation on database processes

  • Keep change logs of any changes made to the database and comment those changes internally


    • The ideal candidate will have:



  • In-depth knowledge of standard concepts, practices and procedures related to database management

  • Expert user of Microsoft Office software and ability to learn proprietary systems

  • 1-3 years prior application development/database experience

  • Will have a Bachelor's degree.



    • If this position sounds like you, join Midway USA - the company on a mission to be "the best-run, most respected business in America for the benefit of our customers".   Apply today!

     MidwayUSA is an industry-leading internet retailer of over 100,000 shooting, reloading, gunsmithing and hunting products. Both country kids from Missouri, Larry and Brenda Potterfield turned their passion for shooting sports into a career by opening a small gun shop in 1977 that would eventually become MidwayUSA (www.midwayusa.com). They instilled family values like honesty, integrity and respect for others into the business, and strive to maintain this culture with each Employee added to their growing team. For over 36 years, MidwayUSA has offered JUST ABOUT EVERYTHING® for Shooting, Reloading, Gunsmithing and Hunting with an unyielding focus on Customer Satisfaction.
     
    Apply Today!  


    Apply Here
     
    PI87663283

We have a lot of ideas and customer requests on our product roadmap and need to grow our team to meet the demand. The role is primarily development, but would suit someone who enjoys going beyond just writing code — working in a small but professional team, you will have the opportunity to shape the future of the product.
