item.title: Director of Engineering at Wikimedia Foundation (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Summary


Imagine a world in which every single human being can freely share in the sum of all knowledge.That's our commitment. And we are looking for a passionate technical leader to help us deliver on our vision. Wikimedia Foundation is hiring an Engineering Director who will help us serve and grow our half a billion users per month.


This leader’s first mission is to help us structure our engineering organization and she/he will have a direct influence on their own path and future at Wikimedia. With the primary focus on mobile and service-oriented infrastructure, the Director will successfully lead strategic discussions across the Foundation and assist in creating a long-term plan for the technical org. This visionary will also manage, develop, and grow a global team of 15+ mission-driven engineers.


Description



  • Develop a culture of collaboration, team empowerment, and accountability

  • Manage, coach, mentor, develop, and grow a geographically distributed engineering team

  • Deliver software that globally adds to the sum of all human knowledge

item.title: PHP Engineer for Fast-growing SaaS Company in Fort Worth at Koddi (Fort Worth, TX)
item.description:
Koddi develops platforms that help digital advertisers market more intelligently and optimize advanced ad campaigns. We're expanding our engineering team to scale out the successful product set we have by integrating more deeply with current clients and expanding into related verticals.


Why work at Koddi?



  • We solve problems that are hard, fun, and rewarding

  • Our team is smart, experienced, motivated, and ambitious

  • We have an engineer-friendly environment

  • We move very quickly and deliver for clients

  • Our clients are intelligent and industry leaders

  • We work with top tier partners (Google, TripAdvisor, etc)


This role - PHP Engineer / Developer - will work on our engineering team to maximize the performance and functionality of the current platform while contributing to new features and functionality.

item.title: Front End Developer (Angular.js) at eHarmony (Santa Monica, CA)
item.description:
JOB SUMMARY:

We’re looking for amazing JavaScript application developers who love crafting cutting-edge user experiences. 

At eHarmony we're matched with Javascript.  We use Node, manage dependancies with NPM, build with grunt, leverage backbone, underscore and handlebars on the front-end. You don't need to know all of these frameworks to work with us (in fact, most of us didn’t use these a year ago), but you should be salivating to learn them. If you master javascript design patterns like MVC, MVVM you're probably a good fit. 

We are highly interested in candidates that have:
• Experience developing high-traffic consumer facing web sites
• Personal projects that show an aptitude for engineering and product sense
• Ability to work in areas outside of their usual comfort zone and love to learn new technologies 
• Experience starting projects from scratch and jumping in to an existing architecture

If that sounds like you, keep reading we have an exciting opportunity to join a fast paced, super smart, cutting edge, [insert your favorite buzzword] team of developers.  

Ideal candidate requirements: 
• Expert knowledge in Angular.js, JavaScript, CSS3, and HTML5
• Advanced understanding of AJAX frameworks, REST and JSON
• Strong understanding of front-end optimization techniques
• 3+ years software development
• Motivated by writing fast, scalable code with testability in mind
• Keep up-to-date on the latest front-end techniques and trends; respond to customer feedback & testing
• Self-motivated, and can excel in a team-based environment

What you'd do: 
• Work with Product Designers to implement the next generation of eHarmony products
• Build efficient and reusable front-end systems for desktop and mobile
• Participate in design and code reviews
• Collaborate with other team members to incorporate team innovations

We are very passionate about what we do here, and at the same time have fun doing what we love.


We work with latest technologies. Tech stack includes: Node, JS, HTML5, CSS3, Underscore, Backbone, Handlebars, jQuery, Java, Hibernate, Spring 3, MongoDB, Voldemort, Hadoop and more...

item.title: Ruby on Rails Engineer at Higher Learning Technologies (Iowa City, IA) (allows remote)
item.description:
Ruby on Rails Engineer Needed for Explosive Growth EduTech Startup


We’ve had an incredible ride over this past year at Higher Learning Technologies. We were in INC magazine, just raised $5.5 million dollars, and have a #1 grossing education app. We are an education platform changing the way the world learns and we need a world class hire to lead our iOS development team.


With high customer satisfaction and integrity, each worker’s progress contributes to a direct and quantifiable impact on our 450,000+ users. We want someone who is able to handle an organized and cohesive workflow with the flexibility to work on projects that challenge you.


HLT builds apps using modern web and mobile technologies, such as Ruby on Rails, Objective-C, and Java. We operate as a distributed and highly collaborative team organized around an agile framework.


Primary Responsibilities



  • Design & development of Ruby on Rails applications

  • Design & development of API libraries

  • Involvement in developing and improving all aspects of our applications (development, testing, deployment, architecture)

  • Working with RESTful APIs and JSON formatted data

  • Writing unit and acceptance tests

  • Writing complex sql queries

  • Creation of technical documentation for APIs and component designs

  • Providing technical support of applications (fixing bugs and supporting clients' needs

item.title: Software Development Lead - SharePoint at TechSoup Global (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
In this role, you will be a technical  team lead to developers responsible for maintaining and supporting our MS Commerce Server platform, along with other integrated product platforms, while helping us build new integration points.


You will manage all facets of software development, including scoping work, defining solutions, working with architecture to define the technical direction of projects, overseeing and mentoring a staff of software engineers and coordinating with other managers to ensure successful delivery of projects.  You will work with our TechOps - Infrastructure team and other support teams to provide production support when there are production support issues.


We are looking for a candidate who likes working in an Agile Scrum environment and who is focused on delivering quality timely results based on business goals and priorities.  This position reports to the Senior Director of TechOps – Engineering.


Software Dev Lead Responsibilities:



  • Assist in the planning and implementation of new features and enhancements to our product donation platform, including understanding features of the technology and exploring high-level solutions with stakeholders at all levels.

  • Create, implement and manage against project plans for the development and implementation of new features for our eCommerce/Sharepoint platform.

  • Actively participate in agile planning, scrum, demonstration and retrospective meetings.

  • Work with the ScrumMaster to maintain Sprint artifacts like the Burndown chart, Task Board, velocity, and the other associated engineering tasks for each Sprint.

  • Provide oversight to development tasks such as software design, prototyping, coding, trouble shooting, system configuration and unit testing of product features.

  • Plan and execute projects by ensuring that developers have appropriate product and technical specifications, direction, and resources to deliver products effectively.

  • Establish realistic estimates while ensuring that projects remain on track to meet deadlines.

  • Manage day-to-day execution of projects. This includes tracking problems and driving resolutions.

  • Actively participate in requirements analysis and break projects down into smaller components and help estimate tasks.

  • Track and report project status and propose mitigation actions to turn around slipping projects.

  • Participate as part of our Release Management Team to define releases, schedule upgrades and create production deployments plans.

  • Troubleshoot production problems, including the allocation of team resources to ensure timely resolution of any problems.


Additional Responsibilities:



  • Work with other technology leads to define organizational best practices and implement those practices on your team.

  • Communicate effectively within the IT Team and facilitate information sharing.

item.title: Android Developer at Beatport (New York, NY)
item.description:
Android Developer


Beatport is growing and we're looking for talented people who are passionate about what they do. We've built an amazing business around inspiring others to play with music. Everyone's role helps us spread this joy even futher. We’re looking for a Lead Android Developer to push our mobile applications as far as they can go. 


About the Job:


As our Android Developer you'll manage a team of developers and play a key role in shaping technology decisions. You'll have the opportunity to recruit the technical talent you need to create exceptional mobile experiences.


You Definitely:




  • Have experience leading an Android team.




  • You're an expert in Android development and develop applications with Android design principles and conventions in mind.




  • You have experience working with RESTful APIs.




  • Have successfully released Android apps on Google Play.




 It would be nice if you:




  • Have experience with streaming media to mobile devices.




  • Have experience designing and developing RESTful web services.




  • Have experience with HTML5, CSS, JavaScript, and at least one backend language.




  • You value and have implemented mobile app unit testing and test automation.




  • Contribute to open-source applications and/or libraries.




 Benefits:


We offer a competitive compensation package, plenty of vacation days, and VIP access to select music events. We hire people who love what they do and we make sure they have plenty of room for growth- we have an Employee Development Program which includes conferences and lab days.


Moreover, you will work with a team that values collaboration and mentorship. We are always helping one another -someone almost always has the answer for any question you've got.


How to apply:


Please send a short note introducing yourself and why this position appeals to you. Include a resume, and links to code samples and a link to a portfolio if you have one.

item.title: Software QA Automation Engineer at Dematic Corp (New Berlin, WI)
item.description:
Dematic Corp. has an opening for a Software Quality Assurance (QA) Automation Engineer to join the highly motivated Software Products Engineering group in our New Berlin, WI office. Under the general direction of engineering management this position is responsible for the design, development and execution of testing procedures to verify that product requirements are fully implemented. The position works directly with Project Leads to determine an optimal testing strategy for each individual product within cost and schedule commitments, and works with the Quality Control Lead to formulate quality plans and processes to be applied across products. This individual will regularly install and configure a wide range of material handling software products.


Requirements:



  • Bachelor degree in Computer Science or related field

  • Experience writing software test cases

  • Experience with a defect tracking system

  • Demonstrable knowledge of software test types: unit, integration, regression, user interface, automated, and performance

  • Strong ability and desire to learn new software development technologies, especially as they relate to software testing

  • Ability and desire to acquire in-depth knowledge of Dematic’s material handling products

  • Passion for Quality Assurance through automation with a solid work ethic and team player attitude

  • Designs and develops test automation to verify functional requirements and assess overall performance of an application

  • Hands-on experience with software testing at all phases (unit, integration, regression,

  • system/acceptance, load & performance, end-to-end) is required.

  • Perform manual testing as needed

  • Knowledgeable in automated application testing & application performance testing concepts.

  • Automate test suites to ensure product quality

  • Experience automating test cases for User Interface and non-User interface components

  • Experience with scripting language for test automation such as Python

  • Working knowledge of relational database – Example: SQL server

  • Knowledge of automated testing tools

  • Experience with open source automation frameworks, Selenium/Webdriver is a plus

  • Experience with open source load & performance tools like JMeter a plus

  • Experience with some higher level programming language - Java, C#

  • Understanding of software development life cycle and agile methodology

  • VMware experience

  • Experience with or solid understanding of an object-oriented programming language and OO concepts

  • PC backup and recovery experience

  • Requirements management 2-3 years’ experience

  • SubVersion source code management

  • Microsoft Office

  • QMetry Test Case Management system

  • Ability to understand and use testing simulators or emulators

  • 2-3 yrs. Material Handling industry experience


Preferred:



  • Knowledge of automated testing tools

  • Experience with open source automation frameworks, Selenium/Webdriver is a plus

  • Experience with open source load & performance tools like JMeter a plus

  • Experience with some higher level programming language - Java, C#

  • Understanding of software development life cycle and agile methodology

  • VMware experience

  • Experience with or solid understanding of an object-oriented programming language and OO concepts

  • PC backup and recovery experience

  • Requirements management 2-3 years’ experience

  • SubVersion source code management

  • Microsoft Office

  • QMetry Test Case Management system

  • Ability to understand and use testing simulators or emulators

  • 2-3 yrs. Material Handling industry experience


Key Responsibilities:


Participates in the full software development process to represent the requirements of a professional Quality Assurance.  Supports the development of software test requirements and test plans for software modules under development. Participates in both the execution and management of the test plans.  Participates in providing estimates for testing of software modules.  Supports the reviewing of semi-complex customers’ standards specification and other documentation to determine software engineering requirements. Participates in presentations of technical findings and developments.

item.title: Software Developer - Performance at Dematic Corp (Waterloo, ON, Canada)
item.description:
The Global Software Performance and Optimization team is located in Waterloo, Canada and is part of Dematic’s Global Software Development organization. We work closely with the both the Global Software Application Engineering group, who are responsible for system deployment and the Global Software Development Engineering group, who develop Dematic’s software solutions.


As a key member of the Performance & Optimization team you will work closely with the other engineering teams to provide a wide range of performance and optimization services, including:



  • Ensuring that new software meets requirements for scalability and performance.

  • Identifying root causes of performance issues internally and at customer/partner sites.

  • Prototyping new solutions designed to address performance issues.

  • Evaluating and recommending new hardware and software.

  • Defining, designing and deploying new performance testing systems.

  • Contributing to technology whitepapers on performance and optimization.

item.title: Software Developer - Global R&D at Dematic Corp (Waterloo, ON, Canada)
item.description:
The Global R&D Software Organization within Dematic is responsible for delivering standard software products to support a wide range of conveyor and sortation solutions, warehouse automation, and distribution operations. Development teams are distributed across multiple locations in Germany and U.S., as well as Waterloo, Ontario.


As a Software Developer on the Analytics team, you will have the exciting opportunity to help build a new development team in Waterloo. You will have hands-on responsibility for designing, implementing, and testing a new Analytics platform to help Dematic global customers compare sites and conduct predictive analysis, optimize the performance and throughput of their warehouse and distribution systems, and manage equipment effectiveness and maintenance.


You must have a passion for understanding customers, coming up with innovative ideas, and working collaboratively with other talented people to put those ideas into products.


Key Responsibilities:


Design and implement new Analytics platform to support wide range of customer deployments
Lead or contribute to software architecture and database design
Work with peers on code reviews, refactoring
Write test cases within automated test framework for all development
Work within a Scrum environment to plan and deliver incremental software in defined sprints
Proven ability to work directly with customers to understand requirements and elicit feedback
Support process transformation to Agile methods across global software organization and company
Build development tools to support full software engineering lifecycle including test automation
Build strong partnerships with other architects, technical leads and project managers
Build out development toolset to support complete lifecycle from requirements through to testing
Travel to other Dematic sites with some frequency (particularly in the first six months)


NOTE: This position will be located in our Waterloo, Ontario office.

item.title: Software Tester at Dematic Corp (Waterloo, ON, Canada)
item.description:
The Global R&D Software Organization within Dematic is responsible for delivering standard software products to support a wide range of conveyor and sortation solutions, warehouse automation, and distribution operations. Development teams are distributed across multiple locations in Germany and US as well as Waterloo.


As a core member of our Analytics team, you will have the exciting opportunity to develop an Analytics platform to help Dematic global customers compare sites and conduct predictive analysis, optimize the performance and throughput of their warehouse and distribution systems, and manage equipment effectiveness and maintenance.


You will have broad responsibility to define end-to-end test strategy for the product, design automated testing, and work with the rest of the team on test-driven development. You will work closely with the team throughout the software development process, and work with other test professionals to improve our test automation systems and testing practices within global software development.


You must have a passion working as part of a team to deliver innovative software and helping the team improve how we work.  leading continuous improvement in how we work.



Key Responsibilities:


          Ensure complete testing of new Analytics platform to support wide range of customer deployments


          Provide software testing expertise, perspective, and guidance to the team


          Contribute to design and implementation of an automated testing framework


          Automate as much testing as possible, and complement with exploratory testing where required


          Review release plans and sprint goals and define appropriate test plans


          Contribute to software architecture and database design


          Work with peers on code reviews, refactoring,


          Write test cases within automated test framework for all development


          Work as a core member of scrum team to test software as it is developed in defined sprints


          Proven ability to work directly with customers to understand requirements and elicit feedback


          Support process transformation to Agile methods across global software organization and company


          Develop development tools to support full software engineering lifecycle including test automation


          Build strong partnerships with other architects, technical leads and project managers


          Build out development toolset to support complete lifecycle from requirements through to testing


          Help the team however you can to meet its commitments


          Travel to other Dematic sites with some frequency (particularly in the first six months).

item.title: Ruby on Rails Developer at Filament, a Division of Digital Telepathy (San Diego, CA)
item.description:
As our Ruby on Rails Developer, you’ll be working with the seasoned team behind products like SlideDeck, Hello Bar and Flare, as we take our next big step - Filament. As a key member of our Products Division, you’ll be responsible for building systems and bringing app concepts to life for our growing userbase of thousands. Join us in our mission to make the web better!


About You


You’re well versed in Ruby on Rails application development and enjoy the rhythm of agile, test-driven development cycles. You’re passionate about delivering cutting-edge, world-class solutions to solve business problems through development of high quality code. Most of all, you thrive in a fast-paced, flexible startup environment - it’s not about robotically clocking in hours at your desk, it’s about making sure you’re working on the most impactful thing at all times.


Oh, and you should love memes, GIFs and general internet hilarity. This is serious business, after all!


What You'll Do


As a developer on our team, you’ll have a huge impact on all of our current and future products. No pigeonholes here - your influence will be felt at every step of the product lifecycle, from concept & design, development, QA and launch, refinement and even ongoing optimization. You will be responsible for determining and promoting Ruby on Rails best practices for our team and organization, and collaborating with developers, designers, the strategy team and business stakeholders.

item.title: Software Engineer at fast-growing startup at FoundationDB (Cambridge, MA)
item.description:
FoundationDB is scouring the ends of the earth for the most exceptional developers to join our team. We're doing something audacious: building totally novel software to take on an establishment that's decades old. And so we're looking for engineers who love to tackle challenges others think are impossible, who work as part of a team for truly great results, and who thrive while learning new technologies.



As an engineer at FoundationDB you'll be building the next generation of distributed database technology. You will work with a team of exceptional engineers with backgrounds from top CS programs, research fields, and successful startups. We don’t just write software, we build our own languages, simulations, and state of the art tools to write better software.


As an engineer at FoundationDB you'll be part of a team that is extremely rigorous in its technical work and that also takes fun seriously. Aside from Nerf gun fights in the office, we have a flexible schedule and encourage the use of paid time off. Each member of the team is given growth opportunities in areas that they determine.

item.title: Front End Developer at Sustainable Industrial Solutions (Durham, NC)
item.description:
We are looking for a skilled front-end developer to join the Sustainable Industrial Solutions team. I mean, who wants an unskilled front-end developer?


We’d like for you to be obsessed with making things simple and efficient. We have a well-documented API that will be used for all front-end applications and you will be responsible for helping in the development of application logic.


You must not be afraid of rolling up your sleeves and learning new technologies. While we work off a common framework across applications (Angular.js), we firmly believe in using the best tool for the job. We are constantly growing our codebase and your opinion will be valuable.


Responsibilities:



  • Develop new site functionality and features for fast-paced customer demands while keeping focus on productization (50%)

  • Troubleshooting and QA, along with organized code documentation (25%)

  • Work with other non-technical people in the office to create quick HTML-based mockups. A good eye for design is important to have (15%)

  • Collaborate with project teams to plan, analyze, organize and execute product development (9%)

  • Occasional IT support when we accidentally break things (1%)


Benefits:



  • Witty banter (working with us is like being in a bad Aaron Sorkin movie)

  • Flexible work environment with telecommuting options

  • More bean bags than you could ever want (but you have to fight the dog for them)

  • Windows with natural sunlight

item.title: Software Engineer, Core Server Tech at DeNA (San Francisco, CA)
item.description: At DeNA our goal is to make the best mobile social games in the world and our game servers are central to that goal. item.title: Frond End Developer at Windsor Circle, Inc (Durham, NC)
item.description: You will be working on our world class Email Marketing Automation Platform. Our web application stack includes Backbone, jQuery, LESS, and Marionette.js, built on top of AWS using Python's Pyramid web framework.  This is an exciting opportunity to get in on the ground floor with salary and stock options while working with cutting edge technology.  Telecommuting is available 1-2 days/wk with the rest of your time spent in our awesome downtown Durham office.

item.title: PHP Web Developer at Bonfire Tides, LLC (Reading, MA)
item.description:
Web geeks!


Are you an energized, talented and motivated individual fascinated by the mobile web and the future of interactive media?


Bonfire Tides (www.bonfiretides.com) is a small digital studio with a passion for innovation and 
bold user experiences. We are conveniently located in downtown Reading, MA - just steps from the commuter rail.


So, what are we looking for?
+ An individual with a passion for web, mobile web, app development and user experience development. 
+ A developer who can work with designers to bring their ideas to life in rich and interactive ways - with a focus on intuitive user experiences and interfaces.
+ An enthusiastic team player who loves contributing and investing in new ideas.
+ Someone who is willing to go the extra mile to grow with our studio.


Position Details:
+ Intermediate-level position
+ Competitive Pay
+ Flexible Hours
+ Gym/Internet Reimbursement
+ Sick downtown area with good eats!

item.title: Generalist Software Engineer (New Grad/Junior Role) at LiveRamp (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
ABOUT LIVERAMP


LiveRamp is the leading data onboarder, enabling marketers to unify their customer database across disparate online marketing applications and leverage it for analytics, targeting, measurement, content optimization, and more.


ABOUT THIS JOB


Can't be tied down to a single specialty? This is the job for you. It's hard to say what tomorrow's challenge will be, but you'll be happy to hack away at it, whether it's a Ruby on Rails web UI, a distributed analysis Hadoop application in Java, or something completely new.




RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Design and build sophisticated systems to process and visualize massive amounts of data.

  • Make mistakes. Fix them; learn from them; make different ones next time.

  • Be at the forefront of technology innovation. Keep LiveRamp on the cutting edge of industry tools and best practices.

  • Push your teammates to become better engineers. They will do the same for you.

  • Work on your own great ideas for our company during Hackweeks.

  • Contribute towards building a great company




QUALIFICATIONS



  • Excited by the idea of building scalable and reliable products.

  • Comfort in multiple languages, frameworks, and environments.

  • Type S(tartup) personality: smart, ethical, friendly, hard-working and proactive (no exceptions).

  • Desire to work in San Francisco. We will relocate you if necessary.




EMPLOYEE BENEFITS



  • Own equity in the company. Every employee is a stakeholder in our future.

  • Work with talented, collaborative, and friendly people who love what they do.

  • Participate in a thriving culture. We host events such as weekly yoga, game nights, happy hour, and a two night camping trip.

  • Leverage our health insurance, dental insurance, vision insurance, 401K, and pre-tax commuter benefit.

  • Work in the heart of San Francisco - the best city in the world.

item.title: Core Engineers at Meetup (New York, NY)
item.description:
Meetup is hiring exceptional Core Engineers to work on a product that's already helped millions of people find and build local community worldwide. You'll work with a smart, dedicated engineering team to build the next generation of the site.

Requirements:



  • A love of what you do 

  • The idea of helping grow local community worldwide thrills you 

  • Extensive experience programming in Java 

  • Experience developing for the web 

  • Strong DB/SQL skills 

  • Python/Perl/Ruby experience a plus 

  • Javascript experience a plus 

  • Formal CS Degree a plus 



Our team is smart, ambitious, supportive, and above all - we are excited by what we do. While meeting regular deadlines and being focused on quick, quality completion of projects, the environment is relaxed and fun.    

Every member of the Meetup Team is expected to: be an Innovator; be a Collaborator; be a Champion for their ideas; be an Expert; have High Standards; be dedicated to the power of self-organized groups and our mission of A Meetup Everywhere About Most Everything ("MEME"); and most importantly, Get Stuff Done That Makes a Difference!

Check out our dev blog:  http://making.meetup.com/

And scenes from our latest hackathon: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ttEb0C-IPyA

If the above describes you and your passions, we'd love to hear from you!

item.title: Sitecore Developer at RBA Inc. (Wayzata, MN)
item.description:
RBA is a national digital and technology consultancy that combines expertise in strategy, design and technology to close the gap between ideas and results. We believe the best, most complete solutions fuse the modern digital experience with proven technology engineering to seamlessly deliver end-to-end solutions for our clients. We are looking for passionate people who share that belief and have a desire to grow in a fun, entrepreneurial culture that offers the right combination of challenging, innovative projects, professional development and generous financial rewards.



As a senior Solution Sitecore Developer/Architect consultant, your focus will be on deep technical roles and leading teams in development and testing of mission critical enterprise solutions. You will be responsible for the design implementation of custom components and applications using the latest versions of the .NET Framework, ASP.NET, C#, VB.NET, Sitecore CMS platform, Office and other advanced components of Microsoft technology.

item.title: eCommerce Reporting Developer - Business Intelligence at Dick's Sporting Goods (Coraopolis, PA)
item.description:
The eCommerce Business Intelligence Developer is responsible for the planning, design, development, testing, and deployment of eCommerce reporting solutions to provide key business intelligence and analytics capabilities leveraging technologies including Oracle, MicroStrategy, and Adobe SiteCatalyst. The eCommerce Reporting Analyst with work with business and IT partners to define business requirements, ensure data architecture alignment, and enhance processes while playing a key role in the entire development lifecycle.


Technical Specification, Support, Development and Design -Integrate internal and external data sources into the data architecture -Develop technical design specifications for data integration strategies -Apply software development methodologies and standards to solve business problems -Design, develop, and test data management and reporting solutions -Create technical and end-user and documentation 


Business Process Development -Work with business partner(s) to identify business requirements for new and/or enhanced reporting requests -Develop functional specifications addressing potential data sources and business metrics -Conduct functional / business specification with cross functional groups (IT, Merchandising, CRM, eCommerce Departments)

Project Support -Define, coordinate, and execute user acceptance testing sessions -Serve as primary contact for production issue escalation and investigation -Compile needed data to troubleshoot issues -Work with IT and business users to resolve issues

Training -Conduct/Assist in the development of training materials for end user group -Conduct/Assist with hands on training sessions for end user group

item.title: SharePoint Administrator at Federal Home Loan Bank of Cincinnati (Cincinnati, OH)
item.description: The SharePoint Administrator provides technical support for the SharePoint environment including assessment and implementation of new capabilities, and providing Information Technology with a long-term perspective on the relationship of SharePoint technology to the business opportunities facing the Bank.

item.title: QA Analyst at Solium (Calgary, AB, Canada)
item.description:
Are you an individual that no matter what you seem to do you always end up breaking something?


Is your natural disposition to be destructive and knock down limitations?


Do you enjoy Dinosaurs, Nerf and a basic culture of innovation.


Then you've come to the right place.


Located in Calgary, AB and reporting to the Manager, Quality Assurance, you can bring your specialization in disturbance/destruction and specialization in Quality Assurance to our world-class product development team.


Shareworks has been developed using Oracle’s J2EE framework (including the EJB, JMS, Servlet and JSP technologies), while incorporating new technologies and frameworks (Spring, GWT).


You will be surrounded by a team that understands how to translate business needs into commercial software by challenging the traditional ways of doing things.  We want innovators, people willing to challenge the norm and strive for improvement.  If you are interested in working with an ambitious team, whose product is the cornerstone of growing, global company that is reshaping an industry, then Solium is your battleground.

item.title: PHP Framework Developer at CloudFlare (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Responsibilities:


We are looking for experienced PHP Framework developers to join our team. Our Framework developers work on our in-house PHP framework that drives many applications and customer facing APIs at CloudFlare. Framework Engineers also assist API Engineers when needed. We have a small team which deploys frequently so your contributions will be felt immediately. Projects will be fast-paced and may include working on improving existing applications or components, building new applications or components, improving development processes and practices, and participating in department strategy. CloudFlare is an engineering-driven environment and we pride ourselves on finding smarter, faster, and better ways to solve problems.

item.title: Software Engineer at Brightcove (Tempe, AZ)
item.description:
Brightcove is looking for a Software Engineer who will participate in the design, development, testing, and documentation of software systems for video streaming and playback.  Candidates are expected to have development experience in object oriented and functional programming methodologies as well as experiencine working with relational or NoSQL databases.


This position will work with teams based in Tempe, AZ.


Responsibilities include:



  • End to end production of server-side systems including design, development, test and maintenance

  • Participation in Agile-based teams delivering new customer solutions, and updates to existing solutions on a regular basis

  • Work with other engineers to help design and develop the next generation of video streaming systems

item.title: Software Engineer (for financial applications) at Thasos Group (Cambridge, MA)
item.description:
Thasos sources and combines non-financial “big data” on a global scale, resulting in billions of aggregated, real-time observations of human activity. By analyzing patterns in this activity, we infer changes in core fundamentals for individual companies, industries, and even the broader economy before traditional sources of fundamental information become available.


Our company is a forward-thinking team headquartered at MIT that includes Greg Skibiski, Founder of Sense Networks, and Alex “Sandy” Pentland, Head of Human Dynamics Research at MIT.

item.title: QA Software Engineer at Brightcove (Seattle, WA)
item.description:
Brightcove's Video Cloud product is the industry leading online video platform for media and marketing. Our customers range from corporate product marketers to large non-profit organizations to major media publishers.


We are looking for a developer to work on our analytics platform. The analytics platform mixes historical data about platform usage, as well as real time data. We have an exciting road map for this product, and need someone well versed in Java development who can implement core components, and extend our platform in a scalable and supportable way.


ABOUT THE TEAM:


The team you'll be joining is a small, self-organized Agile group focused on solving hard engineering problems. Brightcove is full of truly talented software professionals who love their craft. We use an agile process that ensures the features we build will delight our customers *and* that we're usually home in time for dinner.  We are always shipping code -- even several times a day. The team consists of developers who double as experts in operating the systems that they build and take pride in our extremely high uptime stats and our software quality.

item.title: 2 x Lead Java Developer/ Java Developer (Software Engineer) at Diamond Light Source (Harwell Science & Innovation Campus, UK)
item.description:
The Data Acquisition team at Diamond hosts a dynamic group of software developers who engage with scientists and engineers to deliver novel solutions to aid the research portfolio of Diamond researchers. At Diamond you will experience the full software engineering lifecycle using Agile development processes; programming in Java to develop highly robust server applications and science focused user interfaces.


Lead Java Developer
Provide leadership within the group that supports and enhances the data acquisition software used on Diamond’s beamlines. Work with beamline scientists and external users to understand their needs and to help establish data acquisition processes and software requirements; implement new functionality, and enhance and streamline existing functionality. Be actively involved in the development of the core GDA framework.



  • Provide leadership within the data acquisition group to develop, test, maintain and support the GDA software on Diamond’s beamlines, in collaboration with beamline staff and the Scientific Software and other groups.

  • Bring and apply valuable engineering experience to the Data Acquisition group.

  • Provide direction, support and motivation to members of the data acquisition group. Help ensure work is delivered on time and of high quality. Help the group members follow a disciplined engineering approach.

  • Provide first line support of the software for beamlines, interacting closely with both beamline staff and external users. Including fault diagnosis and resolution. Take responsibility for escalated issues.

  • Enhance the core GDA framework to make it robust, adaptable, and easy to use by developers.

  • Use technical and professional knowledge to identify opportunities for technical or process improvement across the beamlines supported by the team.

  • Deliver high quality reporting and professional advice, presenting findings to senior management and guiding future approach.


    • Java Developer
    Support and enhance the data acquisition software used on Diamond’s beamlines. Work with beamline scientists and users of Diamond to understand their requirements; implement new functionality, and enhance and streamline existing functionality. Be actively involved in the development of the core GDA framework.



  • Develop, test, maintain and support the GDA software on Diamond’s beamlines, in collaboration with beamline staff, other members of the Data Acquisition group, and the Scientific Software group.

  • Provide first line support of the software for beamlines, interacting closely with both beamline staff and external users.

  • Enhance the core GDA framework to make it robust, adaptable, and easy to use by developers.

  • Provide a technical advisory/support function to other departments.

  • Use technical and professional knowledge to identify opportunities for technical or process improvement.

  • Undertake research or development work within parameters determined by more senior roles, with regular review of progress.

  • Maintain responsibility for the management and coordination of own workload, and ensure outputs are delivered on time and to high quality.

item.title: Web Developer at Dick's Sporting Goods (Coraopolis, PA)
item.description:
Dick's Sporting Goods is in search of an eCommerce Web Developer. The primary function of the "Web Developer” is to participate in designing, coding, testing, configuring and deploying of content and front-end website functionality to eCommerce websites. Specifically, the Web Developer's primary role will be to work directly with business users as well as with other web developers on the technical solutions, from design through implementation, adhering to designated coding standards.


RESPONSIBILITIES: 



  • Technical resource for designated technical areas such as programming, mark-up and scripting languages and eCommerce platforms.

  • Designs, codes and unit tests functionality and/or integrations between systems

  • Executes implementation, deployment and maintenance efforts

  • Works with cross functional team members to develop page layouts/designs and static and/or dynamic solutions for website content. 

  • Addresses multiple technical issues for resolution

  • Works with the entire eCommerce Production team to estimate work efforts for deployment of all campaigns, which will be used to drive the workflow and production schedule. 

  • Any other essential function that may occur at the request of the supervisor

item.title: Web Application Developer at Canadian Discovery Ltd. (Calgary, AB, Canada)
item.description:
Web Application Developer


Are you looking for a dynamic, entrepreneurial environment within which to channel your initiative and enthusiasm? Do you enjoy finding creative solutions to technical challenges? Are you looking for variety in your work, and a say in how to do things better? Are you are comfortable with, or excited to learn Agile practices such as daily stand-ups, task boards, automated testing, code reviews, continuous integration and delivery, and minimum viable product? Canadian Discovery is looking for a Web Application Developer who will thrive within our tightly-knit Software Development team, contributing to product design and development, automated testing and maintenance.



Your role, which is expected to evolve over time, will initially include:



  • Development and maintenance of web applications within a Microsoft environment using Visual Studio, C#, IIS and SQL Server.

  • Anticipating, identifying, troubleshooting, and resolving issues with our web applications and servers.

  • Estimating the scope of your work; meeting project deadlines.

  • Automating workflow by using scripts and appropriate tools.

  • Testing, documenting, and reporting the results of your work where necessary.

item.title: Automation QA at ThoughtWorks (New York, NY)
item.description:
As a Lead Quality Assurance Analyst here’s what you can do at ThoughtWorks:


  • Come up with testing strategies that meet the ever-changing requirements of our  user-centric solutions and business goals

  • Design, build, and test critical and complex custom-designed, multi-tier, business applications that use a wide range of current technologies

  • Mentor and evangelize Agile, Lean, and Continuous Development testing best practices 

  • Utilize your hands-on skills while providing leadership and strategic guidance to the teams and client

  • Learn something new everyday. 

  • Travel the world. 

  • Speak at conferences. 

  • Write blogs and books.

  • Start new offices in places you’ve never been before. 

  • Think through hard problems, and work with a team to make them reality.

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, transparent, non-hierarchal, and ego-free culture where your talent is valued over a role title

  • Develop your career outside of the confinements of a traditional career path by focusing on what you’re passionate about rather than a predetermined one-size-fits-all plan

item.title: PHP dev interested in big data and helping scientists at Stirplate.io (New York, NY)
item.description:
We are looking for an experienced PHP developer who wants to have an impact on the world. At Stirplate, we are empowering scientists to work more efficiently by completely automating their data analysis using cloud computing. You will work directly with the founder as well as a bioinformatics specialist to build out tools that will make scientists tear up because they are so happy.


We work with very large data (20gb-500GB) per experiment, so at any given time we will have a few hundred cores running to process a single experiment.  We use all the cool toys that Google's Cloud offers, using cutting edge software from the bioinformatics world as well. So, we have cool tech, really awesome science, and are doing something that most people think is impossible.

item.title: Devops Engineer at Rustici Software (Franklin, TN)
item.description:
When we hire, we generally just try to find the smartest people around and then make a role that suits their unique talents. This time around we’re looking for a very specific kind of developer / system admin.


How to apply?


We’re exceptionally picky, so make sure to do your homework, then email jobs@scorm.com with this information:



  • Why you want this job

  • Proof of your abilities (this varies depending on who you are…)

  • Stories, links, etc… something that conveys your competence

  • A resume, if you want

item.title: Web Developer at Manalto Inc (Reston, VA)
item.description: Manalto is looking for a passionate web developer to join our talented team, building industry leading web applications. We are passionate about Scrum, code quality, pixel perfect design, automated testing, drinking espresso, and having fun.

item.title: Software Engineer at SpinFusion, Inc. (Denver, CO)
item.description:
What you’ll work on
Our roadmap is aggressive and you will play a big role in the future of SpinFusion’s footprint within the healthcare space.  You will be part of a small, talented full stack web team focused on the creation of brand new healthcare applications for our existing and future clients.


You’ll be a key part of designing and implementing new features, exploring prototypes with our in-house design team, and working with customer service team to take our product stack to the next level.  Your work will be used and enjoyed by tens of thousands of enthusiastic end users every day.


How we work
We take ownership of our features from ideas to delivery. This includes planning sessions with customers to building out servers and configuring our deployment process. We are patient with our designs in order to pay off technical debt early and learn from our past mistakes.


We believe strongly in Continuous Delivery, although we haven’t completed our journey. We build infrastructure around testing our applications the same way every time.  Our software does not yet deploy or test itself but we’re getting there.

item.title: Web Developer at Kiwanis International (Indianapolis, IN)
item.description:
Web Developer and Associate Web Developer position available


Responsible for developing functionality and maintaining data integrity of the Kiwanis-family Web sites and the KiwanisOne reporting system. The position also will provide technical support to staff related to troubleshooting and new technology integration.


Web Team:



  • Commitment to the vision, mission and values of the organization, the International Office and the Information Technology department

  • Work directly with the Web Development Manager to collaborate on development projects

  • Attend and engage in weekly department meetings, strategy & code review sessions and brainstorming huddles

  • Work directly with IT/web team members to identify, address, and resolve issues

  • Collaborate effectively with internal teams consisting of project point persons in all departments

  • Propose, manage and adhere to project workflow and scheduling, including timeframes assigned, testing phases and launch plans

  • Provide regular project status updates on assigned projects and tasks

  • Maintain an accurate and forecasted projects outline at all times


Position Responsibilities:



  • Work closely with the Web Development Manager to maintain and improve the Kiwanis-family websites, member resource portal, and online reporting system-positioning the websites as the primary club admin and communications tool to staff, clubs and members, including timely and accurate updates

  • Work collaboratively with the Web Projects Manager, Senior Web Projects Specialist, internal designers, freelance developers and other external partners to produce online projects

  • Maintain the secure operation of Kiwanis-family websites (internal and external-facing)

  • Ensure integrity of programming and codework so that the Kiwanis website structure remains current, relevant and scalable with new technology

  • Establish and maintain website directory structures, configuration and content files

  • Ensure overall consistency guidelines between all sites, including appropriate documentation (code notations/comments), knowledgebase (continuity documents) and proposal of and adherence to web team/development best practices

  • Assist with project specifications via requirements gathering, project strategy, identifying source data, and mockup reviews

  • Assist with spec review, development schemas, code testing, documentation, reviews and go-live preparations

  • Oversee troubleshooting of website systems, application software and interfaces

  • Learn the Sitefinity platform, including updates and module/widget app implementation

  • Work collaboratively with web team members to outline project needs and proceed with project plans to completion, including appropriate and timely tracking in Trello task lists and discussions on Slack boards

  • Propose and develop new or custom applications, such as interactive forms or interfaces to database information, based on user feedback, analysis and technology trends

  • Maintain knowledge of current and emerging web development and programming trends

  • Maintain web accessibility and usability standards for all sites per W3C and Section 508 standards

  • All other duties as assigned.

item.title: Senior Front End Developer at Everbridge (Lexington, MA)
item.description:
Everbridge, Inc. is seeking a talented Senior UI Software Engineer to be an integral part of a senior development team supporting its flagship SaaS-based communication platform. The ideal candidate must be proficient in the development of Java-based high-performance web applications.


The position requires excellent problem-solving skills along with strong communication skills. We use the latest and greatest technology to develop our platform. The stack includes Javascript (JQuery, AngularJS, Backbone.js), Tomcat, Spring, Java (and JVM languages), MongoDB, social network integration, GIS, and mobile applications.


Specific duties include:




  • Design, develop and support software solutions for company’s core communication platform and various web and mobile applications built on top of core platform.




  • Work directly with product management, QA, and related team leads to ensure the timely completion of projects.




  • Create and maintain robust high-volume and scalable production applications.

item.title: Senior MongoDB Engineer at Everbridge (Lexington, MA)
item.description:
Everbridge, Inc. builds software that makes a difference. We are seeking Sr. MongoDB Engineer to join our growing company. MongoDB is part of database solutions that power our high performance communication services. Ideal candidate must be proficient in high-performance MongoDB powered applications. The position requires excellent problem-solving skills along with strong communication skills.


Primary responsibilities:



  • Implement and review MongoDB architecture design, DB deployment, data migration, and reporting scripts.

  • Work closely with Java based application developers with best practices for MongoDB

  • Work closely with operations on monitoring, analyzing and tuning MongoDB applications for optimal performance and scalability

  • Design DB solutions for complex business requirements, including data processing and data analytics.

item.title: Senior Architect, Team Lead at Everbridge (Lexington, MA)
item.description:
Everbridge provides industry-leading interactive communication and mass notification solutions to organizations in all major industries and government sectors.  This position offers the right candidate an opportunity to participate in two of the fastest growing segments of the Internet – SaaS and the Cloud!  Get in on the ground floor at Everbridge, the market leader for Incident Management and Communications solutions.


We are seeking an Architect/Team Lead with specific project expertise on the development of Web and Mobile Applications and to lead a team on new product development.


We offer a highly competitive salary, bonus and options for the right candidate.


Responsibilities



  • Lead the architecture, design and development of new product or key components of the product.

  • Think strategically and drive technical vision. Lead the architecture design and development of new product or key components of the product.

  • Lead and mentor a team of developers in delivering the product with considerations in functionality and usability, along with performance, scalability and security.

  • Lead, advocate and enforce best coding practice.

  • Collaborate with Product Management, Operations, Client Services teams to establish technical standards and process to assure reliable delivery of product with unparalleled reliability and scalability.

item.title: C# or JAVA Senior Programmer at The CBORD Group, Inc. (Ithaca, NY) (allows remote)
item.description:
(This position will allow for a remote employee if you have previous remote work experience but you must be located in the US.)


Summary


The Senior Software Engineer will be part of a dynamic SCRUM team responsible for building SaaS and premise based web software using the latest concepts in architectural design, performance optimization, application delivery, database storage, and  user experience.  Responsibilities include product design, coding, testing, and documentation across different areas of the system using technologies such as .NET, JavaScript, HTML, SQL, and related.  The Senior Software Engineer has no personnel management responsibilities. and operates under minimal supervision.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities of the Senior Software Engineer include the following.  May be required to perform other related duties as assigned.

  • Complete administrative responsibilities in a timely fashion

  • Participate in department analysis, design, and code reviews

Core to CBORD



  • Promote and maintain a high quality, professional, service-oriented company culture among staff and customers

  • Participate in establishing and achieving their individual goals which are aligned to the company business plan

  • Remain focused, flexible, and takes initiative in working towards the company goals

item.title: Senior Back-End Engineer at LiveRamp (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
ABOUT LIVERAMP


LiveRamp is the leading data onboarder, enabling marketers to unify their customer database across disparate online marketing applications and leverage it for analytics, targeting, measurement, content optimization, and more.


ABOUT THIS JOB


Do you thirst to design, build, operate, debug, and optimize sophisticated distributed systems? Are you thrilled to creatively discover new ways to leverage 2 petabytes of data and 100 billion requests per month at lightning fast speeds? Do you love working collaboratively with intelligent, energetic, no-nonsense colleagues? Are you as nice as you are brilliant? Consider joining us.




RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Build, operate, and optimize large distributed systems.

  • Design and implement algorithms to efficiently process, analyze, and serve massive datasets on a 300+ node Hadoop cluster.

  • Be at the forefront of technology innovation. Keep LiveRamp on the cutting edge of industry tools and best practices.

  • Push your teammates to become stronger engineers. They will do the same for you.

  • Work on your own great ideas during Hackweeks (5 times per year!).

  • Contribute towards building a great company.




QUALIFICATIONS



  • 3+ years experience building scalabe and reliable web applications.

  • Comfort writing complex JavaScript (bonus points for previous Backbone.js experience).

  • Ruby or Java expertise or the brains and brawn to become an expert.

  • Good design sense and the ability to create a pixel perfect UI from a wireframe.

  • Type S(tartup) personality: smart, ethical, friendly, hard-working and proactive (no exceptions).

  • Desire to work in San Francisco. We will relocate you if necessary




EMPLOYEE BENEFITS



  • Own equity in the company. Every employee is a stakeholder in our future.

  • Work with talented, collaborative, and friendly people who love what they do.

  • Participate in a thriving culture. We host events such as weekly yoga, game nights, happy hour, and a two night camping trip.

  • Leverage our health insurance, dental insurance, vision insurance, 401K, and pre-tax commuter benefit.

  • Work in the heart of San Francisco - the best city in the world.

item.title: Web Developer (LAMP/PHP) at MCN Healthcare (Denver, CO)
item.description:
Are you looking for a software company that values their developers and provides great incentives and work-life balance? Do you like working in a collaborative team? MCN Healthcare is an established software company that provides SaaS products to the healthcare industry. Our goal is to make our culture stand out and provide a fun and engaging place to work while creating excellent software solutions. We are looking for software developers who have a passion for full-stack development and can help us grow our products and services. We currently work with a LAMP stack with Doctrine ORM, RabbitMQ, and ElasticSearch using Git for version control and Travis CI for continuous integration. If you have experience with these tools, awesome. Great developers don't program in a language, they program into a language, so if you feel confident you could learn our tools efficiently, we'd love to meet you.


Responsibilities:



  • Provide technical insight and guidance to other internal teams

  • Support existing and new software initiatives in a SaaS environment

  • Design architecture solutions with team members that can scale easily

  • Collaborate with our QA team to effectively work through bugs and enhancements

item.title: Frontend Software Engineer at MaxMind (Waltham, MA) (allows remote)
item.description:
As a frontend software engineer, you will be responsible for developing websites and applications. This includes creating new web applications to help our clients better detect fraud while also working to improve our existing applications and websites. You will work closely with the rest of the product team to convert designs to usable markup and with the development team to produce complex, interactive, database-driven web applications.


Our backend code is largely written in Perl and Go using PostgreSQL and Linux. We maintain high standards for our development practices. All new code is expected to include automated tests run by TeamCity, and all work goes through internal code review on GitHub Enterprise.


As our first frontend software engineer, you will have the opportunity to extend these development practices to all of our frontend work as well. You will work closely with our existing team to make sure that our frontend and backend systems evolve together. 


Remote position- US and Canada applicants only.  


Salary range starts at $110k and is negotiable depending on experience.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Everbridge (Glendale, CA)
item.description:
Everbridge, Inc. is seeking a talented Senior Software Engineer for its Glendale, CA or Lexington, MA office to be an integral part of the platform engineering team supporting its flagship notification system. The ideal candidate must be proficient in the development of real-time high performance, concurrent, fault-tolerant parallel processing applications using Java. The position requires excellent problem-solving skills along with strong communication skill.


Specific duties include:



  • Drive the design and implementation of the core infrastructure and software stacks with the initial focus on the voice platform development.

  • Evaluate and select off-the-shelf products or open-source components that can be integrated into the existing system to improve scalability and manageability.

  • Write quality and maintainable code with extensive test coverage in a fast-paced environment.

item.title: Software Engineer (All Levels) at Pangea (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
We're a startup engineering team seeking another passionate polyglot. As a Software Engineer, you'll be an unrelenting individual willing to brave the storm of learning. We're a startup with assumptions to validate and a product to build, refine and improve. You're expertise and input is what you have to offer.


We believe innovation is a result of collaboration across teams, especially in an industry like ours. As such, this position will require flexibility, regular coordination and effective communication with the operations, business development, technology and marketing teams. Our team is a diverse yet like minded group of individuals. Our educational background spans pre-med, pre-law, physics, mathematics, computer science, and computer engineering. Our technological background spans Mac, Windows, Linux, Python, Ruby, JavaScript, C#, Android, iOS, and even PHP! Our gaming background ranges from Counter-Strike and Starcraft to foosball and basketball. The engineering team works in a semi-private space of our office giving us an easy platform for collaboration and discussion. We run Agile with week-long sprints. Everyone on the engineering team has a maxed out Retina Macbook Pro with dual screen monitors.


Compensation: $60k-$150k depending on experience


Benefits



  • Fortune 500 level health, dental, and vision insurance.

  • 27 days off a year

  • Commuter benefits (monthly CTA pass or up to $100/month for Metra/parking).

  • Pangea beach volleyball team (weather permitting!).

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Everbridge (Glendale, CA)

The ideal candidate must be proficient in the development of real-time high performance, concurrent, fault-tolerant parallel processing applications using Java. The position requires excellent problem-solving skills along with strong communication skill.


Specific duties include:



  • Drive the design and implementation of the core infrastructure and software stacks with the initial focus on the notification platform development.

  • Evaluate and select off-the-shelf products or open-source components that can be integrated into the existing system to improve scalability and manageability.

  • Write quality and maintainable code with extensive test coverage in a fast-paced environment.

  • Work directly with product management, QA, and related team leads to ensure the timely completion of projects.

item.title: Full Stack Rails Developer at Kudos Inc. (Calgary, AB, Canada)
item.description:
Opportunity Knocks at Kudos Inc.


Kudos is a HR technology company specializing in social peer-to-peer recognition networks. Our SaaS product is used on desktop and mobile clients in over 65 countries and on five continents, and it helps companies of every size bring their corporate culture to life. The world of work changes for the better every day thanks to our apps and platform, and the HR industry is just the beginning.


We are seeking a Full Stack Ruby Dev with strong technical skills, solid experience in delivering well-engineered solutions and a love of delivering software that people love using. The right candidate will have worked with software that has had to stand the test of time and understands how good code design contributes to that effort. We’re also looking for somebody who has solid experience with Agile development (and would hate anything else), and who feels ‘naked’ without a good test suite. Kudos offers a flexible and casual work environment that places a high value on initiative, passion and team building – not to mention a funky, heritage building to do it all in with tons of great snacks and espresso to fuel the fire.


We’re building a truly international business that spans cultures, languages and countries, meaning your work will influence and impact people across the globe.


No Cubicle. Agile. Daily Standups.


We are 100% committed to that trifecta. The Kudos dev team is not here to take orders from a senior dev overlord or a spec sheet handed down from Olympus. Our team is here to collaborate with each other, with the rest of our company and with our clients to continue building the solutions that have made us an industry leader. Amazing apps and platforms don’t code themselves; we want your opinion, your insight and your ingenuity. Every day is different, but that open and collaborative environment is the base on which we build great things.


Rapid Deployment. Cutting Edge Dev.


The Kudos product is growing, and to support that growth we need talented, experienced developers who like to dream big. Our team is developing a platform with serious scalability (think hundreds of thousands of users) serving clients on desktop, mobile and third party integrations. We do it all on Macs and Linux VMs and deploy to AWS. An even larger foray into big data analytics is just around the corner, so if you want to push what’s possible with code, we’d love to meet you.

mbr targeting uses patent pending algorithms for highly efficient real-time advertising. Also it is working at the cutting edge of Big Data and real-time technologies. We operate large-scale deployments of real-time web services and it is based in Berlin, Berlin, Berlin, Berlin, Berlin, Berlin, Berlin!



We are looking for

Full-Stack Javascript Developer (node.js/AngularJS) (m/f)

item.title: Senior C# Developer at The Proven Method (Atlanta, GA)
item.description:
We are staffing an  in- house positions  for a C#.Net Developer  to participate in a large  custom development projects. To date our projects have been 100% new development.  Candidates must be very balanced in understanding the business needs with the technical tasks. We are looking for senior resources that are interested in leading and mentoring junior team members. Must have worked on large MS environment project teams.  The work location is in our Lenox area development center.    Great opportunity to join our growing custom development practice where you can not only hone your .Net skills but also learn to develop in a variety of other tools in our development environment. Recent projects have allowed our consultants to work with a variety of  languages and development tools such as  Java, Ruby,  Drupal and HTML5.


Project Overview


  You will participate in all phases of the design and development life cycle and collaborate with other team members to build a new, cutting edge, enterprise-level web application for our external customer.  This application will drive our customer’s entire business, supporting all core operations such as inventory management, order processing, contract management, time and labor management, billing, payroll, data warehousing, and reporting.


        Collaborate with other Front End Web Developers, UI/Graphic Designers, UX Designers, and Project  Management on feature prioritization, design, and implementation.


        Develop highly interactive user interfaces, dashboards, messaging and workflow, web services, etc.


        Develop the application for use on both the desktop and mobile platforms.


        Use leading edge technologies to provide the best user experience, and to create a high-performing, scalable and maintainable code base.




What's in it for you;


        Work on a talented and motivated team building cutting edge and useful web applications


        Excellent benefits and competitive salary


        Excellent growth opportunities with both personal and professional development encouraged




Company Overview



The Proven Method is a technology services firm that specializes in assisting customers to answer business challenges with technology solutions. We support public and private sector enterprises with Managed services, IT Security assessments and strategy, Infrastructure design, deployment and support. Our philosophy is that business leads technology. We help you find the technology solution that is the right one for your business. In this current economic environment many customers have turned to The Proven Method's Managed services in order to maintain or increase their IT systems performance and security while achieving a reduction in capital expenditures. IT Security and strategy is at the forefront of all organizations today. The Proven Method Subject Matter Experts assess the current vulnerabilities then design and deploy industry 'best practices' to secure private information and provide peace of mind!

Our Professional Services offering includes



  • Business Intelligence consulting consisting of

  • Overall BI Strategy

  • Data Warehousing and Master Data Management

  • Data Integration and ETL Services

  • Cube Development

  • Dashboard development

  • Report Portfolio Strategy and Development

  • Project Management

  • Custom Application Development




    • Our industry expertise spans several industries including



  • Retail

  • Manufacturing

  • Government Agencies

  • Real Estate

item.title: Ruby on Rails Developer at Connexity (Los Angeles, CA)
item.description:
Connexity is looking for a Ruby on Rails Developer responsible for important functional enhancements to our UI.  Used by outside customers, our internal business team, and our developer team, the UI is our fastest and cleanest view into highly complex, multidimensional data.  As a core member of our UI team, you will be the cornerstone of making our rich data accessible and visible, and by doing so will provide other groups in the company with the insights necessary to grow revenue.  With real time reporting of over 15 Billion events per day, close to 200,000 streamed transactions per second and database tables with over a billion rows, we need a creative problem solver to provide windows of insight into our data.

We are not a LAMP stack shop, but rather a NoSQL, Big Data, Real-Time stream processing shop. Our architecture is unique and our software stack purposefully diverse. We are searching for an engineer that likes a challenge, wants an opportunity to work with cutting edge technologies, and thrives in small teams. We are looking for a developer that wants to 'own' key aspects of the client interface and take pride in its evolution. Your contributions will be immediate and will be felt through out the company. Connexity is fun, fast-paced, and open-ended with a strong entrepreneurial spirit and with emphasis on being innovative. We provide ample opportunity for our engineers to grow their skill set beyond web development, offering a chance to design around several NoSQL platforms including Hadoop.


Some of the work you’ll be doing…



  • Building Ruby on Rails interfaces that make it easy to understand and control complex, multi-dimensional data

  • Creatively leveraging AJAX to pull from Redis and Hbase in order to provide real-time views of large datasets, including lots of streaming asynchronous replication.

  • Identifying reports that can be offloaded to helper applications for faster rendering

  • Helping with the schema design for NoSQL databases

  • Optimizing ORM queries to maintain good performance across large datasets

Software Developer? Done with unrewarding and uninspiring work? Push yourself to the next level and join us in our quest to build the best development team in the universe - and beyond ;-)

Where?
From our head office in Rotterdam, you develop Qandidate.com, various internal back-office applications, internal and external API's. You get to team up with highly motivated and experienced colleagues with a strong vision on web development and software architecture. Everyday you're challenged intellectually in an environment where innovation is essential to leverage our performance. That is why one day a week is dedicated to R&D, prototyping and researching new processes, techniques and tools. We publish the results at labs.qandidate.com. item.title: Full Stack+ at Human Condition Global (New York, NY)
item.description:
Human Condition Safety (HCS) seeks a developer to work on using embedded systems and data analysis to radically improve industrial safety. We’re bringing data driven decision making and analytics to an industry that’s been around about as long as human civilization.


Given the breadth of the system, "Full Stack" is probably an understatement so we’re calling it a Full Stack+ until we come up with something better. Our system involves wearable devices, field deployed base stations and radios, cloud servers, standard browser front ends. It could possibly end up with Unity native frontends, feedback through the wearables, more sensors for inanimate objects, radio analysis, etc. We will be looking into bringing in additional data from existing APIs around the web as well as some more interesting places, i.e. let’s make a crane talk to our servers.


You will have the opportunity to work with a variety of databases, embedded systems, web, native, and embedded user-interfaces, and more. Clearly one developer is not going to know every language and technology we end up using from day one. This means that there will be a lot of learning on the job and plenty of room for influencing architecture and technology choices.


About the Environment


We have one developer (the guy writing this) and one hardware engineer (the CEO) at the moment so you will be joining a very early team. Our customers are companies and there are a bunch of wonderful folks working on the business side getting us very impressive partners and interesting sites to beta test and develop the product with.


We will be handling very high volumes of data very early on and so the quality threshold of certain parts will be higher than that of most early stage systems. Even though are moving fast we will also be building our processes and culture and we’re looking for someone who is excited to help us do that.


Responsibilities




    Building and expanding our distributed service-oriented/API-driven architecture




    Coding the wearable tech and base stations




    Scaling our data collection capabilities




    Helping build and expand our analytics and event engine




    Many, many other things

We build the full breadth of software required to make Yodle go. Your feature team might be working on big data analytics one project and a business intelligence dashboard the next. Examples of our diverse systems include a fully customizable website renderer, a reviews solicitation platform and mobile app, an automated search advertising campaign builder, an integration app that allows clients to market to their existing customers, a service discovery framework built on top of Zookeeper, an advanced queuing and syncing system for integration with partners such as Google and Bing, a widget library for quickly building web interfaces from mocks and many more.


Responsibilities



  • Our engineers work on everything from backend, user-interface, and content management to messaging, database systems, and web services. Regardless of which components you touch, we’ll want you to be involved in designing, coding, testing and running the systems.

  • Our engineers solve a variety of complex and challenging business problems with cutting edge technology.

  • We are constantly innovating! We look at ways to improve our core products, seek out products in the market that can be built better, and keep an eye on industry and technology trends to stay ahead of the competition.

  • We have shared ownership of our code base. Anyone can and is expected to work on and improve any piece of code. There are no silos!

  • We explore new technologies and find the best tools for the job. While Java is our predominant language, we are using Scala, JavaScript, Python, and Groovy as well. Some other technologies we tried that stuck: Thrift, Zookeeper, jQuery, MongoDB, Mercurial, Angular.js, and Play.
