  • Writing unit and e2e tests

  • Take part in conceptual phase of new features and further development of our product, envisioning the front-end implementation and keeping consistency and user experience in mind

  • Interface and collaborate closely with our backend team

item.title: FRONTEND ENTWICKLER (M/W) MIT FOKUS JAVASCRIPT at LIGADIGITAL AG (Stuttgart, Deutschland)
item.description:
Zur Verstärkung unseres Teams in Stuttgart suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt einen


FRONTEND ENTWICKLER (M/W) MIT FOKUS JAVASCRIPT


DEINE AUFGABEN:



  • Zusammen mit deinem Team entwickelst und optimierst du innovative, web-basierte Individualsoftware mit aktuellen Technologien

  • Du entwickelst interaktive Web-Anwendungen (Single Page Web Applications) auf Basis von JavaScript und REST-APIs

  • Dabei benutzt du moderne JavaScript Frameworks und Libraries wie jQuery, Ember.js etc.

  • Du stellst die Qualität der Web-Anwendungen sicher und bist für Funktionalitätsentwicklung und Testing verantwortlich

  • Du übernimmst technische Verantwortung und bringst eigene Ideen ein

item.title: Senior Business Analyst (CRM, Web) at CMC Markets (London, UK)
item.description:
CMC Markets are looking for a Senior Business Analyst to work embedded within a Software Development team responsible for the ongoing delivery of new features onto a CRM system, online CFD and Spreadbetting account opening forms, and various retail websites.


Role and responsibilities:



  • With very strong Business Analysis skills the role will require the user to liaise with business and technical teams to develop requirements for features and create new user stories for the development team.

  • With some emphasis on user interface development the candidate will be required to produce detailed wireframes for review with business stakeholders and developers.

  • Once features are in development, the role will require the user to help manage the development life cycle.This involves monitoring progress of the development team, tracking story status, maintaining project/iteration plans and providing clear visibility on project status (including reporting and communicating outside of the team).

  • As new features are completed by the developers the role will also require the user to carry out testing to ensure the output satisfactorily meets the original requirements before being handed over to business teams.

  • The role will occasionally mean assisting the support and customer facing teams to investigate and resolve live issues.

  • The individual must maintain their personal/professional development to meet the changing demands of the role, including all relevant regulatory and legislative training.

  • When dealing with all customers, clients or colleagues the individual must ensure that they provide a clear, fair and consistent high quality service that presents a professional and positive image of CMC Markets.

  • The individual must take all reasonable steps to ensure appropriate confidentiality.

  • The individual must undertake such other duties, training and/or hours of work as may be reasonably required and which are consistent with the general level of responsibility of this role.

item.title: Technical Expert,Gurgaon at ThoughtWorks Technologies (Haryana, India)
item.description:
If you would like to...



  • Create complex, enterprise-transforming business applications as a member of diverse, high energy teams focused on full life-cycle development through the use of Agile Methodologies

  • Use the latest tools and techniques (currently Java/J2EE, Ruby/Rails, C#/.NET, XML, Agile Methodologies, Web Services, EAI tools...)

  • Do hands-on coding and proactively mentor developers (including pair programming)

  • Work in highly collaborative teams that strive to build quality code and provide business value

  • Have the opportunity to work in a number of different domains in a variety of different client environments

  • Continually learn, mentor and develop your career

  • Work closely with clients, both in the Business Domain and with Technical staff members

  • Travel to work at client sites and other ThoughtWorks offices. This may include international travel

  • Senior developers (8+ years) are expected to be the Architect for relatively smaller enterprise level projects and for larger projects, you are expected to work closely with the fellow architects to come up with the architecture and take it further.


And you want to learn...



  • Test Driven development, continuous integration, refactoring, code pairing methods of development

  • How to bring about a big change in the way software is developed and delivered

item.title: Senior Software Developer at Sparx (Exeter, UK)
item.description:
As a Senior Software Developer at Sparx, you’ll be integral to the team from day one, helping to make the big decisions, shaping team objectives and driving our technical expertise and potential.


You’ll be leading the development of the core technical framework of the tablet-based Sparx system and driving its evolution. You’ll work with all members of the team – from data scientists to content developers – to find solutions to the most challenging problems we face when building a system of this scale.


You’ll be responsible for designing and implementing components for the Sparx system, writing high quality, reusable code that focuses on usability, scalability and innovation. Program it how you want it, see how it works in a full classroom the next day and then dive straight back in to making it better and trying out the next idea.


We’re pretty flexible at Sparx and you’ll have the freedom to do whatever it takes to get from A to B. We have one shared ambition: to improve educational outcomes for all.

item.title: Data Engineer @ Glint (we're early-stage) at Glint Inc. (Redwood City, CA)
item.description:
What’s in it for you…


The team at Glint is smart, highly collaborative, and committed to making people’s work lives better.  If you’re hands-on and care deeply about building a business with great products and happy customers, Glint may be the place for you.


What you will do...


We are looking for a data engineer, reporting to the CTO. This is a R&D role that encompasses several key areas such as data  pipeline, analytics, predictive modeling and NLP.  A significant part of the role require production-level coding.

item.title: Senior Cloud Software Engineer at International Systems Research Co. (Tokyo, Japan)
item.description:
As an IT company that thrives on innovations using the cutting-edge technologies and modern system architectures, ISR has cultivated an environment that encourages creativity and values passion for technology.
We are looking for talented Java developers to strengthen our engineering team creating next generation cloud computing services. The team is devoted to developing web services for enterprise security utilizing Google's APIs. Within the team you will on one hand act as a conceptual thinker that is proficient in enterprise web application design and business logic, and on the other hand act as an experienced developer that can implement a layered design, ranging from the web user interface to the back-end application logic and data services.

item.title: Strong PHP Developer for an Expanding Start-up Needed at Studio98 (Los Angeles, CA; Tampa, FL) (allows remote)
item.description:
What Developer means to us…


Someone with a very strong development foundation that can work with a team of people from around the world to develop the best quality products for our users.


You will be able to work from home, but is a full-time, salaried employee position.


This is not a development company where we will say, “These are your standards and the way you HAVE TO DO IT.” You will be working with the team to constantly evolve the processes and standards to improve the products we produce for the world.


Bring your skills to the table and let’s make some great tools.


Submitting a few code samples are a plus.

item.title: Senior Level Full Stack Engineer (C# / MVC / SQL Server) at Medidata Solutions (New York, NY)
item.description:
Medidata Solutions (NASDAQ:MDSO) has an immediate opportunity for highly skilled Sr. Software Engineers to work on our flagship product Rave. Rave is used everyday by pharma companies, biotech and clinical research organizations the world over. Medidata's Rave is part of a platform that provides our customers with the most advanced tools for planning, executing and managing their clinical trials. Result? 7 of the top 10 grossing drugs in 2013 were developed on our Medidata platform. 


We are continually building and improving our SOA cloud-based clinical trial solutions to put innovative technology and insightful data into the hands of researchers allowing new treatments to reach markets safely, efficiently and effectively. Working at Medidata will allow you to impact society in a positive way.


The engineers who best fit at Medidata are those that make good decisions, communicate well, and are eager to make an impact. We are curious, flexible, passionate, honest and selfless. We enjoy freedom and responsibility and can get things done. We are not afraid to fail and have the confidence to remain calm in stressful situations. We can survive on our own but prefer working as part of the team of equally talented peers. We are self-improving and disciplined and enjoy learning and sharing what we've learned. We are missionaries, not mercenaries.


What's in it for you?
We offer our engineers a highly competitive compensation that includes base, bonus and a strong benefits package that includes medical and dental insurance, vision care, short- and long-term disability insurance, life insurance, health care and dependent care flexible spending accounts FSA), commuter FSA, 401K, tuition reimbursement program, paid company holidays and unlimited paid time off.

We provide top of the line computers (PC or MacBook Pro), adjustable standing desks and the most comfortable work spaces. We have plenty of space for collaboration, game room and a private rooftop terrace.


We help our developers be more efficient by providing them with a license for Visual Studio Premium with MSDN, a ReSharper license, and a PluralSight subscription.


Every engineer gets an opportunity to work on a personal-interest project for two weeks every six months. We send people to conferences to learn, get exposed to new ideas and bring back the knowledge and the contacts that they acquired.

item.title: Frontend Engineer at AltSchool (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The Product, Engineering, and Design (PED) team is made up of a group of talented individuals working to craft a 21st century operating system to power the AltSchool personalized learning model. Our suite of software applications and hardware tools must serve four distinct user groups - students, teachers, parents, and the AltSchool Operations team - yet work together as a seamlessly integrated whole. The unique challenges that we face in this endeavor create opportunities to flex your creative and analytical skills on a variety of different products, such as our student activity playlist, teacher workflow dashboard, parent app. A user-driven approach guides our product design strategies, so we encourage members of PED to interact closely with our user-groups in a variety of ways, including regular classroom visits and our PED-Educator Buddy Program.


Responsibilities


You'll be helping to build web experiences that are as delightful to use as they are functional. Your work will:



  • Help teachers become superheroes.

  • Provide parents unprecedented insight into their children's education.

  • Provide students with an inspiring and personalized education.

  • Help researchers discover and improve how children learn.

item.title: Lead Technical Support Engineer at Infoplus Commerce (Saint Louis, MO)
item.description:
One of the highest compliments you can get as a Support Engineer is that your customers ask for you by name. 



  • Are you an experienced support engineer who makes everyone around you better?  

  • Do you put the customer at the center of your universe and do whatever is needed to solve their problem?

  • Are you asked for by name? 


The right person for this position?  If you love solving the deepest and gnarliest tech problems, enjoy working with all types of customers from around the world, thrive on variety, and want to have a real and meaningful impact on the company and the product,  this job is for you. 



  • You'll be a member of a special team at Infoplus - all highly energized and focused.

  • You’ll be given the best tools and environment possible so you can focus on superior engineering and support - and ensuring that our clients love what we do.

  • You'll be empowered to always do what you think is best for the client.

  • You’ll be surrounded by other smart people who love what they do and believe in what we aim to accomplish together.


This isn't your typical Support gig.


You will have the responsibility of coaching and helping your support team solve problems for a wide range of customer segments, from start-ups to large companies, to help identify and resolve product issues, and to provide guidance for product improvements and overall direction. 


Here are just a few of the things you'll get involved in:



  • Provide quality support through professional written and verbal interactions while demonstrating high technical competency.

  • Triage, diagnose, test, and assist in solving critical customer issues for our products.

  • Create and curate knowledge-base articles and documentation to help other support engineers and customers help themselves.

  • Define best practices and improved methods to increase user experience, quality, and consistency.

  • Build internal relationships with our development and product management teams to help communicate customer needs, urgency and priority.

  • Be flexible around work hours in order to assist customer needs and work with the team of support engineers and developers.

  • Perform case reviews to identify trends and improvement areas and define action plans for improvements.

  • Partner and work with internal teams to resolve tactical issues and completing strategic projects.

  • Be a change champion and help mentor and grow other support engineers by teaching them all of the above.


This is a position for someone that wants to work for a different type of company.  


Someone that wants to have their work and input matter.  


This is a position for someone that wants to be a superstar.

item.title: We Need .NET Application Developers to Solve Wicked Problems at Mercury New Media (Tampa, FL)
item.description:
We are a closely-held web and mobile (don't forget the data!) consulting firm and we are looking for driven senior-level Application Developers.  Are you experienced and current in your .NET coding skills and dig classic software patterns?  Looking for a no-politics zone to do your best work?  Mercury is the place for you!


We are a Westshore-based group of talented designers and developers devoid of heavy corporate structures, approval processes and tight boundaries.  We're situated just right for Tampa AND Pinellas residents and ya, we work from home sometimes, too.


Before “designer”, “developer” or “consultant” our team members define themselves as professionals. Keep one thing in mind: interpersonal communication, technical excellence and thought leadership are expected!

item.title: Web Developer: We are tyring to make the world a better place, wanna help us? at MyDevices (Calabasas, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
By 2020, there will be 50 billion connected “things”. In fact, there are already more devices than humans. This is why myDevices developed an innovative device management system that lets users remotely diagnose, fix and protect all their devices from the myDevices’ mobile app (iOS and Androisd) or the web based dashboard.


PHP Web Developer


We are currently seeking a web developer who has excellent spoken and written communication skills.


This position provides an opportunity for growth within a quickly expanding company in the Internet of


Things/connected devices and mobile industry.

item.title: Software Developer, Houston, TX at Arcurve Inc. (Houston, TX)
item.description:
Want to work in a software development environment where the focus is on creating, developing and delivering high quality software solutions?  Are you interested in working in a fast paced environment with highly skilled peers?  Read on…


What you would be working on:


Working with clients to design, build, implement and deliver custom software solutions including:



  • Handling Large time series data sets

  • Complex Event Processing/Event Detection Experience

  • Application development for multiple environments (Windows, Linux, Embedded)

item.title: Backend Developer -award winning mobile dev shop in Brooklyn, crazy cool project at TENDIGI (Kings County, NY)
item.description:
Award winning boutique mobile development shop looking for a backend developer:  Our team has an exciting project lined up for 2015 and we're looking to add a backend engineer on a freelance basis. An apt product comparison for what you would be working on is Uber's backend-end. 


The job would be full-time (40 hours/week) for 20 weeks starting in early January 2015. Must be on-site occasionally at our studio in Brooklyn - otherwise you are welcome to work remotely or at our office (we have a great studio in DUMBO with lot's of great perks and friendly co-workers)

item.title: Research Software Engineer at National Consortium for the Study of Terrorism and Responses to Terrorism: START (College Park, MD)
item.description:
The National Consortium for the Study of Terrorism and Responses to Terrorism (START) is now hiring a Research Software Engineer to work at START’s headquarters at the University of Maryland, College Park. This is a full-time position starting in February 2015 or earlier.


Responsibilities: 


The Research Software Engineer will conduct research, applying and testing best practices of information retrieval, machine learning, natural language processing, entity extraction, and sentiment analysis to advance START’s research agenda by bringing computational approaches to the study of social science.  He or she will design and build scalable infrastructure to support text classification and data mining capabilities while working closely across an array of various teams within the Center. He or she will develop and evaluate research tools to support and facilitate START data collection and analysis tasks. Specific tasks include:



  • Building, automating, and deploying applications in the Amazon Web Services (AWS) cloud

  • Lead researchers and other development team members to build consistent processes for building, scaling, and deploying applications

  • Developing document classification tools using information retrieval, machine learning, and natural language processing strategies as appropriate

  • Developing and adapting entity identification and extraction strategies

  • Developing and adapting geo-referencing techniques for use with unstructured textual data

  • Developing and adapting sentiment analysis models for use with unstructured textual data

  • Providing programming support to START staff and researchers on projects varying in scope, as needed

  • Participating in strategic decisions about technology, definition, and implementation of solutions to enhance START research efforts


Salary:


The annual salary for this position will be in the range of $75,000-$100,000 (depending on education and experience), plus full University of Maryland benefits (as explained at http://uhr.umd.edu/benefits/benefits-at-a-glance/). The person selected for this position will work on site at START’s headquarters at the University of Maryland, College Park, and will report directly to the PI of the NSF Project.


Application Information:


Qualified applicants should submit a cover letter and resumé via email (with subject line “Research Software Engineer”) to infostart@start.umd.edu. Please include contact information for two professional references.


Applicants will be reviewed until the position is filled. Candidates are encouraged to apply by January 21, 2014 for best consideration.


The University of Maryland, College Park, actively subscribes to a policy of equal employment opportunity, and will not discriminate against any employee or applicant because of race, age, gender, color, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, religion, national origin, or political affiliation. Minorities and women are encouraged to apply.

item.title: SysAdmin/DevOps Engineer at Sprout Social Inc. (Chicago, IL)
item.description: We're a group of developers and ops engineers who practice a Dev Ops culture. We work together to build new technology and to keep production systems and code happy. We're looking for someone who wants to be in the middle of that, specifically bridging development and operations to maintain and evolve this culture as we grow the whole team. You'll build high-scale, mission critical infrastructure that lets us grow our product faster than our team, doing more with less, and yielding more predictable outcomes. We have a good deal in place today but we're anxious to evolve into the next generation, and we want you to play a big role in that. This role is based in Chicago and you need to be authorized to work in the US today.

item.title: UI / UX Developer at Spotio (Dallas, TX)
item.description:
SPOTIO is looking to hire an entry level UI / UX Developer.


To succeed in this position the most important traits are an eye for design, a desire to create a product that is loved by the end user and always wanting to get better through learning and trial and error. Of course big picture thinking and the ability to break it down into actionable chunks is nice as well.


You will be working on web design and front end development as well as mobile design (not mobile development). Breadth of experience isnt as important as the ability to grow within your current talents.


You will have a meaningful impact on the product now and into the future. We make decisions fast, move fast and always iterate to get a better product in front of our customer. The quest to continually make Spotio simpler and more usable (read intuitive) is ever present.


If you are the type that wants to hide behind the numbers of a large corporation or is hesitant to give your honest opinion then dont apply. Unique opinions and perspectives are not only welcome but appreciated.



  • Do you need to have a computer science or design degree? No, but it would be a plus if you do.

  • Do you need to have years of professional experience? No, but if you dont you need to have good examples of project you have worked on even if they are your own.

  • Do you need to be an expert in html, css, javascript and jquery? No, but you need to be proficient and able to work with all of them.

Does this sound exciting and right up your alley? Or in the least you want to learn more?


Yes?


Great! then I want to hear from you.


Lets talk about how this opportunity might be a good fit for you and vice versa.






Benefits


Why work at SPOTIO?


Our customers success is our success and you will have a significant role in both. Spotio is driven to add real value to our customers daily lives through the use of data, metrics and accountability in a mobile sales environment. The CRM industry will be a $36 Billion industry by 2017 and the mobile CRM industry growing by 500% this year alone. After dominating our current market segment the expansion opportunities are virtually limitless.


In addition to a base salary, Equity earning opportunities will be available for the right candidate.

item.title: Full-Stack Engineer--NYC at AltSchool (Kings County, NY)
item.description:
The Product, Engineering, and Design (PED) team is made up of a group of talented individuals working to craft a 21st century operating system to power the AltSchool personalized learning model. Our suite of software applications and hardware tools must serve four distinct user groups - students, teachers, parents, and the AltSchool Operations team - yet work together as a seamlessly integrated whole. The unique challenges that we face in this endeavor create opportunities to flex your creative and analytical skills on a variety of different products, such as our student activity playlist, teacher workflow dashboard, parent app. A user-driven approach guides our product design strategies, so we encourage members of PED to interact closely with our user-groups in a variety of ways, including regular classroom visits and our PED-Educator Buddy Program.


As a Full Stack Web Developer, you will be building applications that aim at breaking the walls of the classroom. We have multiple positions available at all seniority levels. Whether you are a fresh graduate looking to start your career or a seasoned engineer who has multiple years of relevant experience, we can provide the right environment and problems to solve that match your skills and challenge you appropriately. An undergraduate degree in Computer Science or a related discipline is required.


Responsibilities


Full life-cycle development of web-based applications:



  • Writing single page apps with 12-Factor HTTP RESTful backends.

  • Planning and writing unit, functional, and integration tests.

  • Implementing basic monitoring and health checks.

  • Performing code review for peers.

  • Triaging your bug queue.

  • Doing light relational database administration, such as performing migrations, creating indices in response to slow queries, and normalizing schemas.

  • Load-testing, profiling, and debugging your code.

  • Architecting scalable and reliable systems, including planning for failure through redundancy.

  • Analysis of algorithm runtime and space, Big-O notation.


You will also collaborate with the rest of the Product, Engineering, and Design team in the San Francisco and New York offices:



  • You should think of yourself as an above-average communicator; you’ll spend a lot of time talking to people ~3000 miles away.  You’ll be interacting with product managers, teachers, and students.

  • Light travel may be required for the position in New York, up to one week per quarter.

  • Some degree of flexibility around occasional events that must happen on a Pacific or Eastern time-friendly schedule(s) will be required.

item.title: Project Manager II at fi360 (Bridgeville, PA)
item.description:
fi360 is looking for a focused and accomplished Project Manager II to join a growing team of talented and driven team members to help manage and deliver a wide array of financial product and technical projects. We are seeking a person who is passionate about technology and has continually improved their skill set. Our team is lean, agile, and on a mission to accomplish great things.



Who Is fi360?
We are a unique company that helps advisors and large financial services companies optimize their portfolio of holdings through the use of best practices and software. We have been around for over 13 years and are in rapid growth mode looking to hire IT staff who are not afraid to tackle the newest technologies in web and mobile software. We offer flexible work schedules and unmatched benefits packages.



Our Culture
We are working diligently to create a cultural environment that fosters innovation and productivity by offering flexible work arrangements and un-matched benefit packages. You would be working with a virtual and on-site team of senior engineers and architects to build the next generation of financial service applications.



@ fi360 you will:
• Work in creating our first mobile enabled financial service tool
• Be exposed to the latest development techniques
• Manage infrastructure as well as application development projects
• Be part of a rapidly growing and stable organization
• Apply best practices to project management

item.title: Mobile Engineer (Android/iOS) at AltSchool (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The Product, Engineering, and Design (PED) team is made up of a group of talented individuals working to craft a 21st century operating system to power the AltSchool personalized learning model. Our suite of software applications and hardware tools must serve four distinct user groups - students, teachers, parents, and the AltSchool Operations team - yet work together as a seamlessly integrated whole. The unique challenges that we face in this endeavor create opportunities to flex your creative and analytical skills on a variety of different products, such as our student activity playlist, teacher workflow dashboard, parent app. A user-driven approach guides our product design strategies, so we encourage members of PED to interact closely with our user-groups in a variety of ways, including regular classroom visits and our PED-Educator Buddy Program.


At AltSchool, we have developed an intuitive cloud-based platform that is both device and operating system agnostic. Educators, students, family and staff use a variety of applications from their mobile devices everyday as part of our core educational experience.


You will become a key contributor to the design and implementation of our mobile applications developed on our web platform as well as gather metrics from and optimize the deployment of 3rd party applications. You will be responsible for the implementation of features across a variety of proprietary and 3rd party products and services using different languages, which improve the user experience on mobile devices in the classroom and beyond.


We are building a wide variety of mobile application on a variety of platforms that support workflows, deliver content and applications as well as capture metrics. Using your leadership and technical expertise, you work with the Product and Engineering team to prototype features and innovate new approaches to increase user engagement and reduce friction.


Responsibilities



  • Develop product features and innovate new approaches to increase user engagement and reduce friction on mobile devices

  • Product ideation. Express your thoughts clearly to everyone

  • Follow our user-centered design process in every aspect of your work

  • Help drive our vision to build a ground up educational platform

  • Full life-cycle development

  • Writing excellent documentation

  • Iterative development in a fast paced execution biased culture

  • Creating milestones and communicating progress to key stakeholders

  • Performing code review for peers

  • Triaging your bug queue

item.title: Backend Engineer at AltSchool (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The Product, Engineering, and Design (PED) team is made up of a group of talented individuals working to craft a 21st century operating system to power the AltSchool personalized learning model. Our suite of software applications and hardware tools must serve four distinct user groups - students, teachers, parents, and the AltSchool Operations team - yet work together as a seamlessly integrated whole. The unique challenges that we face in this endeavor create opportunities to flex your creative and analytical skills on a variety of different products, such as our student activity playlist, teacher workflow dashboard, parent app. A user-driven approach guides our product design strategies, so we encourage members of PED to interact closely with our user-groups in a variety of ways, including regular classroom visits and our PED-Educator Buddy Program.


As a Backend Engineer at AltSchool, you would develop software that moves and processes data in order to enable personalized education. 


Responsibilities


Full life-cycle development of web-based backends:



  • Writing single page apps with 12-Factor HTTP RESTful backends.

  • Planning and writing unit, functional, and integration tests.

  • Implementing basic monitoring and health checks.

  • Performing code review for peers.

  • Triaging your bug queue.

  • Doing relational database administration, such as performing migrations, creating indices in response to slow queries, and normalizing schemas.

  • Performing DevOps responsibilities.

  • Load-testing, profiling, and debugging your code.

  • Architecting scalable and reliable systems, including planning for failure through redundancy.

  • Analysis of algorithm runtime and space, Big-O notation.


You will also collaborate with the rest of the Product, Engineering, and Design team in the San Francisco and New York offices:



  • You should think of yourself as an above-average communicator; you’ll spend a lot of time talking to people ~3000 miles away.  You’ll be interacting with product managers, teachers, and students.

  • Light travel may be required for the position in New York, up to one week per quarter.

  • Some degree of flexibility around occasional events that must happen on a Pacific or Eastern time-friendly schedule(s) will be required.

item.title: Director of Software Development at TeacherMatch LLC (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
Summary



  • The person is responsible for the overall planning, management and completion of product related software development projects

  • Works with customers, sales and customer support team members to develop project scope of work documents and project plans. Uses project management skills to manage project roles, identify resource requirements, and define project deliverables leading to successful development of required software

  • Identifies the technical approach (architecture, components etc.) to be used on a given project and manages the system development process that includes planning the sprint, actively monitoring and working with software development team(s)/QA team(s) to bring those to successful completion

  •  Ensures effective communications and relationships between various team members are maintained.


Essential Functions



  • Works with appropriate customers, sales team members, customer service team member to identify and coordinate software development for current and existing software based products

  • Prepares customer requirements and translates them into wireframes, detailed business and technical requirements and interfaces with the respective product development teams to develop software delivery

  • Develops sprint cycles along with resources and manages sprint based software development projects

  • Identifies, tracks, monitors and communicates project-related issues, scope changes, variances and contingencies that may arise during the delivery of software projects

  • Maintains effective communication and working relationships with customers and all the internal stakeholders that may consist of sales, software development team and customer support team members

  • Identifies the technical approach to be used on a given project and manages the system development process including the development of a delivery plan, systems analysis, technical design, testing and acceptance of a software system and/or applications. Thus, a good hands on knowledge of modern high availability and high scale web based applications is a must

  • Maintains a good working knowledge of latest tools, technologies and databases as well as Linux based stacks that are use in building high performance web applications. Has a good knowledge of highly scalable architectures and databases.

item.title: Next Gen Archiving Product Manager at Sonian, Inc. (Boston, MA) (allows remote)
item.description:
We are looking to bring on-board a Next Gen Archiving Product Manager to focus on extending information preservation to more types of data and building out more sophisticated features for enterprise customers.  The product will connect content repositories to store not only email, but also communications and content systems such as instant messaging, social software, and file repositories.  End user apps will also be developed to provide a great search experience for users to find their stuff and to draw knowledge out of the preserved content. 


Sonian is launching the next wave of big-data cloud archive and analytics services for both SMB and Enterprise customers.  We are eager to find a talented product manager to join the team and lead the next gen archiving application. This position requires someone who has a strong understanding of technology, solid project management skills, and good strategic acumen.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Al Jazeera America (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Summary:


Reporting to the Director of Engineering, the Senior Software Engineer is responsible for architecting and developing digital products and services for the Product & Innovation department. The ideal candidate will have exceptional coding skills, with an emphasis on Ruby on Rails, and more than at least 5 years of software development, leadership and management experience. The exceptional candidate will also have a proven track record of large-scale product launches and team management. Additionally, this role will require in-depth general technical knowledge, and the ability to effectively work with the digital product team and other stakeholders to deliver a complete product that meets business requirements per schedule.



Key Responsibilities and Accountabilities:



  • Developing web applications within the Ruby on Rails framework



  • Supporting the Product and Editorial teams within the Adobe AEM framework



  • Create, lead and maintain architectural and coding standards, and informing business decisions with technical insight



  • Ensuring that our products are scalable, extensible and perform at a high level, as well as providing technical mentorship within the Engineering department and technical expertise and support across the organization



  • Working with the various stakeholders to generate ideas for new applications and product lines, and to determine scope and priorities



  • Guiding products and projects through the full development cycle using Agile and XP methodologies: requirements gathering, application architecture, iterative software design and development, QA, product release and support



  • Pairing with other team members as part of the development process



  • Programming and expanding major system components using industry-standard best practices



  • Working with the various stakeholders to determine scope and priorities and to generate ideas for new products



  • Participating in architecting and building new products and enhancing existing products at the direction of the Product team



Education:



  • Bachelor’s degree in related field or equivalent industry experience preferred



  • Advanced technical degree a plus



Experience:



  • 5 to 10 years experience in application development

item.title: Use your data science skills to help consumers at the CFPB - and work from home! at Consumer Financial Protection Bureau (Washington, DC) (allows remote)
item.description:
We are now recruiting Data Scientists for a position on our Data Team. The Data Team supports and champions data analysis and business intelligence within the Bureau, and is also responsible for policies, procedures, standards, strategy and technical direction for CFPB’s many data assets. The Data Team maintains the CFPB master data catalog and data warehouse. Data Scientists can work at our headquarters in Washington DC, or can work from home anywhere in the USA.


As a Data Scientist you will:



  • ·         Provide support to other analytical teams in the Bureau, serving as a technical expert for at least one advanced analytical technique (such as data mining, machine learning, geospatial analysis, natural language processing, or predictive modeling).

  • ·         Develop software using programming languages such as R, Python, Java, C

  • ·         Incorporate data from traditional RDBMS and NoSQL environments (such as PostgreSQL, Microsoft SQL Server, MongoDB, etc.) into the analysis workflow by writing appropriate querying and processing code.

  • ·         Create and deliver effective, persuasive verbal and written presentations for both technical and non-technical audiences that synthesize findings and provide clear, simple recommendations on possible courses of action.

  • ·         Pursue relevant training opportunities to ensure skills in analysis methodologies, tools, and techniques are kept up-to-date and on the leading edge of data science.

item.title: Python Programmer at Addictive Mobility (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Addictive Mobility is seeking an energetic, motivated and intelligent software developer to join our Engineering team. Addictive Mobility is a successful, rapidly growing company, with expanding offices in Toronto, New York and Dubai. This is an opportunity to join one of the most innovative companies in Toronto, and one of Canada's fastest growing start-ups. We increasingly exceed the needs of our diverse client base, including major, well-known retailers and internationally recognized agencies in the US, Canada and the Middle East.


About the Role:


This is an intermediate to senior role that requires someone who has a lot of energy and enthusiasm to develop the next big thing in online advertising. You must be a self-starter who is highly analytical, and show meticulous attention to detail. You will be working on an exciting product, contributing to different aspects of the system as required with room for growth into more senior positions.


You will gain exposure to a high transaction real-time system that processes over 30,000 requests per second. You will be working on Addictive Mobility's real-time bidding, data collection, and ad server technologies. You'll get to play around with with a highly tuned infrastructure optimized for super low latency and high transaction rates.


We have a fast, nurturing work environment in an open concept office at the heart of Liberty Village. Near restaurants, pubs, grocery stores, as well as local events and festivals. Don't bring lunch on Friday's because it's on us!

item.title: Network Engineer III (Reg FT) at Community College of Allegheny County (Pittsburgh, PA)
item.description:
Network Engineer III (Reg FT)

Community College of Allegheny County

General Summary
Install, support and maintain server software and hardware and applications to assure integrity and reliability. Integrate applications and services with college operations in support of the college mission and goals.

Job Duties
1. Diagnose, research, resolve and troubleshoot hardware, software and coding issues.
2. Develop, deploy and maintain software applications and scripts.
3. Install, maintain, patch, select and upgrade servers and application software.
4. Work with vendors on existing and new systems.
5. Create procedural documentation.
6. Provide technical support to internal and external customers in the selection, implementation, interface and use of software and hardware.
7. Support and maintain network resources supporting LAN/WAN users in remote and local sites.
8. Participate in network security to protect the college's information resources.
9. Conduct performance analyses and audits of services, applications and systems.
10. Perform other duties as assigned.

Job Specifications
Bachelor's degree in computer science, information science or related field and a minimum of four years progressive experience. Experience in web based development tools, object oriented programming, systems analysis and design, networking and Microsoft's .NET development platform. Experience in Microsoft Exchange, Lync, SharePoint, SCCM, IIS and virtualization, VBScript, JavaScript, and PowerShell is desired. Attentive to accuracy and detail.

Job Category
Administrator

Job Type
Full-time

Campus
Office of College Services

Department
Information Technology Services

All applicants must apply online at: http://apptrkr.com/556727. The College's online application system will allow you to complete a college application, apply online, answer screening questions, and attach a resume, cover letter and other documents.

item.title: Senior CakePHP Software Engineer at SalesWarp (Baltimore, MD)
item.description:
SalesWarp is hiring Senior CakePHP Software Engineers to work on our innovative products and in our agile focused design process.


You’ll have the opportunity to make a big difference on existing and new product lines as well as create innovative solutions for our clients. Ideal candidates should be quick learners with desire to both learn and share knowledge in a dynamic team environment.

item.title: Devops Engineer at Voxy (New York, NY)
item.description:
We believe that learning a language should be fun, rewarding, and a gateway to the best experiences life has to offer. If you agree, we’d love to talk.


Voxy is looking for a talented DevOps Engineer with the tech chops to keep our systems and architecture running at top speed, as we work on dramatically improving the way millions of people around the world learn English. Our development environment is fast-paced and Agile, and this engineer will be too!


What You’ll Be Doing:



  • Work side-by-side with the development team, providing them with a robust and scalable software environment to build a cutting edge and complex mobile/web app service



  • Be the systems administration support arm, primarily in a production environment (80-90%), with some support on the IT/office side (10-20%)

  • Keep a keen key eye out for future issues that may arise, and nipping them in the bud

  • Underneath the guidance of our lead devops engineer, find the best ways to evolve and build out our growing infrastructure



What we’re looking for:



  • Strong understanding of Linux (Ubuntu) systems administration

  • Experience building, monitoring, and scaling complex web applications

  • Experience creating & implementing monitoring for network, server and application statuses, with knowledge of monitoring tools such as graphite, nagios, zabbix, and/or cacti

  • Proficiency in scripting and automation (Python strongly preferred)

  • Experience with AWS

  • Strong ability to write quality code, with a background in software development (even if just a a hobby!)

  • Capacity and willingness to pick up new technologies and tools

  • Good technical documentation skills



Nice-to-Haves:



  • Experience with Puppet

  • Experience with continuous integration, testing, and deployment

  • Understanding of NoSQL, Postgres

  • Experience in a startup!

  • Interest in languages acquisition a big big plus
     


Working here, you'll enjoy:



  • Competitive salary and stock options

  • Medical, Dental, Vision, Flex Spending benefits

  • Gym reimbursement, Citibike, FancyHands account

  • Ongoing professional development

  • Reimbursement for attendance at industry or professional conferences

  • On-site language classes

  • Monthly team outings

  • Unlimited snacks and beverages and access to beer fridge

  • Awesome team of super bright, creative, talented, and passionate individuals

  • Sweet space in downtown Manhattan easily accessible by many trains



Want to know more about us?


Voxy is a NYC-based company that is changing the way the world learns English. Our proprietary personalization technology and exclusive partnerships with leading content publishers enable us to deliver a one-of-a-kind solution to over 2.5 million English learners across the globe. Our mobile and web applications make it possible for individuals to learn from the world around them, turning everyday experiences and content into fun, game-like activities. Our custom-built, live one-on-one tutoring platform brings the necessary human element front and center, and is a core piece of our methodology. Voxy’s disruption of the $80B market for English language education has been recognized by leading education investors and the company has been deemed a pioneer by The New York Times, CNN Money, Fast Company, Mashable, Univision, Veja (Brazil), Venturebeat, and others.  Most recently, in August 2013, Voxy announced a strategic partnership with Pearson, the world’s leading learning company. This new partnership marries Pearson’s global scale with Voxy’s cutting-edge technology to connect with and improve the lives of the over two-billion people learning English worldwide.



Recognized by Business Insider (2012):


The 10 Best US Tech Companies To Work For In 2012


Recognized by Forbes.com (2013):


The 12 Companies Transforming Their Industries

item.title: JavaScript / NodeJS / MEAN Stack Developer at A Different Engine LLC (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
item.description:
A Different Engine is looking for a Javascript Engineer/NodeJS/MEAN stack developer who will work with our design and development teams in building tools and content management applications focused on the NodeJS and express stacks (can't say all will be mongodb backed, or have an Angular front end). Candidates should be expert JavaScript developers comfortable with advanced JavaScript concepts (knowing how to use Promises - good, understanding ES6 generators - great).  Day to day responsibilities will be as primary developer and technical lead on NodeJS content management tools and projects.  Ideal candidates should be able to architect and build large scale, JavaScript applications based on standard frontend Javascript tools and libraries such as Express, Angular and Backbone.  We also frequently use RequireJS and Grunt so familiarity there is a plus however we're open to exploring different stacks such as Gulp or Browserify.   As we expand as a team we are also adding automated testing to many of our tools and projects using tools such as Cucumber and Karma. We also do some backend development using Ruby-On-Rails so familiarity there is a plus.


 When not working on back-end tools we may ask you to work with some of our front-end HTML5 projects for emerging media platforms so the ideal candidate would be comfortable on both sides of the development stack. We are a client facing organization so candidates should also be comfortable speaking directly with outside clients as well as internal design teams, producers and stakeholders. 


A Different Engine is looking for a software craftsmen who take the vision from our design team and turns it into a reality for our clients.  We are looking for folks comfortable across a variety of languages, platforms and frameworks, who can code, and get things done regardless of language. Our primary development work is done in JavaScript however we frequently need to build quick and dirty tools for our clients to host, or their existing CMS (Drupal a lot) so PHP is frequently used however we also have an affinity for frameworks such as Ruby on Rails,  and Nodejs/Express when we can choose the full stack.  Our projects generally are 3-6 month development projects and we maintain internal tools and frameworks to ease and speed development.


We are an interactive agency which means we build applications for our clients. Unfortunately this frequently forces us into more of a "Waterfall" development methodology. We're trying to address this by using Agile and iterative methodologies as much as possible. From a management perspective we're looking for folks who have experience with using and adapting agile practices to less than agile projects so we're looking for candidates familiar with agile processes but able to adapt to our project realties.


While the ideal candidate would be in or willing to relocate to the San Francisco Bay Area (or NYC) we are open to remote work for the right candidate.

item.title: Front-End Developers at Kinetic Data (Saint Paul, MN)
item.description:
We are looking for two exceptionally creative developers who know their way around front-end web design and implementation using the latest tools that best solve the problem at hand.  You’ll be involved in a wide-range of projects including crafting environments for our customers using our internal platforms, generating reusable components and processes, maintaining best practice guidelines and more.  This position is full-time and on-site in our St. Paul, MN location.


Responsibilities:



  • Assist professional services leads in scoping consulting projects

  • Design, deliver and deploy customer solutions in a fast-paced environment using a combination of standard web development technologies and our rapid development platform

  • Interact with the sales engineering team to help design engaging demo environments highlighting our products

  • Gather requirements and write documentation

  • Knowledge transfer of development work to customers

item.title: Data Architect at New Classrooms (New York, NY)
item.description:
About the Role


We are looking for someone who loves every aspect of how data contributes to an application because it is crucial to ours. You will be responsible for contributing to the design of our data model, managing our data access methods, ensuring proper data flow, championing the data portion of our overall architecture, and also supporting developers to make best use of our data layer. We are a start-up which means everyone wears many hats. We don’t need a classic DBA. We want a strategic thinker who understands development from the data perspective.


You will report to the Product Development department and will have touch points into Operations, Academics, and the Field teams. We need someone who thinks fast and can operate as an efficient, effective “do-er”.


What You Would Do



  • Collaborate with the Development Operations Manager and Product Managers to produce and evolve data models for the systems that drive our program

  • Serve as the central point of contact for developers (in house and vendors) in need of data from multiple systems

  • Design effective, efficient data transformation procedures to facilitate integration between internal and external components

  • Proactively investigate, document, and communicate issues/measures around data quality

  • Plan out and manage data structures to best support both operational and reporting needs

  • Work with our Systems Administrator to apportion necessary data servers

  • Establish a tuned database for data access and data creation/update

  • Support quality assurance team to establish data scenarios for testing and ongoing operational monitoring

  • Monitor databases performance and provide fast response to database instability

  • Own the logical data design and its translation into a specific data model

  • Install and test new versions of the DBMS

  • Writing database documentation, including data standards, procedures and definitions for the data dictionary (metadata)

  • Plan and maintain tuned, secured databases

  • Work with Security Manager to control data access permissions and privileges

  • Developing, managing and testing data backup and recovery plans

item.title: .NET Software Developer at New Classrooms (New York, NY)

Software Developers at New Classrooms work at the intersection of technology and education. Building and improving on groundbreaking technology, our Software Developers play a critical role supporting the development of new models for personalized education. We are seeking a .NET Developer to produce, maintain, and evolve personalized learning algorithms.

  • Design and develop solutions to be added into the product portfolio

To Apply

Disclaimer


Job descriptions provide an overview of the position, but are not designed to dictate responsibilities. Every member of the New Classrooms team is prepared to carry out any task regardless of title or department in order to fulfill the organization's mission.


Work Authorization


In compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.

item.title: Front End Software Developer at SmartProcure (Deerfield Beach, FL)

Software Developer

We're looking for a passionate software developer to help us build the next generation of SmartProcure, a well-funded civic startup disrupting government procurement by aggregating, indexing, analyzing, and otherwise transforming government purchasing data. We work with Code for America Accelerator and have an incredible team of seasoned executives and engineers. item.title: C# and .NET Developer -- Fun Venture-Backed Startup at Amplifinity (Ann Arbor, MI)

The ideal candidate has a solid background in ASP.NET (C#).  Some experience in PHP is also desired, but not required. We want to talk to candidates who work well in multiple programming languages and are eager to learn more.

item.title: VP of Engineering at Yodle (New York, NY)
item.description:
Yodle, Inc. is the NYC-based leader in local online advertising and is helping to redefine the products and technologies for small businesses to compete on the Internet. As Yodle’s Vice President of Engineering, you will help manage and grow the team of software engineers while building the processes and the technologies that allow us to deliver maximum value to our customers in record time. You will synthesize business and technical activities and ensure we have coordinated efforts across the entire organization. You will stay abreast of new technologies and evangelize and motivate technology solutions throughout the company. As a “programmer’s programmer,” you will guide and inspire Yodle’s engineers with your deep knowledge and experience in computer science practices. Yodle practices Agile and Continuous Delivery methodologies, and you will be expected to extend and solidify those efforts. You will be working closely with the CIO and Product team to deliver business value and innovation to our customers as efficiently as possible. You will be managing a team of over 60 software engineers across two locations.


Learn about how Yodle is transforming work on our tech blog.


Responsibilities



  • Grow and foster a culture of innovation, professionalism, quality, and engineering excellence. Encourage and promote creative thinking and problem-solving.

  • Ensure all software projects are technically aligned and optimally positioned.

  • Constantly improve the development process.

  • Deliver clear technical direction and standards for the engineering organization and ensure compliance.

  • Foster and maintain close working relationships with the Product, QA, DevOps, and UX departments.

  • Facilitate collaboration between software, product development, and business stakeholders.

  • Grow new relationships and strengthen existing networks between the technology team and their partners across the business.

  • Demonstrate a deep technical background and an ability to think strategically about business, product, and technical challenges.

  • Establish career development goals at an organizational level.

  • Develop and coach engineering managers, team leads, and engineers.

  • Enable and empower managers to develop talent on their teams while ensuring compliance to organizational goals.

  • Inspire creativity with FedEx events, hackathons, etc.

  • Implement and manage annual and multi-year technology strategies

  • Grow and empower technical leadership in software to participate in strategic and architecture planning.

  • Establish transparency by broadly communicating architecture and strategy goals.

  • Conduct regular 1:1s. Provide useful feedback to your direct reports, peers, managers, and others in the company.

  • Clearly communicate the technical goals to the engineers and keep them front and center. Ensure engineering is always adding business value. Communicate engineering tactics to the business side.

  • Adroitly prioritize tech-debt pay-down projects as well as larger strategic initiatives (versioned deployments, deployment frequency).

item.title: Web Developer / Software Engineer (m/w) at SYNYO GmbH (Wien, Österreich)
item.description:
Die SYNYO GmbH ist ein dynamisch wachsendes Wiener Forschungs-, Entwicklungs- und Beratungsunternehmen, das spannende Projekte zu innovativen Themenfeldern mit starkem Fokus auf moderne Informations- und Kommunikationstechnologien durchführt. SYNYO beschäftigt hochqualifizierte MitarbeiterInnen unterschiedlicher Fachrichtungen mit exzellenten Fähigkeiten und unterstreicht damit seinen interdisziplinären Forschungs-, Entwicklungs- und Beratungsansatz.


Für innovative Projekte in den Bereichen „Open Data“, „Smart Web Applications“ und „Information Visualization“ suchen wir 2-3 Software Developer (mit unterschiedlichen technischen Spezialisierungen) für unser Büro in Wien:


Aufgabengebiet:



  • Mitarbeit bei Projekten im Bereich Collaborative Web Platforms, Data Analytics und Information Visualization

  • Umsetzung innovativer Web-Applikationen und Datenbankarchitekturen im Team

  • Durchführung von Anforderungsanalysen und Erarbeitung spannender Anwendungskonzepte

  • Erfahrung mit Konzepten der agilen Softwareentwicklung und Versionierungssystemen

  • Ausgeprägte konzeptionelle, methodische und analytische Fähigkeiten

  • Teamplayer, proaktive Arbeitsweise, Flexibilität und Lernbereitschaft

Wir bieten:

Wir haben Ihr Interesse geweckt?


Dann senden Sie uns Ihre gesammelten Bewerbungsunterlagen an die angegebene E-Mail.

item.title: Hadoop Developer Risk Engines New York- midtown $1,100 per day at Nomura (New York, NY)
item.description:
Department overview:


The Risk engine group is responsible for design, development and level 3 support for the Risk Engines and Analytics applications within the Risk & Capital Technology group. This group is primarily focussed on the calculation, aggregation and reporting of the risk analytics.

item.title: VP of Engineering at Noom (New York, NY)
item.description:
Noom is a New York-based health & wellness tech startup that uses mobile technology to help people lead healthier lives (22 million and counting!). While other fitness companies just track, we coach. We learn from the best research in nutrition, psychology and behavior modification and combine it with the latest tech to design next-generation health & wellness apps on Android and iOS.


We’ve built a strong foundation with hundreds of thousands of paying customers, a grant from the National Institutes of Health, $7M in Series A funding led by RRE Ventures and a team of 40 full-time Noomers -- 30 in our NYC headquarters and 10 in our foreign offices (Seoul and Berlin).


Just the U.S. alone spends $3.8 trillion dollars on healthcare, and large chunks of that can be saved by shifting more to prevention. The existing healthcare system has no idea how to do this, and that’s where we come in.


We are looking for a VP of Engineering; a leader, someone who will grow the engineering organization and help evolve Noom technology, all while keeping the team productive and happy. This person will inspire not only the team, but the entire Noom community, and carry us through the technical challenges and opportunities as we set the standard for wellness intelligence.


You will get to lead a team of world-class engineers, help millions of people be healthier, tackle some of the hardest problem in healthcare and technology, and get very generously rewarded. There are still no Googles or Facebooks in wellness, so help us build one.


What You'll Be Doing:



  • Drive technical, architectural, and organizational decisions, making sure we build a scalable, efficient, and maintainable infrastructure

  • Grow and evolve Noom engineering through best practices, coding guidelines, and design documents, ensuring the organization as a whole feels awesome, top-notch, and fun

  • Optimize interactions between engineering and other functions, e.g product management, design, marketing, etc. 

  • Work closely with recruiting team to hire and successfully on-board a team of engineers, following the existing process and improving it

  • Help design and refine a scalable engineering culture to accommodate this growth

  • Be a good career coach and mentor, help engineers grow to be tech leads, and guiding all others towards success

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Noom (New York, NY)
item.description:
You


We're looking for an awesome Senior Software Engineer with tons of programming experience (doesn't matter if it was at Apple or in your mom’s basement), excellent communication skills a true team player and someone who is passionate about engineering. A CS background or degree usually helps a lot, but is not a strict requirement, if you really know your stuff.


If you want to be part of a rapidly growing health and wellness start-up based in the heart of NYC, send us your resume. We are very discreet and will never share any of your information with anyone. Or if you have any tech related questions, email our co-founder directly at artem.petakov@noom.com.

item.title: Frontend Developer (m/f) at Westwing Home & Living (München, Deutschland)
item.description:
Westwing is one of the world’s fastest growing eCommerce companies: Backed by well-known investors with over EUR 150 mn. in funding, we are the leading Home & Living eCommerce company in the 15 countries we serve. Every day, we inspire more than 17 mn. members with stylish furniture and accessories from well-known brands they love. In 2013, we surpassed EUR 110 mn. in annual sales and continue to grow rapidly.


Our international team is the secret to our success. Westwing balances style expertise and creativity with a deeply data-driven business mindset. We are proud to be working with inspiring colleagues who are smart, fun, ambitious and looking for the challenge to transform an industry.


Do you think this could be you? To pursue our ambitious expansion strategy, we are looking for an awesome Frontend Developer (m/f). As Frontend Developer, you will be responsible for turning our websites into a beautiful and unique shopping experience for our customers.


Your responsibilities will be:



  • Working closely with our product managers and designers to turn static PSD designs into amazing user interfaces

  • Implementing new features with performance, user experience and style in mind

  • Thinking about large and small screen: you will address mobile, tablet and desktop

  • Sharing ideas and knowledge with other developers

  • Fixing cross-browser issues, pro-actively testing your code in the major browsers

  • Ensuring high quality and standards compliant coding


We offer:



  • An exciting opportunity to build an amazing frontend for one of the fastest growing international eCommerce players

  • A position in a high-caliber Tech team with like-minded developers

  • An attractive compensation package


Location: Munich

item.title: Software Project Consultant (Microsoft Dynamics CRM) at Cobalt (Alexandria, VA)

All candidates must be comfortable working directly with customers in a collaborative environment.

item.title: (Front/Back/Full Stack) Software Developer at SwiftGift (London, UK) (allows remote)
item.description:
Hi!


We are SwiftGift, a small startup based in the heart of London. We believe that the gifting experience could be made easier. To improve it we are creating a platform, that allows you to send real gifts to anyone, without knowing their address.


We launched our beta in December 2014. The launch has been a great success and we are growing fast! We have got coverage from various media sources including TechCrunch and we have experienced a great surge in interest from reporters and publications –  more articles are on the way. Our next step is to build a completely new platform and a mobile app. And for that we are looking for talented, responsible, people to join our team. We are looking for 3 different people to join our team.


Essential skills


You should get in touch with us if you:



  • Are an experienced web developer

  • Are interested in building an app that will make millions of people happier

  • Want to play with cool new technologies (NodeJS/React/Flux)

  • Are ready to build up a project from the very beginning

  • Like working in a team and having real responsibility

  • Know how to use git and Github


Frontend:



  • Know ins and outs of how browsers work

  • Have a lot of experience with clientside MVC like: Backbone/Spine/Ember

  • An expert in JavaScript and used libraries like jQuery and Underscore

  • Have an expert knowledge of CSS and HTML


Backend:



  • Have a lot of experience with at least one of: NodeJS/Rails/Sinatra/Django

  • Know your way around with SQL/NoSQL (MySQL/PostgreSQL/MongoDB)

  • Have a strong knowledge of JavaScript or willing to learn fast


Highly desirable:



  • Not being afraid of CoffeeScript

  • Keeping up to date with things like React and Flux

  • Knowing how to handle a nerf gun


We offer a skill-dependent, negotiable salary – don’t hesitate to approach us. We have a fun, friendly team with people from many different countries. You will blend in perfectly!


Some of the benefits we offer:



  • Employee discount and voucher codes

  • Team events

  • Free fruit, drinks and more

  • Free taxi home if you work late

  • Basketball hoop and other office toys

  • Equity after the trial period

  • Access to any technical books you want to read

  • Free Spotify subscription

  • Trips to our cozy london office if you’re working remotely

  • Potential for work-related travel

  • Attractive central Knightsbridge location

  • Possible relocation to London after the trial period


If you are interested in joining our amazing team, please send us your resume, some examples of your work and your expected salary to jobs@swiftgift.me

item.title: System Administrator - BSD/Linux at trivago GmbH (Dusseldorf, Germany)
item.description:
Join trivago and help shape the future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Work with latest technologies and with colleagues from over 60 different countries. We believe in personal development through flexible, self-directed work and cross-functional opportunities. Enjoy a working environment that encourages new ideas, fun and questioning the status quo!

Our Data Centre Operations team is seeking a technology guru to help us maintain our multi-datacentre network infrastructure. Are you ready to tackle some of the leading software and system issues to ensure a smooth user-experience for our 45 million visitors using trivago every months? In this critical position you will tap into your in-depth knowledge of both networking best practices and security flaws to protect trivago against attack and vulnerabilities. You’ll be working with top notch network equipment, systems and tools to keep our labs humming smoothly at all times. We’re a company that will let you work when, how and with whatever PC or Mac you choose. If you’ve got what it takes to tackle complex software and system issues and you have the drive to take trivago to the next level then we look forward to hearing from you!



Your tasks:



  • You monitor and maintain our multi datacentre network infrastructure to optimise routing policies for increased speed and availability

  • You monitor the workload of critical systems and predict necessary changes to cope with future workload. We’re growing, and growing fast, so we want you to make sure our systems and infrastructure stay the cutting-edge of computer technology

  • Thinking like a hacker, you challenge the status quo of our security rules while maintaining accessibility – we appreciate the balance of safety and fun for our users

  • Use your know-how and logical thinking to troubleshoot reasons for critical malfunctions in our complex technical environment

  • Reduce manual work by setting up automated processes for monitoring, error detection and system setup



Your profile:



  • Bachelor or apprenticeship in Computer Science or equivalent experience. At least 5 years networking experience in organisations with large networks – web environment preferred

  • Large-scale operational knowledge of Juniper ScreenOS, JunOS and Cisco IOS including security features

  • Solid understanding of BGP routing protocol

  • Hands-on experience working with and troubleshooting of network related issues using Linux or Unix (FreeBSD) based tools

  • Advanced know-how of monitoring systems (Nagios/Incinga/Cacti) and Apache httpd webserver

  • Up-to-date knowledge of network-based attacks and their mitigation.

  • Solid scripting skills

  • Fluency in English. If you understand German too, that would be even better

  • Razor-sharp analytical abilities, coupled with a strong sense of responsibility, urgency, and drive



What we offer:



  • A pleasant working environment within a dynamic and international team

  • Independent work in an innovative, rapidly growing company

  • A free choice of computer and equipment

  • Fast personal development and a steep learning curve

  • Flat hierarchies and short decision paths

  • Cross-functional opportunities in project and teamwork

  • Regular team events, a wide range of sport activities, a fridge full of beer and non-alcoholic beverages as well as fresh fruit every day



Apply online: http://www.trivago.com/jobs/details/571-system-administrator-bsdlinux?cip=99060001011163

item.title: Front End Web Developer at ServerCentral Inc. (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
We’re looking for a bright, self-starter to work with us on defining, designing and developing our vision as we further hone our datacenter solutions and services. Our idea is to create a vision in regards to the software-defined and controlled datacenter of the future. In this datacenter, Cloud, bare-metal, managed services along with networking, monitoring and billing will all be at a customer’s disposal and controlled from a single “pane of glass”.


You’ll be working with some of the most current technologies and building and supporting customers and services around infrastructure as a service (Iaas), platform as a service (Paas), software defined networking, DevOps and others.


More importantly, you’ll be working with a passionate bunch of geeks who are the best in the industry. We have hundreds of loyal and really knowledgeable customers, both on the enterprise level and within the content provider space.


With a world class staff of people in all of the technical fields we play in – networking, software development, provisioning monitoring, system administration, application architecture, physical deployment, datacenter design, power provisioning, and operations as well as support and customer care; ServerCentral is a one stop shop for any customer need.

item.title: Systems Engineer (10pm - 7am EST shift) at 1010data (New York, NY) (allows remote)
item.description:
Position Summary


1010data is looking for a seasoned Systems Infrastructure Engineer with a desire to streamline the process of creating and maintaining private cloud computing infrastructure. This is an opportunity to work with a team of talented engineers and developers to help 1010data manage a large and growing high performance cloud computing environment. The successful candidate will have a passion for high performance computing and be instrumental in building a highly scalable, secure, 24/7 availability system.  The person in this role will work between the hours of 10PM-7AM EST.


Responsibilities


The successful candidate will be responsible for building, scaling, securing and maintaining our server infrastructure as 1010data grows.


The candidate would be responsible for the production systems would sometimes be required to work after hours or weekends.


Requirements


Education & Experience


Candidates should have expertise or familiarity in/with:



  • Operating Systems – Windows, OSX, Linux

  • Scripting Languages – PowerShell, Batch, AppleScript, VBA, Bash, Perl, Python

  • HPC Databases – Columnar stores, Key-Value stores, Hadoop, HDFS, HBase, SQL, Apache Cassandra

  • Hardware, Storage, OS and database configuration in distributed, elastic, highly available, shared nothing, message-passing systems

  • Datacenter automation, OpenStack

  • Networking – Cisco IOS, TCP, UDP, DNS, Multicast, emerging transport protocols, and switched fabric

  • B.S./Ms in Computer Science, MIS or related field from a top tier university (or equivalent experience) preferred


Additionally, candidates should have a strong, general knowledge of technology.  They should be able to demonstrate a solid, analytical thought process in response to challenges or problems.  A proven track record with managing large production environments is critical.


Personal Competencies


Personal Impact


The successful candidate will be a cooperative, creative person who is strongly motivated to solve business issues.  This person will be adept at finding the right technology balance to solve problems quickly and efficiently, while creating a maintainable codebase that can evolve as technologies change. This person must be capable of working independently and towards goals vs. just following instructions.  


Communication


As this is a customer facing role, the ideal candidate will:


-communicate clearly and have strong, positive interpersonal skills;


-feel comfortable presenting to a group including management;


-have the ability to articulate in his/her ideas, consider options presented by others and reach an informed, balanced technical opinion;


-create clear, concise memos/summaries, design documentation and presentations


-demonstrate the ability to review the technical documentation provided by others and provide constructive comments.


Teamwork


As 1010data is an entrepreneurial, fast-growing company, all candidates for employment must have a strong personal work ethic and an unparalleled passion for excellence.  A positive, balanced, roll-up your sleeves attitude is of absolute necessity as is the ability to contribute to team based efforts.

Linux Engineer

item.title: Full-Stack Developer at Epion Health (Hoboken, NJ)
item.description:
Epion’s Growth Philosophy and Culture:


If you get “Lean Startup,” then keep reading. At Epion Health, we live and breathe the Lean Startup methodology. We learn using experimentation, data analysis and small product iterations to constantly improve our product. Epion Health offers a Software as a Service, patient engagement platform at the point of care, beginning with the patient check-in process. We're searching for team leaders and team players who are passionate about our vision, who share our values and who have a desire to impact the growth of our business.


Key industry thought leaders, leading healthcare companies and influential investors who have revolutionized the healthcare industry have thrown their weight and financial backing behind our team & vision. We pride ourselves on the technology and products our team develops, and our impact on healthcare. 


As a developer at Epion Health, you will have the unique opportunity to work in the dynamic, challenging and opportunity rich healthcare industry. Help us add value to the system and we all win.
