item.title: Information Technology Specialist at VOICE Charter School (New York, NY)
item.description:
Position Responsibilities:


VOICE Charter School is expanding its operations team and recruiting an Information Technology (IT) Specialist. Reporting to the Facilities and Operations Manager, and working in close collaboration with the Data and Compliance Specialist, Operations Assistant, and others members of the Operations Team, the IT Specialist will serve as the point of contact for a variety of computing needs throughout the school and will support and troubleshoot computer systems and network resources throughout our school. The IT Specialist will play a critical role in ensuring the availability and integrity of mission critical systems supporting the diverse business and education demands of the organization. The position will require application of troubleshooting and problem solving skills to address standard problems and issues that arise.  During larger deployments and upgrades, the IT Specialist will be responsible for supervising and/or directing a small staff of office assistants.  Responsibilities include but are not limited to the following:


Direct Support



  • Providing desktop, network, server, and application support to school staff

  • Assuming full responsibility over network operation and winding down support contract with the installer

  • Ensuring that all school technology and network connections are properly functioning

  • Implementing software services in consultation with the Data Specialist

  • Installing and configuring server, desktop, and netbook systems 

  • Installing support operating systems (OS) and applications, and imaging these systems for archival storage

  • Overseeing user accounts, permissions, and networked objects in Active Directory (AD) and Google Chrome Console 

  • Setting up and configuring telephone equipment and VOIP switching

    • Troubleshooting servers running MS 2008R2/2012, ensuring network connectivity, and resolving Cisco switching Ethernet issues



  • Providing workstation service and support for a variety of PC and Apple systems and running a variety of operating systems on an on-call basis

  • Independently identifying, analyzing, and resolving highly technical problems when they arise

  • Providing IT support for business and education applications such as FUND-EZ, Intra Links, Imagine Learning, Google Chromebooks, SalesForce, and Microsoft (MS) Office Suite

  • Reaching out to vendors to resolve technological issues


Communication and Documentation



  • Documenting all work performed to build a robust technological knowledge base for future reference

  • Establishing clear communication with the Facilities and Operations Manager regarding up to date information on technological issues that have been escalated to the manufacturer or software maker and being sure to communicate progress on a resolution

  • Working directly with the Data and Compliance Specialist to ensure IT hardware and software are fully functional so that the data team can complete their data tasks in a timely manner

item.title: Software Developers and Engineers - GCHQ at GCHQ (Manchester, UK)
item.description:
Combat threats to UK security with your tenacity and technological expertise


GCHQ works to keep Britain safe and secure in the face of wide-ranging threats from cyberspace and emerging technologies. To tackle different challenges, we deploy agile teams of engineers with expertise in a wide range of technologies, disciplines and skills – and with varying backgrounds, from new graduates to experienced professionals.


By joining us, you could find yourself reacting to real time events by delivering enhancements and systems that have to go live fast – perhaps a matter of minutes or hours. Or you might be working on complex systems and infrastructure, where solving the toughest problems can be a long term commitment. There are many other business critical tasks too, such as contributing to testing, user experience, integration, data algorithms, design and database architecture.


But whatever projects you’re involved in, you are guaranteed challenging, cutting-edge work that will stretch your abilities, strengthen your skills and expand your knowledge. And, you’ll be playing a valuable role in protecting the nation.

item.title: Lead DevOps (m/w) at ThoughtWorks Deutschland (Hamburg, Deutschland)
item.description:
Und ja, wir wissen: DevOps ist keine Rolle, sondern vielmehr eine Philosophie - und wir suchen Enthusiasten/innen, die unsere Leidenschaft hierfür mit uns teilen.


Darauf kannst Du Dich freuen:


Als Lead DevOps übernimmst Du die Verantwortung, die Bereiche Operations und Entwicklung zusammen zu führen, um eine fortlaufende Auslieferung qualitativ hochwertiger Software zu ermöglichen. Gemeinsam mit dem Kunden und Deinem Team entwickelst Du ein Verständnis für die erforderliche Infrastruktur: Beispielsweise die Einrichtung einer Build/Release-Pipeline oder die automatische Bereitstellung von Cloudservices. Die Vermeidung von Performance Engpässen und die Skalierbarkeit der Infrastruktur liegen Dir ebenso am Herzen wie das Coaching von Kollegen und Kunden.


Darüber hinaus wirst Du als Lead DevOps bei ThoughtWorks



  • Jeden Tag etwas Neues lernen

  • Dich um Design, Implementierung und Administration von Build&Deployment Umgebungen kümmern

  • Mit neuen Tools experimentieren und deren Anwendbarkeit für Produktivsysteme bewerten

  • Eng mit den Bereichen Operations, Entwicklung und QA zusammenarbeiten

  • Dich auf das konzentrieren, was Dich begeistert, anstatt festgelegten Strukturen zu folgen

  • Als Coach in Technologie-Teams arbeiten und ein Vorbild für weniger erfahrene Kollegen und Mitarbeiter auf Kundenseite sein

  • Viel reisen, auf Konferenzen auftreten und Artikel bzw. Blogs schreiben

  • In einer dynamischen, kooperativen, transparenten, nicht-hierarchischen und ego-freien Kultur arbeiten, in der Dein Talent zählt

item.title: Senior Software Engineer (C++ / Qt) at TomTom (Edinburgh, UK)
item.description:
'Five years from now we'll be active in areas we haven't yet dreamed of'.


Harold Goddijn, CEO TomTom.


Would you like to make world class products to enable and motivate people to participate in more sporting activity and to gain more enjoyment from the activity?


Where do you want to be?


We are looking for the best and brightest minds in software development to join our Sport Unit. The experience and future opportunities will include problem solving during whole development process, from identifying problems to fixing them and writing unit tests to support regression tests and architecture and implementation of desktop application.


As a member of the global Sport team, you are asked to deliver the following:



  1. Completely new cross-platform desktop application

  2. Modules used to connect to social networks and communities

  3. Unit tests and test applications


What do we expect from you?


There is no set route to become a Senior Software Engineer (C++ / Qt) at TomTom. But to be successful in this role, this is the kind of profile we have in mind:



  • Strong experience in C++ programming and familiarity with Qt framework

  • Experience with cross-platform application development, especially for Windows and Unix systems and with any of the standard development tools and compilers (VCC, GCC, clang)

  • Experience with creating rich GUI applications by using Qt technologies

  • Experience with OpenGL/DirectX API


What do we offer?



  1. An adventure in the cutting-edge field of digital mapping, traffic and navigation solutions

  2. The chance to work in a fast moving, innovative and international environment, dealing with all kind of different countries and cultures

  3. Indefinite contract, flexible benefits, 25 annual leave days, flexible holiday plan, collective health insurance, pension scheme, up to 50% discount on products, bonus scheme

  4. Among others, an online learning platform (1500 courses & 11000 e-books) as well as live speeches from software development gurus, like Uncle Bob

  5. International relocation package and professional support (if applicable)

  6. Salary Range: £ 30000 to £ 60000.


Interested?


For the full story about the vacancy (ref 22725) or procedure, please click on www.tomtom.jobs or contact Olga Bugheanu.


Online assessments and pre-employment screening is part of the selection process.


Posting date: 15th of December 2014


Closing date for Applications: 14th of January 2015

item.title: Senior Dev engineer Mobile iOS at ING (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
item.description:
ING is looking for an experienced (mid-senior level) Mobile Dev engineer to strengthen its development team that delivers complex mission-critical software solutions for the Global digital channels space.


If you want to work at a place where we care about scoring high on The Joel Test, where we believe that you can live by the agile manifesto without jeopardizing the necessary compliance and QA measures, where we find that the problem chooses the language/technology and not the other way around, where we are committed to fostering a proper engineering culture and building a high-productivity team of smart Dev engineers with the getting-things done mentality, please read on.


Your main focus will be on building ING’s:



  • Mobile security solutions for iOS or Android utilized across all online channels of ING Commercial Banking including the new ING Commercial Banking Portal.

  • Native mobile and tablet applications for iOS or Android for the new multi-product and multi-country ING Commercial Banking Portal, which gives clients integrated access to Commercial Banking products and services.

  • Other in-house software solutions in response to business needs.

  • In addition to developing complex software solutions, you will also contribute to:

  • Streamlining our development process all the way from code check-ins to deployment into production in collaboration with Ops colleagues (using the best tools that we can find: e.g. Jira, git, Jenkins, Maven, Artifactory, …).

  • Improving our continuous integration, increasing our automated test coverage, and helping us get to the next level of maturity with respect to Continuous Delivery.

  • Your work environment


You will work in the dynamic and challenging environment of the IT organization of ING Global Digital Channels.

item.title: Senior DevOps Engineer at Harvard University (Cambridge)
item.description:
Harvard University


School/Unit
Harvard University Information Technology

Sub-Unit
------------

Job Function
Information Technology

Time Status
Full-time

Department
Teaching and Learning Technologies

Salary Grade
059

Union
00 - Non Union, Exempt or Temporary

Duties & Responsibilities

This is a fully benefited, full-time Harvard University position that has been funded through June, 2016.  There is the possibility of renewal, contingent on funding, university priorities and satisfactory job performance.



The Teaching and Learning Technologies (TLT) Program is a strategic Harvard IT initiative that supports teaching and learning across all the schools, facilitates pedagogical innovation, and contributes to educational research. Reporting to the Senior Manager, Platform Technology, the DevOps Engineer designs, builds, manages and maintains scalable and robust enterprise application server environments utilized by application development and technology teams within Harvard University Information Technology (HUIT). Implements Apache, Tomcat, Passenger, Gunicorn and other application server environments running in Linux environments both in the cloud and on-premises, supporting applications written in Java, Python, PHP, Ruby, and other technologies. Implements and operates Jenkins CI environment. Collaborates with systems administrators, network engineers, database administrators, and information security personnel to architect robust application environments. Works closely with developer teams to design and build deployment models to match development needs. Serves as a technical resource to developers and web designers in their use of these technologies. Coordinates with all teams to design appropriate applications and systems monitoring strategies. Our systems serve mission critical applications to a large enterprise community of student, faculty, staff, and general public users.

Basic Qualifications

    Bachelor degree with 3+ years professional experience
    Linux server experience
    Experience designing and operating cloud-based environments, especially AWS
    Experience with infrastructure automation tools such as Puppet, Chef, Ansible, AWS Cloud Formation
    Strong experience with Apache or other webserver configuration
    Familiarity with the software development lifecycle
    Unix shell scripting experience
    Strong communication and interpersonal skills
    Excellent troubleshooting and analytical skills
    Ability to work in a team
    Rotating on-call duties

Additional Qualifications
The following are desired but not required:

    Experience with Jenkins or other continuous integration systems
    Experience with highly available enterprise environments utilizing load-balancing network devices and proxy servers
    Working knowledge of REST, web services
    Familiarity with web application frameworks such as Django, Rails
    Familiarity with content management frameworks such as Wordpress, Drupal, MediaWiki
    Familiarity with identity, authentication and authorization frameworks such as CAS, LDAP, Kerberos, Active Directory, Shibboleth, SAML
    Familiarity with relational databases
    Experience with source code version control systems (git, subversion, cvs, etc.)
    Experience with bug tracking systems (Jira, Bugzilla, etc.)

Additional Information
Please note:  This position is also posted at a grade 58. We have two openings for the position of DevOps Engineer. The grade level and title will be determined based upon the level of experience and skill set of the successful candidate.


**For internal HUIT employees, this is a referral bonus eligible role**

•    Please note: Harvard University requires pre-employment reference and background screening.
•    Harvard University Information Technology is unable to provide work authorization and/or visa sponsorship.
•    This position has a 180-day orientation and review period.

Harvard offers an outstanding benefits package including:

Time Off: 3 - 4 weeks paid vacation, paid holiday break, 12 paid sick days, 11.5 paid holidays, and 3 paid personal days per year.

Medical/Dental/Vision: We offer a variety of excellent medical plans, dental & vision plans, all coverage begins as of your start date.

Retirement: University-funded retirement plan with full vesting after 3 years of service.

Tuition Assistance Program: Competitive tuition assistance program, $40 per class at the Harvard Extension School and discounted options through participating Harvard grad schools.

Transportation: Harvard offers a 50% discounted MBTA pass as well as additional options to assist employees in their daily commute.

Wellness options: Harvard offers programs and classes at little or no cost, including stress management, massages, nutrition, meditation and complimentary health services.

Harvard access to athletic facilities, libraries, campus events and many discounts throughout metro Boston.

Join Harvard University Information Technology (HUIT) to assure Harvard's leadership in IT!


More about HUIT:

Harvard University Information Technology is a primary provider of IT services to the Harvard community.
In collaboration with Harvard's CIO Council, we maintain IT policies and foster innovation across the University.


Mission:

To assure Harvard's leadership in IT, we strive to make it easier for faculty, students, and staff to teach, research, learn, and work through the effective use of information technology.

Values:

•    User-focused
•    Collaborative
•    Innovative
•    Open
 
Pre-Employment Screening
Credit
Criminal
Identity
Employment


Appointment End Date
30-Jun-2016

EEO Statement
We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.



Apply Here

item.title: Tech Lead @ GoPro at GoPro (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
The Role:
We're looking for an awesome, fun, smart, hardworking, creative, friendly, responsible Tech Lead to help GoPro execute on company vision, create great products, and make a great working environment. Your day will consist of tasks like architecting, researching, designing, implementing, and testing software. You'll also act as the technical liaison amongst our product, design and business development teams.

You should be a great communicator who is patient and most of all a team player who loves to both code and mentor others. You should take pride in being able to achieve success through other capable and talented engineers. Want more specifics?

You Will:
* Be an effective people manager who is active in coaching, one-on-ones, performance reviews, recruiting and removing blockers
* Lead the team in the software design and development process by establishing best practices and patterns that lead to high quality code metrics
* Code in a variety of languages, helping us create excellent software - you'll spend around 10-50% of your time working with the code your team is responsible for
* Collaborate with other Tech Leads on system architecture, the enterprise data model and overall system performance
* Ensure production code has been through the code review process prior to release
* Give general education sessions and help inform the team of group decisions 

Our Stack:
Here are some of the tools we currently make strong use of. If you're an expert with any of these, all the better!
* Ruby on Rails
* PostgreSQL
* Angular.js
* Ubuntu
* Vagrant/Dockr
* SmartStack



So what's so great about our gig? Yeah, we figured you'd ask eventually. 
* Competitive base salary 
* Stock Options 
* Full benefits (medical, dental, vision) 
* Life insurance 
* 401K 
* Paid Vacation Time 
* On-site snacks/beverages 
* Discounted Gym membership 
* We all learn, teach, and train together. Learn something new? Tell us about it. We'll return the favor. 
* Sunny, dog friendly office that's centrally located. 

How To Apply:
* The Sourcery will be the first point of contact.
* All applications receive a response.
* All applications are kept strictly confidential.
* To apply, click here.


GoPro is an equal opportunity employer.

Applicants must be quick learners, have a strong work ethic, have well developed organizational skills, and have excellent communication skills.  The base location on this position is open to Laramie, WY, Fort Collins, CO, or Golden, CO.

item.title: Intermediate Application Developer at Easy Metrics, Inc. (Issaquah, WA) (allows remote)
item.description:
You are a great developer with around five years of experience working with web-based applications. SaaS experience is extremely helpful. You are a good problem solver and troubleshooting is fun for you. You're a fast learner and keen to work with skilled developers to advance your knowledge. Technology and programming is your passion, you do it because you have to and not just to earn a living. You prefer community-based Open Source solutions over closed proprietary systems simply because you like to pop the hood and tinker when the need arises. What is your favorite Open Source project?

Your preferred environment is linux and you understand how to configure and work with Apache, Tomcat, Postgres, and MySQL. You can grep log files like a pro and uncover causes to problems and come up with solutions. You are proficient in Java and PHP, maybe along with Javascript and AngularJS. Jaspersoft Pro experience would be a great asset. You have experience writing unit tests and using GitHub, perhaps even some release management. You have experience working as part of a remote team and can be counted on to deliver when it counts. You are familiar with JIRA and Confluence and working in an agile environment with frequent releases.

We offer a unique remote-only environment working with experienced, self-motivated developers. We are a privately-held startup in adolesence with many large customers and funding in place for growth. This is a Contract-To-Hire situation where you will be tested and when accepted as a full time employee, you will be eligible for excellent benefits and stock options.

item.title: Build the frontend for an app thats transforming an industry all around you! at PlanGrid (San Francisco, CA)

• Work with us to make a dent in the universe. Our software is very literally changing the foundation of society

item.title: Android or iOS Application Developers at Honeywell (Austin, TX)
item.description:
Would you like to be part of the coming revolution in “The Internet of Things” and connected devices?  It is an exciting time to consider joining Honeywell!


We are seeking Android and iOS developers who are passionate about working on cutting edge apps that actually control things in the physical world.  These individuals are super creative mobile developer who want to make a big impact on next generation mobile products.


We are shaping the next generation of connected home technology with products and services that help people get their homes in tune with their lifestyles. Our products and services make people’s lives safer and more secure, more comfortable and energy efficient.  Do people who use your apps say, “Wow! Awesome!” and give 4 and 5 star ratings?  If you are an experienced application developer with “five star” apps and a start-up mentality, we have a great job for you. 


Our team is small and nimble with limited hierarchy and lots of ownership. You’ll report directly to the Director of Application development for Honeywell Connected Home.  We're looking for a developer who is an out-of-the-box thinker, passionate about our mission, who wants to dive in and get their hands dirty.  The position will be located in Austin, TX, and you must be prepared to relocate to Austin if you don't currently live there.  Unfortunately, Visa sponsorship is not an option for this role at this time.

item.title: Software Development Analyst Associate at Lockheed Martin Canada CDL Systems (Calgary, AB, Canada)
item.description:
Researches, designs, develops and/or modifies enterprise-wide systems and/or applications software. Involved in planning system and development deployment. Responsible for meeting software compliance standards. Evaluates interface between hardware and software, operational requirements and characteristics of overall system. Documents testing and maintenance of system corrections.


JOB SUMMARY:
1. Software programming and testing with C++
2. Maintains existing code including refactoring and adding new features
3. Performs and receives regular code verifications (for both senior and junior engineers)
4. Contributes regularly to the continual improvement of all aspects of software development including tools, processes and coding standards
5. Travels occasionally for off-site field trials at the customer site or at government test ranges to perform activities such as software integration, installation, testing and maintenance
6. May contribute materials for larger project reports
7. May write:
7i. User documentation where necessary (e.g., sections of User Manuals)
7ii. Engineering reports where necessary for specific tasks
7iii. Other duties as may be assigned from time to time by the employer

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
1. The design and implementation of reliable, soft real-time software
2. Unit-level and exploratory testing
3. Other duties as may be assigned from time to time

item.title: Lead Developer at ThoughtWorks (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
As a Lead Developer at ThoughtWorks, here's what you can do:



  • Work with really smart people that "get-it" and will challenge you to be better

  • Every organization is becoming a software company, you'll be at the helm leading that transformation within global organizations in the Retail, Finance, Airline, Education, Government and Energy industries

  • Think through hard problems, and work with a team to make them reality in disruptive and impactful ways.

  • Work on large-scale, custom-designed, multi-tier, enterprise-level software development projects using Java, Ruby and/or .NET

  • Inspire teams of software engineers

  • Be responsible for the quality of software and resolving any issues regarding client satisfaction

  • Be a mentor and role model to less experienced developers

  • Employ "Agility"  including task estimation, test automation, deployment automation and Continuous Integration to improve overall execution speed and product quality

  • Travel the world.

  • Learn something new everyday

  • Speak at conferences. 

  • Write blogs and books.

  • Think through hard problems, and work with a team to make them reality.

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, transparent, non-hierarchal, and ego-free culture where your talent is valued over a role title

  • Develop your career outside of the confinements of a traditional career path by focusing on what you’re passionate about rather than a predetermined one-size-fits-all plan

item.title: GIS Engineer at Churchill Navigation (Boulder, CO)
item.description:
Are you a Jack of all GIS?


If you’re interested in very large scale multi-resolution spatial datasets, then you will love this job!


You must be a very good programmer (Python, C++) who also has knowledge of spatial concepts.


Your main responsibilities are to develop and maintain a toolchain to gather, edit, process and convert raster/vector map data for use in our real-time software. Streamline and automate the pipeline from acquiring raw data to deploying processed sets to customers.


Main tasks



  • Writing scripts for processing of geospatial data.

  • Processing of Digital Elevation Model datasets (eg. LIDAR).

  • Gathering and preprocessing vector datasets (eg. OpenStreetMap).

item.title: Field Programmer at Churchill Navigation (Boulder, CO)
item.description:
Are you a SuperDuper Field Programmer?


Travelling to far away parts of the planet, flying in cool helicopters, debugging in the cockpit, all the while feeling like James Bond? Sounds exciting? Read on!



We are producing state of the art mapping system hardware and software that interface to million dollar equipment in aircraft around the world. No two customer setups are the same, and the requirements are diverse and challenging. You will face issues that you’d never think exist, and you’ll need to summon all your knowledge to solve them. No job is impossible, no customer is left behind.

item.title: Software Engineer at Spectrum Systems, Inc (Pensacola, FL)
item.description:
Spectrum Systems, Inc. is seeking skilled software engineer with experience in object oriented design and architecture using SOLID principles in a continuous integration environment.  The ideal candidate will have experience designing and developing complex, multi-layered systems in a mission-critical environment.  This position will be application development, database design and development, user interface design and development, build and release engineering, and maintenance.  The ideal candidate will have a broad skillset with extensive experience in the .NET environment and framework.  This is a permanent, full-time position with extensive benefits located in Pensacola, FL.  US Citizenship required and the candidate must be able to pass a background check and drug screenings.  Travel between 0-10%.


What will I be working on? We use the latest technologies and development tools available.  You'll be able to chose your cutting-edge hardware, and will develop in Visual Studio 2013 or greater.  You'll be working on new development in a full .NET stack.  Everything from database to mid-tier, to UI design.  You'll be joining a motivated team of developers.

item.title: Software Engineer at Harvard University (Cambridge)
item.description:
Job details

Auto req ID: 33940BR
School/Unit: Harvard University Information Technology
Sub-Unit: ------------
Location: USA - MA - Cambridge
Job Function: Information Technology
Department: Teaching and Learning Technologies
Salary Grade: 058
Union: 00 - Non Union, Exempt or Temporary



Duties & Responsibilities:


This is a fully benefited, full-time Harvard University position that has been funded through June, 2016.  There is the possibility of renewal, contingent on funding, university priorities and satisfactory job performance.
 
The Teaching and Learning Technologies (TLT) Program is a strategic Harvard IT initiative that supports teaching and learning across all the schools, facilitates pedagogical innovation, and contributes to educational research. Reporting to the Senior Manager, Development and Open Source Community Lead, the Senior Software Engineer will work as part of an agile team to build software that supports the pedagogical mission of the University.  


Basic Qualifications:



•    Bachelor degree with 3 years software engineering experience or equivalent.
•    Familiarity with design patterns, algorithms and data structures, and the ability to apply them effectively.
•    Experience building web-delivered applications using one or more of Python/Django, Ruby on Rails, Spring, NodeJS or similar platforms.
•    Experience building and consuming REST APIs.
•    Experience in client-side development, including UI development in HTML5, CSS and Javascript.
•    Demonstrated ability in testing and quality assurance, including experience with appropriate unit testing suites.
•    Flexibility with regards to development platform and a demonstrated ability to adapt to new development languages and libraries.
•    Ability work in a team.
•    Strong aptitude and desire to learn



Additional Qualifications:


•    Experience working with an agile development methodology.
•    Experience with test-driven development practices.
•    Experience in requirement capture and direct client engagement.
•    Experience using an LMS or MOOC platform as a student, instructor or teaching assistant would be a plus.
 
Additional Information:



**For internal HUIT employees, this is a referral bonus eligible role**

•    Please note: Harvard University requires pre-employment reference and background screening.
•    Harvard University Information Technology is unable to provide work authorization and/or visa sponsorship.
•    This position has a 180-day orientation and review period.

Harvard offers an outstanding benefits package including:

Time Off: 3 - 4 weeks paid vacation, paid holiday break, 12 paid sick days, 11.5 paid holidays, and 3 paid personal days per year.

Medical/Dental/Vision: We offer a variety of excellent medical plans, dental & vision plans, all coverage begins as of your start date.

Retirement: University-funded retirement plan with full vesting after 3 years of service.

Tuition Assistance Program: Competitive tuition assistance program, $40 per class at the Harvard Extension School and discounted options through participating Harvard grad schools.

Transportation: Harvard offers a 50% discounted MBTA pass as well as additional options to assist employees in their daily commute.

Wellness options: Harvard offers programs and classes at little or no cost, including stress management, massages, nutrition, meditation and complimentary health services.

Harvard access to athletic facilities, libraries, campus events and many discounts throughout metro Boston.

Join Harvard University Information Technology (HUIT) to assure Harvard’s leadership in IT!

More about HUIT:

Harvard University Information Technology is a primary provider of IT services to the Harvard community.
In collaboration with Harvard's CIO Council, we maintain IT policies and foster innovation across the University.


Vision  - We aspire to be an organization with:

•    Committed and skilled people accountable to Harvard’s mission and serving faculty and students
•    Simple processes making it easy to work with us, do our jobs, and deliver results
•    Innovative technology that is the right technology for the right reasons, including prudent experimentation.

Mission:

To assure Harvard’s leadership in IT, we strive to make it easier for faculty, students, and staff to teach, research, learn, and work through the effective use of information technology.

Values:

•    User-focused
•    Collaborative
•    Innovative
•    Open



Pre-Employment Screening:


Criminal
Education
Identity
Employment


Apply Here: http://www.Click2apply.net/hfnn6jj


PI87457456

item.title: Lead Engineer Inertial Navigation at Churchill Navigation (Boulder, CO)
item.description:
Our products’ performance depend heavily on high quality inertial navigation solutions computed from combined sensor readings. While current industry solutions work acceptably, we are looking for someone who will help us push the envelope. 


The requirements are most demanding and if you think you can handle the position, please contact us and we’ll fill you in on the details.

item.title: Application Programmer Mobile at Churchill Navigation (Boulder, CO)
item.description:
Love mobile technology, but tired of cranking out freemium games all day?


We make professional apps that feel like high end games! You will be working on streamlined sidekick tablet/smartphone apps that complement our complex 3D airborne mapping product. There is a heavy emphasis on the recording, streaming and playback of video streams with embedded location metadata, and rendering maps and HUDs.

item.title: Lead Programmer at Churchill Navigation (Boulder, CO)
item.description: Your job is to oversee and coordinate the programming efforts for several challenging projects going on in parallel. You will need to make architectural decisions, and provide guidance to the team. You will be responsible for implementing the most critical and difficult codepaths.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer at Basic6 (Westport, CT)
item.description:
We're looking for candidates with a passion for technology who would be excited by the prospect of working with a startup.


We are a well funded company, https://www.basic6.com, expanding on a small number of fronts, primarily in the area of Internet of Things. In an environment where changes are frequent and new technologies are explored on an on-going basis, the ideal candidate is one who is capable of adopting a project on their own, explore possible technical solutions, and contribute to a development plan. You must have a positive attitude, an ability to communicate openly, honestly, and to understand other points of view.


We do work on IoT devices, server work to communicate with the devices, UI work, and windows desktop development. No one candidate will cover the gamut of what we do, and as you are able to
contribute particular skills in some of the areas we cover, we will fit you in where you can best express your skill - there is plenty of work to go around.


We look for candidates who want to join for the long haul; on the way toward that goal some period of contracting while we feel each other out could be fine. Working from home some of the time is also quite acceptable for the right candidates.

item.title: Full Stack Developer (LAMP) at BeFunky Inc (Portland, OR)
item.description:
BeFunky, the popular photo editing platform with 25M+ users, is on the hunt for a new Full Stack Developer (LAMP) that will be located in its beautiful Portland, OR office. We’re looking for a full stack developer with a wide range of skills specifically with experience in web environments. We’re a small, close-knit team looking for the perfect person to help us create the most beautiful applications the world has ever seen!


* Lead front and back end development and contribute towards advancement of our BeFunky Web Platform.
* Work closely with the product and UI/UX creative team to bring designs to interactive user interfaces.
* Tune MySQL database for performance and scalability.
* Design and implement features that can scale to millions of users


What we offer:
* Very competitive pay along with high level health, dental, and vision benefits.
* Paid holidays and 3 weeks PTO
* Work in our 3000 sf amazing office in Portland. An inviting and open floor plan with plenty of natural light. 30-ft bow truss wood ceilings with large multi-pane windows.
* Free photobooth in the office
* All the snacks and drinks you could want
* Awesome co-workers and a company you’ll be proud to be a part of!

item.title: Application Programmer at Churchill Navigation (Boulder, CO)
item.description:
You are the front line of developers!


You work on the part of the code, that has the most visible effect to our users. You program the high level application logic, that defines how our product will be used. You are responsible for programming the UI and all the interactions, and using the underlying engine to implement new features that our customers request.

item.title: Java / JavaScript Developer at TD Ameritrade (Jersey City, NJ)
item.description:
Performs product design tasks of increasingly complex nature which may require extensive research and analysis. Works independently with little direct supervision in the development, testing, implementation and maintenance of systems of moderate size/complexity. Analyzes and evaluates existing or proposed systems. Provides detailed analysis of problems and recommends solutions. Applies innovation and creativity to development process and problem-solving. Participates in the development of detailed system specifications for major systems installation. Works directly with the client to recommend/develop system solutions to business problems. May provide leadership or work direction to more inexperienced team members. Has significant exposure to and demonstrated proficiency in all aspects of programming and analysis, including design factors, hardware and software requirements, systems facilities, and execution protocols.


Applicants must be eligible to work in the U.S. Immigration sponsorship is typically not available for this position.

item.title: Software Delivery Manager/QA Manager at Terapeak (Toronto, ON, Canada)
item.description:
Software Delivery Manager / QA Manager


Job Description


We are a seeking an experienced Quality Assurance Manager to lead our testing and manage a small Software Quality Assurance Engineering team. This opportunity is appropriate for experienced software Quality Assurance professionals with a track record of success and a solid understanding of software quality control methodology, processes, tools, and related technologies. This is a challenging, highly technical 100% hands-on quality assurance/engineering technical lead role requiring analytical, innovative thinkers who can successfully test our applications. As well, this role will have responsibilities across customer success, release management and production gatekeeper. The candidate is expected to be a team player, flexible, a strong driver for results and continuous improvement.


Responsibilities:



  • Lead and manage a small team of engineers in the Quality Assurance team.

  • Mentor, guide, and coach other QA team members from a technical perspective, in order to make sure they are successful individually and as a team.

  • Lead the design, implementation and rollout of an Automated Testing Framework for integration and regression testing using technologies such as Selenium/Webdriver, WebdriverJS, QUnit, JUnit.

  • Integrate automated testing framework with CI environment (Jenkins).

  • Automation of all performance testing as part of our CI environment.

  • Provide test plans to ensure on-time delivery of builds to production.

  • Identify, research, report, track and verify software defects proactively and comprehensively

  • Participate in root-cause analysis of defects

  • Recognize test case, test coverage deficiencies, or process problems and propose improvements

  • Coordinate testing efforts by customer support, engineering and offshore QA engineers

  • Ability to function effectively in a fast pace and dynamic environment and manage continuously changing business needs; excellent multi-tasking and time management skills required

  • Communicate clearly and concisely in verbal and written form.


Skills & Requirements



  • 5+ year minimum experience in software development and QA, working on either a web application or a client/server application.

  • Highly experienced working in a SaaS based platform.

  • Mobile and web QA experience in an enterprise or SaaS offering.

  • Able to recognize process deficiencies and propose improvements

  • Demonstrate extreme attention to detail and organization in all aspects of work

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills

  • Experience of Agile and/or SCRUM

  • Understanding of ETL and Data Warehousing

  • Experience testing REST web services

  • Experience with Jenkins or other build servers

  • Experience writing SQL queries

  • Excellent working knowledge of Windows and Mac operating systems and related hardware


About Terapeak, Inc.


Terapeak is a leading provider of online analytics to eCommerce merchants.  In short, we help people make more money on platforms like eBay and Yahoo Japan (and soon more!).   Terapeak has mastered the world’s largest single ecommerce data set and we are looking to expand our reach to other platforms.  Many online merchants are only scratching the surface of the potential revenues they can make online.  Terapeak is here to help them get closer to that potential.  Terapeak analytics make a difference to merchants around the world, every day.  We are not afraid to adopt new technologies and methodologies if we feel it is what’s best for our customers.  If you want to be excited to come to work every day knowing that you will be making a difference today, tomorrow, and next week, give us a shout.  Come grow with us.

item.title: Software Developer - Custom Applications - C# / SQL at Premera Blue Cross (Mountlake Terrace, WA)
item.description:
Job Summary:


Analyzes, designs, develops, modifies and maintains application software, as well as proficient in relevant programming languages and testing methodologies.  Proficient with software development life cycle (SDLC) and IT change control procedures.  Under minimal supervision (many times works autonomously), utilizes expertise within assigned application areas to analyze and solve medium to large, moderately complex, business needs with technical solutions. 


Represents team in projects that cross team boundaries.  Demonstrates ability to quickly troubleshoot and resolve production issues.  Communicates and collaborates effectively within and across team boundaries, including IT management, as appropriate.  Collaborate in developing requirements, conducting analysis, design, coding, unit-testing, and documentation.  Aptitude for gaining a thorough understanding of the business and actively applying it to individual work, as well as promotes teamwork and leads by example.


Responsibilities:



  • Under minimal supervision, analyze medium to large, moderately complex, business needs to determine appropriate solutions and design appropriate technical solutions.

  • Consult with business partners to determine requirements and assist in identifying and documenting appropriate solutions through the application of technology to meet business needs.

  • Demonstrate proficient understanding of Systems Analysis and Design concepts.

  • Construct/modify code to meet business needs based on program specifications.

  • Perform unit testing and document results to ensure modifications/functions meet desired results.

  • Participate in testing associated with cross-functional project team efforts as dictated by project assignments.

  • Effectively analyze and resolve medium to large, moderately complex, production problems related to assigned applications, assess alternatives and implement long-term solutions. Successful performance includes demonstrated ownership and timely responses to production problems and business unit inquiries.

  • Produce appropriate documentation and notifications for changes to production systems or fixes to production problems.

  • Participate/Lead in post-implementation reviews, generate problem reports and provide appropriate feedback.

  •  Demonstrate thorough understanding of project planning techniques and assist in creating project plans.

  • Promotes teamwork and leads by example.  Unquestionable ethics and integrity is pertinent.

  • Initiate a personal training plan, continue acquiring skills and knowledge, and pursue an understanding of the organization’s business plans and strategies.

  • Participate in on call production support rotation, as needed.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer / Senior Programmer at WB Games - NetherRealm Studios (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
SUMMARY OF POSITION
Netherrealm Studios, a division of WB Games Inc., seeks a Senior Gameplay Software Engineer to join the team behind Batman: Arkham City Lockdown creating game systems for exciting, cutting-edge action games on iPhone and iPad. As a member of our studio's game engineering team you will work closely with engineers, designers and artists to develop gameplay for our next AAA title. As a Senior Gameplay Software Engineer, your domain will span as much of the codebase as your skills and interests dictate, as you design and implement extensions to existing systems and pivotal new game systems to meet the needs of our talented in-house team of content developers. In addition, as part of our studio's highly collaborative engineering group, you will have opportunities to share your expertise on the development and implementation of systems across the entire codebase. This job will require collaboration with the rest of our engineering team on issues of technical design. You will also work closely with other engineers and content development experts on implementing and refining systems to meet our designers' vision. The Software Engineer will also work with their team's production staff to help develop realistic schedules and identify all dependencies.
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Design, author, maintain and refactor game systems that meet all design, technical and schedule requirements.

  • Work closely with QA and your technical leadership to ensure the stability and accuracy of game systems by identifying, communicating and resolving defects.

  • Author, review and provide feedback on technical and end-user documentation of game systems.

  • Collaborate with technical leadership and other engineers to help establish overall technical design and architecture.

  • Collaborate with designers and content creators to brainstorm solutions that satisfy design and content requirements.

  • Work closely with the production staff in building and maintaining realistic schedules and identifying dependencies.

  • Coordinate with QA and leads to ensure successful roll out of new features to the team and establish testing and maintenance of systems.

item.title: Senior Software Engineer / Programmer, Engine at WB Games - NetherRealm Studios (Chicago, IL)
item.description:
SUMMARY OF POSITION
NetherRealm Studios, a division of WB Games Inc. seeks a Software Engineer – Rendering to work closely with the award-winning technology team behind the Mortal Kombat and Injustice franchises building cutting-edge technology and powering the development of NetherRealm's next generation of console games. As a member of our studio's KoreTech team you will work closely with the Principle Rendering Engineer, content development leads and the rest of your peers on the KoreTech Team to develop state-of-the-art rendering and tools technology. As a rendering engineer, your domain will span as much of the rendering pipeline as your skills and interests dictate, as you design, implement and maintain pivotal new rendering and tool technologies for our talented in-house team of content developers. In addition, as part of our studio's highly collaborative engineering group, you will have ample opportunity to share your experience and expertise on the development of both tools specific and general engineering systems. Opportunities for involvement in the creative process will also present themselves regularly throughout the course of each project. This job will require collaboration with the Principle Rendering Engineer and Director of Technology on issues of technical design. You will also work closely with our Art Leads and other content development experts on requirements gathering, iteration during feature betas and subsequent long term support. The Senior Software Engineer - Rendering will also work with the KoreTech Producer to help develop realistic schedules and identify all dependencies.
JOB RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Design, author, maintain and refactor rendering code that meet all design, technical and schedule requirements.

  • Collaborate with Principle Rendering Engineer, other Rendering engineers, Art Leads, Senior Technical Artists and other content development experts to identify elements of the content development pipeline in need of optimization or replacement and on proposals of exciting new rendering technologies.

  • Coordinate with content development experts to develop tools to utilize new rendering technologies.

  • Author, review and provide feedback on technical and end-user documentation of new rendering tools and features.

  • Collaborate with technical leadership and other engineers to help establish overall technical design and architecture.

  • Work closely with the production staff in building and maintaining realistic schedules and identifying dependencies.

item.title: Manager, Software Engineering at kCura (Chicago, IL)
item.description: Responsible for building and leading a highly effective team of software engineers, and working with departmental contacts to support the demands of the department and meet the objectives of the product development process. The engineering manager is responsible for the professional development of their reports and is the subject matter expert for the product features they are involved in.

item.title: Sr Big Data Engineer - Java at Trulia (San Francisco, CA)
item.description:
Big Data Engineer


San Fran, SOMA


Direct Hire

What you’ll work on:
The world of real estate data is huge and spans a multitude of data sources. We're looking for the right engineers to help build and improve core back-end data services, processing pipelines, storage platforms, and search infrastructure that feed our real estate site. Your work will surface daily on millions of pages across the site and provide millions of users with cleaner, more relevant, more local, information.   

This position involves designing and building large-scale applications and systems to acquire, process, store, and make discoverable vast quantities of real estate information. You will tackle challenges around performance optimization, parallelization, and scalability that come with the data demands of a high-traffic, constantly growing, and public website.

You:


- Have over 5 years of proven results oriented experience with a delivery focus in building scalable, high-performance, reliable, highly available and large distributed systems.


- Have 2 years of managing big data experience.


- Love to work with open source technologies like Hadoop, spark, Kafka, Zookeeper, Hbase, Storm. 


- Live to break down and solve complex problems by creating practical, maintainable, and scalable solutions
- Desire to be constantly learning new things and can make good forward thinking judgments about new technology.


- Are able to handle multiple competing priorities in an agile, fast-paced environment.


- Are a great person that willingly collaborates, listens, and cares about your peers as well take pride in coaching & mentoring.

item.title: Supervisor of SW Development (.Net stack) at CDK Global (Hoffman Estates, IL)
item.description:
ADP Dealer Services is now CDK Global.


Stability meets Agility.  CDK is one of the largest technology providers to the automotive industry, with more than 26,000 dealer sites in over 100 countries and nearly 9,000 employees worldwide. From data scientists to sales and operations experts, we’re hiring to support your growth and ours. GreenLight Your Career.



CDK Global is looking for passionate, skilled software engineers to join a great team building a new product suite to change the car buying process for both dealers and consumers. Work on an advanced distributed system leveraging technologies such as AngularJS, .NET WebAPI, NServiceBus, RabbitMQ, RavenDB, and SQLFire. Our newly renovated workplace is a creative and collaborative environment supporting an agile methodology.  The ADP DS Engineering team is a group of fun, pragmatic, full stack engineers with multi-language coding skills focused on engineering excellence and continuous improvement. 
 


The FOS Technical manager is responsible for managing FOS R&D resources, driving development of new products and enhancements of in market products. You will be an important member of the management team and will be a key thought leader for all of FOS’s product development. You will be responsible for managing and continuing to build a dynamic software development organization, both in the US and offshore. You will have a number of direct reports with all associated administrative management responsibilities.

item.title: Manager of Continuous Integration at CDK Global (Hoffman Estates, IL)
item.description:
This position can sit in our Portland, OR or Hoffman Estates, IL office.


ADP Dealer Services is now CDK Global.


Stability meets Agility.  CDK is one of the largest technology providers to the automotive industry, with more than 26,000 dealer sites in over 100 countries and nearly 9,000 employees worldwide. From data scientists to sales and operations experts, we’re hiring to support your growth and ours. GreenLight Your Career.




At CDK Global we provide integrated technology solutions to over 26,500 auto, truck, motorcycle, marine, recreational vehicles and heavy equipment dealers in over 100 countries worldwide.  
Never heard of us?  
Have you ever bought or leased a car?  
If so, then we’ve been there with you, behind the scenes.  

We are transforming the way vehicles are marketed, sold and serviced by delivering innovative, easy-to-use, and scalable solutions.  Using agile methodologies, we satisfy our customers through the early and continuous delivery of quality software.  Do you believe in the idea of continuous delivery?  Do you enjoy building and implementing tools that increase the pace and quality of application delivery?  Do you believe in the principles of DevOps?

If you answered ‘yes’ to any of these questions, then we’d love to hear from you!  
We are looking for an Engineering Manager to lead our continuous delivery and ALM tools engineering team.  You will provide technical leadership, mentorship and coordination to a team of talented engineers, both in the US and India.  You will be responsible for the continued development of our continuous delivery pipeline, creation of tools to improve developer productivity, maintenance of source control management systems, and implementation of other solutions to improve the repeatability and reliability of application releases.

item.title: Front-end developer at N-Play (Jacksonville, FL)
item.description:
Want to be part of a talented development team that is building the next generation technology platform for consumer home search? N-Play is seeking for immediate hire Web Designers/Developers who are skilled in HTML, CSS, JavaScript and jQuery. to help design and develop a large-scale, widely distributed cloud-based platform for delivering home search services.


Responsibilities include:



  • Work closely with Product and Marketing Managers on all web design and user experience projects

  • Create wireframes and prototypes to explore ideas for user flows

  • Gather feedback from users and stakeholders to drive toward a final set of mockups or prototypes

  • Maintain the overall design standards, integrity and consistency for the N-Play brand and products

  • Work closely with the Marketing team to provide any creative support

  • Collaborate with others in crafting and implementing your technical vision.

  • Follow agile processes with a focus on delivering production ready testable code in small iterations.

  • Mentor and provide guidance to other developers on the team.

  • Participate in the entire development life cycle, from concept to release. 

  • Participate in all phases of quality assurance and defect resolution.

item.title: Applications Developer Analyst 2 at University of Florida (Gainesville, FL)
item.description: University of Florida Enterprise Systems is currently seeking a web application developer to join the Development Services team. Development Services is an innovative team focused on building enterprise frameworks, solutions and creating development standards for the University of Florida. We are looking for a skilled team to enhance and maintain an existing .NET financial application and associated reports. You will be involved in the analysis, design and development of new features and reports as well as enhancements to existing code. You will work in a collaborative, team environment and participate in the full software development life-cycle. You will be required to meet with customers, analyze requirements, propose solutions, create design specifications and prototypes, develop and test new code, document solutions and deploy builds. A secondary responsibility of this position is participation in the development of new products which may require learning new skills. You must have excellent communication skills, have an aptitude for leaning new tools and languages, keep current with the latest trends in application development and have a history of producing quality work.

item.title: AdWords Api Project at Dealer Inspire (Naperville, IL) (allows remote)
item.description:
We have a paid search dashboard that was created about a year ago and has been continually getting new features and bug fixes. The main part of this program creates dynamic ad groups, ads and keyword lists based on an inventory file. 


Going forward, we need complete reporting, Bing integration, more dynamic ad features, Google Analytics integration and so on. 


I estimate this as a full (or close to full) time position for the next 6 months. If all goes well we could go on a maintenance and feature agreement or we could also hire this person on for other projects we have.

item.title: Sr. iOS Developer, Frameworks at The New York Times (New York, NY)
item.description:
The New York Times started on paper. Then we moved to the web. And now we’re focused on mobile.



We are looking to grow the NYTimes mobile team to help bring our award-winning journalism to new platforms and technologies. As a software engineer on the iOS Frameworks team, you’ll be responsible for creating and improving shared code across all of the New York Times iOS applications. 

We look for engineers who take pride in writing reusable code with an emphasis on quality over quantity. At the Times, we deal with scale and architectural challenges on a regular basis, and the code we write has to hold up as well as our world-renowned journalism. The Frameworks team is the driving force at the Times for ensuring that these challenges are met with the best solutions. The ideal candidate has experience designing functional and clear APIs, is fluent in current best practices and design patterns, and is excited to work with other teams to create an architecture that works for their needs. Candidates are expected to have several years of iOS experience. Knowledge of CocoaPods is beneficial, but not required.

As a part of our iOS team, you will enjoy a vibrant culture that promotes innovation nestled within an established and respected institution. Inside our gorgeous Midtown building, you will find floor-to-ceiling windows, plenty of whiteboards, a team with a sense of humor, and countless colleagues with a passion for developing products people love and the rock-solid software that powers them.

If you’re interested, please contact us at techjobs@nytimes.com.

Company Information:


The New York Times Company (NYSE: NYT) is a global media organization dedicated to enhancing society by creating, collecting and distributing high-quality news and information.  The company includes The New York Times, International New York Times, NYTimes.com, INYT.com and related properties. It is known globally for excellence in its journalism, and innovation in its print and digital storytelling and its business model.  Follow news about the company at @NYTimesComm.



EEO Statement:


The New York Times Company is an equal employment opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, marital status, age, disability, national origin, citizenship or any other protected characteristic. The New York Times Company is committed to diversity in its most inclusive sense.

item.title: Front-End Web Developer, Atlantic Media Strategies at Atlantic Media (Washington, DC)
item.description:
About Atlantic Media Strategies


Atlantic Media Strategies is a fast-growing digital agency focused on delivering products and services that enable our clients to thrive in a constantly shifting digital world. Every day, we bring the savvy of a world-renowned media company to Fortune 500 companies, public policy institutions, fast-growing start-ups, and other media brands. Our team of strategists, editors, writers, designers, developers, and marketers work together to create smart, substantive experiences—from major online transformations to clever editorial campaigns.



The Role


Web developers play a critical role in most of our projects, and are part of an integrated team of product specialists working to build experiences that delight, inspire and engage.  In a leadership and client-facing role, you will work to help define and structure projects, and guide the development process from start-to-finish.  The ideal candidate will be intellectually curious and highly practical, with the willingness and ability to handle a wide variety of challenges in a fast paced environment.
